Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Dillonc1980
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days in HK for a friends wedding in April and couldn't fault the Eaton. Quite a large number of us flew out from UK and split over 5 hotels. The Eaton was actually the cheapest and best quality of all the hotels used (ok Peninsula was better but different world at £500 per nite). We only booked B&B due to wanting to do the real tourist thing but breakfast was excellent. All food fresh and great quality. Only issue we had in 10 days was wifi issues but not exactly an issue in HK as hardly the back of beyond. Location is very good too - if you want to save money on package holidays book hotel separate as worked out at least 15-20% cheaper but hotels in HK only accept certain cards such as MasterCard so check before you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Functional but not My Cup of Tea”
Reviews.Author: RekhaChoudhry
Reviews.Content: Well, I honestly can't blame them for the sizes of the rooms, but yes the hotel rooms were definitely small. I would not have recommended this hotel to anyone travelling for fun or leisure, as the Eaton Smart has been designed, quite frankly, keeping in mind the business traveller who just wants a good bed and a hot shower - which the hotel does provide. I like to enjoy my hotel stays and experience the sights and sounds of a good luxurious ambience - things that I sorely missed at the Eaton Smart. The food was a little bland and insipid and most of the times felt like it had been reheated and served. Service was a little slow especially in the coffee shop. Overall, I really would not want to stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Bob T's review”
Reviews.Author: robert t
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Room was very clean and the AC worked well (very important in Hong Kong). Close to the MTR (3 blocks away) and within walking distance of the harbor. Room recently redone, bed comfortable, good water pressure and very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality that made you feel special”
Reviews.Author: family4A1baby
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd trip to Hong Kong this year. Eaton Smart being #54 on Tripadvisor sealed the selection. 2 of us stayed from 31/8/12-2/9/12 in room 1605. The room face a quiet church. On Sunday morning, we could hear the church bell. Before arriving at Eaton Smart, I emailed Stan Chua that it was my friend's birthday, expecting a small cake. On 1st Sep, I was in the toilet when they delivered the cake and white wine. My dear friend got such a sweet surprise. We, are frequent travelers, agreed that Eaton Smart left such a memorial impression - hospitality that made you feel special. Food around the hotel was great 1. Zhang Ji Xiang Gang Zai Yu Dan Wang 章記香港仔魚蛋王's oyster porridge was BEST! 2. Tao Heung 稻香超級漁港 dim sum at Nathan hotel was better than the one-Michelin star 3. Tsui Wah 翠華餐廳 was just opposite 4. Wine buffet at Nathan Hotel 5. Nathan congee 佐敦粥麵家 was just another street away Shopping was near 1. temple street night market 2. Fortune Teller street at the end of temple street 3. Wing On was on opposite street of Nathan road 4. Yu Hua Guo Hou 裕华国货 We didn't know where was the free airport express bus K1 as we took the cab in. Man,the hotel concierge guided us and even helped us get onto the bus. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectation”
Reviews.Author: Richard343
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in August 2012. We decided to stay at this hotel because the price seemed reasonable, not over the top, or at the low end. Having stayed at many hotels around the world, this hotel was far better than we expected. The staff were very friendly and helpful and could not do enough for us. If you want free WI-Fi internet access in your room, then this is the hotel to stay in. I checked out many hotels before booking here and most charged for internet access and their prices were excessive.The speed of the complimentary Wi-Fi in the rooms was satisfactory for all the data I needed. An important thing about staying here is that is about 5min away from the Jordan MTR railway station which gives you fast access to all parts of Hong Kong. The buffet breakfast was very good with all the food one would expect. The buffet dinner was very expensive and I recommend having dinner at one of the many restaurants near the pier or on Hong Kong island. Again, we found this hotel exeeded our expectations and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: CAFCDarren
Reviews.Content: The Eaton Smart is a nice clean hotel located on Nathan Road in Kowloon. The Night and Jade markets are very close by, and the hotel will even take you a free guided tour to them. Like most hotels in Hong Kong the room is small, but very clean and tidy with all modcons. The staff are very helpful and seem to genuinely want to please. There is a Chinese, Japanese and Western style restaurant. You have the option of a buffet affair in the evening which had some good food, including oysters. Breakfast was also very good, with eggs cooked at a hotplate to order. The reception area is very small, which made checkout a delayed process, and the bar area is a bit understaffed during the day. They have a 'can do' button on the telephone which is a nice touch. Jordan MTR station is close by for getting to Hong Kong island and other areas.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenDen1London
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in good location. Reception area is basic. Helpful and efficient staff. Good value. Stayed here 3 times and every time good. Breakfast good. Got free upgraded room which was huge for HK! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: The staff can't do enough to help you. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Nice lobby and restaurant areas, bit pricey though. Set in a good location to explore Kowloon. The shower was nice and warm. The pool was peaceful. Beware of the lifts though, they don't stay open for very long at all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Gemmayzetraveller
Reviews.Content: I initially picked this hotel because the frequent flyer miles offered two nights in it. The location is excellent, near lively streets and the night market. we were upgraded to a suite upon arrival! breakfast is OK and reception not very nice. but staff are friendly, very efficient, not intrusive and don't overdo politeness. amenities are good, toilets are nice, maybe a little small, but for the price, this is definitely a great place for either tourism or business (even though it is not in Central, but it is great if you are on business and want to save some dollars). Rooms are modern and clean, in-room lighting system is nice, there is an i-pod station, with OK views on HK. So definitely worth it to stay there and very highly recommended. I left with a nice feeling of relaxation, service efficiency and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: manishkbhatia
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Eaton Smart was very good and comfortable. The hotel is a centrally placed city hotel and very convenient for moving around kowloon. The staff is friendly and non-intrusive. Excellent lobby area. Great In-room dining. Kids loved the Spaghetti with Tomato. Great choices for hotel dining for sushi and cafe food. Couple of things on the downside - room layout is a little odd and A/C was not cooling properly. Overall loved the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Kathi83
Reviews.Content: With so many options to choose from in Hong Kong, we felt a bit overwhelmed when picking a place to stay in Hong Kong. A friend of ours who is from Hong Kong recommended Eaton Smart to us as that is where he chooses to stay when he's there. We couldn't be happier with our choice. Firstly, Hong Kong Island or Kowloon?- is the first question we asked ourselves... Kowloon is so much better! And the hotel is in a really great part - Nathan Rd - a 2 minute walk to the Jordon MTR, Kowloon is more authentic, more organic and interesting. We booked a club room so we got the E lounge included in our daily rate. BRILLIANT! No need to pay extra for breakfast when you've got the E Lounge "continental" breakfast... They provide you with hot breakfast options including eggs, hash browns, mushrooms etc.. PLUS yoghurt, toast, fresh fruit, smoked salmon and cheeses etc etc.. really really great value. In the evenings you can go down and have wine or other alcoholic beverages for free as part of the package. The room itself - the bathroom is quite small but functional, the room itself is also on the small side but that's pretty typical for hotels in Hong Kong - it's still very functional and comfortable with plenty of storage space for clothes and bags plus we also had a couch and a large desk included as well. We also had views of the buildings and the night life outside. The bed was a touch on the hard side but again this is quite common. The staff - extremely helpful and friendly, happy to chat and give you any advice or info. We ate in the restaurant the first night as we arrived late and I also ordered a cocktail from the bar, the food and drinks are reasonably priced and tasty. We have nothing negative to say about the hotel, we were happy with our choice and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong August 2012”
Reviews.Author: Hyacinthandfriends
Reviews.Content: Have just had 10 nights at this hotel and not one complaint - staff were were very helpful, rooms clean and loved the 'can do button' on the phone - no request was to small - would certainly stay there again and would recommend this hotel. The restaurant quality food in the bar was superb - well done Eaton great value for a hotel in a great location in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: flo-josh
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights. Room on the 17th floor was very quiet though a little small. Bed comfortable - very welcome after elsewhere in China. Excellent bathroom. Wifi easy and good. Staff all very helpful. Buffet breakfast had good range of food for all tastes. Ate from the a la carte menu in the evening a couple of times - pleasantly surprised at fresh-tasting food. Location perfect for getting everywhere, and taxis very cheap down to the Star Ferry. Would definitely choose to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myoverseastrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eaton Smart Hotel from 4/8/12 - 9/8/10, room 1431. We were very disappointed with this hotel. Door to bed 3ft. We had stayed in other hotels in HongKong before but not this bad. Wall of room is so very thin you can hear all noises coming from outside. Children from next room playing, shouting and running even pass midnight. Opening & closing of doors from other rooms too. When I was outside the room I can even hear my husband talking on his handphone. We had a couple of sleepless nights. Echo coming out from tv. Complained twice but nothing was done. We put up a " Do not disturb sign " on our last day with unlock luggages & things all over the room and left room to go for a meal. Yet housekeeping came in to tidy room. Although nothing was missing, this is still not right. What is the point of putting up the sign?? I will never ever stay in this hotel again and will never recommend it to friends & relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel couldnt fault would stay again”
Reviews.Author: hatfiena
Reviews.Content: we caught the free shuttle bus from Kowloon to Eaton smart hotel which dropped us outside the hotel which was convenient, we walked past concierge and caught the lift from ground floor to the lobby which is neat and clean also noticed the elegant resturant and a outside dinning area/ drinks. the staff were friendly and efficient and made check in quick and easy we had requested a double bed but was not avaliable at the time and were given 2 single beds, the lady at check in made a request for house keeping to push the beds together which was no trouble at all and was a lovely touch. we travel up to the 18th floor, it was good to see some of the rooms were seperated by doors so the "Ding" of the elevator wouldnt keep you awake. we find the room a tad on the small side but nicely furnished the bathroom was nice slight misshap with the shower hose. we left for the day to sight see and as requsted our bed were pushed together and room had been serviced. we defenatly had a wonderful stay at the eaton smart and would HIGHLY recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Eaton”
Reviews.Author: KatielouAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights. Great location with easy access to the metro and Temple St night market. Rooms were large by HK standards. Rooms and bathrooms were kept clean with linen and towel change when requested in line with their "green" policy - you choose when you want changes. Good bathroom amenities provided . WIFI easily and quickly available in room free of charge. Gym and pool were adequate - fairly basic but then we didnt come here to swim :) Staff were friendly and polite, helpful when asked questions, happy to book tours etc. E-Club access was useful but wouldn't pay too much (if anything) for it. Basic drinks and snacks during happy hour, very basic breakfast provisions, otherwise not much use for the holiday traveler. There are plenty of good, cheap restaurants and cafes within easy walking distance of the hotel which would be more than sufficient for most people.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton = Easy”
Reviews.Author: Arsoptales
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, excellent facilities and service.Langhams smaller brother so enjoy the standard langhams are famous for at a lower price.Good hotel great price. Good location only 5 mins to Jordan mtr. Close to airport express Kowloon station. E-point downstairs can use Internet and print. Clean rooms and happy staff. Good buffet. Good for business. I had brought a new luggage lock before flight and when I arrived it wouldn't work-called 'can do' centre. In 5 min a staff member arrived with bolt cutter! Delivered iron and ironing board to my room straight away for meeting next day. Always stay at Eaton it's too easy

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: samSG81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in July. The hotel was undergoing some renovations so it was a little noisy in the mornings and in the day. Not a big issue since we were out most of the day. The hotel is new and clean and very conveniently located in between Jordan and Yau Ma Tie MTR stations. A big plus was that the airport express shuttle bus stopped right opposite the hotel. Very recommended for the price we paid for a deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Does not treat its guests with any respect! BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: metcalve
Reviews.Content: Arriving at about 10pm at night with Typhoon Signal 1 (Vicente) hoisted, it was pouring elephants and dinosaurs. Airport Express K1 shuttle stops outside the hotel, and requires you to carry your bags across the small lane before you are met with the lousiest and most completely and utterly useless concierge/bellhops you will ever meet. Not only did the bellhops not offer any assistance until you have carried the bags to them, they will drag your bags for you for a mere 10m before "depositing" them in the lift and pressing the Lobby button for you and leaving you alone with your bags once again. There were 2 of us travelling with 4 bags + 2 handcarry after a month-long holiday in the USA, so those empty bellhop carts and bellhops (primarily) would have provided very good assistance (and would have received a good tip too!). Check-in was another completely useless and cold process. There were only two queues opened when I was there and each of the staff is serving one guests each. It took a 15 minute wait before I was served, in a very cold manner. As Vicente came in hard and strong the next couple of days, we were pretty much immobilised in the hotel. We were intrigued by an advertisement in the lifts which proudly proclaims that their Chinese restaurant chef is a 1-star chef (whatever that means!). We went there on the night Typhoon Signal 8 was hoisted at about 9pm, and received one of the coldest welcome from the staff. Food tasted like it was out of the sewage. What completely peeved me was the check-out. There was a note on the desk after checking-into the room which says that guests receive at 15% discount when dining in the chinese restaurant. At checkout I presented the note and perused the bill and noticed that I did not receive the discount. I asked the check-out staff, Karen, if the discount has been applied, and she called the restaurant who verified that it has been, although I repeated to her that no it has not, to her persistence that she has already "double checked" that yes, it has been. I asked for her to present the restaurant bill to me which she initially told me she cannot show me, and thereafter told me to wait. I did. For about 20 minutes, until I can no longer hold it and wanted to get to the airport. I received an email later from Karen saying that 1) I did not present the discount note (which I did, she returned it to me without looking at it) 2) the discount has not been applied. 3) to come back to the hotel so that she can refund the discount to me I sent it back to her, disgusted, and asked her why did she claim that it has been all this while then? Am I also expected to return just to get the discount? I am not unhappy about the 10USD or so discount, but merely a matter of integrity and the lack of respect shown to me from another fellow human being claiming that I am a liar. Received another email from the manager to apologise for the inconvenience and that the staff Karen has been counselled, and that they will refund the discount into my credit card which I used at check out. Bellhops, once again, at checkout, was completely useless. I will go back to Nathan Hotel the next time I am back in Hong Kong if I want to be in TST.

Reviews.Title: “Busy tourist hotel on Kowloon side”
Reviews.Author: Goingnutsinchina
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I've stayed at Eaton Smart hotel on meeting up with overseas visitors. It's a very busy tourist hotel with two confusing entrance areas and weird lobby area. Often there are long queues to check in and out of the hotel. The rooms are tiny as typical of HK hotel, but they are comfortable. The location of the hotel is good for shopping in the TST area of HK.If you can get a good rate then this hotel is OK, otherwise it's a bit overpriced and I think there are better options in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - V.Good Service”
Reviews.Author: kiwifolk
Reviews.Content: Return visit to this Hotel. Stayed 5 nights and got a really good deal with an Executive Room. Booked direct on-line; watch the prices for about 2 months and got a fantastic deal. When arrived they upgraded us to a Suite, had 5 other couples join us too. The service was fantastic, and the extra money for the Executive Lounge is worth it as not only do you get a large room for HK standards, you get breakfast, coffee and snacks during the day and free drinks and finger food for 2 hours in the evening. Factor that into the price and it is worthwhile. Staff were fantastic in the lounge too. Highly recommend. On top of this the location is fun, we go to HK twice a year for 6 years now for business and here you are right in the middle of the markets etc.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and good value”
Reviews.Author: mhquay
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Novotel on Nathan Road in a club room however on this occasion moved almost next door to the Eaton Smart for a 5 night stop-over. We went for an E-Club room but changed to a suite with E- Club membership which was slightly cheaper than the Novotel Club room but gave us a larger room with all the club perks. The Eaton club room was quite basic. The hotel has lots of eateries including a great yum cha restaurant. The hotel may not quite have the polish of the Novotel but it certainly is a good value alternative if you seek to stay in the Jordan area of Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Smart”
Reviews.Author: chameleon47
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with Wife and Grandson. Despite having a room with an extending couch bed for Grandson, we were charged for a roll away bed. The price was high just for a roll away when the price of the room was already premium. Not as central as many of the Kowloon hotels. Rooms were clean and well equiped.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - small room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very good. Service and cleanliness was also good, but the room was too small. The value for money was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good value”
Reviews.Author: Jaycee S
Reviews.Content: The location was conveniently located near the night market. The lobby offers a bar, a restaurant and a coffee/snack bar. We had a small suite which included a seating area. The room was not very large but comfortable. What was lacking were outlets and luggae racks. The hotel provided many luggage racks but only one additonal outlet converter was allowed. That was a bit frustrating We had complimentary breakfast buffet which was very good. Fresh eggs/omlettes, seafood, hot Asian food including dim sum, fruit, cereals, pasties etc. The dinner buffet was not impressive most likely because we had to pay for it. For about $50 we had about as much selection as the breakfast. There was cold seafood and a few meat cuts, but not much stood out as impressive. I would have been better off ordering from the menu. We took the complimentary city walking tour and tai chi lessons offered by the hotel. Both were entertaining and fun. On the walking tour our guide took us to the night market and explained everything we needed to do to get the best value and where to find certain items. The tai chi lesson was very entertaining thanks to our instructor, I swear he must be an action film star. Anyone of any age or size can take this class. I used the free gym a few times. The equipment was very good but there wasn't alot of room. In addition to free weight and other strength training equipment there were yoga and pilates equipment as well. One HUGE turn offf in the gym: The was some constuction being done outside and the workers must have been smoking. I understand nearly everyone in Hong Kong smokes, but who wants to smoe while working out? Overall for the price I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a good price”
Reviews.Author: hutchNIreland
Reviews.Content: We booked thru booking .com and got twin rooms at good price.handy location for metro and buses.bought breakfast at the hotel,they did an offer which was cheaper than Internet prices,good value.rooms clean,modern,bathroom also fine,good shower.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not fantastic either”
Reviews.Author: mntp
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in HKG several times I have a few hotels to compare with. We stayed in a club room which is a must if you stay otherwise this place is just another hotel. The club offerings made the stay a lot more pleasant and nightly cocktails are nice. Hotel is centrally located and is close o everything, so this ticks boxes. Staff are friendly and the food is nice. Our room way clean but small and fairly plain. It was also cold as we were on he end of he building with loads of glass. Would stay again however I would ask for a upgraded room. Not a bad choice for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: teapot8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a club room and found the whole experience to be positive. Staff, without exception were helpful and friendly. Room was big enough for three of us. Club room included breakfast and evening 'cocktails' which were appreciated after a day in the city exploring! Loved Hong Kong and would return to the Eaton Smart. Recommend that you try the Buffett dinner, great seafood and an opportunity to try local cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt get to stay in the CIty View room but service was good”
Reviews.Author: angely_angel
Reviews.Content: Went to Hong Kong for my Honeymoon. We requested to stay in the City View room for our 7 nights there but we didnt get it. Instead we were placed in a Deluxe room. It was spacious enough for both of us and we didnt feel cramp at all. Strangely, they 'upgraded' our old TV set to a flat screen one during our 3rd night there. We received a bottle of complimentary champnage and chocolates to celebrate our honeymoon. Pretty sweet a thought I must say. Had free access to EClub and we go there almost every day. There is cocktail party every evening but we always miss it. Had breakfast there for about 3 to 4 times. Small place but food was replenished fast. However, when it's raining, the place will be very crowded and almost to a point the staffs were not able to handle the overwhelming crowd. Some of the staffs became a lttle impaitent when the crowd came. Generally a good place to have a coffee or drink anytime of the day. Pool was really small. Too small I must say. We only went there once. ABout a 5 mins walk from Jordan MTR. Very convenient. RIght opp the entrance of the hotel is a very very good restaurant called Cui Hua. We ate there 3 times! Go there for breakfast/lunch/dinner! They serve very good food. And I am totally missing it now. Walking distance to Temple Street and we even walked over to ladies street once from the hotel. One incident that happened during our stay was that my hubby cut his leg in the bathroom. Prob the facilities are getting old, the rubber of the door stopper came off and my hubby accidentally stepped on it and cut his foot. We called for a band aid and it took quite a while to come. THankfully he stopped the blood while waiting for the band aid to come. We feedback to the person who brought us the band aid about the stopper but nothing was done. Feedback again during our check out and hopefully they will do something about it so that no one else will get cut again. A pointer to note is to speack English if you can. Staffs are generally more helpful and kind when they know you can speak English. Also applies to Hong Kong in general.

Reviews.Title: “as doll house”
Reviews.Author: Mazaaaj
Reviews.Content: the first impression that you get when you see the hotel from outside, you will feel like the hotel is very big and comfortable. but once you get in, you will be shocked. the rooms are very tiny and old furnitured. i didnt feel comfortable in it at all. and also i dont recommend it for friends

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Temple Street Night Market”
Reviews.Author: Lou C
Reviews.Content: Had 5 nights here in a Delux room. (We got 2 Delux rooms as we had 2 teenagers with us) Room was small but clean and tidy. As others have said not much space to leave 2 large suitcases in. However we were gone every morning by 9 and did not return until midnight so it served its purpose well. About a 2 minute walk to the Temple Street night Market. Walking distance down to Star Ferry but in 36 degrees Celsius a taxi was much cooler and very cheap for 4. Buffet breakfast very expensive so found other places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, still a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Cindy L
Reviews.Content: My first stay in Eaton after hearing so many good reviews about the hotel. The rates are quite expensive, probably because I stayed during the peak period (Summer holiday and weekends too). Location: Near A21 airport bus stop, less than 5 mins walk! Nearest MTR Station is Jordan and I would say although it is further away from the A21 airport bus stop, it is still walkable. You can also find lots of good food nearby such as the famous Australia Diary Co, Mak's Noodles all at the opposite side (Parkes Street) Room: We were allocated room next to the lift lobby, and generally it is not sound proof, so we could hear the noises from the corridor at times. However, it was still alright as we were not disturbed during our sleep. We didnt manage to get the room with the front city view too! :( Our room faced the back and it was quite unsightly. Other than that, all is good and there's wifi too (new perks!) They took quite a well to check us in, cause of the peak season. Room is not really big too, but it is the norm for hong kong. Overall, it was still a pleasant stay. To add on, their bed were really comfy! If you would like to stay in Kowloon area, staying at Jordan area would be a good alternative as compared to TST!

Reviews.Title: “it is just TERRIBLE.......”
Reviews.Author: ckuan1
Reviews.Content: We are staying here as we speak and believe me we will be checking out tomorrow. It is one of those mistakes that I have made... I thought location is good for us but its services are just terrible. The western restaurant buffer for dinner was dirty and not much to eat. We will check out tomorrow go another hotel in Jordan. Incredibly dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BKamdar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights in April 2012. The hotel is right on Nathan Road which the main shopping street of Hong Kong. Plenty of shopping and restaurants in the area. Jordon metro station is just 10 minutes walk. The room was very big and very clean. Service was excellent. Highly recommended. Book in advance to get their best deals.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: amp-qld
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights before flying out after the previous two nights at the Metropark Causeway Bay. I think, in hindsight, we would have stayed here for four nights as the room was bigger here and the hotel was cheaper. Access from the MRT was a slightly longer walk than at the Metropark and we had difficulty finding the lobby which is on the first floor accessed from a side street. After that, things were good. I think we were upgraded as we certainly didn't have the issue of the room being small as mentioned by some other people. The free shuttle bus included in the Airtrain ticket calls at the hotel and it only takes about five to ten minutes to get to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice of hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: VicAlan07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with a 6pm late check out on the last day. Room was very comfortable and the staff very helpful. The Chinese restaurant downstairs provided the best Chinese meal the we have ever had. Worth staying here just for that!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, EVEN if your from UK but comfortable & Good location”
Reviews.Author: dan773
Reviews.Content: I have tried to provide info below on the following topics HOTEL, LOCATION, GETTING THERE, PUBLIC TRANSPORT. HOTEL 1st thing to say is that I have stayed at lots of hotels where the rooms are described as small. My experience has so far been that those reviews have been from people that must be used to large rooms. So I took not too much notice of the reviews saying these were small. However, we had a delux superior room, dont be fooled by the title, read this as 'small & standard' This was the smallest room I have ever stayed in, that includes travelodge and similar standard hotels in UK. (see photo) That said the bed was not too small and the room was comfortable and cool. there is not much space, so some juggling suitcases etc will be needed nor is there much wardrobe space. We did not eat at the hotel, however there is a cafe where if you show your room key you get a but 1 get 1 free offer on hot drinks. LOCATION If you have not been to HK before you should know this to help you make a choice. basically you can stay in either Kowloon or the HK Island. This hotel is in Kowloon, there are attractions on both and I dont think it makes much difference, public transprt is cheap and easy to use to get from one to the other. everything is sign posted in English NATHAN ROAD. This is where the hotel is. Its a long straight street which is I guess the HK 'Oxford Street' It takes about 20 to 30 mins to walk from the Hotel to the Harbourside. You can also get a Bus or the MTR (the tube / subway) The hotel is about 5 min walk from the nearset MTR. I can see no disadvantage from staying at the hotel GETTING TO HOTEL (from Airport) You can get here many ways and this only reflects what we did as I think it was the cheapest. We got the Express Train from the Airport. Took about 30 min from airport to Kowloon. Cost 70 HKD per head From Kowloon we got a Cab to Hotel. This took 10-15 mins (traffic is mad) and cost us 40HKD (10 HKD excess for the bags). We did this in reverse on way back. You could get the MTR from Kowloon to the nearest station to the hotel, this would take longer and only save you about 20HKD (less than £2) GETTING AROUND Everyone we met spoke great English. We got an Octopus Card at the airport (this is like a Oyster Card in London) It cost us 150HKD which is broken down into a (50HKD) deposit and 100 HKD on the card. you then touch the card a the turnstiles on the MTR or on the bus and it debits the fee from the card. To add money you insert the card into a machine and add cash, its simple with English instructions. You can use the card to pay for food etc as well at a lot of places. As we left HK we gave the cards back to the info desk and you get the cash on it refunded (less a small fee, which I think was 9HKD) The MTR is clean and easy to navigate, its all airconditioned as were the buses. Hope this helps, enjoy HK we did

Reviews.Title: “Good for stopover”
Reviews.Author: maplebjb
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 17th floor, by the sound of it, possibly a renovated room? It was just a stopover one night stay, so we were pretty laid back and by the time we arrived at 4.30, we just were happy to stay put. As we came back with three suitcases, we decided to leave those at the airport left luggage area for the next day. Wise decision. So we found our room big enough for the two of us with just one case, and very comfortable. The rooms were quiet and clean as was the bathroom, the only possible negative would be the lack of water pressure, but that was not a big deal. I thought that the lobby was probably too small for the hotel's size, seemed to have issues just accommodating people booking in or out or asking questions. But overall was quite happy to stay here, being not too far from the airport express station, Temple market etc. It was interesting walking the streets and seeing the sights, and was overall quite happy with our choice to stay here. I would stay here again if we come back to Hong Kong, hopefully next time longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great service”
Reviews.Author: Fanny T
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at Eaton. We booked two club rooms for four nights and specially request for two rooms close to each other. The front desk agent upgraded us to two suites right next to each other with no extra charge. Every staff are very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again next time when we visit HK. The location is very convenience to MTR and local malls and shops. You can practically buy anything just a few blocks away. Restaurants are also pretty good around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Urine Soaked Bed Super Small Room”
Reviews.Author: CheapEater
Reviews.Content: Booked Deluxe Room for wife and myself. Room was so small there was only ONE chair in the room. Someone had to sit in the bathroom or on the bed. The room was so small we had to shuffle our luggage around the room so we could open the luggage and/or just to move in and out the room. We had 4 large pieces of luggage and 2 small pieces. More disturbing, was our bed sheet was dirty, they gave us another bed sheet and left, leaving us to change the bed, we removed the bed sheet and uncovered a urine stained mattress cover and to make matters even worse, the "new clean" bed sheet had long black streaks on it. Absolutely Disgusting. Will never return because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Return to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: eveready18193334
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, genuine staff concern, great breakfast and comfotable rooms with spectacular views.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: NimsM
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel at the last minute based on recommendations on Trip Advisor, after my previously arranged accommodation plans fell through. The location is good, but that's pretty much it. My room was tiny - which isn't a big deal - but totally without charm. While the girls at reception were okay and the guy who cleaned the room was fine, the concierge whom I approached for directions wasn't very pleasant. He took out a map and gave me some lightning-quick instructions which I couldn't really follow. He was visibly impatient when I asked him to repeat, gave me a further 10-seconds of his time and turned away before I could ask anything further. And yet, he was all smiles and patient with the couple before me. I can only assume that it was because I was a solo, female traveller who was not White or Chinese (the couple was Caucasian). I was happy to check out at the end of my trip. I don't see any reason to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, reasonable price, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Singapore-traveller
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart Hong Kong is part of the Langham Hotels group which promises a certain level of comfort and service. It has 460 rooms over 21 floors. For a family of 5 adults, we booked 3 Superior rooms for 2 nights through Eaton Smart website, for HKD880 per room per night. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to Deluxe rooms on the same floor (16F). Although we arrived at 4:00pm, 2 rooms were not ready, and we were given free welcome drinks (beer/wine/cola) at the T Bar while waiting. Next to the T Bar was the E-Point (internet area) with 6 PCs (big screen monitor) and a printer. The reservations people made an effort to get us to book the E Club rooms, but we were in Hong Kong to eat and shop, so we did not need hotel breakfast and evening drinks. We had a great time tasting the best Hong Kong dim sum, noodles, pastries and desserts on both Kowloon side and Hong Kong island. Eaton Smart had 7 elevators, of which 4 were glass-wall type which looked out north at the Nathan Road - Gascoigne Road junction. The 16F rooms were quiet, small but well laid-out. There was a big work table with glass top and an executive chair. Room had Hitachi LCD TV, free wifi, fridge, safe, coffee/tea, kettle, safe, ice bucket, free 2 bottles water daily. The concierge on GF had a refrigerator with more free bottles of water. There was an ice machine along the corridor, but could be easily missed. We asked housekeeping for iron and board, and they were delivered within minutes. Bathroom had long bath, magnifying mirror, hairdryer, shampoo, toothbrush, etc. The sliding door was difficult to close because it had no handle. The full-length mirror outside the bathroom was a good feature. On 21F, there was a small swimming pool, and a gym. We had an 8:00pm flight, but had to check out at 1:00pm. The concierge stored our luggage while we went for more food and shopping. When we returned in the evening, we were allowed to use the shower on 21F, and changed into clean clothes. There was only 1 shower cubicle each in the male/female changing rooms, so had to queue with the other guests. Eaton Smart is next to Nathan Hotel and Novotel Kowloon. The Airport Express K1 bus stop was just across the back lane, and the bus brought us to Kowloon Station in 10 minutes. From the hotel, Jordan MTR Station was about 250 meters away. To get to Hong Kong island by MTR: Jordan-TST-Admiralty, only 15 minutes needed. Location is excellent! Crossing Nathan Road, you will reach the north end of the Temple Street Night Market. A bit further west is the Jade Market. Eaton Smart offers free tours (on certain days) of Temple Street and Jade Market, but this is useful only for first-time visitors. More interesting are the markets, flower street and goldfish street in Mongkok.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: SMC56
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room on the 11th floor for three nights at the end of May. The room was small but adequate. The queen size bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. There was enough room to store our bags at the side/end of the bed. The bathroom was very modern and the shower was wonderful, with a great shower head and plenty of hot water. The hotel is located in a great spot, easy walking distance to all the markets in the area and down to the waterfront. We had breakfast in the hotel one morning and it was a very enjoyable meal. We also had lunch at the small restaurant across from the entrance to the hotel - recommended in some other reviews - it was good. The hotel is easy access from the airport express station. We used the free bus on arrival and then as we had an early morning flight we took a taxi to the station which was cheap and only took about 10 minutes. We used the free computers in the lobby area. Would recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price this hotel feels like a steal of a good deal.”
Reviews.Author: laurelpoulton
Reviews.Content: Overall I really have enjoyed the Eaton Smart. The amenities and restaurants are excellent. The pool and gym were clean and well maintained. In the restaurants the food was delicious and well priced. The only negative I can come up with is that I wish the room was a little larger but the design and flow of the room was nice. For the price this hotel feels like a steal of a good deal. I will be coming back to the Eaton Smart.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tim m
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in an E-Club room. Great rooms, good service, helpful staff and many extras. Handily located close to metro and main bus routes in the centre of Nathan Rd. Well worth paying the extra for a club room with the advantages it gives.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: christinatan_85
Reviews.Content: It's located on Nathan Road, very convenient for any activities there is, convenient stores, food, shopping, MTR station, bus stop, etc. The room was okay, the hot water is HOT (not warm), which was great for me personally, after all the tiredness from shopping and walking. :D It was very crowded, long queue to check in and check out. Check in at 12, get a room at 3, though email has been sent to prepare my room at the earliest. :( Luckily we can go shopping around the area while waiting for the room. Overall it was a very satisfying staying here. :)

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Denise T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Club room in June 2012. We also stayed in the same room in 2007 & nothing has changed from the decor everything from the paint to the TV so disappointed. Under the desk their was so much dust. The staff were very helpful especially in the EClub (that's why they scored average) but looking at the big picture you need to up date the rooms it had been 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: relaxingaussies
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located on bustling Nathan Road. 5-10 minute walk to nearest MTR (Jordan). Arrived later in the evening that a typhoon was forecast so hotel was extremely busy as warning was issued to remain inside the hotel. Staff were very friendly, calm & helpful throughout this time. First room allocated was an older suite which was very tired. Upon speaking to staff we were moved to a refurbished suite which is what we though we were booking from photographs on the hotel website. This room was spotlessly clean, modern & nicely furnished with a lovely bathroom complete with rain shower. We also took E Club lounge benefits which I would strongly recommend. It was nice to relax in the Lounge with a drinks & canapés after shopping in the 35C heat & humidity. It also includes 'Continental' breakfast every morning. There were fresh juices, cereals, bacon eggs etc as well as croissants, pastries & toast. A variety of coffees & teas also available. Delicious & sufficient start for the day ahead. Thanks to Marilyn & her friendly & thoughful staff for their service. Advisable to pay for E Club benefits. Well equipped gym & nice rooftop pool complete this hotel. Recommended for your stay in HK. Book refurbished room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, perfect location, hope to return!”
Reviews.Author: Alikat3182
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Hong Kong was full of uncertainty. Not sure which location was best, originally we booked in wan chai, until we heard it was something of a red light district...not exactly what my 4 year old daughter, my parents and myself were after. Scouring the Internet and comparing hundreds of hotels we finally settled on eaton smart due to the price, and the fact it had a pool, which my daughter loved! We took a bus from the airport, which was cheap and fairly easy to navigate, but we had a few lost moments when we couldn't seem to find Eaton, only to discover the concierge is down a side street. After that, we were dealt with promptly at reception, and managed to get a room on the same level as my parents. The rooms themselves, sure..they were a bit dated, but they had everything you could want..and if it didn't, a phone call to reception would result in whatever you requested being delivered 2 minutes later ( in my case, an ironing board) (and then an adapter, which I later discovered was actually supplied in the desk drawer...oops). The hotel has a gym and a pool, as stated above, which are both kept immaculately, and when we were there it was never busy, which was nice. But the best bit about the hotel for us was the Eclub, you pay slightly more to get an Eclub room, which I believe are bigger than standard (rooms in hong kong are notoriously small, but I found ours plenty big enough for myself and my daughter). Along with the larger room, you get access to the Eclub, a lounge that is THE reason this hotel stands out...included in your room rate is free buffet-style breakfast,all day tea, coffee and nibbles, and evening drinks and canapés that more than makes up the price difference between a standard and an Eclub level room. In the Eclub lounge there is also free access to the computers printers and Internet, but there is free wireless Internet throughout the hotel, and the staff in Eclub were very helpful with suggestions on what to see and do. Eaton Smart is in the perfect location, close to stations, buses, plenty of shops and markets...it's ideally located and so easy to get around. We only wish we had have booked a longer stay so we could have explored a bit more...but we'll be back, and we'll be staying at Eaton Smart for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: IntlTrainer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business last week. It was recommended by our customer in Hong Kong - it is close to her office. The room was small which is usual for Hong Kong but well laid out. I liked that there were sliding shutters that made the room nice and dark. The bed was ok but a little hard for me - I like a softer bed. The bathroom was clean and there was a nice big shower with no tub. There was no flooding the bathroom while taking a shower which happens to me quite frequently when there is only a shower. The breakfast was ok - nothing outstanding. There should be something for everyone - American, UK, anyone from Asia. The hotel was really busy so I guess it is popular. Close to shopping and a taxi ride or metro ride away from everything else. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel- I'll stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Caughtdetravelbug
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised when I entered the superior room. V clean and basic amenities all provided. Certainly not large but typical size of hk rooms. Good for stopovers. Comfortable beds n pillows but walls are quite thin. Could hear neighbours' merry making. When I first arrived at 3pm, I was quite dismayed to learn that my room wasn't ready till 4pm but I was presented a welcome drink n sat at the lounge while waiting for my room. At 4pm promptly, the service staff came over n presented me the key. She was polite n that really helped improve the wait. But I still hope guests do not need to wait anymore. Attended a wedding dinner that night in the hotel. Virtually every dish that was served was hot n delicious. Plenty of eateries near the hotel too. On the whole,a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gjc47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on stopover. A Good Hotel, centrally located. Service was excellent throughout with helpful and friendly staff. Evening meals excellent and good value. Breakfast buffet good too. Room well appointed, comfortable and clean. Minor niggles: powdered milk (for tea) with the room refreshments tray, horrid, horrid, horrid - mini tubs of long life would easily sort this. Room a wee bit cramped (for two). In summary a good hotel, would stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Tait
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly, efficient and extremely helpful. Our room was very clean, good air conditioning although on the small side. The dinning facilities are excellent with a varied menu. The concierge was most helpful and will book any attraction on your behalf. The only negative is the price of drinks in the hotel with beer around £7.70 a pint at Coke a Cola at £5.00 a can. There is a small supermarket across from the hotel and I suggest you buy a stock of soft drinks from there. The location of the hotel is perfect for shopping and is a 5 minute walk from the subway station and Temple Night market. We will be returning to the Eaton Smart Hotel on our next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Value, Clean, Great Service, but Restaurants are way off.”
Reviews.Author: viator1
Reviews.Content: I had a really good stay here at the Eaton Smart Hong Kong. Great location on Nathan Road. The rooms are typically HK small which is easy to get over because they are so clean and modern. The service is really exceptional here - even at 2am in the morning I was having some connectivity issues with the various iPhones and laptops and the staff went far out of their way to make the fix and assisted me. It was really appreciated. The gym was really nice and I had a full work out everyday. My only complaint would be the food. For the quality - it was really expensive and not worth it. Also - the wine selections were awful. Almost every bottle we tried was tasteless and sub par - especially at the price point. I think I sent three bottles back one evening, I would had given Eaton 5 point rating - but the food quality really held me back. Besides that - I would stay here again and just eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall value”
Reviews.Author: Jared E
Reviews.Content: Needing somewhere to stay in Hong Kong for 5 days, this hotel looked perfect for my needs. It has a good gym, bar and restaurant , plus is within walking distance to the night markets and the train system. I would only have two bad things to say about this place. Be careful in the pool, the chlorine levels were that high that they nearly burnt my eyes, plus they charged me on checkout for so called free wifi. They said I missed a tick box when booking, so they had to charge me. Overall though, it is a good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: PennyMc2212
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were a little nervous about what we would get but it was great! We did upgrade to eClub and the access to the lounge for internet, snacks and breakfast was well worth it. The staff were very good and the room was large and well stocked. The only small niggle was that there were no bedside lights so one you turned the overhead light off you stumbled around in the dark!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: avrilmc
Reviews.Content: Handy location,near to metro station.rooms nicely decorated,beds very comfortable,shower is great,needed after a day in the high humidity! Staff very helpful ,no complaints at all. Haven't eaten here but they do give a discount on breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “It served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Glitterangel74
Reviews.Content: Room was clean but stunk of stale cigarettes despite it being non smoking. Central for the Night Market and cabs are so cheap. Cocktails in bar are nice ESP the one with Sake!!

Reviews.Title: “Super comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: walsined
Reviews.Content: Well-equipped, clean room with a super comfortable bed. Standard speed Internet access was free (wi-fi and wired) but we had to pay extra to upgrade to fast broadband when we wanted to stream TV to the laptop. Location is good - on busy Nathan Road and only a short walk to the metro station. There is an outdoor swimming pool on the roof which is pleasant enough but not very big.  By Hong Kong standards it is a really nice hotel for the price. We didn't eat there however as there are much cheaper alternatives close by.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property, very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Anita S
Reviews.Content: Great for corporate clients, single travellers, friends or with family! Very chic and modern design now. The club room is fantastic, very spacious and have your own desk to do work on which was great. Beds were comfortable and the staff were extremely competent and fluent in English. Would definitely come back! I definitely recommend an upgrade to the club room! Wish I could stay for longer!

Reviews.Title: “8 nights in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: RodnJude
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton as a couple from 27/5-4/6. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite which was situated on the 12th floor, we had views up and down Nathan road. Room itself was certainly big enough for us, as it had a separate lounge area, could do with a bit of renovation as it was looking a bit tatty around the edges. We had access to the E Club and it's a real bonus, continental breakfast each morning and drinks and nibbles each afternoon from 5.30-7.30pm. Wi Fi access in the E Club and computers to use if you didn't bring your own was a plus. Marilyn and her staff should be commended on their professionalism, a job well done. Pool and gym area were also great. Getting there was easy from the airport with the shuttle. Jordan station is close by, a tip to getting there quicker is to use the back exit from the hotel and then walk down Chi Wo Street, it runs parallel with Nathan Road but is a lot less crowded. Hotel is in a great spot and has easy access to the main attractions. Get yourself an Octopus card when you get there, you can use it on the MTR and at a lot of their smaller convenience stores, saves you looking for change at the station every time you need to go somewhere, you just tap on and off. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great stay”
Reviews.Author: sesshi101
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel, staff was nice, and room well kept. Easy access by taxi to this location not much of a view more inter city type of place. Price is not bad, breakfast a bit expensive with okay item. Good for Asia stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinnythejinny
Reviews.Content: We booked a club room but they upgraded us to the queen suite room which was nice. Rooms are big for HK standard if you are living in club or higher. e-Club breakfast is not so great just passable, so if you are getting a better deal without breakfast just keep that out. Overall hotel staff was very prompt and room service was excellent. We didn't like the location of this hotel much but considering kowloon being the worst part of HK, its not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: EastSussexToad
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at check-in at 9 in the morning we didn't expect to get a room for hours. Not only did we get one right away, we got an upgrade with a smile! Room a bit small (normal for space-challenged Hong Kong apparently) but very nice indeed, with everything we needed. Good view down Nathan Road, with all its goings-on. Public areas (and external glass lifts) very impressive, and staff extremely polite, efficient and friendly. Fantastic buffet breakfast. Excellent, sensibly-priced food in the bistro-style restaurant (not the posh Chinese one - we didn't try that). Hoegaarden on tap and served in the correct glass too - what a bonus! Would definitely recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small and old room”
Reviews.Author: PerrySingapore
Reviews.Content: My family 2+2 stayed in Eaton Smart HongKong Room 631 last week. Room was too small to add another bed for my 8yo kid. Eventually, he slept on the floor. Wash sink was too small. Toilet bowl was too high for my 4yo boy.

Reviews.Title: “Where the action is”
Reviews.Author: Isolde E
Reviews.Content: I agree with others that the rooms are small (but modern and stylish), plus we arrived early in the morning and had to wait till 11am for a room. But the pluses outweigh the negatives. It is fairly reasonably priced and centrally located in Kowloon, my favourite place to be in HKG, it's just off the main drag - Nathan Road. You can turn out of the hotel, walk down Nathan Road to the harbour and everything it has to offer. Views, ferries, shopping and fabulous restaurants. I highly recommend you go for a pre-dinner drink in the lobby bar of the Hotel Intercontinental, at the end of Nathan Road, on the harbour from 6pm and watch the laser light display every night at 8pm, just beautiful. Hong Kong is buzzing as always, a wonderful city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: GarricsBarcelona
Reviews.Content: A very good property. Rooms have normal size for HK standard and are well maintained. The " Can do" service is extremely good as they were assisting all the time during my stay and very fast. Specially manager on duty on 12th June night. Time for check in or check out also very convenience and in general all reception staff very friendly and useful. Breakfast is really good plenty of choices ( Asian and Western ). I was also surprised for the gym, full and new equipment. Location is extremely good in Kowloon and quality price the hotel is one of my picks. The only negative point is internet, even is free during your stay you need to pay for the faster options. Management should consider to give fast option for free as we are in XXI century. Saying that the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Alec W
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small, but this is Asia. And the rooms are certainly clean and comfortable. The house restaurants are good, and the service exemplary. And to cap it off, they even gave me a birthday cake (and I was checking out on my birthday, not staying the night). This hotel also has a pool, which was much appreciated. Many other hotels do not have this. Location is good, only one block to the Jordan MTR station, and maybe 10 minutes walk to the Kowloon waterfront. A taxi to/from the Airport Express station is only about HKD30.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: NIchole T
Reviews.Content: My husband recently (may/June 2012) spent three weeks in China/Hong Kong for my 29th birthday & our 1 year wedding anniversary. We stayed in 4 different Hotels & also spent a night on an overnight train from Beijing to Xian. All of our hotels we booked had 4 or more stars or so it read. Some even reading 5 stars. Eaton Smart was the worst & the most expensive. We booked a deluxe room from the 4th June 2012 to the 11th June 2012 with flight centre. Negatives- 1) not worth the room rate 2) Late checkout rate 3) slow check in 4) no explanation when checking in regarding re activating the room card for our late check out 5) Size 6) Bathroom 6) bed 7) Towels 8) Noise during 1 night 10) Price of a can of soft drink Positives ; 1) delicious food at the buffet 2) reasonable location if you don't want to be across from the harbor .... I emailed the hotel prior to arriving informing them when I was arriving & the reason for my stay. I requested to have the room until 6pm the day of checkout. I got a prompted email saying this was not a problem however at a fee. A fee of almost the complete 1 day room rate when I only wanted it for 5 extra hours. We checked in around 5pm. Check in was very slow. We are given our room card without an explanation that on the day of checkout we need to re activate the card as we have paid for a late checkout. The room was extremely small. There was nowhere for each of our suitcases. There was a cupboard however it was not wide or long enough for the smallest of our suitcases. We ended up putting 1 suitcase under the desk However with the suitcase under the desk the chair couldn't go under the desk which gave us no other choice for it to stay next to the bed. Our other suitcase, we put suitcase on the stand blocking the entrance from the bedroom. There was nothing deluxe about the room. The round aircon duct was partially hanging of the roof & the safe didn't work. The bathroom had been recently renovated. Poorly renovated must I add. The grout between the tiles around the bath was coming away from the tiles, the toilet roll holder was coming off the tiles, behind the toilet roll holder was a filthy dirt or some kind of mark not to mention the holder was covered in dust. The roof had some kind of oil which had dripped & dried in the corner & the shower curtain was mouldy. The beds & pillows were hard but the blind kept the sun out if you wanted a sleep in. The towels were small & rough on your skin. On the last day I request from the cleaner extra towels which she kindly handed over without any issue. During our second night I was woken at 4.20am by loud thumping noise coming from above my room. I let the noise carry on for a further 20 minutes & called the front desk. No answer. I called again. I advised of the noise & was informed that security would attend. I stood at my door for 10 minutes waiting for security. They didn't come despite the noise still going on. I got back into bed. The noise was loud, loud enough that I called the front desk again at 5.00am. I was put through to the duty manage & informed that early that night there was an air conditioner problem. I asked how long the noise was going to continue for. I was told until at least 6am. I asked why they choose to fix the air conditioner issue at 4.20am rather then earlier that night. The manager couldn't answer. The manager offered to move me to another room, just to sleep & could return to my room when tge noise had stopped. I was certain no matter what room I was in the noise would still be heard as it was ridiculously loud & grinding. Plus I didn't want to move rooms for a few hours to be moved again when I had possibly fallen asleep. Later that day my husband & I went out & returned to the room to find a bottle of red wine. I thought that it was a nice way to apologies for the noise. The wine got the better of me & I goggled it. $8 US! Is that all they could afford considering I had paid $7 for 1 can of coke?? My husband & I did eat at the buffet. Paying the same price as we would here in Australia approx $55. The food was delicious the only positive thing the hotel has about it. Wing a staff member from the gym within the hotel was polite & gave great directions & Shamar from the bar made great cocktails. The location is within walking distance to Temple street night market & between Salisbury Road & The ladies market (1.5km either way). This hotel was recommended by flight centre & I was very disappointed. For the price paid better accommodation & service for the same room rate if not cheaper could be found at plenty of other hotels. I don't recommend this hotel & will definitely not be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say”
Reviews.Author: MDaleNZ
Reviews.Content: A friend and i had a lovely stay here. We shared a room with the wrap around windows, super impressive views! The staff were amazingly helpful and friendly, and the hotel was immaculate. Our room booking came with breakfast included, and, daily happy hour, which we made the most of! (Free cocktails and canapes!!) we hardly needed dinner!

Reviews.Title: “clean and impressive facilities”
Reviews.Author: seeker115
Reviews.Content: stayed in recently renovated deluxe suite early june 2012 + clean, tidy, fresh + free wifi (came with room) + convenient cafe and restaurant on ground floor lobby + great 24hr gym and massage chairs and pool (were the only ones using it) + international plug adapters in room + free water + close to everything (bus stops out front, short walk from mtr, 7eleven starbucks maccas all within a stones throw) + helpful english speaking staff + very impressive looking hotel in general (glass elavators looking out over nathan road) + nice hot shower + convenient ipod/iphone dock and charger - quite small rooms (but probably pretty normal for hk) - could have done with an extra rug or sheet on the bed - sound travels quite easily (easily woken by people in the hall or by loud neighbours) would recommend to others. good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MrPeters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Smart for 10 nights in a club room. The hotel is conveniently located at corner of Nathan and Gascoine Road. Our room was located on the 16th floor, room size was good with plenty of space for our needs. The hotel has a great gym with several treadmills and bikes. Pool area is located on the same level. Breakfast is served in the E Club on level 1. The staff were very efficient, who assisted on several occasions with restaurant bookings. A good selection of food at breakfast. There is a 24hr restaurant across the road, together with 711 and money changer. Ladies market, sneaker street are also walking distance from the hotel. Overall we had an enjoyable stay and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton last November”
Reviews.Author: Ana V
Reviews.Content: So sorry to be reviewing Eaton only now. My officemates and I stayed in 2 rooms at this hotel last November 2011 for 3 nights in a superior room which included free breakfast. The rooms, although old (we found out there that the renovated rooms start with the next room category - deluxe) were clean and spacious for a HK hotel. Service was okay, breakfast selection was great and the free water (you could get the free water anytime you pass through the cooler in the ground floor of the hotel) was a bonus! The only downside for us at the time was that there was no free wifi and there were only a few terminals we could use for free at the lobby. It was easy to get a cab in front and there was free shuttle service to the airport express. There's a Starbucks at the next corner, a 7-11 in front, as well as a money exchange. It was safe to walk even at night. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Carol383
Reviews.Content: The room we had was very clean, the only thing I can pick on is the size, it's very small

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Suetoo62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while traveling with a group of college students. The Hotel is very clean and quite attractive, although many rooms are quite small. If you stay here, paying for an upgrade is worth the money. The Eaton Smart is right on Nathan Road. It is a short walk to the subway so you can actually get anywhere. It is a short walk to various markets, ie the Ladies, temple night market and the jade market. The hotel offers a free tour to the Temple and Jade markets, free tai chi classes and wifi is available. We would stay here again There is an extensive breakfast buffet offering both eastern and western style breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robinson72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on stopover to UK. The service is 5 star and so was our room. All rooms have a city view. Great location for exploring Hong Kong. We had a lovely dinner at a local restaurant right across the street. It was delicious. They also provide a free shuttle to and from the station. The transport system here is first class. Our luggage was checked in at the station and so we didn't have to worry about it at the airport. Just superb.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: EdNaLai
Reviews.Content: My first staying at Eaton Smart HK. Staffs (from concierge to house keeping) were very helpful and knowledgable, very clean and a good location with good food, shopping and MTR all within walking distance. Looks like the place has been recently refurbished. Room ambience was very comfortable and welcoming after a hectic work day in the city. Even the complimentary wi-fi speed was reasonably good. There are 3 PCs at the lobby with printer making it very convenient when you need to get something printed. They also offer free tai-chi classes in the morning. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Free tours to night market, jade market and Tai Chi Class. Breakfast offers gluten free bread is a plus!”
Reviews.Author: alang-alang
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at Eaton Smart. I stayed there on June 5, 2012 because Agoda.com offers me a reduced rate with applied award points. So, it was a great deal. The first time we stayed there we were upset because they would charge us a luggage storage fee. This was not really traveller's friendly. We often fly in and out of HK but we need to do business in China so storing extra luggage in HK hotels before we return home was a plus to us. But if hotel charges us a fee for storage, then, it is not good. We would not have gone back there if it wasn't for a great deal. To be fair, the hotel room is a bit small if you compare it with the room at Nathan Hotel which is just right across the street. However, their rooms are more updated. Although small, they are well designed. At this stay, we noticed that it offered special breakfast deal. We decided to try. To my surprise, they served me gluten free bread when I asked. Now Eaton Smart is on my good list! The hotel now also offers free tours to the night market, jade market, and free Tai Chi class. That is a super deal. I will go back to this hotel again but I would ask for a firmer pillow. The one I had was too soft.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: EKKC89
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all 3 Hong Kong Langham properties, Langham Place is by far #1, not just because it is the newest and best appointed; but the service and ambience are both impeccible.I can't undestand why the Langham can command a higher rate with its old rooms and low ceilings. I stayed at the Eaton this time because my #1 choice was fully booked. The people tried very hard but it simply can not overcome all the physical disadvantages.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: herbert f
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have stayed at this hotel on a number of occassions and now that the renervations are complete it is terrific.Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms clean and adequate Location is very good' Very close to markets shops etc Plenty of places to eat and drink.close to under ground rail and buses' The breakfasts are excellent a great place to stay while in HK or Kowloon

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theandrews031
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Ebookers which included an upgrade to include the Eclub package. We have no complaints. Our room was on the 15th floor and found the room spacious and clean. Everything was kept clean throughout our 6 day stay. Found the staff throughout the hotel to be very helpful and friendly, especially the Eclub staff who go that extra mile. We had access to the EClub which we felt was worth the money. Having free WiFi in the room is a plus and tea and coffee facilities. We ate breakfast both in the EClub and the Metro Grill. Both having something for everyone. The Eclub does serve hot food at breakfast but on a smaller scale from the Metro Grill, which you would expect. The Eclub serves drinks and bites between 5pm & 7pm, which is lovely to have a drink before heading out or after a busy day. People have commented on the price of drinks in the hotel bar but we felt it was on par with other 4* hotels we've stayed in. We arrived from the airport using the Airport Express then the free shuttle bus. As the hotel is the second last drop off it does take a while especially as we arrived into the city at 5pm. However, used the bus back to Kowloon station and it only took 5/10mins. We also used the check in service at the rail station which made travelling out to the airport more relaxing. Our return flight was late at night and the hotel allowed us to use the swimming pool and showers for changing on the day of departure. I feel that this is something that most large hotels don't offer. The hotel is constantly busy with functions and weddings but never felt overcrowded. This was our first visit to Hong Kong and loved it. The walk to Jordan station only takes 5/10mins which was not a problem. It does look like they are planning to open a new station just outside the hotel which would be great. Loved the location of this hotel which made eating out in the local restaurants more enjoyable as we felt they were not full of tourists. Getting around this city is stress free and very cheap, UK take note. We made trips to Macau and down to Stanley. Unfortunately it rained when we went to Macau so felt we didn't enjoy the island as much but did venture into one of the casinos! The bus trip from Central station down to Stanley is great, stunning views and a great market when you get there. A bit westernised but still good. Make a visit to the Ten Thousand Buddhas. This is amazing but the least signposted which made it more difficult to find. The climb up to the top in mostly in shade so even on a very hot day its not too bad. When visiting the peak make sure you do the walks, great views of the city. We visited the Chin Lin Nunnery and Nan Lian Gardens, this was lovely but remember an umbrella even on a sunny day as there is very little shade. So much still to see so will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in renovated deluxe room”
Reviews.Author: chrisandilda
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights 1st of May and was not disappointed. Deluxe Room was perfectly fine for myself (6 months pregnant), husband, 3 1/2 year old and 1 large luggage. All the 'western' necessities we needed, such as comfy bed, free fast wifi, lcd tv, minibar, aircon, clean marble bahthroom with hot shower and flushing toilet were provided for in a modern decorated deluxe room. The service was excellent, ordered room service once and extra towels and all arrived in a timely fashion and check in/out was a breeze. Had buffet brekky for $110HKD/adult (daughter was free) and it was the prefect start to a long day of sightseeing. Jordan MTR was 5min walk, temple st market 2mins walk, McDonalds across the road on Nathan Rd, which my daughter loved, and 7/11 on Pak Hoi st entrance of hotel as well as money changers and Tsui Wah restaurant for a nice cheap meal. Taxi from airport approx $230HKD (that inclu tolls, and luggage fees) almost the same price if taking airport express/shuttle buses - for the convenience when traveling with a family was worth it. Taxis readily available in front of hotel and pretty cheap by western standards and pretty honest by Asian standards. Used combination of MTR and taxis, so an Octopus card is also an essential. Given its close proximity to MTR the location is ideal for a starting base for all your sightseeing needs - if I wasn't pregnant with toddler in tow we probably wouldnt need to use the taxis as the cheap public transport is more than sufficient to get you where you want to go. Hubby used the gym and was more than adeqaute for his needs. Highly recommended this place for all types of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Normal hotel”
Reviews.Author: JunChyang
Reviews.Content: When we check in at 3pm,the staff tell us only have 1 room ready! And we can't get all the room in time ! Another room will ready at 5pm and another 2 room will ready at 7pm! How can this happen when we already paid it!? The hotel not enough cleaning staff? The 3 deluxe room we have still ok and clean,everything look new! The suite room hotel are terrible! In the 6 floor! The room are old and dirty,I can see some hair on the floor! Tv are old! Dust are all around the table! Bathroom are really small! Hairdryer,bathtub,the bed all look old! I can't believe it,with the price I paid I surely wish to get better than this! the only good about this hotel are their friendly staff,the cleaning staff are polite,front counter staff name Kay also very friendly,helpful and also other I can't remember their name!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in Superior room”
Reviews.Author: TPP18
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the 6th floor superior room for 2 nights in May. This is a bad decision definitely. The room conditions are bad. For examples, dirty carpet and wall paper, mould smell, crack toilet bowl cover, dust in the bedframe, old tv, smelly telephone etc. Everything is old and with funny smell in the room. It's like entering an old 2/3 stars hotel room and I am very shocked. I feedback this to the Reception and she offered a room change on the next day. I was told that all Superior Room should be around the same confiditions (old furnitures), but maybe cleaner. Considering the hassle of changing room and eventually I did not take up this option since I only stayed for two nights. I would have much appreciated if the room change could be done immediately when I feedback to them upon check in. Besides, I don't feel safe in this hotel. Seems like anyone could just enter the hotel and access to the floors. They do not have the enhanced security lift where room cards need to be used to access certain floors. Good thing about this hotel is the location. There are restaurants and 7-11 across the road. Also very near to MTR and shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at Eaton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lost_world09
Reviews.Content: Our first stay was in Aug 2011. We were pretty impressed with the high standards of Eaton Hotel and we decided to stay in the same hotel for our second trip to Hong Kong. In my frist review, I lamented that there was no wi-fi in hotel room. Guess what? Few months later, my wish came true. Now there is free wi-fi in the room. This is definitely a big plus point to the fantastic hotel. I guess Eaton will now be more popular with tourists. During my check-in, I saw someone trying to book a room and was told the hotel is fully booked. Mind you, it was not a weekend but a Wednesday. For people travelling to Hong Kong and wanting to stay in Eaton, better book early to avoid disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABA12
Reviews.Content: It was a quick business trip. I chose this hotel on recommendation and I was not disappointed especially in a place like HK. Service could be improved though. What I liked most was the location.The station was close by.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: karan p
