Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean and comfortable room. Helpful, polite and friendly staff. Good rate for such a nice hotel. Lovely roof top pool, with the cleanest, and best changing rooms I have ever used at a swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy G
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that is perfectly situated for Temple street night market, Ladies market etc and with easy access to MTR and local/ Airport buses this is a great choice. The moment I checked in the signs were good, the reception was welcoming and efficient. I had booked a Deluxe room and was on the tenth floor, it was extremely well furnished, clean and comfortable. The room was fairly small but this is something that is to be expected in Hong Kong unless you pay TOP $!! Having said this it was plenty big enough. The bathroom was excellent. During my 5 nights at the hotel all of the staff that I had any contact with were brilliant which makes the experience much more comfortable. The Concierge were incredibly helpful!! The pool on the roof of the 21st floor was so relaxing and offered some good views. I would certainly stay at the Eaton Smart again when in Hong Kong and on my experience I would recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value HK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saksatien
Reviews.Content: This is not a five stars hotel. But if considering the room's price tag and the pay off, it is one of the best value hotel in Hong Kong. The best part of this hotel is the location. The hotel is located in the middle of Nathan road, the center of shopping & restaurant areas. You can take an Air Port Express and then take the free shuttle bus to directly drop off at the front of the hotel. The MRT subway (Jordan) is just a few minute walking distance. There is a convenient store (7-11) just opposite the hotel entrance. Plenty of restaurants is in the area. The hotel is close to the temple market, a local shopping area. And it is only a few MRT stop to other tourist areas, such as Mong Kok, ... The lobby is not that grand, comparing to other luxury hotel. The room size is quite small, but it's a typical in-town hotel in Hong Kong. The room is not new, but not that old. The bed amenities are high quality. The TV set is not modern, but with sufficient channels to watch. The air condition is quite. The room also has a free wifi. The only complain is the noise from the adjacent room's bathroom. It can wake you up early in the morning if your neighbor uses bathroom early. The bathroom is not modern, and small. But it is clean. It has sufficient amenities, and the sanitary wares are decent. The staffs are also helpful.

Reviews.Title: “If your room is on level 7 or under DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Irish R
Reviews.Content: We had several rooms booked for a family holiday - on arriving at level 6 and exiting the lift - the smell of damp & mould was very noticeable, you could even see mould on the walls in our room. One room also had bugs crawling over the bed! It took about 3 hours but we were changed to rooms on a higher level (& the rooms were newer).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: formulafrog G
Reviews.Content: The Eaton Smart is ideally situated on Nathan Rd right near the Temple Street night markets and not far from Jordan MTR. It's also fairly near the Ladies market. There are two types of room - one has been refurbished and the other still has older decor. We had a refurbished room so it was modern and clean. Both styles of room are quite small, but that is common for Hong Kong. Our room just looked out on to the side street and had a wooden shutter. My brother had the older room but it had a big bay window looking out on Nathan Rd. The refurbished rooms start from the 9th floor upwards. The rooftop pool is fantastic, as are the views. The hotel lift is external see-through capsule and has a 180 degree view.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star hotel with easy access to MTR”
Reviews.Author: lryland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2012 for 5 nights as a single traveller. The hotel located is excellent as it is very close to Jordon MTR station and many shops and restaurants. I had a single room with excellent décor that was clean and modern. The service was very friendly and efficient. The hotel pool is located on the roof and has a well equipped gym attached. I paid $120 aud/night and was happy with the location and standard of the hotel. The hotel was friendly as it was easy to met fellow travellers in the garden lounge area. You are very close to the night markets and shopping at your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Location Price & Service - All very good”
Reviews.Author: MartinM60
Reviews.Content: Our first holiday in Hong Kong and could not have chosen a better hotel. The staff were very friendly, and importantly very efficient. The EClub was very good value for money, and would recommend it for the breakfasts, and the evening canapes/drinks which were complimentary. Very well run hotel, I wish they were all like this.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Eaton Hotel for a number of years now every time I stop over in Hong Kong. I stayed there again just recently 2 weeks ago, and as usual, the service was great. The concierge/bell-hop, the front-desk, the restaurant staff --- everyone super-friendly, helpful and efficient. I was upgraded to a junior suite which was really very comfortable, clean, well-furnished and equipped. It was a real pleasure to get to my room and unpack/unwind after a 14.5 hour flight from CA. The hotel is very conveniently located close to Jordan MTR and just a couple of minutes away from the Airport Express train station in Kowloon. I used the rooftop pool for a few minutes before checking out --- lovely. Wish I could have stayed longer to enjoy all the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, average location”
Reviews.Author: Abby R
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Eaton Smart Hotel in Hong Kong for 5 days. The hotel rooms are extremely small. For one person they are adequate but too small for two people. There is not enough room for two suitcases in the room and a very small storage space. The pool area of the hotel is ok, very shallow pool. The staff at the hotel are adequate but they are not overly friendly or helpful. There are not a lot of Western restaurants near the hotel, however there are several asian restaurants close by. There is one restaurant at the hotel which is very nice. The other end of Nathan Road would be a better location to stay, closer to Holiday Inn, there are better shopping and eating options down the other end.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: soehar
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is quite good. Walking distance to almost everywhere. Temple street is just across the street. The deluxe room is pretty small but has been renovated recently. Bathroom is tiny, just enough room for 1. (but then, this is HK). Check in staffs were nice and friendly. We didn;t have time to use hotel facilities this time, but we are coming back in 2 weeks to stay in club room. Will let you how the room goes. (almost forgot, the bed was very very hard.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sandra168
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart was a wonderful experience. All the staff from the greeting to our farewell were all very accommodating and extremely friendly. Our room was very comfortable and was very clean everyday. Our 9 day visit was well worth the value. We took advantage of the free Tai Chi Class that was offered and it was so much fun and a learning experience. We also used the Exert Fitness facility and again very clean and up to date. Every morning we used the Main St Cafe and took advantage of the buy one get one free coffee. The staff at the Cafe made an effort to get to know you and remembered you as well. We found the location of the Eaton very central for us. Our travel was to visit our son and we and we highly would recommend the Eaton Smart to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Karin H Melbourne Aust.”
Reviews.Author: Karin1953
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Smart for 5 days and had a lovely time. Once we got our room sorted out we were very happy with what we had. We had booked an club room but were given a very run down and tired horrible room that certainly could do with a re-vamp. Very disappointed with this. I would have thought that if you booked a club room it should be one of the better rooms they have. I went back to reception and told them I refuse the stay in that room and wanted a renovated room to which they agreed to. The room we had was on the 16th floor with floor to ceiling curved windows looking out onto Nathan Rd. The room was very nice and comfortable although there was only one chair in the room (no armchairs or settees) so one of us had to sit on the bed. There was only one side table beside the bed with a lamp and nothing on the other side (have never been to any hotel with this problem) had to put things on the floor. The room itself was very clean and the bathroom was small but had everything you could need. The E-Club was wonderful and we were very well look after by Marilyn and other staff. They could not do enough for you and were always around replenishing drinks etc. It was great going there after a days outing somewhere in Hong Kong. Also very close to transport and very cheap getting around Hong Kong on the MTR. Even taxi's were very cheap (never paid more than $4 Aust going anywhere). Very convenient especially when you are to tired to use MTR. All in all and a lovely time at Eaton and would go again when next in Hong Kong. Aside from this all the staff at the hotel very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Hotel Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Danny F
Reviews.Content: Eaton is a convenient boutique hotel. But it is a very comfortable business traveler hotel. And the E-Club really is a jewel. The staff there led by MArilyn Villeneuve are exceptional. The warmth and friendly service make up for many other perceived hotel shortcomings and for the business traveler it is a convenient and comfortable place to unwind, do a few e-mails and catch up I have stayed there for many years and even the rooms are small I only sleep there but the rest of the establishment and its location make it a great spot

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hong Kong Base”
Reviews.Author: alinghi2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Eaton and cannot praise the hotel highly enough. Firstly, one has to accept that Hong Kong is a busy city with lots of people and land is very scarce. The Eaton rooms are small (like all of Hong Kong) but extremely clean and comfortable. We stayed in a club suite which is well worth upgrading to. Magnificent view up Nathan Rd from the 16th floor through the floor to ceiling curved windows. Flat screen TV's. Hot strong shower. Quiet air conditioner. Big comfortable bed. Everything as you'd expect. The wonderful E Club staff provide a great breakfast (hot and cold) and the 2 hours of evening cocktails and snacks was most welcome after a long day of exploring/shopping - all included in the Club room price. We can't understand some of the reviews which suggest that the rooms are tired. Our room was immaculate. Bathroom looked shiny and brand new. Settee was very comfortable! The location is perfect for the traveller. Really easy to get to/from the airport via the Airport Shuttle and HK has the best transport system in the world. The MTR rail station is a very short stroll away and they run every couple of minutes. Easy and safe to get anywhere and costs no more than US$2 a trip. Temple and Jade markets are around the corner, but the best is the Ladies Market which is a kilometre walk away or one train stop (50c). We had a perfect stay at this hotel and will certainly book here again when next we visit Hong Kong. Before you arrive, think boat cabin and then get a great surprise when you find out how BIG the rooms are!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be - The Eaton Smart Hotel Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: MargC1955
Reviews.Content: The club rooms at the Eaton Smart are the only ones big enough for more than a single traveller. We booked a deluxe room and had only enough room to walk around the bed and nowhere for our suitcases - nor their contents. The club room we had to upgrade to was very comfortable but the settee was pretty uncomfortable. Pity they've changed things as we very much liked this hotel when we stayed there previously. The location is still great though within easy walking distance of MTR, Ladies Market and the Night Market. Also the Jade Market.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at Eaton”
Reviews.Author: Wistin
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart is big hotel located on convenience area on Nathan road, surroundings by various hotels, shopping place, restaurant, easily to access the public transportation and etc. Hotel restaurant on lobby area offer great choices of menu and friendly service staff. I stayed in Club Room which I felt not-worth compared to room quality and interior decoration. Room have an old look and bedding not at good satisfied, other furnished also aged (ie. TV, Hair dryer, Bathtub) E-Club offer nice benefit facility and great service during stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Johnno1960
Reviews.Content: Teh Eaton Smart is in the busy Nathan Road. It is in within walking distance to the Night Market and the Ladies Market. We also walked from the ferry with our suitcases and it was a nice 20 minute walk although we were fighting the crowds. The Reception staff were very quick to check us in and very friendly with good English. The room although small was adequate for our 5 day stay. The restaraunts in the complex were comfortable and offered great food. We had Tapas on the 1st day for lunch and we should have shared as it was a very generous amount. Breakfast each morning was a Buffet and the food was delicious but pastries a little crunchy for my liking. Our Chef Raymond did a fantastic job with the busy morning crowd. The Main Street Coffee shop which is at the front of the hotel was a great place to meet and relax. The hotel has Wi Fi throughout the complex. The gym was fantastic only small but offered weights and machines with a rooftop pool. The 2 x massage chairs were a delight for weary bodies. The bed was a little hard but that is just personal preference. Overall a good hotel for a short break. if it was any longer I would look for a hotel with larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively convenient,good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: K H
Reviews.Content: The free shuttle (K1) from Kowloon station is comfortable, but the ride itself took us about an hour to reach the hotel, since the bus stops at other stops first (the Eaton hotel is at the 6th stop). Check in at the hotel is a bit long, and one of the rooms that we booked was not ready when we arrived (3pm). Apart from the bad start, the rooms are comfortable and clean. I stayed in the club room, which has a large windowed wall. The E Club breakfast is pretty basic, service is average, but one can tell that they are trying. Coffee here is not so good, but Satrbucks is just around the corner, where I'd go for my coffees. The MTR Jordan is nearest, about 10 mins walk along Nathan road. The street is very busy in the evening, lots os shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A WARM WELCOME”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: The Eaton Hotel and its E club offer the business traveller and vacationer a home away from home when visiting Hong Kong. Located in Jordan, the hotel is conveniently located near both bus, MTR and Hung Hom Station. The E Club is a welcome retrreat at the end of a busy day of meetings and walking the trade fairs and provides a relaxed social atmosphere, where you can choose to share conversations with fellow travellers or simply relax with a beverage before continuing to explore Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Tans2010
Reviews.Content: We booked a Club Room and upon arriving at midnight after a 9 hour flight, were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a corner suite for our weeks stay. Certainly can't fault the room. The service in the Club Lounge was warm, friendly and efficient. The Hotel is within a hop and a jump across the road to the Temple Street night market - a must visit for the traveller. Also walking distance to Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui. Loads of great restaurants around. Excellent service overall especially the concierge. The complimentary Tai Chi lesson held regularly 3 times a week is a bonus and was very professionally conducted. A real treat and a great intro to Hongkong. The soon to be opened Jordan train station entry/exit just across the road from the Hotel will be tremendous!! We will certainly come back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Smart Hotel for travellers who is smart enough to pick a hotel so conveniently located near Temple Street...”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeCatlover88
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Eaton Smart htl last year between 3rd Oct and 6 Oct 2011. A colleague friend previously stayed there before and recommended us. Upon arrival was very disappointed when told our rooms were not ready need to come back an hour later. It really sucks when we took SIA first morning flight to Hong Kong hoping when we reached the hotel we can check-in. Not much choice we decided to go for lunch nearby the hotel to kill time. We walked bck almost 3pm and again was told the rooms were not ready and need to wait awhile more. I lost my composure demanded to check-in immediately!!! Front office staff saw me very agitated and fuming hot without much ado prepared the key instantly. Sometimes it works when you screamed at the top of your voice demanding instant service despite the embarassment when everybody started looking at your direction. I don't gave a damn!!! Only plus point of this hotel is near Jordan MTR stn (5 mins walking distance) and when you exit frm the hotel crossing the road junction is the Temple Street aka Men's Street. You can shop in the evening for all kinds of things from souvenirs like t-shirts,scarves,ladies and men attire,kidswear. And a variety of items like toys,bags,belts,shoes,slippers,watches and the lists go on and on ecetera ecetera. You may also find good reasonably cheap food for dinner and supper if you shop around til midnight. It never ceased to amaze me this same stretch of street I visited a decade ago has got it old charm and attraction mainly to tourists like me and my friends. Hong Kong - I'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: james l
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of Kowloon. Easy to find, just leave Star Ferry and walk for 10 minutes down Nathan Road. We had the last two rooms on the night we stayed. These were not very good. Make sure you inspect your room before paying. Im sure our rooms were not typical. Good staff. Very good breakfast. Try the Nathan Hotel next door if this ones full.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location for a city break in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: SixpenceUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton for 3 nights in March as a city break en route to New Zealand. The hotel is very centrally located: just a few minutes walk from the Temple Night Market. The bedrooms/en-suites are very small, but it was equipped with everything we needed. There was a good choice of hot and cold buffet for breakfast. We only ate in the restaurant on our first night, but it was okay - not a very extensive menu though. The other two nights we found plenty of local restaurants serving a great choice of Chinese food. If that's not your thing, McDonalds is just across the road from the hotel. We found it easy to walk down to the Harbour area, and also plenty of shops very closeby the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel -- great location, friendly service, free wifi in rooms”
Reviews.Author: Josephine N
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at Eaton ever since 'discovering' it by chance some years ago. This would have been about our fifth stay there and each time we're pleasantly surprised by the improvements made -- both to facilities and service. The rooms though small, are comfortable although I feel the dim lighting could be replaced. But the best thing is the free wireless internet connection in the room now! The hotel staff are friendly, attentive, and helpful. This time, we decided to try the Airport Express instead of book a taxi to and from the airport, and were pleasantly surprised again, that the free shuttle stops right at the doorstep! The shuttle also takes you to Kowloon MTR for city checkin on the day of departure -- no hassle and so convenient. We checked out of the hotel, hopped into the shuttle, checked in our bags and then did more sightseeing/shopping/eating without worrying about our bags and rushing to the airport to checkin! Tip: buy your ticket online -- cheaper and faster -- no need to join the long queue at the airport. Hotel is conveniently located...very near Jordan MTR, and the street markets of Temple Street (just opposite) and Tung Choi St, Fa Yuen St, etc in Mongkok (about half an hour leisurely walk with lots to see, and eat, along the way) And, if u need a laundry so that u dont have loads to wash after a relaxing holiday, there's one just across the street at Woosung Street. 1st 3 kg at HK$33, subsequent kg at HK$10. Cheap and good...if u send the clothes in early, u can even collect later in the day. Opens from about 8am to about 8.30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: msmelbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on transit to Australia. The hotel is nice, rooms are very nice, comfy bed, room not so big, clean and nice bathroom. Staff were very nice and very helpful. We had dinner at the restaurant Yat Tung Heen of the hotel, it was alright - I wouldnt say it best meal but it was alright after 13hours of flying. In the morning we had the breakfast buffet at the Metro Lounge of the hotel and that was delicious! So many choices. I would have preferred to have had their buffet dinner rather Yat Tung Heen. Before we left for the airport in the afternoon, we had lunch here again and just did ala carte. It was delicious again. If we returned to HK for a longer period of time, I dont think we would come back to this hotel. It did the trick for a transit stop over hotel, the size of the room would have bugged me and the location wasnt super central. I didnt see any good shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel with good facilities and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: baytravellers
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Eaton Smart and will definitely return there. We booked a Club room and noticed that many of the E-Club guests were regular visitors to the hotel. Not surprising as the club facilities are first class. The staff in the Club are very attentive and friendly. Breakfast, all day snacks/tea/coffee/soft drinks are included and the complimentary evening cocktail time is a very social occasion with everyone enjoying a few drinks and snacks before heading out for the evening. Our room, was a decent size - probably due for an update to the decor - and kept very clean and tidy by the housekeeping staff. The room had a good size safe and free wifi internet access - two really helpful facilities that we apprecited. Concierge service at the hotel was excellent. In addition to the usual helpful advice the concierge had a huge fridge where you could collect complimentary cold water bottles and hand wipes each time you headed out to explore Hong Kong - another welcome touch. The gym was well equipped and the pool small but clean and ideal for a quick dip or a lounge in the comfortable poolside area. The hotel is well located on Nathan Road, close to Jordan MTR and on the A21 bus to the airport. We spent the whole week sightseeing - the Octopus card makes travel on all public transport very easy. We did not eat in the hotel restaurants as there are so many places to eat locally but the outside terrace and restaurant in the lobby always seemed busy and there were good restaurant choices within the hotel. All food in the E-club was good and well presented with linen place settings at each table. The staff were attentive to the buffet ensuring it was replenished regularly and plates were cleared quickly from tables - always with a smile!! A great find in Hong Kong!!

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good hotel rather let down by a small room”
Reviews.Author: Helpmeimlost
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights in transit to Australia. The hotel facilities were good with several restaurants, a patio garden; a gym and a swimming pool. It was in a good location - only a few minutes walk from the Jordan Road metro station and the pleasant Kowloon Park. If you were hardy enough to brave the street watch sellers you could walk to the star ferry terminal; space museum; culural centre; and Art Museum in 15 minutes.There are markets close to the hotel including a night market and a jade market but do not bother with the latter unless you are a hardened market goer! All of the staff at the hotel were helpful, friendly efficient and competent.The hotel had a good lift service. We did try the restaurant buffet one night but unless you have a very healthy appetite it is rather expensive. However the buffet breakfast which was included in the price of our room was excellent. The hotel is surrounded by many restaurants but with so many it is difficult to know what one to choose without some local knowledge. Our room had a TV but with only a limited choice of channels; a safe; a mini bar; wi-fi; a good bathroom with lots of hot water although only with only a shower. The air conditioning unit was efficient and quiet. The room was always kept tidy fresh and clean.There was no problem with any noise in the room. When we arrived we were advised that our room had been upgraded which was just as well! Obviously space is at a premium in Hong Kong but our room was small - maybe the equivalent of a US single room. It had limited wardrobe and shelf space with no drawer space at all. This could have been a real problem had we been staying more than a few nights

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: janet G
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel en route to Sydney. The courtyard bar/restaurant was an oasis of calm amongst the hustle of Nathan Road. A good breakfast and good lunches and evening meals. However the room was much smaller than we had thought from the internet site with no room to open both cases down at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Mpayton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days on the way to Australia. From the moment we got out of the taxi on arrival until the time the staff called us a taxi to leave we were treated with the utmost courtesy and respect. The staff were so attentive. I have not known service like this before. W|e had an amazing time, the hotel is located perfectly for the markets, the MTR and not far to walk to the harbour. The breakfast is not good value for money. The meals in the restaurant seem good of an evening. The drinks are expensive unless you take advantage of the "happy hour". We would certainly stay here again as the staff are fantastic, the location is ideal and the standard of accommodation is very good. Size of rooms seems to be an issue in HK but ours was fine. Wife loved the glass outside lifts, the 3rd floor garden was great to chill out in. Lets put it this way...if we went back to HK we would not book anywhere else we would certainly go here. On a sociable note, make sure you take the harbour ferry, make sure you take the tram to the peak (unless misty or foggy as a waste of time) wander the markets and also take the walk down the "avenue of stars" by the harbour. Also go to the gardens and temples (sorry cannot remember the names) you will find that the gardens/temples are a sea of tranquillity in an amazing high rise city. We did 4 days here on the way to OZ and having done this we think it is enough unless you want to explore inland China ie the great wall etc. HK is great but there are only so many places you can see and so many times you can be asked to buy fake rolex, fake prada bags, and have a hand made suit. Go enjoy it for a few days but no more

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: OliviaB19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in April on business. We booked 2 double rooms however when we checked in we were informed that there was only one double available and one twin (2 single beds) but as we had had a long trip and it was late at night I was too tired to argue. Also as we had booked Club rooms access I was under the impression that the rooms would have floor to ceiling windows etc but this was not the case. The rooms are a little tired looking and could do with some updating - the carpets were a little stained and the bathroom was a bit grubby looking but nothing too bad. We had E Club access so breakfast was included which was good - no a massive choice but certainly enough for everyone to fine something. E Club access in the evening included canepes and drinks, and the staff there were great. I used the gym which was very good but not the pool (due to the dreadful weather). Will stay again next time I visit HK due to the staff mainly, and also the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0nAndrea
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed at the Eaton Smart for the first 2 days of our honeymoon. The hotel is very close to Nathan road and Jordan subway station so we took public transport from the airport. We did find that the subway stations have a lot of steps so we struggled with our big cases a bit! We got a cab back to the airport at 6am no problem, the concierge just flagged one for us. Our hotel room was small but very clean and modern and they gave us a bottle of wine and some fruit as we were honeymooners, which was great! I can't comment on the breakfast because we didn't have it - but we did have drinks in the bar and a latte and pastry in the cafe, which were both lovely. I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A night in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: This a typical business/tourist short stop hotel, bedrooms were adequate and catering was good. Reception was excellent as was the concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarynB
Reviews.Content: This is hotel that I have stayed at on business trip over 6 times. The location is a little away from the main shopping/eating area however it is only a 10 minute walk. 5 mins to the MTR and a 10 min walk to Ladies Market - for those wanting to shop. The rooms are very well appointed and if you get the upgraded room type is amazing. Large and with a very well appointed and large bathroom (for Hong Kong Standards). The buffets are a little expensive but do give a lot of food, so for those larger eaters well worth it. Get breakfast included in your stay as the breakfast buffet here had to be one of the best I have ever eaten at. As a 1865 Club Member you get the upgrade and free internet so if you are a frequent traveler look at taking the membership out (Langholm) - the perks are definitely worth it. Staff are usually very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Smart Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart was an excellent place to stay in Hong Kong. The location is in the centra Kowloon with access to buses and train networks. Walking is not a problem and there are many things to visit and see. The harbour is a good walk from the Hotel, but enjoyable. Accomodation was good with no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Typical 'stop over' hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lasvegas-marmalade
Reviews.Content: This hotel was what we would expect on a stop over. The rooms are quite small, but adequate. There is no bath but a very large shower. The breakfasts were a bit busy and you often had to queue and the dishes were not always filled promptly with fresh supplies. The positives are the location, near to the night market and also the 'Chinese' part of Nathan road. There is also a very pleasant cafe with internet access. Unfortunately we were blighted by noisy neighbours one night. We would however use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Smart Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: MICKANDJAN
Reviews.Content: Our room was compact but comfortable, everything very clean and smart, nice room which was booked as "Superior". Food here is first class as is the general customer service. However the view from our room wasn't brilliant, if you want a good view you would have to ask for one of the top floor rooms at the front. However you don't go to such a fantastic place like Hong Kong to hang around in your Hotel Room. The location is excellent, easy walk to underground station, bus stops and very cheap taxies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Services!!!”
Reviews.Author: wanazwan
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from our first ever trip to Hong Kong two weeks ago and stayed there for 3 nights. The service at the front desk during the check in was excellent as from the concierge to our room less than 10 minutes. The location was good as it was a walking distance to Jordan MTR and Temple Street Market. If you feel for a quick bite, there's a 24-hours McDonald just across the hotel and Starbucks next door. Coincidently it was my birthday and I received a complimentary birthday cake! The room and services are beyond our expectation. The room size is acceptable (bare in mind this is Hong Kong!) but the bed........AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: emmak808
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton hotel for 3 nights in April. The hotel is situated in Kowloon and is in a great place to explore the area. Temple street market is 2 minutes walk away and the nearest MTR station (Jordan) is 5 minutes walk. We got the airport express train then the free shuttle bus service. This drops off at the hotel door. This is well sign posted and by far the easier way to get to the hotel. We did this at 11pm with no problems. This large hotel has a lot of amenities, approx. 5 restaurants and a few bars. We only had one drink in the bar, £5 for a pint of lager, it was expensive compared to local places in Hong Kong but nothing you wouldn't expect from a hotel bar. The room was compact but clean and modern. My only complaint would be that although the bathroom was modern it looked like in the last update they had done everything else but not replaced the bath. We had a late flight home and asked for a late check out. We were offered an extra hour (1pm) and advised that if we wanted the room until 6pm it would be a half day rate of £100 (we didn't pay this rate for our room). We went with the 1pm check out and spent the afternoon doing some last minute sight seeing before returning to the pool for a swim and got showered and changed there. I would recommend this hotel and will book again if i get the chance to return to Hong Kong. It's a great city and three days was not enough time.

Reviews.Title: “Love the room upgrade!!”
Reviews.Author: dgrbleu2
Reviews.Content: I stay annually at this Eaton Smart and was availed this time with an upgrade to a city deluxe room, which was on the end of the hotel and had a wall of windows, looking north up Nathan Road. Huge bed, large work area, bigger TV, and small minibar area. Still a small bathroom but the size of the room made that easy to overlook. Used the e-Club as usual and staff and service were excellent as always- Danny & Marilyn make the e-Club great!! Free in-room wi-fi is new and very appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Super efficient, clean and free wifi in all rooms!”
Reviews.Author: CarolToronto
Reviews.Content: My mom and i stayed at this lovely hotel for 14 nights btw end of March and April 2012. Prior to booking, I thoroughly researched hotels in Kowloon, Hong Kong on the internet and found this one so i proceeded to look up user reviews to see what others had to say about this property. Surprisingly, about 90% of the reviews were extremely positive, a good sign for me to book this hotel! Although there were some negative reviews, these were mainly complaints in relation to the small size of the rooms which to us is irrelevant as what mattered the most for us was to stay in a centrally located hotel with clean comfortable beds and bathrooms. Check, check and check! The research paid off! The closest MTR is Jordan exit B1, a mere 5-min walk from the hotel. The only drawback for us on arrival for check-in at 3pm was that our room was not ready and we waited for two hours to get it. This was a small inconvenience since, unbeknownst to us, we had received a complimentary upgrade to a deluxe room. Nice touch! We were so exhausted after a long 15-hour flight that we truly appreciated this gesture. This hotel has all the amenities of a five-star hotel. Adapters are provided in addition to free wifi in the rooms. The Metro Cafe on the LG level has the best caffe latte in HK! In addtition to the great tasting coffee and pastries, u get a free coffee when u purchase one if u present your room access card. As to the service, I agree with other reviewers that the staff at Eaton were all attentive, courteous and professional in everything but i have to mention that our reservations agent Billy Wong was exceptionally outstanding! I wanted to personally thank him but he was not on the premise during my time there. overall, we had an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Professional staff, comfortable rooms, within walking distance from jordan mtr.”
Reviews.Author: thq
Reviews.Content: Appreciated the complimentary daily wifi and the umbrella and shoe horn provided (1st time I came across). TV has a variety of international channels and there's daily complimentary newspapers. The location's not too far from the mtr.

Reviews.Title: “Club rooms a must”
Reviews.Author: allblacksPerth
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel a couple of times firstly with family, my husband and three boys. Hong kong hotel rooms are small so we had two rooms with a connecting door. Boys loved the pool on the roof. When I stayed there last I went with a friend and we stayed in a club room with all the perks of the club floors. Breakfast, coffee and tea all day and cocktails and nibbles in the evening. The Eaton is so handy to everything in Kowloon, the markets, MTR and shops are great.

Reviews.Title: “Experiences at Eaton Smart”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: 1. Easily accessible by A21 Bus FROM and TO the airport. Airport Express Shuttle Bus Stop in front of the hotel. 2. Easy walk to Jordan and Yau Ma Tei MTR Stations. 3. Bus stop to Star Ferry Pier almost in front of the hotel. 4. Expected arrival was between 0000H and 0100H, we sent an email if we can be provided some snacks when we arrived and their Guest Relations Officer did provide us a sumptuous early morning snack. 5. Complimentary cold water when leaving and arriving at the hotel is a big help with all the long walks in HK. 6. Great atmosphere and food and drink offerings at the E-Club during breakfast and afternoon cocktails. On our last day, they allowed us to enjoy the afternoon cocktails before going to the airport even if we had already checked out. They also offered the use of their Changing Rooms at the 21st Floor (Gym and Swimming Pool area). 7. 7-Eleven right across the hotel, Starbucks just around the corner, McDonalds and Wellcome Supermarket across the other side of Nathan Road. 8. Jordan/Temple Night Street Market along your way back to the hotel from the Jordan MTR station. 9. Good gym equipment. 10. Friendly and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service pushes it up”
Reviews.Author: btravels20
Reviews.Content: There is nothing eye popping about the rooms or the decor of this hotel. It's standard for a 3-4 star hotel in hong kong. The rooms are clean and well kept up. However where this hotel really shines is in customer service. From check in the staff was very accommodating. Even after we left they were helpful. When a personal item of very small value was left in the room the hotel held it until we could pick it up a week later. That's just one example of their helpfulness

Reviews.Title: “overall good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: rooms are comfortable and tidy. i hv been staying with this hotel for several times due to biz travel. convinient location for tour around. rooms are quite small, pillows too soft. others are good.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, friendly staff, good food”
Reviews.Author: enid61
Reviews.Content: We booked in for 2 nights on our return from Australia and weren't disappointed. The Staff were all very friendly and helpful (unlike many in the UK) and the room was spacious and spotlessly clean. We ate in the hotel for dinner on the 1st evening and breakfast on our last morning there. The food was well presented, good quality and reasonably priced. This is an excellent place to stay for touring around. We walked a lot of the time but also enjoyed the Big Red Bus Tour which helped us to see a lot of the area. Didn't have time to enjoy the pool but did manage to relax there of an hour before flying back home! It was lovely and peaceful! Would definitely stay here again if we return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, very modern”
Reviews.Author: Anthony C
Reviews.Content: Positives: - Short walk to the Jordan MRT station - Close by to many local favorites - Very updated, modern interior - Bathroom was fantastic - very clean and excellent water flow - Great value for what you pay for - take advantage of their "24 hour price match" on their website - Focused on being green - you put in your keycard into a slot to activate the electricity for the room - great way to save on bills and you won't ever lose your keycard in your room Cons: - Bed was a little stiff for my taste - Room was small, but it's Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “EATON SMART GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: sueashleyallen
Reviews.Content: Arrived 23/02/12,stayed four nights.Although room was small it was no problem,we had a double bed that was extreemly comfortable,and we had enough room for our two suitcases.The T Lounge and Bar were good and very welcome after being out all day.Have stayed on the island previously,but the Eaton Smart was more central.MTR,F100,Star Ferry etc

Reviews.Title: “The Smallest Bedroom in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: tomsBeds
Reviews.Content: Yes, we were booked into the hotel by a tour company who obviously had done a "deal". However the room was the smallest twin room we have ever been offered in the far east [over 25 years]and when we complained about its size we were told no other rooms were available. To give you an idea the room excluding the small ensuite was abou 12 feet by 13 feet into which had been squeezed two single beds one up against the wall and with less than a foot between it and the other one. No bedside tables or bedside lamps at all,one dining type chair to sit on and a small desk with a single table lamp on it and hardly room on the floor to open a large suitcase. With no light switches to turn off the ceiling lights when you went to bed, you had to get out of bed to turn them or the the table light on the desk off. View, what view,just a scruffy tenament building. The Breakfasts were expensive and the pastries stale on both mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location!”
Reviews.Author: leikan2000
Reviews.Content: The Eaton Hotel Hong Kong enjoys a convenient location on Nathan Road in the heart of Kowloon's famed shopping and commercial district. Just a few minutes walk from Jordan MTR (Hong Kong metro) Station, guests here are in easy reach of many of Hong Kong's top attractions including Temple Street and the Hong Kong Jade Market. The room is comfortable with modern decor and broadband Internet access. I was able to be upgraded to a suite with a acceptable price. It has a living room with a desk, sofa area, as well as Chinese tea ceremony facilities. In the Yat Tung Heen restaurant, I enjoyed good quality Cantonese dim sum for a brunch. The hotel also has a nice Japanese restaurant, and surfing the Internet while drinking good coffee was a wonderful and relaxed experience for me in their cafe, which has an entrance on the Nathan Road. The concierge was impressive with his reach knowledge on the city itself and what's going on in the city. The process of check-in/out took a bit time and can be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location on Nathen Road with great connections for the MTR and local markets etc. The rooms are quite small and basic. While in hong kong you expect small rooms there was nowhere for a case to sit. Still they are comfortable and well maintained. They make a decent base if you will not spend much time there. The hotel itself is very confusing and has no real front door and can be a bit of a tangle. Hotel bar and restaurant were disappointing but there are so many great options for food in the local area there is no reason to eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong experience”
Reviews.Author: Leslie B
Reviews.Content: good location to most attractions,MTR station, buses and restaurants. Helpful concierge with knowledge of most things to do with Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Central and Great E Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: gcrefs
Reviews.Content: Well we arrived at 8pm from Australia. Our room was ready turned down and ready for us. Check in was a breeze - one receptionist taking our passport details whilst the other preparing the credit card deposit, room key and transport of our luggage to the room. We got a large room - 3 person located on floor 16. The room had 2 single beds and in a seperate lounge area was a sofa that pulled out to a small double bed sized bed. The room was the largest that I have stayed in on the multiple trips we have done to Hong Kong. The only real complaint was the carpets were a little worn in the room - other than that the toiletries supplied, the linen and beds were all of a first class nature. This is compared to the Langham and Novotel hotels. We used the E Club on level one - very spacious, relaxing, nice chairs and lounge area that couples as breakfast and evening cocktails area. It is open from 7am - 11pm - continually staffed with some awesome knowledgeable people that really make your time in Hong Kong a memorable visit. From organising day trips, altering flights, altering transfers - all was done without any problems. Marilyn who is a regular staff member in this area goes out of her way to assist you, make you feel welcome and ensure that your every need is met. The food was great in the E Club - breakfast every morning had a different offering available. Hot breakfast, large array of hot fresh pastries, juice, good tea and coffee and a range of cereals and fruit to get you off to a good start. Come 5pm - an open bar - drink what you like! Complimented by some great nibbles and warm food to make the day sweep past. The Jordan railway station is a safe 5 min walk away. The Temple Street markets are 2 mins walk away. Some amazing restuarants and places to eat in close vacinity. I would make mention of a trip to Mongkok - we found a great money exchange lady - not that difficult to find really - just head towards the Langham Hotel when you exit the metro (2 stops from Jordan). Her address is 525 Shanghai Street - basically on the corner of Shantung and Shanghai streets - there are two banks on these corners and she is just south of them. The rates were the best in Hong Kong - sometime 5% - 9% better than other areas on the street. She offered currency changes for all units of currency (commission free). We were lucky to get $8.04HKD for our dollar (Australian dollar). As we were leaving to head to Europe she happily changed our HKD and AUD to Euro for us at the awesome rate of $0.79 Euro. Temple Street markets have a great variety of clothes, electronics (I would recommend the world traveller adapter that can be used anywhere in the world - pick one up for around $50HKD). Some great toys and souvenirs available as well. I actually think the quality and prices here are now better value than the markets in the Mongkok area. The street food is the best food and tastiest that I have encountered in Hong Kong - from Cantonese, Chinese, Seafood, Indian and Japanese there was a variety to tempt your taste buds all at reasonable prices. Drinks were ridiculously cheap - local beers for around $3AUD for a 750ml bottle. I would make mention about the lads at the concierge - arranging transport. luggage storage and general information about things to do and places to see - if Marilyn and her staff in the E Club didn't answer your questions then these boys did! The pool is heated - on the roof top - with awesome views. The gym is very spacious and have free weights, machines and all the amenities of any modern gym. The equipment is new and good standing - the shower and locker room large and great to use after a work out. A great place to stay and at a reasonable rate of around $240AUD per night - breakfast and E Club included. This rate was offered directly by the hotel after an online enquiry directly to them. They offered and arranged private transfers and communicated very well throughout our reservation process. I will post some photos for you to enjoy. Happy to come say hi again soon!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: toper3_jr
Reviews.Content: Booking as part of a air/hotel package the price was well justified for what was offered. We were upgraded to a club room which had wrap-around windows on the 19th floor. Eventhough it was a smoking room(the room had NO noticable smoking smells or anything to reflect this.) The amenties in the room were great from the flat screen TV, to the Coffee/Tea service, and the robes. Bathroom looked newly refurbished and super clean. Plenty of room for luggage people, relaxing. And when checking in and needed an adapter they were super friendly and helpful even with directions to specific locations where we wanted to go. (Only bout 2 1/2 blocks from nearest MTR station and free shuttle to Airport Express Train.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: coolandyboy
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from hotel staff from the moment we arrived until our departure. Location central, lots of shopping and good restaurants with reasonable price in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service and misleading staff. Hotel clean and rooms ok.Dissapointing for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Pureteck
Reviews.Content: Booked a room on the club floor for me and my father and was promised 2 separate beds. On check in at 6pm told not available now but will be later. Went out for dinner and arrived back at 10pm to be told sorry bad luck. Only a king size bed too share available. Very bad attitude. Also a friend of ours was with us and it took over 20min for him to check in. Hotel is clean but the service is horrible. Club lounge was full with lots of loud kids. Not very good to relax with a quiet drink after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Not for most tourists”
Reviews.Author: Merrilyn1617
Reviews.Content: I am sorry but this hotel was not anywhere near as good as we expected. The location on Nathan Road was great and the pool was nice, but the rest of the place was a complete let down. Admittedly we did not stay in the E lounge rooms, but even though I expected small, they were claustrophobic. Our only window had a wooden shutter which we had to keep closed or have people looking in from windows everywhere opposite, so it was a tiny, dark, hot and smelly room. The prices for drinks in the bar was ridiculous even to Australian standards, let alone Hong Kong prices, and the staff were not that friendly or helpful, except the ones downstairs getting you taxis etc, they were great. There was a good cafe down stairs, but even getting there could be an adventure as not all lifts actually went down to that level, and it advertised as all day dining, but we went to get a coffee at 11 pm, and all was shut. I keep hearing about all the rooms in Hong Kong being this small, but we stayed the first five nights on HK Island, and the room was beautiful and good sized, we only moved to Kowloon because of the markets, and had booked and paid for all accommodation before travelling so did not know that the transport was so easy, good and cheap or we would have stayed in Causeway Bay for the duration of our stay. Don't recommend this hotel to fellow Australians.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Smart Hotel, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: suzanne m
Reviews.Content: The Eaton Smart was an excellent hotel which I stayed in recently. The location, facilities, food, staff, internet access and room were all outstanding. I was travelling on my own, so the comfort of the hotel, and the great food, attentive staff and central location were all excellent. I would without doubt return to stay there again, and I would recommend it to anyone travelling to Hong Kong. The hotel is spotlessly clean, and the quality of food available was excellent. The breakfast buffet was a particular highlight. Lastly, the concierge service was also great, ensuring tour departure/arrival and airport bus transfers were smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Dee S
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on Nathan Road but do try and get a room on one of the higher floors as the road can be very noisy. We had use of the E Club which to us was invaluable. Breakfast was lovely and included Chinese food - dim sum - and western food, fried eggs, bacon etc. Small snacks are available throughout the day (eg biscuits) and happy hour is from 5.30 to 7.30 which for us was a God send. Wine in Hong Kong is incredible expensive with the cheapest bottle starting at £30 but here it was all included. Spirits etc were imported and there was a limitless supply of soft drinks, juices etc. The food in the evening was varied and if you are watching the pennies it would be possible to just eat in the E club (although perhaps a little boring). The nearest MTR is about 5 minutes walk away, buy an Octopus card for ease of use, which can also be used on the buses which in turn are regular, clean and air conditioned. The hotel is impeccably clean and staff tremendously helpful with excellent English language skills. Rooms warm and cosy. This is our second visit to Hong Kong and we didn't even look at other hotels so impressed were we with The Eaton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for shopping and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: flashpacker50
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay here. Location was very good for all the markets in Kowloon. Easy walk to the ferry terminal to cross to Hong Kong island. Typical business type hotel with good standards overall. Breakfast was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for Temple Street Market !”
Reviews.Author: roblindag
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel on our 5th visit to Hong Kong. The location was new to us - the only other time we stayed in Kowloon was in Harbour City - a great location which has become rather expensive. We were very pleased with the location. We always take the Airport Express bus (often being the only westerners on the bus!). It's easy, cheap (40 $HK) and you get a good view of HK on the way. The names of all the hotels around each stop come up on the digital display. The hotel has everything you need in a fairly small space - bathroom good - all marble and up to date. Hold out for a breakfast included in the price as hotel b/fasts are quite pricey. Lovely buffet with all the choices - cereal, gorgeous fruit, full English and Asian. Only the tea and coffee were not up to scratch - often less than hot - but hey! Tea and coffee making in the rooms and more of anything on request. Also late checkout on request - ours was 12 am. The location is just over the road from Temple Street Market where we spent many a happy,haggling hour. Also - on the way down Nathan Road to the Harbour front (20 mins walk and a must do in time for the 8.00pm laser show on the Island skyscrapers) you must visit Kowloon Park - an absolute haven in the middle of H/K madness ! Would use this hotel again for value for money, comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay at Eaton Smart hotel Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Barrie W
Reviews.Content: As I had a number of small meetings planned in Hong Kong I booked a Biz-Suite. This was well equipped with free wi-fi, a good sized desk and a colour printer with fax and scanner. The separate sitting/office area proeved ideal for my meetings, mainly with two other people, and the E-Club facilities far exceeded my expectations. The staff in the E-Club were both courteous and helpful and the range of drings and refreshments were plentiful and of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: susan h
Reviews.Content: This hotel in on Nathan Road, the famous golden shopping mile. Looks good from the outside, and the inside, although as you draw nearer to the hotel you do think oh dear this doesn't look good. But it is a lovely hotel. The staff on the concierge desk were brilliant, the staff at reception weren't very polite, a little abrupt really. But although the rooms are small, they are very clean, and you have everything that you need and more. Flat screen TV, hair dryer. It does lack storage though. But the hotel is used as a stop over for Australia, so most people don't stop longer than 3 days. The hotel has a lovely restaurant and cafe bar, and is a lovely area to be in. It has the most amazing living wall, as the hotel is very environmental friendly. Would defiantly stay again, as it is situated in an excellent area for walking, and all transport. All rooms have air con, and free safe.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern room setting. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was very modern and new. Size is a bit small but compare to most Hong Kong Hotels nowadays, it is considered on par. The location is superb with easy access to train stations and close to the night markets

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart is a great place to stay if you're on a budget. Staff are relatively friendly but sometimes did not take the time to work problems out. There was one day when i was there and we came down to the bar near reception and noticed there were no lights on at the bar. Asking a staff member "what time does this open?" the response i got was "12pm". It was already past 1pm and yet no sign of any staff members for the bar... shouldn't there be someone managing that place?? Anyhow we went elsewhere and made no issue of it. The whole stay was overall good but all goodness was destroyed when upon checking out, I realised my credit card had been charged 3 times for the one room. They denied doing it and said they only had the one copy of the credit card. I eventually got my money back.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at EATON SMART”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good, clean and spacious room,. Good club facility and courteous service. Check-in and check-out was quick. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but centrally located with food and shopping right outside”
Reviews.Author: Katmik T
Reviews.Content: The room is very small. Ours overlooked a highway and parts of Nathan Rd and the courtyard. It had one queens size bed, a desk and a bathroom. There really isn't much room to move around. That said...it's not bad if you are only going to the hotel to sleep and shower. Amenities: Comes with outlet adapter for your electronics (i think it came w/ 2); 4 computers w/ free internet access in the lobby; free wireless in room; free tai chi lessons in courtyard at 8am; Nearby: right across the street from the back entrance, you got the seven-eleven, a fish-ball noodle shop that is open past midnight, and taxis and mini buses at your beck and call. By the front entrance, you got Starbucks and all the treasures of Nathan Rd, opened late late late into the night!!! Not to mention a lot of buses (including the airport bus) stops on Nathan Rd right by the hotel. The night market is a few blocks away and we walked all the way to Tsim Sha Tsiu and back along Nathan Rd. It may be slightly pricey for the size and all that but we were often out at 8:30/9a and back around 1a so we just needed a decent, clean place to sleep and we really love that it is so well located and convenient. The Jordan MTR is just a few blocks away as well. Every morning, we got to try out different places for breakfast b/c it's all within a 5-7 mins walk from the hotel. (If you want large rooms, I've heard that the Sheraton near the harbor has the largest rooms in Kowloon peninsula).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very good for travelers”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel a lot of times. Very nice hotel and very friendly staffs. Cood location. Room is very comfortable. Price is cood also.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: kiko1203
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart is a good (and cheaper) alternative to expensive TST hotels with the same star rating. Located along Nathan Road which is next to a bus stop and 5 to 10 minutes walk to Jordan MTR Station. Which is why when going around, i recommend to take the bus instead of the MTR. The Concierge is there to guide you on which bus to take and where are the stops it makes. unless you have the budget to take taxis all the time, I find taking the bus better and more convenient than walking up and down MTR escalators/stairs. and yes, book the club rooms if you want more room space. it has a huge bathroom with a bath tub. allows access to the club floor with the unlimited drinks and free internet. club floor also has buffet breakfast. or, you can add additional HK$ 50 if you want a wider buffet selection at the Lobby Floor. Normal buffet rate at the lobby floor restaurant i think is HK$ 150 plus Just don't expect the club room to look exactly as the website photo :-) And no complaints on hotel staff. customer service indeed. If not in a hurry, best to take the A21 bus to Eaton Smart from the Airport as it has a stop right in front of Nathan Hotel (which is beside Eaton Smart).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Steven F
Reviews.Content: I researched HK accommodation and settled on the Eaton Smart. We were very happy with our stay. we were fortunate enough to be upgraded from the city club to a suite which was very spacious (rare in HK!). The service was outstanding - friendly, helpful and efficient. We also benefitted from the e-club facility which included free cocktails and wines between 5 - 7:30pm which was a real treat. The location is awesome from Kowloon (on Nathan road and close to the night markets). We definitely be back! Steve

Reviews.Title: “Customer service somewhat lacking.....”
Reviews.Author: Mary W
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant stay at the Eaton Smart for our one night stopover. The check-in staff were pleasant and efficient and our room was upgraded without asking. The staff in the restaurant were excellant and the food and coffee good. Our experience was soured however by the attitude of the gentleman on reception on the morning that we left. We had paid for a full breakfast to be delivered to our room in time for our early departure. This had been paid for through our travel agent in the UK when booking the hotel stay. On checking in however, we were told we could only have what they termed a breakfast box. We reluctantly agreed to having this delivered at 4.30am to our room in time for a 5am check out and decided to take the matter up on our return to the UK. The breakfast wasn't delivered and on checking out at 5am we advised the gentleman on reception that we would be claiming a refund through our travel agent on our return home. We were offered no apology and the gentleman stated that we would not get a refund. He insisted that we wait for the breakfast box which (after he had made a call in Chinese) arrived a few minutes later while we were still discussing the matter. I declined and pointed out that we were on our way to the airport with luggage, didn't wish to carry anything else and would get something there. The gentleman was quite argumentative and we were left with little alternative but to take the rather heavy bag which we discovered later to contain stale sandwiches and pastries and other items which we had to discard. Not a good advert for the hotel and I would certainly not choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Ainsworthian
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and was in a superb location. All staff were very helpful indeed. My room was more than adequate, immaculately clean and all amenities worked well. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Hong Kong on business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Airport shuttles stop at front door”
Reviews.Author: Joan E
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location for access to Shenzhen or Hong Kong International. Moderately convenient for Kowloon attractions; 3 blocks from Temple St night market, 20-30 minutes walk to exquisite harbor area and ferry to Hong Kong Island or 2 blocks from MTR for the quick trip to Hong Kong Island. Nearby Kowloon park is terrific, beautifully landscaped. Room was space efficient, clean and comfortable, with friendly service. Hotel restaurant offers overpriced western food but it served our purposes when we had a morning departure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small for price”
Reviews.Author: davlanders
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are quite small for the price and I was charged for internet daily dispite our organization being told that in room internet would be free since we booked so many guests. I should have known there would be billing problems when I had to fax a reservation instead of doing it online like every other hotel in the world. I do commend them for their efforts in being green and the breakfast was great. The bar was also open and airy and a pleasure to spend time in.

Reviews.Title: “Strategically located in the heart of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: LDtraveller
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart is a great place to stay especially if you want to stay in a place that is centrally located to everything. Easy to get to and from the airport. Close to MTR although we walked everywhere as most attractions were easily accessible (TST, night market, temple st, jade market, ave of stars, etc). There are great local restaurants nearby and also a 24 hrs McDonald's across the street which we regularly visited for a quick snack. Room: Stayed at Eaton Smart for 5 nights in a Superior Room. Although the room was small with one side desk and chair we were able to fit our 2 large suitcases and carry on comfortably in the room. The beds were comfortable and clean. We got a room on a higher floor with the view of the church, we found it to be very quiet and didn't hear any noise from the street. Bathroom was clean and decent size. You also get 2 free small bottles of water each day. We decided not to upgrade to the EClub as we did not anticipate on spending lots of time in our hotel room and eating out was a lot cheaper. Fitness Room: One of the requirements for us when traveling is a hotel that has a gym. We found that Eaton smart had a great, clean facility on the 21st floor and consisted of a cardio room (included: 3 treadmills, 2 bikes and an elliptical machine, and wii video games) and a weight room with full set of weights and machines. Towels were available at the front counter along with change rooms and showers for men and women. The only thing about the fitness room is that there is a fragrance machine that automatically sprays scent in the air, so if you are allergic to perfumes and strong scents it can become very difficult to work out. I noticed this on two occasions when I tried to work out during my stay. Lobby was very clean and updated. The check in desk is very small but the employees were very nice and provided great customer service. We arrived later in the evening so check in was a breeze, check out was also very quick. There are also a couple of computers that patrons can use for free and we found that we could also get onto one with little wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: dclarry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early March 2012, stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay there. We can get the free shuttle bus from Kowloon Station which runs every 12 minutes and drops you off right in front of the hotel. Check in was fast and efficient and the staff are very professional and helpful. The rooms are small (Hong Kong standard) which did not bother us as we spend little time in it anyway. The rooms are well equipped and bathroom is also the same with a large shower which was great after having walked hundreds of miles exploring Hong Kong and Kowloon. We also enjoyed drinking our cocktails (which were well priced and excellent) in the open garden near the bar and restaurant. There is also a very well equipped gym in the hotel however the only unfortunate thing was that the pool was closed down for maintenance until late March. My wife thoroughly enjoyed her morning Tai Chi lesson with Master Cheung which was provided by the hotel for free. There is also a free tour for the Temple Street Market and Jade Market which we did not do due to running out of time. The location of the hotel is great if you want to stay in Kowloon and explore the north and south of it. It is right on Nathan Rd near Jordan with plenty of restaurants nearby. It is also a 5 minute walk from Jordan Station, which will take you everywhere in Kowloon and Hong Kong and it's about 20+ minute walk from the harbour (if you like walking it's i not too far). The hotel is great if you want to see Kowloon, plenty of restaurants around, Temple St and Jade Market is nearby. Overall great hotel at a good price (we booked about 4 months ahead).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price.”
Reviews.Author: robmead
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights late Feb, early March. Rooms were small but as you would expect in almost any city hotel. Location was good, on Nathan road, near the night market and close to the MTR. Sadly the swimming pool was under maintenance whilst we were there, and it would have been nice to know before we booked. No mention of an alternative was given to us. Free wi-fi now available throughout the hotel, however it isn’t secure access. Would recommend the breakfasts. Everything you could want for the morning. Overall a good hotel, at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and its location.”
Reviews.Author: Steven N
Reviews.Content: I hv been staying in this hotel for numerous occasions be it business or holiday, the plus point is its location which is near to the MRT, eateries and convenient stalls within walking distance. Another plus point is its friendliest and professional staffs that always greet you with a smile. Lastly, for the price I would consider the room to be adequate, especially you are at the heart of shopping district along the Nathan Road. I will definitely be staying in this hotel when ever I am in Hong Kong be it business or holiday.

Reviews.Title: “enjoy the stay”
Reviews.Author: hendronet
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights with my wife & 5-yo boy after visiting Macau. It's my first stay at the hotel (last year we stayed at Nathan Hotel nearby). We found Eaton is slightly cheaper than Nathan Hotel so we decided to try there. The room is about the same size & style (modern interior) as Nathan Hotel. We got a free upgrade but based on my research before booking the hotel, the upgraded room is actually the same size, only now there is an ipod dock (we didn't bring ipod though, so it's pretty useless). The service is good, check in & check out process was fast. It's located at Nathan Road, walking distance to Jordan/Yau Ma Tei MTR, Kowloon Park & temple street market. There is an outdoor swimming pool at the top of the building but it's very cold in March to swim. Would give 4 notches for sleep quality if they provide king-size bed for my room choice. Overall I'm happy with the hotel, nothing very special though.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the E Club Level”
Reviews.Author: Fee70
Reviews.Content: When staying on the E Club level the rooms are dearer but the extra benefits are well worth it. Free internet, seperate area for Breakfast, lounge area available to you all day for afternoon tea, and cocktails and supper food. The staff in all the areas of the Hotel were helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. The pool was closed for maintenance which was fine as it was still cold but the pool area looked lovely. The E Club rooms were large in size, I didnt see the other rooms on the other levels to compare. The only down size was a bit of traffic noise which I got used to after 1 night. The higher the level, the less the noise. Overall we had a great time here at this hotel, close to train station and right near the Temple markets.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: jughead52
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an overcrowded and cramped feel to it. The rooms are very small and the view from my room was of a dirty wall with washing hanging out. My toilet wasn't working but this was rectified quickly. The minibar had virtually nothing in it. Even the location is inconvenient for the harbour and the main sites of HK. I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms - needing maintenance. Not value for money”
Reviews.Author: YorkBonBon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in February 2012 on the way back from NZ. We normally stay at The Nathan but couldnt get a booking there so as this was close by opted to stay here. The rooms are very small and cramped . As we had booked a " Delux " room we queried if we had been allocated the right room - we were assured that we had and when we asked what made it delux we were told it was the decor . There was no where to put your cases to keep them out of the way - and virtually no hanging space for garments. When we arrived the room was so cold - even after we shut off the air con -we had to ask for a blanket. In addition there were no cups in the room to have a cuppa so we had to ask for those too . On the second day our room wasnt made up , so we had no clean / dry towels - so day 2 we had to ask for those . Day 3 our room was made up but the tea/coffee/sugar wasnt replenished so we asked one of the staff for some more of them. The bed was very very hard , but the pillows were lovely and soft . The grill of the air con was falling off and a socket in the celing was hanging off. We love Hong Kong - and when we come back we will make sure we dont stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, dreadful room”
Reviews.Author: Angela G
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading it's web site - what a mistake! Have stayed in Hong Kong over a dozen times so am used to the accommodation there and this was way below standard. We booked and paid for a city club room and were shown to an un-renovated standard room with no bedside tables or lights, the bed was pushed up against the wall so one of us would have to climb over the bed to get in. On complaint, we were given another room, again un-renovated, but with better windows! One bedside table, no reading lamps and only one chair. There was also a power point hanging off the wall and this was later fixed using super glue ( by them not us!). The staff are great and the public areas are lovely but unless you can get a renovated room the accommodation is very ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but inefficient”
Reviews.Author: Aaronlo
Reviews.Content: The staff are nice to offer champagne and chocolate for our honeymoon. However, the air con was faulty and generating loud screeching noise throughout the night (despite the room being newly renovated).. The next day, the maintenance crew tried fixing it and left the whole carpet wet in the process. Housekeeping did tried to dry the carpet. However, the carpet is still damp when we return. Worst, the same noise came back the following night. Due to the loud noise, we were unable to sleep that night. A generally good hotel to stay if they can ensure that the rooms released are suitable for guest stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price but small room”
Reviews.Author: JamesBWong
Reviews.Content: 6 night stay in HK, the hotel I usually stay was full so I was a bit sceptical. Arrival: No one to help with the luggage but we followed the escalator to the lobby area. Check in: Very efficient and quick Room: Small, room to walk around the double bed, not much room to open the luggage. Bathroom was ok. Room was very clean, bed was comfortable. A fridge, safe, kettle and hair dryer as basic amenities Hotel: No Wifi in the rooms, but cabled broadband (surcharge I think) but there are 6-7 computers in the lobby (free internet). We didn't try the restaurant but I had a beer at the bar (cost me $80 for a pint!!!) Area: It was in between Jordan and Yau Ma Tei MTR station, walking distance from the busy Mongkok and ladies market. Temple St is only 5 mins walk. Seven-Eleven convenient store directly opposite main entrance and also 24 hrs McDonalds across the road (I got hungry after a night out, 3am) Overall: Liked the hotel, did exactly what was needed. I didn't mind the small room as I don't stay there inside that often. Recommended! Special mention: To Alex the concierge, based on the ground floor. He helpfully arranged a last minute bunch of flowers to my room (Valentine) and was very helpful for my trip to Macau

Reviews.Title: “We love the E Club at the Eaton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: colonnnade
Reviews.Content: My self and my wife stayed in the Eaton smart Hotel on Nathan road for 5 days in Feb 2012 . It was our 5th stay at the hotel .We always book a club room because (i) You can check in and check out there (ii) it is available to have meetings all day (iii)The Buffet breakfast is excellent as are the happy hour cocktails and canapes. The manager Marilyn makes you so welcome and will look after all your requirements. The bedrooms are a good size and there is an excellent restaurant with a nightly buffet to die for. Location is excellent on Nathan road among all the shops and less than 5 minutes from the night market and NTR . The staff are well trained and helpfull at all times .There is a pool and gym on the 20th/21st floor which is usefull at the end of a busy day. I have no hesitation in highly recommending the Eaton HKG

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: thequeeeen
Reviews.Content: Rooms - Small but clean, in a place like Hong Kong where real estate is prime and there's so much to do other than spend time in a hotel, it is a decent place to return to at the end of the day.  Location - Being about a 5 minute walk from Jordan MTR, Eaton is highly accessible and centrally located. It's also about a 5-10 minute taxi ride (HKD 30-40) from Kowloon Station, where the Airport Express station is.
