There is also a free hotel shuttle which you could take from Kowloon MTR, though this took us around in circles for about 30 minutes! Across the road from the hotel is Tsui Wah, a traditional Hong Kong cafe which was pretty good.  Service - Check in was fast and concierge was knowledgeable.  Value - When price comes into the equation, a lot of places fail to make the cut. This is where Eaton shines.

Reviews.Title: “Just a right value for your money”
Reviews.Author: kimytch
Reviews.Content: We make Eaton a hotel of our choice every time we visit Hong Kong. It casually sits on Kowloon's Nathan Road clpaw enough to Airport terminal, major Kowloon attractions and shopping areas, and most important - yes, right beside a MTR station. We'd recommend this hotel for everyone who seeks for a right value for a travel budget - not cheap nor expensive and just balanced in terms of service, location and money.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore all the bad reviews about the rooms before renovation (its finished)”
Reviews.Author: Oscar S
Reviews.Content: (i know all you want to do is read a quick review not an essay so i made it easy for you guys to read) LOCATION: This hotel is a city hotel (almost) right next to the awesome Temple Street Night Market and its on Nathan Road so you won't be bored. Theres a 7/11 literally right next to the hotel and McDonalds right in front of it (there are a lot of other restaurants on the street as well) TRANSPORTATION:The MTR station is only about 5 minutes away, and the Airport bus (free) is literally right next to the hotel. ROOM: Very clean and modern. Massive windows, Aircon, a (around) 40" flat screen. Not very big, but this is understandable because this is a city hotel. Unless you are The Queen, you will be happy with it, lets put it that way. SERVICE: They all spoke English perfectly. We arrived on 7 am even though we could only check in at 1pm, they stored all our bags in the safe storage area and when we checked in it and went to our room at 1pm, it was there for us. It felt a bit weird though when they took our credit card with two hands and bowed at the same time. Something I'm not used to. CONCLUSION: very nice hotel, especially for the price. I'm definitely staying there again when we go there this december.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience in Eaton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raymond L
Reviews.Content: I had stayed one night in Eaton Hotel yesterday and tried it's Chinese Restaurant. The food quality is excellent and the restaurant manager is friendly & professional. Desserts are also my favor and higly recommended. Location is good, nearby the mtr station and temple street. Room is cleanliness & tidy but the corridor looks a little bit old. Overall experience is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Judy C
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel online using the information supplied on the Internet. We booked a Deluxe room but on arrival the room was so small (no room for the suitcases let alone walk around the bed) without hitting a wall or two. We then decided to upgrade to a Club Room which was so much better. The staff were reluctant to inform us of all our upgrade entitlements. This included breakfast with free internet in the breakfast area. I had remembered researching the more expensive room included breakfast and had I not mentioned this at reception we would have not have been told breakfast was included. Apart from the initial hiccup the Hotel was clean, room service well done and the location fantastic. I would stay at this Hotel again but if it is your first time and you book through the internet make sure you know all the facts relating to your room selection and other options if you choose to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Ms-Chan
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart is located conveniently between Jordon and Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. We caught a hotel shuttle bus from the Airport at HKD $130 per person which is a shared shuttle and took you all the way to the hotel doorstep in half hour. We were very close to Temple street and Ladies Market, and many stores and mall right on the main street. 7-eleven is right outside the hotel for your convenience. And also alot of cafe and restaurant could be easily found. Not forgetting the hotel offers 24hr room service at good value. We were very happy with our Superior room which comes with full length window overlooking the city. Room is small but essential for us. Bathroom is with tub and attached shower. Buffet breakfast is cheap and good with wide selection of local, american and japanese section. If convenience and excellent location is what you're looking for, Eaton Smart will definately not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Hotel, until you buy a drink!”
Reviews.Author: redblackbird
Reviews.Content: We arrived fairly early morning, staff were pleasant, but our room wasn’t ready. They invited us for a coffee - which we took to mean complimentary - we had a tea and a coffee in the smallest cups, and were charged HK$80 - about £8.00. Later that afternoon after a brief walk about we decided to have a nice quiet drink at the bar, which was empty? Call it fatigue, jet lag, after the mornings drinks, but we sat there had two halves, and one pint of Stella HK$183.5 - about £18.00.....that roughly works out at £9.00 a pint! This is a huge hotel, there are about seven lifts - and they also charge for wi fi - but state there are free computers for guests for 'casual' use. There are six computers!!! Needless to say there is some waiting if you want to use one. Our stay was for one night, we were on our way home from Auckland, a trip we have done several times and stayed at hotels in other countries en route, nowhere else had we had to pay such high prices for drinks. We ate out had two meals two drinks HK$80….about £8.00 I wonder how much that would have cost in The Eaton?A

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: khrisered_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during 2008 and not during 2011. The staff were very helpful and even upgraded my room without my request at no extra cost. Central location and within a short stroll to the Underground network. Breakfasts were sumptuous and became a highlight of this hotel experience. A thoroughly professional and caring staff. We recommended it to friends and they reported a similar experience and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Eaton Smart at around 09:15am following an overnight flight from Melbourne. We were met at the door having reached the hotel via the free shuttle bus from Kowloon MTR station. Our cases were collected by the friendly porter for delivery to our room. Having arrived so early we expected to have to wait for our room but the helpful reception staff allowed us to book in straight away, Although our booked room was not available an alternative of equal quality was offered. Our bags arrived shortly after we reached our room on the 11th floor which had an amazing view. We were pretty tired after our flight and getting the room early meant that we could get some sleep straight away. We had our lunch in the Metro Grill which offered a good choice at reasonable prices. As our flight to London left at 07:55 the following day we had to check out at 04:00 and again the helpful staff arranged a taxi for us to the airport. The room was excellent although slightly on the small side. Both my wife and I were impressed by the service and value for money offered at the Eaton Smart. We would stay there again if in HK.

Reviews.Title: “1st Time....No Regrets”
Reviews.Author: Gel S
Reviews.Content: Our 1st time to check into this hotel the experience is awesome! Friendly staff and very accommodating. We accidentally left our money in our room and we got back its all tidied and cleaned. To our surprise they secured our cash and didn't took a single cent. Honest people. Location wise, its good coz its near the subway and you can go out for night market which is less than a mile walk to stores and shops. Starbucks is just across our hotel if you need a quick caffaine fix! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Smart Choice”
Reviews.Author: LeslieNow
Reviews.Content: Our enjoyable stay this past week was in the older section, with a small room, but we get used to that with many Asian properties. Once again, a very clean hotel, with staff that go above and beyond to serve and please. We reserved an e-Club room, and thoroughly enjoyed the amenities of the e-Club. The hosts were so gracious and accommodating. We were surprised to discover the hidden daily buffet off the main restaurant area, and it's well worth the HK dollars. However, across the street from the hotel, we found a Chinese fast food that has the very best Chicken fried rice I've EVER had, and I do know my fried rice! (Tsai Wah is the name) I would only expect and wish for free WiFi throughout the hotel guest floors, as many competitors offer this, and being connected to the internet is a must for travelers. Once I paid for a connected my computer, my husband could not connect with his. The e-Club does provide WiFi, but in the room is a highly valued guest service. The rooms could use updating, but all-in-all, cleanliness and great service made this a delightful stay, with all the great "old city" attractions nearby. Don't miss the night market... a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great area. Close to the Jade market and the Temple Street Night Market. There are lots of little restaurants to choose from in the area. The rooms are small but that is typical in Hong Kong. Clean,bright and comfortable beds. The breakfast buffet is excellent and worth purchasing.

Reviews.Title: “Should treasure loyal customer more”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart has several room types. However, after more than a year's time as guest, and I stayed there almost every 3 to 4 weeks, I suggest the hotel to upgrade its club room and suite room. Those layout is bad and very old style. I prefer to downgrade myself and stay in the Executive room. As a voyager member and a very regular guest of Eaton, I am disappointed that I am not given a free breakfast every time when I stay there. It is not a big deal, but it gives loyal customer very bad feeling.There are not many TV channels, especially cable or satellite. Suggest Eaton invests that and give guest better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Hk”
Reviews.Author: Swedepar
Reviews.Content: Staff, location, room, bar, all perfect. Bang for the buck!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect first visit to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Ailzypie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, clean, and modern. The hotel is bit hard to find off the street, and the entrance is pretty much through the hotel's driveway. There is free Internet in the lobby and it's right next to Starbucks, Jordan MTR and temple street night markets and the jade market. The best part are the free tours for the local area that the hotel offers. Not many (if any) guests hardly take the tours so if you're lucky like me, you get your own personal tour guide!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended stay”
Reviews.Author: tbearsydney
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about. Just a good quality solid clean and stylish room for excellent value. Great service at the front desk very helpful beyond what is normally expected. Also, when some unexpected small fees showed up in my credit card statement, I just emailed them and they very quickly reimbursed me no questions asked. I would definitely stay again. The rooms are a little bit small, but it is Hong Kong and everything else about the hotel outweighs this minor defect. The best thing about the room was the shower heads. Really good pressure and best shower I had in Asia. The beds are also really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nat_Dreamer66
Reviews.Content: Adequate bathroom amenities and supplies; good hot beverage supplies in the room. Comfortable and cosy room atmosphere. Elegant reception, good dining outlets and fast-speed internet kiosks.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and a great location”
Reviews.Author: HitchHiker26
Reviews.Content: I went to Hong Kong last October to meet my daughter who was travelling back to the UK from Australia. We spent a very pleasant week in this hotel which is situated right in the heart of the commercial "merry go round" that is Nathan Road. It's just across the road from the Temple Street Night Market and Jade Market and just about 20 minutes walk from the Ladies Market in the Mong Kok district. Our mornings where usually spent in nearby Kowloon Park where the people watching is truly fascinating. The hotel is very accessible. On arrival in Hong Kong, a courtesy bus will take you to the door from Kowloon Station, but a taxi is only about HK$30. Your are also only 10/15 minutes walk from Jordan MTR station and the train will have you down to the Star Ferry Pier or across to Hong Kong Island in minutes. The hotel itself is very clean, the staff extremely courteous and it is well served by a number of inhouse restaurants and cafes. Rooms are not spacious (such a thing is a rare luxury in Hong Kong), but were perfectly adequate for our requirement, which was a very comfortable place to sleep. After all, we did not go to this marvellous city to sit in our hotel room! I will return to Hong Kong and the Eaton Smart, and have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nanetterae
Reviews.Content: Recently, we enjoyed our 5th visit to Hong Kong, and the third occasion on which we stayed at the Eaton... Apart from the obvious benefits which this hotel enjoys eg its location.. proximity to the busy Nathan Road shops, Jordan MTR station, Temple street and the Jade Markets, The Eaton's strength lies in the quality of its staff and their diligence in making the traveller comfortable and welcome.. Whilst every one we met at the Eaton was extremely helpful, certain staff members are simply outstanding.. So thank you to Kenneth in the Metro Buffet for ensuring our breakfast coffee cup never dried out, Eric who so kindly made sure that a taxi was available to my daughter and I, and the marvellous Marilyn in the E Club which I would advise any one intending a stay at the Eaton to join up...Marilyn takes an interest in all who visit the E club, and exudes charm, grace and a sincere concern for the comfort off her EClub guests.. All staff speak English very fluently, and smiles were the order of the day from each one, all day and every day. Certainly, the rooms are quite compact but with all of Hong Kong's attraction how much time does one want to stay in the room? If I am lucky enough to return to Hong Kong next year, I would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: luckyrabbit25
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here for 3 nights in Dec 2011. The hotel location is excellent, located between Jordan MTR and Yau Ma Tei MTR. Front desk officers were polite, friendly and speak good English. Room was clean, cozy! Lots of eateries, money changers nearby. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location night markets a must!”
Reviews.Author: richconserve
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the eaton smart for 2 nights as our stop off on the way back from an amazing honeymoon in australia. The location is great with easy transport around hong kong. Well worth the half day tour available at reception. Great sights to take in and the coach trip makes it light work! Eat at the corner of I think temple street. An experience, great value and food. Fish in tanks on the side of the road. Bizarre but so fresh! So glad we stopped in hong kong, somewhere I have often wondered about. Would 150% go back. Such an interesting vibrant city. See the light show every night at the marina the skyscrapers come alive! Quite a sight! We had a full hour massage for approx £20 each which finished the honeymoon off. Go to hong kong!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: courtng
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and in a great location. The metro and several different markets are within walking distance. The roof top pool and work out room have some amazing views of the harbor. The front desk and conceige were very helpful considering it was my first time in Hong Kong. The breakfast buffet was very good with several different options. I have recommended Eaton Smart to other friends staying in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfyingly enough”
Reviews.Author: Chie_MP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room 1428, a deluxe room with one queen-sized bed. The room and bathroom was clean and had the basic necessities that comes with standard hotels (slippers and newspapers included). What impressed me was that the room comes with an umbrella we can use. I guess the hotel knew that it was a rainy season for Hong Kong that time, and so provided their guests with an umbrella. The room is sort of small compared to the other hotels I've been to. But as I've read on some reviews, the 3-star or 4-star hotels really had small rooms. For me, it was spacious enough to accommodate our luggage and other bags. There's a cabinet beside the entrance door where you can put your medium-sized luggage. You can also find a small safe and the coffee/tea tray. Our room has a view of Nathan Road. The bathroom is clean and small, but I think, is ok. Although tall people might have a problem taking a bath because the ceiling is really low. You might need to request a room that will fit this need. The shower is not attached to the wall. For me that is convenient to use. If you have valuables, like laptops or other electronics, you can entrust them to the reception. I didn't lose my laptop when I left it to them overnight. When you get inside the hotel, you'll have to ride an escalator to get to the second floor where you'll find the reception and check-in. It's not that inconvenient, because you can ride the elevator when you need to get out of the hotel. It will bring you to the ground floor. The hotel is very near an 7-11 convenience store, McDonalds and Starbucks is just across the road (in Nathan Hotel). We did not try the food in the hotel, because just a few walks from the hotel, you'll find lots of restaurants. It's also very near the Night Market in Temple Street. The hotel is situated in the middle of Jordan Station and Tsim Tsa Tsui Station. The hotel all-in-all is OK for a short or long stay. I did not find any problems in our stay here. May be because we didn't stay most of the time in the hotel, but still, I can recommend the hotel for anyone planning to go to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Eaton”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Eaton during the Christmas period. This is my second time there. Good location, friendly staff especially those staff in the E-Club Room, the Metro cafe and the conceige counter. However, the Check-out times were a bit longer then expected. Generally, great experience at Eaton. Will stay in Smart Eaton when i visit Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: murpmich
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with nice, if a little on the small side, rooms. Breakfast was very nice and the outside seating area is very nice for an evening drink. The location is very good and is only a short taxi drive to the ferry port. If you happen to be in Hong Kong on a day where there is an evening meeting in Happy Valley racecourse then I highly recommend you go. Even if you are not interested in horse racing the entrance fee of €1 and the spectacular sight of the skyscrapers surrounding the racecourse makes it worth a visit. If you are a betting novice, there are loads of people on hand to explain the Tote process and there is plenty of entertainment and food to make it worth your while.

Reviews.Title: “Long wait on Arrival”
Reviews.Author: graham a
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel ,we got there at 13 30 ,after rows of people waiting to get assistance ,they managed to only check us into our room at 14 50 not once did we get offered a complimentary drink for the long wait as i know check in is at 14 00 hrs,an after a long international flight the last thing one wants is to wait,overall the room was nice ,one thing i do advise is choose a room on the south side of the city not on the north side as you would look direct onto the other hotel no view,from there! Staff was pleasant helped us choose the best places to shop ,as far as the restaurant is concerned we never ate there ,on a scale of 1 to 10 i would say 5.. Pool area is not bad nice view of the city also has a gym ..i should point out that we did pick a busy time of the year to go as most of the hotels where fully booked due to the Chinese holidays,maybe the staff just couldn't handle to many guest at once

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,very helpfull staff.”
Reviews.Author: JULIEIOW
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed in this hotel for a week and loved it.The rooms are small,but spotlessly clean.Breakfast had lots of choice,and there is happy hour two for one drinks every evening.The pool and gym are where really quiet when we stayed,the pool is also heated.The location is good,being the top end of Nathan Rd,about a 15-20 minute stroll past the shops to the Star ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but Spotless”
Reviews.Author: Cags1960
Reviews.Content: Good location, good breakfast, rooms small but you dont stay to long in the room. Use the MTR transport to get around, brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “As good as I remebered”
Reviews.Author: Gems151
Reviews.Content: I had visited this hotel a few years ago and really liked it so decided to stay there again when on a family holiday at Christmas, it did not disappoint, The staff were pleasant and helpful, the hotel was clean, and services excellent in every way. The location is excellent right on Nathan Road, but the hotel is quiet and peaceful inside, with pleasant bars and several dining options, free internet access, a bonus, and roof top pool and gym.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Best Service @ Affordable Prices”
Reviews.Author: Daved F
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart Kowloon is located in the heart of Kowloon, it is only minutes walk to most of the main attractions such as TST, MONG KOK, LADIES MARKET, NIGHT MARKET, etc.. Besides the great location you will find the BEST customer service, most of the staff all speak english and they help with anything and everything. I stayed in Eaton Smart Kowloon for over 9 days and everything was as comfortable as if I was home. Rooms may be a bit small but honestly it is more then enough, Eaton Smart provides you with everything you'll need to live and honestly you are not in Hong Kong to stay in the hotel and hang out in your hotel room, at the end of the day after all that walking you have done in exploring Hong Kong, you are expecting a comfortable, clean, and relaxing hotel room, and that is exactly what you get at Eaton Smart Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tangdoaw
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in Eaton smart during New Year for 3 nights. The staffs did gave us a flavor by trying to do our requests. Location is excellent. Close to both MTR Jordan station and MTR Yau ma Tei. A lot of resturants near by. The room is well clean and decorate. Room size is quite small due to Hong Kong standard. The only minus was that we got the room in a expensive price due to New Year celebration event. Pay almost 200 USD for a single delux room -_-! (reserved via Agoda)

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Krittinan D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Jordan station (MTR), very convenience to go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Small but clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ZOE_ZOE_18
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four nights. Hotel rooms are small but clean. The hotel is located near Jordan station (MTR) and the ferry terminal to Macau. However they do not provide shuttle bus service from airport to the hotel. But we caught air port express train (HK $90)and caught bus K1 (free service) from the station to the hotel. We are told that internet was included when we booked the room over the internet but we were asked to pay HK $100 /24 hours for the internet service. Staff is friendlly and efficient but not very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good for tourist”
Reviews.Author: yauany
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hong kong during near year, we chose this hotel because we wanted to spend the new year's eve and countdown at Victoria Harbour, then after the countdown, we can walk back to hotel from Tsim Sha Tsui to Jordan(our hotel), a nice pick! Because the metro station is packed with people and prohibited to get in from certain location, luckily we can walk home. The room is so small, but we were in hongkong sightseeing, so it doesnt really matter. We from the airport, we first took the airport express to Kowloon station, then transfered to K1 free shuttle bus to hotel, approx 1 hour. Temple street is just across the road, so many shops and foods around, you wont get bored or get hungry. Right across the hotel exit , there's a 7/11, and famous Tsui-Wah restaraunt!!! SightseeingTips: If you are going to visit The peak, Madame Tussard, and the Big Budda, I recommend you go purchased the ticket in advance at airport, Arrival hall A4 counter, we are there during new year, the line is so freaking long, luckily we have the ticket already!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was the right choice for our family vacation”
Reviews.Author: ChewGC
Reviews.Content: We are glad that we chose Eaton Smart Hong Kong for our New Year vacation. Of all our holiday experience with hotels around the world, we can safely say that so far Eaton Smart Hong Kong is the best we have experience. We thoroughly enjoyed our New Year vacation and it all thanks to the staff of Eaton. We felt very welcome and the staff did not failed us - whether our request or our enquiries. We will not hesitate to stay at Eaton again when we visit Hong Kong next time. If not for the Airline being fully booked, we could have extended our stay for another day.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD SERVICE. CLEAN AND FAST”
Reviews.Author: michelle c
Reviews.Content: very good and fast service. only bad thing is that we have to pay for wifi, but they do have computers free of use.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATKA166
Reviews.Content: Took two rooms for my family at Eaton Smart and we stayed for 4 nights. We took the red-eye flight from Singapore and got to the hotel at around 7 am. We were pleasantly surprised that our rooms were already prepared so we could check in, leave our luggage and start our adventure! The hotel staff were always helpful and pleasant, and even the cleaners made it a point to greet whenever we crossed paths along the corridor. We found the concierge (positioned at the street level) was especially helpful. I recall two occasions that they helped us: First was when we needed some directions to get to Ocean Park. The man at the counter readily pulled out a map and a printed set of instructions that not only gave clear instructions how to get to Ocean Park, but also other places on interest around Kowloon and HK Island - buses, MTR etc. Secondly, we bought a camera that had a warranty that covered only HK and China and we wanted to change it to an International Warranty. The concierge helped to call the agent, clarified the steps required to get this done, and pulled out a map to show us how to get to the agent's service centre to do it. Fantastic! The hotel is situated at a very convenient location and we had no trouble at all getting around ourselves. Do get an OCTOPUS Card as soon as you can from the nearest MTR station (in this case it was Jordan) - you can use this card for almost all your rides (MTR, buses, tram, Star Ferry, Peak Tram etc.) and also for shopping/food outlets. You pay HK$150 for a start - HK$50 is the deposit, HK$100 for your use - this was enough for us to use throughout our stay. On the last night of our stay we brought the cards back to the Jordan MTR and got a refund for the deposit and whatever remaining money in the cards (note a small refund fee of HK$7 will be charged). All very convenient! Temple Street was just about 5 mins walk away, opposite from the hotel - very nice stuff there and we went there almost every night to browse/shop/eat and have our yummy HK desserts. There is also a nice restaurant on Nathan Road, opposite from the hotel were we could 'yam char' for breakfast with the local people - really nice stuff there! The rooms were small, as expressed by other reviewers here - but comfortable. Any way we were out most of the day so the beds were basically for us to crash into at night - and they were very comfortable for that! Do ask for the renovated rooms - they look a lot nicer and more well equipped. My kids got an older room and did not have a wardrobe/kettle - not that they needed it, but still these should be standard, right? Overall, we enjoyed our stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Good use of space”
Reviews.Author: Exceeding_Joy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Smart for 4 nites in Dec 2011. Our room is newly renovated and we can see that the hotel management had given serious thought to the design and layout of the room. Room decor is contemporary and there was good use of space. Given the size of the room, there was even a writing desk with chair and an iPod docking station in the room! The bathroom, although small, had great amenities and the tiles used were beautiful. Location was great, just 5 mins walk to the Jordan MTR. Lots of local eateries in the vicinity. There are 6 PCs with free internet access and printer for guest use at hotel lobby. Overall, we had a pleasant experience at the Eaton Smart.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, with convinient location”
Reviews.Author: AlbeeTheOne
Reviews.Content: The Eaton Hotel is on the Kowloon side, but a little bit further north on Nathan Rd. I stayed here when traveling with friends on vacation. The rooms are small, but clean. The staff is helpful, and made the check-in process a breeze. The breakfast buffet is decent, but you can get a lot of choices for food on Temple St which is closer to the hotel. Note that the hotel is bang in the middle of shopping places. There is a swimming pool available on the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: JWings
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights, on my way home from Cambodia via Hong Kong. The room was one of the smallest I've experienced in HK! However, the price was good, the room was clean, great location (2 minute walk to the Night market) and very polite and attentive staff. It would have been nice if they had offered free WIFI though, but at least there were a few computers in the lobby (with a 20 minute session limit).

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great clean rooms, convenient”
Reviews.Author: bankergirl1016
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is known for expensive, small rooms. Given the price, expect small. However, it's newly renovated, has great service and beside the Jordan MTR. It's not the perfect location but the MTR brings you everywhere. Our corporate rate is HKD 600 - which is a steal.

Reviews.Title: “We Love The Hotel Room Comfort”
Reviews.Author: The_LIM_family
Reviews.Content: My Family stayed at Eaton Smart HK for 2 nights. The hotel gave a a connecting rooms for me and my 2 teenage kids. The check in / check out is fast and efficient, the rooms are one of the best we ever have - very comfortable and clean. My family also like to great location of the hotel, within the main shopping belt along Nathon Road and also geat food can be found at Temple street. Overall experience is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: mortui
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights in December and had a wonderful experience. The staff at the check in counter were extremely efficient and friendly. Even when asked to check if the room was already cleaned and prepared half an hour before the check in time of 3pm, the staff promptly went ahead to check and subsequently gave me the room key. The interiors of the hotel was very clean and spacious in my opinion. There was more than enough room to place an open luggage on the floor with space to move around. The interior design was exactly like the photo on their official website, very cosy and comfortable. The bed was definitely something to look forward to after a day of shopping.Bathroom wise was also very clean and restocked everyday. Located just 2 streets opposite Temple street, you are spoilt for choices for local food or restaurants. Even Ladies Market is just a 15 mins walk away. Definitely the hotel to stay in when you go to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “All right Hotel for one night!!!”
Reviews.Author: plane_cowboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for one night only as I was disembarking on a cruise the next day from the Ocean Terminal Kowloon HKG. I booked hotel on the BA website for GBP80 incl tax and other charges, which I thought was reasonable. The Hotel's location is very good, just off Nathan Road with plenty of Restaurants around and plenty to do. I thought my rooms was a bit small, opposite the lifts (surprisingly no noise at all), the water in the bath tub was very slow to drain and I did not have much of a view but hey ho, for the price I paid it was ok, beggars can't be choosers. I checked out the evening buffet in the restaurant but decided against it as it was far too pricey in my opinion, the Breakfast Buffet in the morning was good and plentiful with as much coffee/ tea as you like. I would stay at this property again folks as it suited my travel plans and budget.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Small but very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Edster88
Reviews.Content: Located along Nathan Road, this makes it convenient to get around. Just a short walk from one of the night markets of Hong Kong. Food is all around and immediately opposite the concierge desk is a local restaurant that serves western as well as Chinese meals. Rooms are a little on the small side but clean. I stayed in a Deluxe Room so it was a refurbished room which looked very modern. I enjoyed my stay there and staff were very attentive. Price is reasonable, especially during peak season when the other similar hotels may charge over US$300.00 per room night which is too much. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: DavidDumfries
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Smart for three nights en route to New Zealand. We found the staff very helpful & informative. The breakfasts were excellent- choice of Traditional English, Continental & Chinese food. Althought the room was small, it was more than adequate for a short stay. The bed was comfortable. It is an excellent location. We made good use of the MTR which was close by. There are lots of places to eat on Nathan Road including the Temple Night Market. There was free internet access in the lobby area. We had a late flight on the day we left & were able to use the roof top swimming pool & facilities all afternoon while waitng for our transfer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_WLG
Reviews.Content: First off, the location of this hotel is superb. On Nathan Rd which is the main shopping drag and nicely placed in the middle. The famous Temple Street night markets are across the road (5min walk) and the Ladies markets are about 20mins away. The hotel itself is modern and the room was comfortable, clean and modern. The room is very small but that didn't matter as there is so much to see and do in Hong Kong I didn't spend much time in there anyway. The staff were great, very friendly and polite. The buffet breakfast was good, although very small so it got very crowded very fast. The outdoor seating is fantastic in the evening. The little things that prevented me from giving this a 5 star rating is, no WiFi in the rooms but you can access it in the lobby (for a price) but they do have 2 free computers in the lobby and the intensely strong disgusting perfume they were pumping through the lobby area - a group of us had to go outside for some air! Overall I would come back as the location and room comfort was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: strongy23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Eaton Smart Hong Kong over the past three years after trying many other hotels in Kowloon. The main reason I like staying here is for the great staff and great location. Taxi's outside the front door, 5 minute walk to the MTR, a couple minutes walk to Temple Night Market. Everything is close and easily accessable. I have always stayed in a room that gives access to the E Club as this is one of the great things about the hotel. The staff are extremely friendly and do everything they can to make the stay enjoyable. Evening drinks and canapes are a must! While the rooms are not massive they are comfortable and work well. Hotel rooms in Hong Kong are not very big anyway, but I think the Eaton rooms are fine. If you want a bit of extra space, go for the one bedroom suite. I always book one and think the price is very reasonable and you get use of the E Club included. Rooms are being upgraded, so request a renovated room and you wont be dissapointed. Overall, its a very good hotel, not 5* but I dont go to Hong Kong to sit around my hotel room all day. Its a great base for seeing all Hong Kong has to offer and the staff will make you feel more than welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough room to swing a cat”
Reviews.Author: Pearceperson
Reviews.Content: Absolutely nowhere to put our suitcases. They filled the entire space at the foot of the bed. We were in a upgraded room so can't imagine what a standard room was like. Not bad location on the doorstep of Temple St night market.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: N E
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in mid 2011 on recommendation of our travel agent and the Eaton was great! Fantastic location, friendly and helpful staff, nice decor and clean rooms. Would've liked the room to be a little bigger, but can't complain - was enough for the two of us for 1 week, with all our luggage etc. Found the outdoor bar very nice and relaxing and the free internet stations was great too. Right in the middle of Kowloon! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton is a winner”
Reviews.Author: hk_3414
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Eaton countless times, and I am a business traveler - I spend 150+ nights a year in hotels in different countries and cities. Here is why I religiously stay at Eaton in HK and I refuse to go to 5stars in both sides of the harbor: (1)to me, it is important to feel easy and comfortable when I walk into the hotel. I don’t want big chandeliers and red carpets, and I do not need to see a Bentley parked in front. Only one thing matters: Desire to please, and smiles. Eaton staff, from concierge to reception to room service, will welcome you and try to make you happy. I have not heard a "no" from them. And I am a difficult guest. (2) Location. Take a taxi, take MTR, take a bus, walk. It is really convenient, especially for tourists. You do not want to be in the middle of the TST mayhem where people would follow you to the hotel lobby, but you want to be in a comfortable 10min walking distance or a 2min taxi ride. Night market is right across, Mongkok is 10min walk, etc. Airport express shuttle stop is at the doorstep, every 12 minutes. (3) Their gym is nice, and open 24 hours. Go up anytime. Well - if you are an early bird or suffering from a jet lag and want to have a run at 3am, you can do so at Eaton. They also have a small pool next to gym. (4) Good breakfast, combined with healthy choices and other stuff. You will not find the sheraton variety but you will not be disappointed. (5) Rooms are clean, tidy, in good shape. Yes, they are small - but this is HK and you want large rooms go to kowloon shangri-la or go to macau. Overall you have to define what you are looking for in your HK trip. If you are looking for value, go to Eaton. You would not be disappointed. If you want to be pampered with luxury and pay the premium, go to Peninsula or Island Shangri-La. If you want the HK view, go to Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed rooms”
Reviews.Author: jvm25
Reviews.Content: Handy, convenient for visiting family in Kowloon. Small but very comfortable rooms and we enjoyed the balcony bar. Bit soulless but what do you expect in a huge city

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for a Hong Kong holiday!”
Reviews.Author: LondonPhoebe
Reviews.Content: A slightly belated review for the Eaton Smart - so firstly apologies to the proprietors as we had a great time there - just haven't had the time to write since our return. We were there in October where the weather was a little changeable (Typhoon season so a bit unpredictable) When we booked it, the intention was to use it as a base as we had planned to spend some quality time with friends and family and therefore wanted to just have somewhere comfortable and clean to rest our heads in between going out. Suffice to say it exceeded our expectations in many ways. We arrived from the UK pretty tired after our flight from the UK at 7.30am and the hotel kindly offered showering facilities in the gym so we could freshen up before checking into our room. After a quick wash and brush up, we wandered down Nathan Road towards the Star Ferry terminal whilst waiting for our room to become vacant. At lunchtime we returned to find we had been upgraded to a superior room which was modern, clean and comfortable - plus a decent size which is often elusive in big cities. The staff were very good - always attentive and polite and willing to go the extra mile if required. Although we didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on the food but we did have the odd drink in the bar. There are vouchers in the room for free cocktails etc so keep your eyes peeled! Location wise, although both friends and family are residing on Hong Kong Island and therefore we had to trek down to the Star Ferry or grab a cab to meet up, we found Kowloon to be quite lively and a good base from which to explore. Both HK cabs and the Star Ferry are ridiculously cheap so it's really easy to get around. We used the MTR once too and again - very reasonable, clean and seemed very safe too. In terms of things to do - there's just so many - I can't even begin to list them but any of the markets are definitely worth a visit (flowers, birds, goldfish etc) as are the restaurants and bars / clubs. That said, I must mention the Spring Deer restaurant and the Blck Brd bar as a couple of highlights. If you get tired of the city - head out to Stanley for a breather - you can get a bus from the station in Central (6X)- dead easy and good for a day out. All in all - we had a fab time in Hong Kong - mainly to do with seeing loved ones, but the Eaton Smart definitely had a hand a a very enjoyable Honk Kong holiday and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and consistently good service”
Reviews.Author: Clive E
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Eaton Hotel for 7 years, each time I come back to Hong Kong on business. Having lived in HK, I think I know most of the options that are available but for me, its location, comfort, quality of service and most importantly, value for money are second to none. From time to time there will always be problems cropping up, but the mark of a good company is how they deal with those problems - so far, I have not been disappointed at the Eaton.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but didn't get what we booked.”
Reviews.Author: AndyShowDog
Reviews.Content: We specifically booed a city club room as we only had a day in HK and wanted to see the city lights. The hotel's website describes the rooms as "With floor-to-ceiling windows and a sweeping 180-degree city view you can enjoy the excitement of Hong Kong from the peace and quiet of this well designed and appointed room." When we got there they said they didn't have any available and gave us a tiny room with no view. They said they'd give us a suite with a view the next night to make up for it. The next day they said they didn't have a suite either so I called our travel agent and she spoke with them and we got what they called a suite but it was just another little room with a living room attached and still no view. They wouldn't refund the difference in price saying it wasn't their fault the hotel was full. Everyone had a different excuse for the problem and didn't try to fix it. The hotel is in a great location so if you don't care about the room itself it would be ok. I just would have booked something cheaper had I known I wouldn't get what we booked and that they confirmed.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Travelginie
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are good clean & comfortable. Hotel is centrally located. Close to night markets & on Nathan street. Reasonably priced and even breakfast is included in the price. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Ricky H
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade from a superior to a deluxe room. The room was clean, well designed and quiet. The location is perfect from Temple street and from MTR. Even though they have plenty of computers in the lobby and the in the cafe, it would have been nice if wi-fi was available for free in the hotel or the room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the Hub of Things”
Reviews.Author: S M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Smart, Nathan Road, for 4 nights. Everything about the hotel and its staff is efficient and nothing is too much trouble. It is a fantastic location for both the MTR and shopping. The hotel lobby provides 6 computers with free internet access. The outdoor heated pool is just a treat and was not busy when we were they so we had it all to ourselves. Checking out was the quickest we have ever experienced. The only one negative was the room lighting was too dim.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eaton Smart for 9 nights and found it excellent. The room was fine (except that there was nowhere to store a suitcase) and well cared for by the chamber maid. The hotel is well situated for the MTR, bus (including airport bus) and getting around generally. Breakfast is excellent. All the staff were friendly and efficient. The room service was very good. The restaurant was fine if you couldn't be bothered to go out. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: mayshalws
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 days at Eaton deluxe room. The room is exactly as shown in internet and small but expected. The best part about this hotel is the strategic location. Cab is easily available and temple street market is just 2 block away. Check out very efficient and fast. I stayed at 16 floor and it's very quiet at night. But the unpleasant experience was I'm mistaken with other guest which is same name with me but different arrival date !! Few days before the arrival, received an 2 emails to confirmed the arrival date. To my surprise the arrival date was wrong, so I called them to clarify but the guy said I booked thru Agoda which is not !! And he even asked me to call Agoda if want to cancel the booking. It's worried me but few hours later, they admit made a mistake. Mistaken me with other guest which is same name with name but different arrival date.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eaton Smart in November of this year with my husband for a vacation in Hong Kong. We both found the hotel to be a good value and very good location. The hotel was just a few blocks (easy walking distance) from Jordan MTR, which provides easy access to many areas in Hong Kong via the MTR. The hotel was modern and clean and staff was very friendly (also, everyone spoke English). Yes, the rooms are small but what space isn't small in Hong Kong? We certainly found the amount of space adequate for our needs and kept very clean. The lobby provides computers with free Internet use with a 20 minute time limit. There is an indoor restaurant and outdoor bar/restaurant, but we didn't try either of these. Also, if you are craving a little bit of "home" after a long day of sight-seeing and aren't in the mood for the local cuisine- there is a 24 hour McDonalds right across the street. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here if ever in Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “A visitor from Canada”
Reviews.Author: ed631
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, convenient and nearby all shops, restaurants, and all kinds of transportation. The room is not big but clean and the bed is firm and comfortable. They need an upgrade to a flat screen TV. The toilet flushing is not very efficent (I have to push the handle a few times in order to flush). But the room is very quiet. We can't hear any noise from the street. The a/c is working perfect whereas most European hotels don't. The lobby staff is very friendly and helpful. They all speak English. The breakfast is good and quite a variety of food. The staff are polite and efficient. Good value. Good location. I'll recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable quality stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyDoctor
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Eaton Smart's suites at what was a very reasonable rate for HK. We did so because we had our young daughter with us who needed to be able to sleep during the day. The suite consisted of separate bedroom, bathroom & lounge area. All were pretty small, but not beyond expectations for HK. We had a good view up and down Nathan Road but not much else as higher buildings blocked the view, even 17 floors up! Staying in suite granted access to their e-Club, which meant a continental breakfast that actually was a mini version of their buffet breakfast - including cooked food - and was varied and good enough to keep us going on a 10 night stay. This also included free internet access in the club and a free evening drink. A nice bonus for suite users. The room itself was reasonable - the bed & sofabed weren't the most comfortable - I was fine but my partner suffered a bit. It also could have been cleaner - the main areas were fine but parts out of easy hoover reach were visibly dirty. Location wise it is right on top of temple Street Market, about 15 minutes walk to Tsim Sau Tsui, and about 10 minutes to the closest MTR stations. There is a Airport shuttle but not an Airport Express station shuttle. So, nothing exceptional but nothing really terrible either, and given the same circumstances (i.e. needing a separate sleeping area) would probably do again given the relatively low cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Greaseater
Reviews.Content: I have just returned froa a short business trip and stayed at this hotel in Jordan and I was very impressed and the price was much cheaper than other hotels on Mody road. Outside bar is OK and snacks are served at reasonable prices. Rooms can be small but sign up to the hotel 1865 card and you may get an upograde to a suite if they are available. Pool on top floor and although small it is nicely done. Close to Temple street night market where you can buy cheap copy branded goods. About ten minutes in a taxi to Star Ferry terminal and avenue of stars or alternatively choose the Jordan MTR to link all around Kowloon and HK Island. Will use again if the price stays so low.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: blossom1956
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Hong Kong and Thailand with my husband, daughter and son in law. Thought this hotel was well placed for food and Shops on Nathan Road. I was expecting a shoebox -sized room from a couple of the reviews I read, but ours was a normal, standard typical hotel bedroom, certainly big enough for us! Clean, comfortable beds, flat screen TV, tea making facilities and complementary toiletries- what else do you need? We were on the 18th floor and the room was very quiet, hard to believe how busy it was down on the street!. The breakfast was great, plenty of choice, freshly cooked eggs and pancakes! Lovely terrace to sit and have a drink and a bit of relaxation. There were computers next to reception that were free to use, never had any trouble getting on. My son in law used the gym and the pool every day while we were there and was very impressed. A couple of minutes walk to the MTR station took us to Lantau Island to see the Big Buddha (well worth a visit). Taxis were cheap, although a 20 minute walk down Nathan Road took us to the Star Ferry for Hong Kong Island. All in all, absolutely loved Hong Kong, would definitely go again, and would recommend staying at the Eaton Smart Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yid1983
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from HK,where I stayed at the Eaton I stayed at the Eaton 4 years ago, they have since refurbished the hotel, the rooms are a lot better and the gym is now useable. Staff are very helpful. If you stay there try and get your breakfast with the hotel as the food is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny...... but great location!”
Reviews.Author: AussieinHongkers
Reviews.Content: The Eaton is a great hotel with only one draw back..... it's tiny rooms. If you are after location you couldn't get better, close to train stations, shopping, markets and restaurants. If you don't plan on being in your room much and hang out in the hotels relaxing outside bar/resturant area, this is a perfect place to stay.The service is friendly,food excellent and drinks cold, room service was quick and a good quality.

Reviews.Title: “trip to hongkong”
Reviews.Author: betsyfrost
Reviews.Content: GREAT PLACE! Enjoyable, clean, fun , organised, good care near lots of shopping, economical

Reviews.Title: “My impression of Eaton Smart HK”
Reviews.Author: longpohsing
Reviews.Content: We were greeted well by the front desk staffs and they are very helpful to assist us with the directions.The location is super as we just need to walk to the "Lady St" and many other nice places. As this is my first time to Hong Kong, I am totally loss but with their guidance. I manage to overcome the worry I had. Although we love the breakfast we had in the morning from the hotel, we can find a lot of nice food along Nathan Road. I tried the "Big Boa" & "Gua Tie" and I like it very much.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't have to be in the heart of town to be good!”
Reviews.Author: norman c
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Hong kong many times, but the hotels where we have stayed are starting to price themselves out of our budget so we thought that we would move slightly "out of town" We found a hotel close to Temple Street markets, two stations away from Ladies market at MonKok and sixty seconds by train(we timed it) form the heart of downtown Kowloon. It had all that we wanted and both my wife and I are "gym junkies" so we made good use of the small but very well equipped gym(with great views as well) on the 21st floor. Excellent bar,great coffee, first rate customer service and what views from our 19th storey room! We will be back to the Eaton next time we visit HK!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money and well located for a 3 day Hong Kong adventure!”
Reviews.Author: ultimatehotelguide
Reviews.Content: Rooms are well fitted out with a full marble tiled bathroom, decent selection of in room toiletries and towels, clean with a big flat screen TV which had a selection (about 10) of UK and US channels as well as local TV half of which is in English. Beds are very comfy and I had two great nights sleep here. Normal Extra like in room safe etc. A couple of negatives are that the rooms are quite small, and there is no view from your room, however we were not staying there for the view, and great views can be had only a short taxi ride away. The hotel itself was clean and tidy, breakfast was good with a wide choice of western styled breakfast foods with freshly made eggs of every type at the egg station, as well as a big selection in eastern local styled food. The hotel has good looking restaurants but this is by sight not trying, we ate street food/ local restaurants each evening which was great. The best thing about the Eaton Smart is its location, and the staff. Location wise your on the Nathan road easily walk able to various markets, and your close to local eateries, not surrounded by big expensive international styled restaurants. You are also only a 5-10 min taxi ride ( $. ) from the star ferry to central ( $2-3) where you have the choice of everything. The staff were amazing here. Every time we asked for info they would not only tell us what we wanted, they would mark it on a map and tell us the best way to get there. Very helpful, professional, and made us feel very welcome. Great job Eaton Smart, your staff are a credit to the hotel industry, and we will be back on our next trip to HK. Thank you! P.S. a little warning for anyone new to HK. All over the city are tailors and camera shops. There are great bargains to be had, and tailor made shirts suits dresses etc. however you will be asked "please come look at my shop and fine quality!" after a while it is tedious, but if your not expecting it you could feel uncomfortable. Always remember there first "best price" is normally 30-50% too high. Firstly establish that the price includes delivery, then the quality of the material, then haggle. Better to go in very low and come up. They expect this and it's part of the game! My price for 6 shirts started at HK$4200 plus delivery but we ended up agreeing on HK$2570 delivered for premium high thread grade cotton. Hope this helps and safe travelling

Reviews.Title: “great 2nd stay”
Reviews.Author: eastland
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Eaton in HK. Last time we only had one night which was not enough to get over jet lag (from UK) or see much of HK. This time we had three nights so were able to explore a bit more. Eaton is a well located hotel with good facilities and friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are small but this is normal for HK. Good pool and fitness centre on 21st floor. Great buffet breakfasts. If you shop around you can probably get the breakfast thrown for little extra. Arriving from airport I recommend the citybus #A21 which runs every 15 mins or so (more frequently that the much more expensive hotel shuttles!) and stops with 100m of the hotel - all for HK$33. Hotel is about 20 mins walk from star ferry or the buses stop right outside (HK$5). Subway is 5 mins away and night markets right across the street. We had a minor "toilet malfunction" but this was resolved speedily by the hotel who then offered us a free bottle of (excellent) wine as an apology. It's not the problems that make or break a stay but the way they are resolved! All in all highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: b0ycee
Reviews.Content: good location again close to all the markets - food area's- staff were great -room was a bit small but did not spend much time only to sleep- bed was a bit hard -Lower ground had a great coffee house.

Reviews.Title: “Massive improvements since the refit.”
Reviews.Author: MisterB65
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Eaton on my last five trips to Hong Kong, it simply keeps getting better. Being located one stop down the MTR from the main tourist area, means that the Eaton is proportionately lower in price that corresponding star hotels in HK. Check in was absolutely faultless, as was check out and the rooms, as usual, although small, were spotless. Service in both the bar and the restaurant were first rate. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: bonurge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight prior to a trip to Macau. The location of the hotel is very convenient. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Mc Donald's and 7 eleven are just right across. The china ferry terminal is just 5 minutes away by taxi. The service is also good they will try to accommodate every small request you have. My only complain is that the rooms are quite old and small. But nevertheless it was clean and comfortable. What I love most the is free unlimited bottled water they provide in the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Dreary”
Reviews.Author: BoomerangBabe
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this hotel got 4 stars. The 'deluxe' room was dreary - dark, even in the daytime - with a really hard double bed and a closet area that was far below any reasonable expections. Not enough light to read a book at night. No drawers for clothes; I had to ask for more hangers, a bath robe, and a blanket for the bed. The window treatment was the cheapest biind available in Hong Kong. Don't ask about the view. The 'maids' kept turning off the air so when I returned to the room, it was as hot as a boiler room. The topper for me was returning to the room to find that someone (read: maid) had used the toilet and not flushed. The only redemption were really good pillows and a decent shower.

Reviews.Title: “nice and comfy hotel at the heart of kowloon”
Reviews.Author: bebeocho
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our HK trip last week and we stayed at this hotel. I reserved a superior queen room but was pleasantly surprised that our room was modern unlike the outdated room they had in their website. I requested for a high floor and were given a room on the 18th floor. Excellent location as many have said before. The bed was very comfy esp after all the walking around. Our room was always kept clean and they replenish everything each of the 3 nights that we were there esp the bottled water. Overall I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for shopping...”
Reviews.Author: tria4bali
Reviews.Content: just came back from hong kong, stay at eaton smart hotel in kowloon.. love this hotel...start from c/i..the staff very helpfull, and also they upgrade my room to suite room...wow fantastic!!! the suite room was very spacious with complete amenities, but the big problem only that they charged for internet in the room, but you can have access to free-wifi at the e-lounge at 1st floor...if u in the mood to go down :) anyway love this hotel b'cos of the area..full with shops and restaurants, walking distance to temple street and mtr jordan...love it...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Peefor57
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 2 different occasions at the Eaton Smart Hotel. First time round we had a corner room on the 18th floor which was great. 2nd time was a 'normal' room on the 9th floor which was perfectly adequate but not as good as the first room! What is great about the Eaton Smart hotel is it's location. Only 5/10 minutes walk from Jordan Road MTR and across the road from Temple Street Market. Was an easy walk down to the pier for the Star Ferry crossing and about a 10 minute walk from Ladies Market. Plenty of restaurants and shops around. Would definitely go back there on the next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location, would go there again.”
Reviews.Author: Gerhard A
Reviews.Content: We stayed roughly 6 nights in this hotel and were really pleasantly surprised. We all know that Hong Kong Hotels generally are not the cheapest but have to agree that this hotel is worth-wile. It's located very conveniently on Nathan Road, 7 minutes walk from the red MTR line Jordan station. To get to the hotel from the airport just take the airport express, get out at Kowloon station and take a taxi or use the K1 shuttle bus; very convenient. The hotel has quite some recption desks but sometimes those will be crowdy as the hotel has also quite some rooms. The standard room is relatively small (but I think that's normal in HK) but clean and very comfortable. The hotel has a nice swimming pool on the roof so if needed you can cool down overthere. Furthermore the're free computers to use in the lobby (however very strange WIFI is at a cost; do not get the logic of that) and the breakfast is very abundant and of great choice and variety. Service is great so all in one I would go there again when I would get the chance of going to HK again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Eaton in Kowloon, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Reid B
Reviews.Content: My son's MBA school was holding a one week class at the Eaton in the Kowloon section of Hong Kong. His new wife could not go with him so I got to go along. Since living in Tokyo as a kid in the 50's and 60's this was my first time in Asia. Needless to say I was a bit apprehensive about going to Hong Kong. However, our stay at the Eaton made the trip a wonderful experience. First, location. The Eaton has a great location. It's on Nathan Road which turns out to be the main drag in Kowloon. The shopping was great. From the super expensive stores at the south end to the more reasonably priced stores in the north end. Huge selection of reasonably priced asian restarants: chinese, thai, vietnamese. My son and I had a great time eating at very, very reasonable prices. Also, a 24 hour McDonald's is right across the street. Nathan Road is a great transportation hub. Subway stations and bus stops close by that take you all over Hong Kong including the airport. Again, simply a great location for food, shopping and transport. A perfect location. Second, service. Everyone at the hotel is very helpful. We had a slight problem with the toilet and they responded within 5 minutes and had it fixed within 10. Every request was honored quickly and completely. The front desk personnel spoke english very well. The other staff was not as proficient in english, but sufficiently so to respond to all of our requests. The maid service was excellent. We stayed nine days and the maid service each day was right on. The staff always seemed to care that our stay was very comfortable. We felt much sincerity. Also, they give tours of nearby shopping areas. My guide to Temple Street Nite Market, Quincy, was a real delight. A very nice young man that made sure no vendor cheated me. Again, the best service I've had in a very long time at any hotel, anywhere. The room was very nice. It was not as small as I expected. Smaller than a room in the USA but not by much. The beds were heaven. The bathroom had a shower and bath. The room had a nice flatscreen tv with many international channels. The room had free high speed internet. Just a really nice room. Third, value. My son said the room with two beds was about $190 a nite. Since I did not make the travel arrangements, I don't know how that compares with other hotels in the area. But we were very pleased with the price considering the quality of the room for the price we paid. Oh, huge point. The price included the breakfast buffet for both of us. The buffet was simply magnificent. My god was there so much great food. Western and asian food. Huge selection. And all of it so very good. We had such great, full breakfasts every morning, we did not need to buy lunch. That saved us some extra cash. I did not eat any other meals at the hotel other than breakfast. However, my son's MBA class had a variety of lunches and a couple of dinners at the hotel. He reported that his meals were just as good as our breakfast buffets. Overall, just great food of all Western and Asian types. Summary, our nine days were simply wonderful. We enjoyed Hong Kong very, very much. The Eaton really made our time in Hong Kong just perfect. My son and I have agreed that if we ever return to Hong Kong, we are definitely staying again at the Eaton. Location, Service, Staff, Food, Transportation, and the Rooms were great. Our thanks to the Eaton for making our road trip to Hong Kong so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good price, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: breelam
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice hotel in a fabulous location. I thought the service was excellent. Room service was quick every time (including breakfast), which makes a difference to me. Good restaurants, nice buffet breakfast (which was included with the seminar I attended but is normally HKD110, I believe). Fabulous, fabulous Kowloon location, quick hop to the Jordan subway station for those going to Central. I wouldn't call it a high-end luxury hotel, but it's a solid four stars. The rooms are not huge but folks, this is Hong Kong. Since I paid a hotel inclusive seminar rate, I'm not sure was the group rate was but I extended one night and paid USD 135 plus tax booking last-minute on Expedia in late October if that helps. At that price, what a value! I would have been willing to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Opus48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the good fortune to once again stay at the Eaton on our way to UK and on our return to Australia for the second year running. We were very well looked after and found the staff more than friendly and offered every assistance when we needed it. We particularly enjoyed the attention of the staff in the eClub lounge and would like to thank both Marilyn and Danny the manager for making our time there a relaxing and enjoyable one. The Eaton Hotel is on the busy Nathan Road and handy to many shops and markets and is close to Jordan MTR which enables you to travel virtually all across Hong Kong and the airport. The transport system is one to be admired and works efficiently and cleanly. If we ever venture back that way you can be sure that Eaton Hotel will be on our list to stay at. W&J.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but no more”
Reviews.Author: JonasCh
Reviews.Content: Ok, I was here a year ago and at that time we experienced a severe incident with a blocked fireescape. Have had some contact with the hotel after that where they invited me back to stay a night on their expense as a compensation. To be honest I thought it was a great gesture and accepted... So now on to my experience - We stayed for four days in October and well. The room we got was a bit dated, not really a four star experience - don´t get me wrong it was ok, but not worth the money 2.300 excl service per night. The club was ok, but not more than that - a poor selection of breakfast food and the soft drinks available was few... in all ok but no more... Since this hotel is situated far up on Nathan Street, the only thing you are close to is the Night Market, which is really close....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Johnstone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I generally stay in boutique hotels. Whilst this one is 20 odd storeys high, it is boutique by Hong Kong standards! Well situated, to enjoy the chinese experience. The room was quite small, but nice and clean. The bathroom was new, and quite spacious compared to the rest of the room. Loved the lobby bar, nice place for a few open air drinks, though one criticism was no bar snacks, which are generally available in most hotels. Try to have breakfast included in your room deal, it is buffet style and excellent. The staff are friendly and helpful. Free internet is useful. A good gym and pool on the top floor. All adds up to a good place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in the Eaton Smart late June 2011 for 11 nights. We had 2 deluxe rooms, with breakfast. The rooms are small by UK standards but very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were friendly at all times. The hotel is very well situated for a city break. There are 2 MTR stations within a few minutes walk. The rooftop pool is excellent and was hardly used the whole time we were there. The gym was very well equipped although we didn't use it. Happy Hour every evening. I would definitely stay again. Our 14 year old daughter was with us but of course the hotel isn't geared up for children as it's in a city. She loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: BDHwindsor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in Oct 2011. Staff helpful ,friendly and very professional. Good value for the mony and also a good location. Rooms a little small but very clean and fuctional, rate included breakfast which was great and with a very good selection of items and fresh cooked eggs to your liking each day.Halls could use a make over as they were a bit worn and dated. Would stay again in a heart beat, recommend to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book a superior room”
Reviews.Author: nodnyl11
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights end of Oct, 2 superior rooms booked . Not available when checking in, offered upgrade 1 room with a big bed and a single? for two to share. What's that all about. Finally put into 2 "superior" single rooms ( more like boxes ), when complained at reception was offered a derisory small reduction on the overpriced breakfast. This hotel obviously had overbooked but were not prepared to offer any goodwill to make up for their lack of providing what was booked. Moved after 2 days to Royal Garden. Wouldn't go back or recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Northumbrians
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Smart for four nights in October. A great location for getting around Hong Kong. On Nathan Road, near Temple Street Night Market and the Jordan MTR. A twenty minute walk to the Star Ferry or take a taxi for £2.50. We booked a Club Room. It wan't big, but was adequate, and had everything we needed. Access to the Club Lounge was a huge bonus. Breakfast was very good, with plenty of choice, hot and cold. The 'cocktail hour' was fab. Not only because drinks were freely served, but the staff were fantastic. Marilyn, made us feel so welcome and looked after us so well!! Thank you Marilyn - we'd come back to the Eaton just to see you again!! Another advantage of the Club Lounge was the fact that other guests were happy to chat and give us advice about where to eat and where to visit. All the staff at the Eaton were friendlly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again if we make another visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Ralph B
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly well priced 4 star accom in a great location in Kowloon. Hotels like this make it a pleasure to be a traveler. Comfortable room, good eateries on-site and handy to transport, shopping etc. Nice rooftop pool to relax after your days of sightseeing before hitting the night markets. Could not fault the service or facilities. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “EATON SMART - VERY HAPPY WITH MY CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel10140
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at Eaton Smart Hotel, and we loved it. The staff are wonderful and helpful. The rooms were small, but very clean and practical( we had booked 2 rooms,one for my husband and I and one for our adult son ).The location was perfect. Close to everything, shops, trains, buses,restaurants and the Temple Street Markets. Make sure you go to the markets, it's wonderful. So cheap and good quality too. The food at the markets is also very,very nice.Loved Hong Kong, and loved Eaton Smart. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Have been a wonderful experience in Eaton hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kavitha K
Reviews.Content: Staying in Eaton Hotel Hong Kong has been a wonderful and never forgettable experience. The most unforgettable thing is their eco-friendly environment everywhere. in the rooms, lobby and everywhere. this teach us and encourage us not to use plastic and so on. thanks eaton hotel had a wonderful experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “A Business Hotel worth trying...”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days and it was a very good experience. The rooms were too small but the hotel service compensated for all it's flaws. From housekeeping to lobby staff to concierge and to security - they all gave the best service even 5 star rating hotels can't even provide. 10-min walk to Jordan or Yau Ma Tei station, not too bad for a morning exercise. Should I come back to this side of HK, this will be worth considering again.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable as ever”
Reviews.Author: Nick K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three days at the end of October. This hotel delivers good value for money and is consistently reliable which is why I use it several times a year, mainly for business. Its rooms can be small and the layout is odd, but the staff are excellent even by Hong Kong's high standards. All of them make an effort to go the extra mile. I always use the E Club as I find the extra expense is more than worth it - Marilyn the EClub Manager is good at looking after you! If you are a frequent visitor, make sure that you join the 1865 loyalty progamme as it offers useful benefits like late checkout and free in-room internet, especially if you are a business traveller. The hotel is situated about 5-10 mins walk from Jordan MTR and is only 2 minutes walk away from Temple Street. Be brave and try the food at the hawkers market. The seafood is outstandingly fresh and very tasty. A good meal for two is no more than HKD200 with a beer. I'm back again next month for my fifth visit this year, which says enough in itself

Reviews.Title: “Credit card beware”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Upon booking in about 11pm after a flight from Sydney, I was asked for my credit card as their surety against incidental charges. Quite a normal practice. However, upon presenting my card they said they could not accept it. I asked why, and they advised it was the type of card. It was a new electronic eye card witb 'Debit' typed on it. This initial prblem was overcome by leaving Aus $100.00 with the reception clerk. The next day, having dined at the hotel and charged to my room, I received a 'polite' letter saying I was over my credit, and would I see the reception clerk to rectify it. I was annoyed, and went to reception and asked to see the duty manager. I explained what had happened to him, and he confirmed they could not take my card. The end result was that I had to deposit HK$2000.00 with them against incidentals such as dinning etc.Upon return to Australia, I enquired at the financial institution regarding this, and after enquiries they advised that if a hotel, or any business, accepts Visa credit, they must accept Visa debit, otherwise they are in contravention of their contract. I was also not over pleased that they charged 5% commission on every tour they booked for you. The room was adequate for one, but there was a complete lack of drawers to place clothes in, which I found difficult for a twelve day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Changed but not for the better”
Reviews.Author: WilliamH172
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton for the third time in a few years, for seven nights from October 9th. Since our last stay, the Eaton has been taken over by the Langham Group and "upgraded" The upgrades do not extend to rooms but only the public areas. That's OK because the rooms are fine.
