The Eaton is not the hotel it used to be. Langham seems to be looking for the young market. The T bar has been made over where your mixed drink will now be poured from a terrible "post mix". We all know how bad that stuff tastes. Its called making things easy for staff and not being bothered about what sort of drink you are pouring for the patrons. My drink, the one and only was flat and when this was mentioned we got, "sometimes the staff don't notice this" That's a good answer. All new staff were young staff except for a couple of familiar older faces. A great lady we nicknamed Eartha Kitt on account of the sound of her voice once worked there and poured wonderful drinks. She did not miss a thing and actually chatted with the guests, which was nice. The new younger staff appear to us to be temporary and on their way to doing something else. Maybe they are students but we knew they were a bit offhand in the way they did things. They do not have the experience necessary for a four star hotel. I suppose they have to start somewhere. The new Bose on wall lifestyle speaker system has been added and it predictably sounds thin, hollow and with an annoying treble emphasis. These things always do but cool and designer looking they are. Just don't turn them on. The computer music played is awful and not in keeping with the atmosphere. It is fast paced, funky and not at all relaxing. It is played too loud and destroys the atmosphere. Young people will love it as they shout out a conversation above it. But the big mistake is the new cool looking furniture in the atrium eating area. How could the management let the trendy design consultants fit the place out with chairs too low for the tables, around the sides of this area. Most people eating there had cushions under themselves to get their elbows above the table level. It staggers me that the hotel manager has never noticed this. Well anyway, we will not stop at the Eaton again. It was once a nice hotel to stay at combining old world feel with modern facilities. It is now another stopping off place for young travellers who don't notice or care about the nice touches. We are disappointed more than upset as we had a connection with this hotel that we enjoyed. Cheers. Bill Hanson. Melbourne. Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Kerio33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed over in Eaton Smart in August for a period of three days. On the plus side, the location of the hotel is excellent, right opposite Tsui Wah restaurant, which is a popular Hong Kong cha-chan-teng which serves good food at very reasonable prices. It's a rather long-ish walk to Jordan or Yau Ma Tei MTR, but it's only slightly troublesome during the hot summer days due to the humidity and heat. It should be more enjoyable during the cooler seasons. Transportation is a breeze, and there's no lack of food and even shopping. On the negative end, the hotel staff was rather overwhelmed on the day we checked in, and we were told to wait a good one hour (3pm instead of 2pm) for the room to be prepared after arriving from the airport, despite checking in on time with our entire tour group. We decided to have lunch during this interval, though some of the other travellers were not very happy and were still berating the staff when we left. Our room was on the lower floor facing the road, but the sounds of the traffic were barely audible. We could, however, hear our neighbours talking, even though they were not very loud. The room was small, barely big enough to fit the queen-sized bed and our luggage, but it came with a suite which was quite clean. It looked quite old. On the morning of the second day, I noticed a slight itch on my calf which later turned into three ugly red bumps (in a row)that itched like hell. I had a suspicion the bites were bed bug bites, but since I didn't do a check of the room, I couldn't tell for certain (yet). For precaution's sake, I tried to ensure everything was clean and bed-bug free as much as possible before packing up to leave. Apparently, the bed bug must have hitched a ride in our luggage or clothes, because 2 months after we returned, I noticed my wife was getting bitten frequently; and just today we had to throw out our barely one-year old wooden bedside table because I found a bedbug residing in the crevice, surrounded by it's own fecal matter. We hadn't travelled since the Hong Kong trip, and the bites had only started after we returned, so the only place we could have gotten the bedbug from was Eaton. It was the first time in our lives we had ever seen a bed bug, and we now need to pay almost $1k to get an exterminator to clean up the mess!

Reviews.Title: “Tip top location.”
Reviews.Author: tastingU
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a fantastic rate for this hotel and were very pleased. Location is perfect with temple street across the street. Post office 5 min walk. Food all night long within the same distance. Shopping allover. A little bit small rooms but ok. Nice garden to have a drink at the hotel. Bad on snacks with the drinks. Langham hotel at Mongkok have a much better lobby bar and happy hour and as much as you like to eat snack to go with your drink. Eaton should learn a little bit from Langham. But the good thing about Eaton is you can sit outside and a good winelist.

Reviews.Title: “Contempory style in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mike_McC_UK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Eaton for 3 nights on our honeymoon in November 2010. We found the hotel to be very cool, calm and refreshing to walk into from the streets of Hong Kong - and the staff friendly and efficient. Our room had a great view down Nathan Road and was very well organised to make use of the space, we never felt cramped which for a hotel in Hong Kong is saying something. We enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel as well as light snacks and drink in the outdoor bar area during our stay which was all very nice. The proximity to Jordon MTR station is very convenient and walking to the jade market or Hong Kong Park was also easy to do. I would definitely stay at the Eaton again and would certainly recommend it to anyone travelling to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “good location,prompt service”
Reviews.Author: byebyelove
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 2 nights this month, good hotel, service is prompt, bath room were ok, ample supply of water hot and cold, our room had good view, standard room with flat screen tv, spacious for 3 of us, 2 bed twin size and 1 queen size, very good location in the center of nathan road, 2 blocks from temple street with night market, many fastfood and resto nearby...i got good night sleep, highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: assaph
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eaton hotel for 7 nights in october 2011 and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel location is great, on Natan Road not far from MTR Jordan station and within walking distance from the night market, the ladies market and Tsim-sha-tsui. The room was a bit small but the bed was big and comfortable. It was also clean . One problem- no personal reading lights on each side of the bed. Because of the high floor it was quite and we did not hear the noise from the street. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Barbaraaaa
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. While rooms were small, the rest made up for it. Buffet breakfast was excellent, service also v good. Location good, right in the heart of Nathan Road. I'd stay here again, it was bliss.

Reviews.Title: “be carefull”
Reviews.Author: doctor_rehab
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights here, booked a deluxe room which was suppose to be newly renovated modern room with a flat screen tv and with a bathroom overlooking the bedroom , but i got an upgrade from the reception to a club room, which was more of i would call it a "down grade", room was from the old part of the hotel, its outdated and not stylish at all, their ipod deck is not working, tv is old and thick, and bath tub is is yellowish. tried their breakfast buffet and it was mostly chinese dishes, it needs more varieties. location: ok but T.S.T. is a btr area to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Smart - the smartest place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wottinger
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable 3 night stay at the Eaton Smart. We arrived early in the morning and the hotel stored our luggage free, whilst we did a little sight seeing before we were able to check in. The hotel complimentarily upgraded our room from Superior to Deluxe. Our room was on the 11th floor and was more than adequately sized as we only use it to sleep etc. Included in the price was a buffet breakfast. The breakfast provided both Asian and Western style choices, each of which was excellent in quality and variety. This breakfast set us up for the hectic days we had planned to see as much of Hong Kong and Macau as possible. Next to the concierge at street level is a fridge with complimentary bottles of water for guests - essential in a warm and humid climate. The hotel is ideally located in Nathan Road. It is only a very short walk to the Jade market and the Temple Street night market. Jordan MTR train station is a short 5 minute walk. To avoid the very annoying 'boosters' on Nathan Road when walking to the train station, use the back route via Chi Wo Street. The hotel provides free internet from 6 terminals in the lobby area. The hotel rooms are very clean, quiet and well cooled. The staff are very friendly, courteous and attended to our requests promptly. My wife and I, found the bed in our room to be too hard. If arriving in Hong Kong via air, purchase the MTR Airport return tourist pass. This pass gives you unlimited travel on the domestic train system for 3 days. Miraculously our pass gave us 4 days of free travel, maybe more if we had stayed longer! The airport train gets to Kowloon station in 21 minutes, you then catch the complimentary MTR 'K1' bus directly to the front door of the hotel, and vice a versa of course! I would rate the hotel as generally excellent and will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to a club room”
Reviews.Author: marina m
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 8 days in HongKong staying at the Eaton Smart. The hotel has a superb location and the room we had was a really good size. The club lounge is just amazing, when they say you can have free tea, coffee and soft drinks all day they really mean that, there is a fridge full of every soft drink you can imagine and it's open from 7am until 11pm. The breakfast and the cakes that are out during the afternoon are good but the really amazing bit is the 2 hours every evening where the drink just flows and the food is gorgeous, always 2 hot snacks everynight and as much bread, meats and cheeses as you can eat. The first 2 nights we didn't manage any tea after it! The staff led by Marilyn are just so lovely and nothing is too much trouble for any of them, they make such an effort to get to know you all and to always add the personal touch. Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel but cosy”
Reviews.Author: Ron2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel was once just known as the Eaton Hotel. It is one of the older hotels in the Jordon area of Kowloon. It is well-maintained, and busy most of the time. The lobby is not on the ground floor so it takes a little bit of getting used to when one first checks in. Once the escalator and elevator arrangement is sorted out getting in and out of the hotel from the street level becomes a non-problem. Rooms are in general small, but the bed I had was comfortable. There is a well-equipped gym on the top floor and a small outdoor pool as well. These are the two big pluses for me. For breakfast I normally go to a coffee shop across the street or in a side street off Nathan Road (a main road). You pay a fraction of the cost for a decent breakfast compared to eating in the hotel. Breakfast in the hotel is enjoyable if you have the capacity for a larger meal. This hotel appears to be busy most of the time, so line-up at the front desk can be long sometimes. Staff are friednly; transportation around town and to the airport are easy. For connection to the airport I would recommend taking the free shuttle bus just arcross the street and then the airport train. Airport buses are also avialable but far less flexible in timing and take longer. It is also more expensive .

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Taddles6
Reviews.Content: Smallish room but adequate. Breakfast included was quite good. Good location for guests who like a 1km walk to town. reasonable cost for Hong Kong. Many shops nearby often selling food cheaper than the supermarkets.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Rooms, MTR station a bit far”
Reviews.Author: criz16
Reviews.Content: For rest and relaxation, its a 5 :) I give a 4 for location. We stayed at this hotel during our trip to Hong Kong. The MTR (jordan station, IIRC), is like 3 blocks away (300 meters according to Google Maps). It didn't seem far the first day, but as walking around Hong Kong will take a toll on your feet, walking 3 blocks for me for the 2nd and 3rd day was becoming tiring. Well, this observation may just be applicable to me and others would find the distance enough. Still a great location though as it is along Nathan Road, lots of diners to eat, money changers are abundant, and very near shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location”
Reviews.Author: dawn H
Reviews.Content: The Eaton Smart Hotel is brilliantly located in Kowloon. It is next to Nathan Road which takes you to everything you need to see/do. It is close to the underground transport system which is cheap and very efficient. It is also not too far to walk from the hotel to the ferry piers which are an even cheaper way to travel to Hong Kong Island. Temple Street is well worth a visit for market stalls and street food (we ate here every day as it was so nice) I can recommend getting a map and exploring the area on foot as you will come across some unexpected gems. The hotel and staff were very helpful and friendly and we tried the sushi restuarant which was amazing and the chef explained exactly what we were eating as we are novices with sushi. My only gripe is that on arrival we were asked to provide a credit card for incidental expenses. I know this is normal on check in so had no concerns. However, we were not informed that a pending amount of 1000HKD would be charged to the card. When we checked out we paid our bill and didnt think anymore of it until at the next hotel our card was refused. I then looked at the account and the 1000HKD had not been cancelled and there was the other payment of the actual bill. I contacted Eaton and they told me that it was down to the bank to sort out?? Eventually after a week and a half the payment was cancelled and our money released. While this is only around £90 we had strictly budgetted for various things and this left us short while the matter was being sorted. All I will say is be sure what payments you are authorising and be sure that they cancel any pending amounts when you check out. Other than that it was a brilliant hotel that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Poohbear928
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton for three nights. Flew non-stop from Chicago. Since I didn't want to hassle with figuring out our transportation from the airport to the hotel, I requested the hotel to arrange a limo for us (party of four). It costs 600 HKD. The only thing is we should have booked a van due to our luggages. But thankfully we were able to load everything in. Check-in was slow. There were two ladies at the front desk. And just my family checking in around 9PM. US travelers, please note they will not accept debit cards to authorize your hotel stay. They require a major credit card however upon check out, you can use your debit card to settle the bill. This is exactly what I did and also the onset of my nightmare. I used my credit card to authorize the hold for my stay and I used my debit card to settle my bill. Even after the bill has been payed, the temp auth did not drop from my credit card. When I first called the hotel, I was told it will drop after 3 business days. When that didn't happen, I called the hotel again. They said to call my US bank. I told them it is not my bank who is causing the hold up, This billing person said they will call their bank. After a day, I see one temp auth falling off but another one remains. Seriously, by this time a week has passed since I checked out. I called them again and said this is a waste of my time and money. Those authorizations should have been dropped when the bill was paid. Very poor system and service. In addition, when we requested an adapter for our US devices, this one man came up to our room with an attitude telling us the adapter was located in the upper top drawer of the study desk. And they couldn't tell us this over the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: raf022
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stop-over from England on our way back to New Zealand. The Hotel is ideally situated on Nathan Street. We cannot praise the whole Hotel staff enough, from the Porters, Reception, Waiting and Bar Staff, Housekeeping - ALL were Polite, Friendly and Helpful and spoke Excellent English. We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jashmawa
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel that exceeded our expectations. We stayed 6 nights on 11th floor. Room was small but that is to be expected in HK - we had a window. Room very clean and well appointed, bathroom was lovely. Breakfast was a wonderful buffet with all you can eat, staff were very curtious and all spoke good English. Conceirge was helpful on travel information. Free interent was great - 6 computers in the lobby. The bar area had a good atmosphere and there was also an outdoor area to be enjoyed. The rooftop pool was great for a cool off after a days touring. Would recommend this hotel. Whilst in HK we travelled by MTR, public bus and ferry using the Ocopus card which is so simple to use and very very cheap. We went on the Star Ferry; took the Big Bus Tour of Kowloon, HK Island and a night tour; went to Stanley, Ladies, Jade and Temple Street Markets; went to Macau where we saw House of the Dancing Water at City of Dreams - fabulous show; went to Lamma Island for a very different perspective and hired bikes to ride around the island which has no cars; went to Ngong Ping 360 by cable car - well worth it and the view was spectacular; went to the Peak by tram which also has fabulous views and saw the nightly Laser Light show on the harbour. HK is such a happening plac we really enjoyed it and the hotel made our staff evey more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable and central location.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen P
Reviews.Content: For our three nights stay in Hong Kong we stayed in the Eaton Smart Hotel, Nathan Road, Kowloon on a B&B basis...smart comfortable but slightly small rooms (standard room), a varied choice for breakfast, good standard, hotel staff staff polite and efficient..central location for travel in Hong Kong. Steve and Lynne P. Stourbridge West Midlands UK

Reviews.Title: “"Eaton Smart Hotel" Honkers”
Reviews.Author: tluke
Reviews.Content: Hotel recommended by our travel company. Have to agree, Excellent location right on Nathan rd, Great Service, Very Good breakfast room also with good service Rail and bus service very close, and not a hard walk down to the ferry wharf. All the shopping areas are within walking distance to the hotel A great break to end our holiday on the mainland Thanks Eaton Smart Terry & Lee Eatons Hill Qld

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jockluva
Reviews.Content: We wanted to break our trip from London to Auckland and I had never visited Hong Kong. Unfortunately we did so on the tail end of Typhoon Nesat. After a bumpy landing we discovered most of HK was shut down. The Eaton Smart is one of the hotels served by the complimentary shuttle buses provided by the Airport Express so getting to the hotel was very easy and convenient and the transfer keptus dry despite the monsoon rain. Check in was easy and the room, whilst small, was perfectly functional and very clean. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom provided all the necessary toiletries. I particularly liked the "built in" shower. The complimentary apples was a nice touch. The gym was excellent but we were unable to visit the roof top pool due to being closed because of the typhoon. The hotel is situated in downtown Kowloon and an easy walk to the the all the bustling markets: Temple Street Night Market, Jade Market, Ladies Market with the Flower, Fish and Bird Markets just a little further. I certainly would have liked to have stayed longer and would recommend the Eaton Smart Hong Kong Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “mabooey”
Reviews.Author: mabooey
Reviews.Content: Very well located near Temple Street & Ladies Markets, Nathan Rd & MTR.The rooms are small , however comfortable, well serviced & very clean. The T- Bar was very convenient for a snack & the Happy Hour an enjoyable place to relax after a busy day. We would certainly return to this hotel & have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel would recomend the Eclub”
Reviews.Author: Jenni N
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the Hotel wasn't all that impressive, but very modern and beautiful on the inside. Room was very tastefully decorated and many thanks to the poor cleaners who did an awesome job of cleaning up after my two 20ish travelling companions! Being in my 50's and the mother of 4, I spent 20mins every morning trying to find the floor just so the cleaners could clean it. The beds were a little firm for my likings and the aircontitioner was turned down every day to 15 which was freezing! But easily changed daily. The resturants in the hotel were excellent. The Japanese proving a favourite. The swimming pool although quite small was lovely and the gym looked very impressive. Didn't realise there was a spa or would have taken advantage of that. That will teach us not to seek the advise of the excellent concierges info. We walked for miles looking for one! Good location, close to markets MTR etc but would maybe would like to be closer to the harbour next time. But I am guessing the pricing goes up accordingly. We were members of the Eclub and thoroughly enjoyed this wonderful service. Marilyn and her staff couldnt do enough for us. The girls used the free internet and the free, breakfast was lovely and had a good variety. Evening nibbles and free drinks were another plus. The staff were great, in giving us advise on our daily adventures. Cant thank you all enough for making our holiday so enjoyable. And good luck Michelle with your new lifein Zsen. Great experience all round.

Reviews.Title: “E Club”
Reviews.Author: hgallag
Reviews.Content: The hotel is of good quality, clean and very comfortable. It's easy to walk to the shops and not too far to the ferries. But best of all is the E Club. When booking a room, try to make sure you get membership of the E Club. This means free breakfast, soft drinks and snacks through the day, in a comfortable lounge area with free wi fi. In the evening there is happy hour (or two) with free snacks from the hotel restaurants and alcoholic drinks. Say Hi to Marilyn the manager who is great!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel and good times”
Reviews.Author: KLJump2000
Reviews.Content: Feeling little sad when staid there because family and cat members died on way to Hong Kong just before leaving to come for there holydays. Was many much friends and peoples in Honk Kong so made many much happier in begin and after end even under raining days. Room service friends were many friendly and many much happy faces in names and places from homes. Noodles next door is recommend and in Southern style was many much surprised. Happy end at the ending of trip and holydays had become but verifiably a commendable location for your holydays always.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Smart - smart public areas, noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jaybells11
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks beautiful and public areas are modern, stylish and well maintained, staff are friendly, respectful and helpful. I believe that when we stayed, some of the rooms had been refurbished and some were awaiting refurbishment. The first room we had was awful, there were wires hanging from the control panel, and out of the wall next to the bed. The TV didn't work correctly and the decoration was old fashioned, although this was secondary to the potential danger of the exposed wires. For the first time in my life, I requested to change rooms. The staff were very helpful and courteous and assisted with this change. The next room looked much better, but sound proofing did not seem to be up to scratch - we could hear the family in the room above us, and could hear road noise throughout the night. I imagine that if you get a recently refurbished room, this hotel is pure heaven! The swimming pool and gym is great, and the restaurant and bar is friendly. Location is up the far end of Nathan Road - away from the harbour, but it is a nice walk down, or not too far from the underground station. It is also a nice evening out to go the other way and shop in Mong Kok.

Reviews.Title: “Neat hotel, fantastic location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BarbGrae
Reviews.Content: We are Australians and stayed for 4 nights, paid HKD 1,100 per night. Thought this was excellent value for what we got in the middle of Nathan Road, Kowloon. We were in room 822, on the 8th floor, (a non-smoking floor). There are 21 floors, the top floor has the gym and swimming pool. We had a fantastic time in Hong Kong and this hotel was just perfect for our needs. We booked a Superior and were upgraded to a Deluxe on check-in. The gym and swimming pool on the rooftop are excellent; the ride in the lift with floor to ceiling windows overlooking Nathan Road is fun. We found the staff very friendly in all parts of the hotel, (i.e. cleaning, check-in, reception, pool/gym). We are not travellers who eat or drink in hotels so have no comment on the bar or restaurant(s). The internet was free if you used one of their 3 computers - we had no problem getting time on them - you have to stand up which ensures people limit their usage. The room was big enough, with comfortable bed, nice shower / toilet, clothes hanging space, safe and view of Nathan Road. The location is great right in the middle of Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: ME198
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart hotel has nice clean rooms and is in a good location. The downside is that wifi is ridiculously expensive. I was informed on arrival that to use wifi in the lobby it would be 160 Hong Kong Dollars a day and I wouldn't be able to use it in my room. I travelled round Asia for a month and stayed in 4 star hotels and in every other hotel I received free wifi in my room. I noticed that they do provide access to computers to use the internet but anytime i passed i could not see a free computer. The only other down side was that I had a room right next to the lifts. The beeping from the lift kept me awake and I therefore had to sleep with ear plugs in.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, unfriendly, but decent location”
Reviews.Author: RM_London2
Reviews.Content: So to be blunt about the negatives: it's unfriendly, drinks and food are WAY overpriced, the air con is on way too high all the time all over the hotel, and the whole place feels very...snooty. Beware the 'free cocktail' offer you'll find in your room. They are so tight here it actually does come in a shot glass, and is mostly water. Its embarrassing. The 'free dumplings' voucher is usable only when you buy an overpriced meal at the sushi restaurant downstairs, and the internet 'e-point' is ridiculous. 3 computers for 16 floors of guests AND they make you stand. Nice one Eaton Smart. The positives: Its a good location, the rooms are comfortable, and clean. Perhaps for the older traveller, but for a couple in their late 20s this wasn't a match.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Eaton every time I am in Hong Kong for something like 4 years now. The culture at the place is wonderful. The location is great if you like shopping and going out in evenings.The rooms, as long as you have have a Club Room or better are really quite spacious. I have read some reviews saying rooms are small, but it depends on what you want. I assure you the club rooms are plenty large enough and well appointed. The suites have a very large bedroom as well as seperate lounge room. Can comfortably accomodate family of 2 adult and 2 children in either. It is just a matter of knowing what and how to book for best value for money. I always take the E Club option because for a relatively small amount extra, you get breakfast, all day access up to 11PM, hot food from 5.30 to 7.30 as well as free cocktails, mixed drinks, bubbly, wine or beer. It works out to be great value and an excellent venue just to unwind and meet people. The staff down there are the best and the mangement down there do their best to make sure you are comfortable and smiling. They will even go out of their way to introduce you to other guests so you are never alone, unless that is what you want of course. Extremely professional, friendly and caring. The T Bar at Lobby level and T Garden areas are great as well. Recently renovated, it is a great atmosphere, once again with attentive and friendly staff. You have a good range of food either from the lobby restuarant or just order from the bar or garden area. Not too expensive. But if your budget is really tigh, just pop across the street and there are a couple of local restuarants where you can get good quality food which is really "cheap as chips". They have a new GM now and he seems to be just as friendly as his staff, so looking ahead, I have no intention of staying anywhere else when in Hong Kong. Something like 40 stays there to date and many more to come for me.

Reviews.Title: “They won me back!”
Reviews.Author: g0lf_vacati0ns
Reviews.Content: So, a few months back I swore I will never come back to the Eaton. I take back my words now. Due to corporate circumstances, I had to go back to the Eaton for 3 nights in Aug. I was given a room upgrade to the newly renovated suite. The room was impressive. Modern and nicely decorated and even fitted with a rain shower. There was a seperate lounge and working area with a flat screen TV and another bedroom area also with a flatscreen TV. This experience was 10/10. Looks like they won me back. Well done folks!

Reviews.Title: “great holiday destination, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ray C
Reviews.Content: The hotel has every thing that a traveller needs. Great service, great helpful staff, great food and an excellent atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: roangi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the renovated deluxe rooms. The room itself was not very big, but this is normal in HK where space is so limited. There is no point even thinking that you will get a large room in HK, well not at this price anyway. It was well decorated and clean.. and modern also. A great feature of the hotel were the glass lifts which were outside the building giving a nice view toward the north of the city. The hotel had a number of restaurants, each with its own character. One was more like a lounge with comfy couches, there was a great restaurant, and also a quiet cafe on the basement level. The location is great being only about a 5 minute walk from the MTR station and Kowloon Park. Its right on Nathad Rd, so everything you need is just a few steps away. Hotel staff were all friendly, and the "can do" button on their phone lived true to its name. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ian M
Reviews.Content: Great staff and excellent location. I stayed for a week and during that time found the staff could not do enough to ensure I enjoyed myself. From something as simple as a smile to great directions from the concierge, nothing was difficult. With a range of well priced restaurants this hotel made a perfect base. With good shopping on the doorstep - the night markets a few minutes walk - the underground close (inexpensive and very easy to use) I will stay at Eaton Smart Hong Kong on my next trip. One last thing - free internet access tucked away near reception meant not having to go and look for an internet cafe!

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Smart Hotel, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Pam P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and although our room was not large it was perfectly adequate as we didn't spend much time in it. The staff were very friendly and the room was spotlessly clean.The buffet breakfast was very good and catered for all tastes. My only quibble, and this applies to other hotels as well, is why oh way do they fix the hair dryer in the bathroom. You come out of the shower and by the time the steam has evaporated from the mirror your hair is dry. This bathroom mirror did have a small steam free patch but I would have had to stand on a box to see my reflection in it. If the hotel was anywhere else we would certainly use it again but wouldn't go back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on good location”
Reviews.Author: enruit
Reviews.Content: If you like to be in Hong Kong Kowloon, near the center of the market and close to excellent public transport; this is a good possibility with good service and friendly people. If you want to swim you have to bring your own swimsuit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Sagittarius09
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a few times now, and without doubt it is one of the nicest we have stayed in. The staff are always very friendly and extremely helpful. It is a great location, it is in an area where you feel as if you are amongst the locals, it is also very handy for Kowloon station which is a short taxi ride away. The rooms are clean. The only downside is the internet which is not free but if you go down stairs to the Main St cafe you can use the computers there. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Handy with great service- value for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: beakybaby
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in handy location in Hong Kong at a great price with breakfast +internet package. 5 star service from the staff. Only 1 block/3 minutes walk from MTR and buses nearly at the door. For a 4 star hotel and for HKG its very good value - Wifi is not free but this is the case in larger hotels everywhere anyway even tho its a bummer but there is free internet in the lobby with printer for general use and I think Wifi is free at the coffee shop ( but you have to eat/drink) hey - this is Hong Kong! Breakfast is great and worth including in your pckage if you can. Across the road there is a tiny cafe which serves huge variety of good food western and asian at great value - its part of a chain - if you want a quick bite cheaply and also there is a 7/11 convenience store directly across. Our room was upgraded on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ros1995
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton Smart Hotel for 7 days, great locaction, good clean accomodation, staff extremely helpful would highly recomend. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “good place”
Reviews.Author: 229splash
Reviews.Content: good amenities, close proximity to MTR, neat & tidy rooms, friendly staff & quick service, good breakfast, overall a good experience. free- internet in lobby, shuttle from and to kowloon airport station every 9 min. only draw back small rooms but value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: PinkyPrincess
Reviews.Content: Location was good and room was cosy. The bellboy was helpful when we had to ask for directions. Overall, it was a pleasant stay which was valued for money yet 5* service from the staffs

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service across all departments”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy G
Reviews.Content: We are regular visitors to the Eaton Smart delivering a global management development programme. Always impressed by the combination of professionalism and friendliness of all staff. Amazing memories for remembering names and faces - and most importantly preferences and requirements. Their support means that we can focus our energies and effort on meeting the requirements of programme participants. A great place to do business - and always a pleasure to be welcomed back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and maybe back”
Reviews.Author: anytoh
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean & we liked that they change the towels daily. Breakfast spread was decent. The location was very good, Jordan MTR was 5 min away. Cafes, 7 Eleven, SASA (toiletries shop) are within walking distance. Rooms were small and there wasn't much walking space after putting the luggage. The toilet flushing wasn't working very well & the toilet door doesn't close properly. We have never seen such a tiny metal piece to close the door so we ended up not closing the door each time we used it. If you like clean rooms, free internet service & free buffet, this is the hotel to be!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Sami331
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay at the Eaton Smart Hotel, very good location - 5 minutes walk to Jordan MTR, a restaurant across the street along with 7 Eleven and McDonalds. The Gym and Pool area was okay. The room was a tad small and it was disappointing that the Wifi wasn't free, although there was e-points in the lobby area but was very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but convenient”
Reviews.Author: peggy_tan48
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Eaton Smart Hongkong from 25th to 28th August 2011. Hotel in Nathan Road, very convenient and easy to move around. Jordan MTR in just 5 minutes away. Temple Street is nearby. Very good dimsim restaurant across the road and small eateries around. The lobby/reception is on the second level. Staff friendly and helpful. Both of our rooms were clean and comfortable but very small. With two luggage bags on the floor, there were not much space to move around. Toilets were small too, no place to hang your towels and clean clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice good location bar prices very expensive”
Reviews.Author: cward1321
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel not in the nicest of areas, rooms small but modern. Lots of free Internet access down in lobby. Bar prices silly as in most Hotels. happy hour is 5 till 8.30 not advertised but buy one get one free so ask. food is nice pool small but excellent gym. don't ask for a city view as this side of the side looks like a slum from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel with strategic location”
Reviews.Author: hdsurya
Reviews.Content: I stayed during my holiday trip with family in here. The check in procedure was okay, not slow but quite efficient. Room wasn't that spacious but it was clean and enough to bunk in during sleeping at night. The location of this hotel is just 5mins to the Jordan station MTR and lots of local dining choice in the surroundings area. I would recommend this hotel to my relatives if they happened planning to visit Hongkong! Internet is not free in this hotel. Would be splendid if the hotel provide free internet at least on the public area.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Warris2500
Reviews.Content: I can not really fault this establishment. I stayed here once in 2007 and now back in 2011. Paid extra for a club room and although small is all one really needs. Parts of the building are looking old, but generally good condition. Awesome value for money, especially with the included breakfast. Everyone was helpful. Didnt dine in the restaurant or use the bar area. Free WiFi in the rooms is needed though. Its 2011!!! Catch up!

Reviews.Title: “A great value choice for business events”
Reviews.Author: Ekmanson
Reviews.Content: We had 6 foreign guests from Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, Brunei and China, who stayed for 2 nights and had conference and dinner at Eaton Hotel. The hotel staff (sales & captains) are very helpful and responsive, our guests were also very satisfied by the rooms. They have also given extra credits for the room size, the breakfast, as well as the vegetarian menu of the dinner. It was a great success for the event and thanks Eaton for that!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay the only place to stay in Hong kong”
Reviews.Author: Sorrynan
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hong kong 4 time and talking my 31 year old daughter over next year My husband and I went over for Xmas and it was just great there is nothing wrong with the rooms the beds are lovely we where only in the rooms to sleep any way the food is lovely as well my next trip will be my 5th and I will keep going Judy

Reviews.Title: “We all love it”
Reviews.Author: Dom094
Reviews.Content: We were able to book 2 rooms at a promo rate with free buffet breakfast for our stay last week. The location is not in the center of kowloon but shopping center, night market, 7-11, starbucks, money changer, restaurant and jordan mtr station are all within walking distance. Rooms are modern with lcd tv, ipod speakers, safe, tea and coffee, slippers, toiletries, bathtub, Nice sleeping bed with matching pillows and are very clean.. Staff are helpful and courteous. Buffet breakfast is great. 3 units of computer in the lobby free for guest use. Will definitely come back if able to book at a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and convenient central location”
Reviews.Author: kodix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of Kowloon, very close to the Temple St market and the shopping and going out frenzy between Jordan Station and Yau Ma Tei. Service in reception and bars, restaurants is good as is cleanliness and organisation. The hotel looks good and is relaxed. The pool is small but usually empty and the fitness room looks impressive, but I did not try it. The only let down is the noisy air condition which is needless to say working over time at this time of year. We were booked in Eaton Smart by my partners' parents and I was wondering whether choosing central Kowloon was helpful, but the result was quite convenient as most places were a short cab ride away. If you are interested however in the New Territories or the Island a hotel in the north or next to the Harbour (south) may be more convenient and save time spent in traffic. If someone is interested in the Island the best choice is to have a hotel there.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great!”
Reviews.Author: nathaliewebb
Reviews.Content: We were here on our honeymoon and really enjoyed hong kong as a whole. The location of the Eaton Smart is great really close to Temple Market and all the food establishments. Yes the rooms are not massive but they are incredibly clean and perfect for a city break! We really enjoyed our time at the Eaton Smart and having had it recommended to us would not hesitate to recommend to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “clean and neat hotel”
Reviews.Author: lost_world09
Reviews.Content: Going by HK standards, this hotel would be considered relatively cheap. Hotel is clean and neat, all necessities can be found though room is a bit small. It is near MTR station though not that near, about 5-10 mins walk. Hotel is very near to temple street market, just across the main road. Internet kiosk are available at hotel lobby but no free wireless access. In room cable internet is chargable. There are many TV channels but only few are entertaining. Pillow is of low grade so bring your own if you are particular about this. Sound proofing is also not very good. Cleaning of room is well done and thumbs up for that. Overall hotel standard is above average and value for money. it would be perfect if free wireless internet is provided. I would definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean facilities, good amenities, room a little small”
Reviews.Author: pbnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Smart for 3 nights in July 2011. The room we got (deluxe, I think) was a little small but that's not surprising for a city like Hong Kong. The room was clean and comfortable as was the bathroom, which was slightly dated. The hotel is very well located in Kowloon, a block away from the Jordan MTR station. It's very close to the Temple St night market and you can stroll down Nathan Road, through Tsim Tsa Shui to get to the waterfront/ferry terminals or you can hop on a bus or take the MTR. The amenities are great with a nice pool and gym on the top floor and fun free trips and tours that the concierge arranges for guests. Internet service in the rooms or wi-fi in common areas is not free but they have 3 connected terminals in the lobby that are always available for guest use, for email, checking in to flights, etc. This is a great value for the money and I have no qualms recommending it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Business Travellers”
Reviews.Author: Harold H
Reviews.Content: The Eaton Smart provides excellent value for business travelers, especially for those who use the hotel repeatedly. Their 1865 rewards program is one of the better ones I have encountered for actual stays at the hotel. The Eaton Smart rooms are clean and functional, and the internet speeds are good to support VPN and VOIP without any problems. The hotels location is convenient. It is a short taxi ride from Kowloon Station and the Airport Express, as well as Hung Hom train station, and only a few blocks from the Jordon MTR station with great access to Kowloon and Hong Kong island.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton was the Smart choice !!!”
Reviews.Author: German F
Reviews.Content: Chose Eaton for our return trip via HK. They had a great 'Linger longer for less' promo that made it an easy choice. Modern ammenities although the rooms were a bit small. Very clean, reception staff very friendly and professional, and concierge was superb. Location was convenient, 5 to 8 minute walk to Jordan MTR, between Mongkok and Tsim Sha Sui, shops and restaurants galore. Thank you Eaton for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE EATON SMART”
Reviews.Author: beckymonster
Reviews.Content: Firstly, why the "Smart"? Not that staying here isn't a smart choice (it is) but that extra word just makes it wound weird. OK with that out of the way, this is a great place to stay. The hotel has a modern casual resort feel to it and is located in a rather busy area in Kowloon. It is walkable from buses and from Jordan MTR station. There's lots to see, do, eat, and buy here so bring your wallet! The rooms are indeed tiny but they make great use of their limited space. This is ideal for visitors travelling light. The staff is relatively young, English speaking, and know their way around the area in case you have any questions about sights. The rate isn't cheap but it's not overly pricey considering the fact that you get to stay at a 4 star hotel for a 3 star price. I unknowingly booked a package that included free breakfast buffet and broadband internet, which made my stay all the more wonderful. They are also environmentally-conscious, if you notice the plant wall they have in their lobby with a sign explaining why they have such a structure. I will definetely stay here again if I'm back in HK and recommend it to friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Nice hotel! Stupid Internet rules!”
Reviews.Author: MenB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in august 2011. From the airport you can take the airport express train to Kowloon station. At this station there are free shuttle busses. These busses can bring you to the hotel. Fast, cheap and easy! Check in was fast. We didn't have to wait long. The staff at the counter was not very friendly. It seemed that they were constantly in a hurry with no attention to the guests. But it wasn't that big of deal! Maybe they were really that busy. Room was not very big, but very clean! Sheets are changed every day! Our room had a twin bed, desk and chair and some nightstands. The big Flatscreen tv on the wall had a nice selection of channels. There wasn't much closet space. We had to remove the coffee/tea maker and the tray from the closet to put in our clothes. It's a reasonable size for 1 person though. The bathroom was nice. Not that big but also very clean with a shower (no bath). The ceiling was quite low, so tall people should watch out! Lots of nice amenities (shampoo, conditioner, bathrobe etc.) Overall the staff was very friendly. The staff at the Metro Bar/Lounge were the best. Always smiling and welcoming us when we arrived for breakfast and/or diner. The hotel is very conveniently located between 2 MTR(subway) stations. These are only a 5 min walk away from the hotel. The area around the hotel is great. The streets are always bustling with people. The only problem we had with this hotel was with the Internet access. At the ceck-in counter we were told that wired internet access was included in our booking. After we tried to log in we still had to choose from options which all stated that we had to pay for the internet. We then called the 'can do operator'. She told us that we just had to choose one option and it then wouldn't appear on our bill (which doesn't make any sense btw) It was never mentioned that the free wired Internet acces was for only 1 computer. Which is outrageous in 2011!!! At checkout we were billed for the use of Internet anyway, because apparently we used more than 1 computer, but we refused to pay and then it eventually was removed from our bill. The fact that you have to pay for WIFI or internet in a 4 star hotel in a city like Hong Kong we think is nothing less than ridiculous!!!! Its 2011 and almost everybody in Hong Kong including the tourists have WIFI devices like iPhones, iPads and/or other smartphones, tablets or notebooks. The fact that the hotel staff didn't even know their own 'rules' about the internet acces made matters even worse. Hopefully they'll fix this and make wired Internet and WIFI free for everyone. Nevertheless our overall stay at Eaton Smart Hotel was great. Would stay here again (if they fix the Internet problem) and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “As per other reviewers,”
Reviews.Author: Pyongyangsucks
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located on Nathan Road, facing Nathan Hotel, Starbucks, McDonalds, very close to bus stop from Airport (HKD 33.00) a 7/11 and many eating places to choose from. Actually my bus was FOC - as I was lining to buy the tkt, a guy asked me if I wanted a bus tkt. I thought he wanted to sell it, but I replied I only have 100 bills. He said "I'm giving it to you". For sure the airport express is faster but I always enjoy the transition from all the greenery around the airport to the metropolis view. Anyway, took me longer than expected for the check-in. I noticed that this happens often as I saw people lining for c-in on a couple of other days. Front desk should try to identify and solve this situation. B'fast was included in the package and I have to give kudos for the staff. Haven't seen so much action in a long time! Waiters and cooks well trained to provide good service - relentlessly replenishing, offering coffee, clearing tables. Pity I didn't have the chance to try lunch or dinner. But the hotel policy for having to pay for internet sucks. E-point at the lobby w/ free PCs is not ok if you are working. Rooms are smallish but enough for 1 person and are clean and comfy - just a bit dark to read anything in the room. Brighter lights would be welcome. BTW, if you are like me and likes to read local english papers - better ask concierge as they don't deliver it automatically.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ukans
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good and the staff is very friendly......................................................I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"This is a good-stay place”
Reviews.Author: J&S_Singapore
Reviews.Content: Returned from a wonderful 5-days trip from HK last week, for our yearly Summer sales.. We stayed at Eaton (Smart) conveniently located at Nathan/Gascoigne Road. Access to TsimShaTsai and MongKok is easily few bus-stops away. There is even buses that can bring us across to Causeway Bay (and TaiKoo) at HK Island. If the weather is good at night one may even stroll all the way to MongKok for their night-market, about 20 mins away. Amenities are complete and the many tv-channels is definitely a plus.! Their L-level restaurant also boost a wonderful view of the surrounding. Cannot comment on the hotel food as we eat out (HK itself is already a food paradise.!) The staff are proficient in english, but knowing cantonese sure helps further. The only pity is that we reached HK early on our first day in the morning (8am) but there were no available room for us to 'ckeck-in' or wash-up.. Eaton definitely ranks among the better hotels which we have tried over the past 10 stays, well be prepared tp pay a slightly higher premium too.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting service, not friendly and not collaborative at all”
Reviews.Author: Issian
Reviews.Content: My daughter was on a travel in Mongolia for pleasure when she has been stolen of her credit card and money. She could reach Hong Kong where I booked a room for her in the Eaton Smart hotel in Kowloon. I wished to pay full amount with my USA credit card or at least I thought that I done so as nothing was mentioning differently. I eventually called the hotel the same day for confirming the room. When my daughter arrived she was surprised to see that despite all explanations she has been requested to pay a deposit of 600$. She called me and explained me and I tried to call the reception to insure them that I was paying for her. I ask them to debit my credit card (they had the number and all necessary data and they confirm it). As it was a Sunday they argued that I can contest the payment after and that they will need three days to clear my credit card and be sure that they will be paid. During that time they wanted to keep the only money my daughter had on her. I proposed to send the scan copy of my credit card, passport and an agreement to pay all expenses but they refused. The person I had on the phone has been closed to any service but stocked to procedure and even asked me to come in Hong Kong from Bangladesh as a solution to the problem. He asked me to call my bank and asked them to pay the hotel or to send the money from Bangladesh (impossible to be done from Bangladesh). He was eventually arrogant and sarcastic in saying that I had not the cash on me to pay for this 360 $ bill. I discourage customers to go to this hotel when they can go for the same cost to the Novotel Nathan Road nearby that has been very helpful and very friendly with me and with my daughter. Such establishments should disappear from the market.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - get access to the e-club!”
Reviews.Author: Happywheninair
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. It’s located on Hong Kong’s Nathan Road, very close to the Temple Street night market with easy access to buses and the subway. The staff were very helpful and on arrival we discovered that we were a part of the hotel’s e-club. That meant that we had access to a lounge where snacks and drinks were available all day long (there’s a cocktail hour, where free cocktails are served, in the early evening too). The staff who worked in the e-club were exceptional – very warm, friendly and very helpful (they gave us great recommendations on restaurants and nightclubs). The only issue we had was that on arrival, we sat in the e-club waiting for our room to be prepared for a couple of hours and when we got to our room it took another hour for our bags to arrive – however, that was minor in the grand scheme of things. This hotel was excellent – the rooms were clean, light and bright; the bathroom had a bath and shower. This hotel comes highly recommended and will certainly stay here if I return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Will be going back next year.”
Reviews.Author: Shelley56Sydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton Smart to break the trip up on the way home to Sydney from London. I found the staff in this hotel to be extremely helpful and well mannered. The girls that clean the rooms provided impecable service. Room cleanliness was of a very high standard and supply of bathroom toiletries was plentiful with good quality towels. Beds were comfortable and linen of a high standard. Television has many english speaking channels. The Eaton provides free internet service in lobby area with access to a printer. Breakfast buffet catered to all tastes, and coffee on the outdoor terrace was a plus. Very good coffee. I highly recommend this hotel. Also it is very convientently place to night markets, 24 hour Macdonalds for those of us suffering from jet lag and an easy walk to the Star Ferry. Cannot wait to return. Shelley from Sydney Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Sab2011
Reviews.Content: I would come back here only for the exceptional service. We stayed here 3 nights. Check in, room service, conceirge were all flawless in their service. Its a busy hotel so there are many people waiting for check in at all times but the staff is effecient. Its at 7-8 minutes walk from the Jordan MRT so not very close. There's a 7/11 across the road and Starbucks around the corner too. Malls too are at walking distance. Tsim Sha Sui Pier is a 5 minute cab ride away. The restuarant though does not have many options for vegeterians.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: sunilbhakri
Reviews.Content: We booked two connecting rooms on a one night stop over from UK to Sydney and for that purpose it fitted the bill I guess. But the rooms were so small you almost had breath in to walk around the bed. Clean and modern though but if you like space go elsewhere. Enjoyed a nice lunch at the restaurant and service was good. I guess I should not be too surprised in HK but have stayed in other hotels with much bigger rooms. About a 5 - 10 min walk to the nearest MTR and about 30 hkd from star fferry by taxi. Did not explore the local area but Kowloon is Kowloon once you start pushing north! For a lower cost stop over just about Ok, but for longer I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Arrive a guest and leave a friend”
Reviews.Author: Star_miko
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and relax. Make sure you get a room with access to the e-club

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: chocodung
Reviews.Content: Arrived the hotel at 2:30pm, receptionist informed us the check in time is 3pm, also the twin deluxe room I booked has run out and will offer us an executive deluxe room with king size bed which we accepted. We came back at 3:25pm but was told our room is still not ready, in the end we hang at the counter for 10 over minutes before we get the room key. The room is of decent size, we closed the window most of the time as it is facing a very old building opposite. Toliet has separate shower and bath area, unfortunately there are unpleasant smell from toliet pipe behind the toliet bowl in our 2 days stay. I would prefer to stay in other hotels in that area compare to the money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Weemaz23
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights there as first stop on our honeymoon. Hotel absolutely gorgeous, friendly staff, great location literally on Nathan Road. Fantastic buffet breakfast & friendly staff. Rooms a little small but very modern & were fine for 4 nights & price!! Hong Kong was by far my favourite place to have visited. The culture, the neon lights. My husband & I went for a full body massage & foot massage & for both of us was only £30. Fair enough we were quite sore after as they do be quite rough!!! So many things to do...Happy Valley race course,, the space museum, big buddha on a skyrail, the peak..highest poiny overlooking the city. Would go back again tomorrow if i could. Good value for money. Definitely try eating from the side cafes as this is where you experience the real chinese cuisine & if you are a plain eater there is "the outback" steakhouse, big meals for great prices & the tastiest steak around!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!!! In great hands for long term stays or expat transitions!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeesaSoulodre
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at Eaton Smart for 10 days for business in July. A limousine service was organised for me in advance by the hotel and early check in was arranged in advance as I arrived from a 12 hour flight early in the morning. I was upgraded on arrival to a suite (1024) and asked to wait in the Club Lounge where I was greeted by 2 very friendly staff. The room was very spacious and in their newly refurbished area. The room was very clean and perfectly sized for 10 days of business. A working desk with broadband and Wifi internet was available. Tea and Coffee making facilities also meant that I had constant access to my daily intake of chinese green tea. Room service was also excellent, as was the service from housekeeping. Fresh bottled water was made available each day at no cost to support their guests coping with the hot summer. The Club breakfast featured continental and full english options. The eggs benedict from room service is excellent! A late night hamburger and fries was also greatly appreciated. During my stay I also tried the restaurants Metro and Yagura. All were reasonably priced and of the quality that you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The service was excellent in both. The Eaton Smart hotel is a perfect location for expats looking to transition into the local housing market. At 85GBP per day, I am confident that we could negotiate a longer term leasing arrangement to support our relocation. With a central location in downtown Kowloon (Jordan MTR) and walking distance from the Kowloon Cricket Club, Tsim Sha Tsui and the Temple Street Markets, it's the perfect location for finding your feet in Hong Kong. I could not work out the TV remote control for inroom entertainment. But could easily find the news for the daily news updates. I was very surprised to smell an acrid smell coming from the water pipes in my hotel suite over a number of days. On notifying the hotel staff, I was promptly relocated to another suite on another floor with the same aspect and of the same quality. A complimentary bottle of wine, chocolates and apples were provided by Derek for the inconvenience. As a fashionista I also had the opportunity to discover the custom handbag and shoe craftsmen, Maylin (Hong Kong manufactured) and Ashneil (higher quality). Have a bag made to measure in your favourite hides. I purchased a fabulous "man" bag for my husband from Ashneil. I will also go online and place an order for the family at Christmans. They are both well worth the discovery!!! I would like to congratulate Eaton Smart on the exemplary service of Derek (Service Manager), hotel concierge and the team at E Club! The printing services at the eClub proved highly valuable to planning my business meetings each day, and a copy of the Do's and Dont's in HK from their in house library gave me some useful insights for local customs and etiquette. Concierge quickly organised my taxis and advised the drivers of my destination in chinese whenever I left for the day. The days itinerary was also translated into chinese to ensure prompt engagement with local taxi drivers - who often did not understand english. The service was even better than the Langham!!! I will definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Kristof M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel for nearly six months when working in Hong Kong and consider it as one of the best hotels I have been over the last years. The hotel is well-located at Nathan Road and in walking distance of TST, Monkok, Temple Street,... It doesn't even take five minutes to go to the closest MTR station (Jordan). The room, I stayed in the City Club Room, was great. The room was very clean, comfortable and well equipped. But above all, I had a magnificent view over Nathan Road. Definitly one off the best rooms I ever had. The staff is friendly and ready to make your stay as good as possible. The guys at the ground floor were always ready to call a taxi as quick as possible, the waitresses in the restaurant and bar (garden) area were serving you with a smile, the girls at the reception were giving all the required information (making restaurant reservations, giving directions, ...) and the management did everything to fullfill extra wishes. Overall I can say that this hotel is very good located, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is suberb. I will definitly recommend this hotel to friends and collegues who are staying in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms,expensive dining and little assistance.”
Reviews.Author: Postie3226
Reviews.Content: We were left to our own devices with baggage, on arrival and departure and given scant directions to lifts and room! Location is very good with Nathan Rd being a major shopping thoroughfare. If you want to pay through the nose for a hamburger dine in the hotel! Rooms were clean and spacious but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - location perfect and rooms lovely”
Reviews.Author: BrummieWanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton with my boyfriend in September last year, when it was still the Eaton Hotel. We stayed for three nights on the last leg of a China trip. The first thing we noticed was how strange it was to be surrounded by Westerners after two weeks of travelling through parts of China when we were, at times, the only Western faces around. While we were there, they were remodelling reception. The building work didn’t disturb us, it just meant it got a bit buy around the temporary desk and some of the bars were shut. However, we upgraded to a room which would give us access to the E club – I can’t recommend this highly enough. The E club serves breakfast each morning and canapés and drinks at cocktail hour.  It was a great addition and meant we could grab a snack before heading out – meaning we could take more time choosing somewhere to eat as we weren’t starving. The food was very Western in style though, and so, you could have filled up on the canapés and skipped dinner, but we didn’t want to miss out on a whole city of food outside! We had one of the rooms with the floors to ceilings windows. Although these are deluxe rooms, they are quite small due to the layout with that big curved window. However, the bed was comfy and everything we needed was there, so the space didn’t bother us too much. There was plenty of room to move around anyway, and we had the view up Nathan Road to look at. Location wise, the hotel is great. Right on Nathan Road, walking distance to the metro stop to head anywhere in the city. It’s also walking distance to the Tin Hau Temple and Jade Market and Night Market which I really enjoyed. We also used the rooftop swimming pool a few times. The pool is lovely – small but clean and there are views from the terrace to the harbour which was great. There’s also a gym which we didn’t use. The pool doesn’t have a bar or refreshment area but no-one minded us taking drinks up there. If I went back to Hong Kong, I’d stay at the Eaton again like a shot. It was a great find in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AND EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: gigi888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated very conveniently in the middle of Nathan Road and between 2 mtr stations. There are loads of eateries nearby and it only takes about 10~15 mins to walk to Tsim Sha Tsui or Mong Kok for shopping. We stayed in a superior room on the 19th floor and to me it is considered pretty spacious given the price and compared to some of the other hotels we previously stayed at in Hong Kong. The promotion includes free buffet breakfast and the spread provides a good variety to choose from. The service was excellent, I realised that I left my watch in the room after checking out and they were very helpful and quickly reissued a room card so that I could return back to the room. Also, their room service and technician responded quickly when we had a problem with the tv and requested for addition toiletries. Overall we have a great experience at Eaton Smart, I will definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, near to Temple St and Jade market & Kowloon shopping”
Reviews.Author: StuartinFiji
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2011. The current promotion is currently great, I saved a ton, called Linger Longer for Less.: Stay more and pay less with us from 1 June to 31 August 2011 with the exclusive "Linger longer for less" offer. Book two nights or more at the Best Available Rate and enjoy a greater discount for a longer stay, up to 25%, and qualify for complimentary Internet, breakfast, upgrades and more. • Linger 2 nights save 10% • Linger 3 nights, save 15% + Complimentary daily breakfast for 2 • Linger 4 nights, save 20% + Complimentary daily breakfast for 2 + in-room internet access I stayed for 3 nights, got an upgrade, and had a good night sleep every night. Right next to the JORDAN MTR as well which made transport really easy

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, courteous staff, location so-so”
Reviews.Author: AngelBeez_11
Reviews.Content: I went from 30 Jun - 5 Jul 2011. The hotel is currently having a promotion in which the longer you stay the more discount you get. Not bad. Take note that the cantonese pronounciation of the hotel is "Yat Dong" Room We asked for 2 rooms: non-smoking, 2 single bed. We wanted the rooms to be beside each other but when we reached at 11am, there wasn't any more available. So my friends & I were separated (7th and 18th floor). Overall, the room was clean, and the bed was comfortable (they provided 2 pillows). Only 1 friend complained that the bed was hard. Service Overall, a good understanding of english, speak slowly and you will be fine. Courteous (though sometimes hardly a smile), but ready to serve. I even had them to call a restaurant to make reservation and they kindly assisted us with that. Location i would say the location isn't exactly the best. about a 12-15min walk to Jordan MTR. on a tired day, that's still considered a distance. As it is along Nathan Road, when u travel in 3 or more, take a cab and they can drop you by Nathan Road just outside the exit of Eaton. Not many cab drivers know "Eaton Hotel" but since it's just beside Nathan Hotel, just use Nathan Hotel. :) Oh yes, the hotel provided us a little card with a map and address (english & chinese) of the hotel for us to inform cab drivers. Not bad! Internet As we got the room at discounted rate, so no free WIFI. lobby has computer with internet access, most of the time crowded so you need to queue up. you can also try your luck with the computers inside the cafe. Others - The hotel allowed guests to take water from a fridge at the concierge! this was excellent as water was much needed in the hot weather. So thoughtful & great service. - a cafe called "fei chui" just opp the hotel, serves wonderful HK food till 3am. a must try - towel in the bathroom was soft and nice! hee...

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dhalia85
Reviews.Content: I felt pampered at Eaton Smart, Hong Kong. The aesthetics of the hotel was fantastic. The breakfast was wonderful and a good way to start the day. The hotel is well located and gives you a good glimpse of Hong Kong without going too far. You could walk every where. The hotel staff provided superb service.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel, keenly priced”
Reviews.Author: Hopebruiser
Reviews.Content: The attraction of this hotel, in Hong Kong a city brimming with 5 and 4 star hotels, can be summed up as follows: the location which is great, near transport, shops, the night market, and Mongkok, and also the calibre of its staff. The hotel staff are very helpful, and give you real "local" tips, in my case, a tip enabled me to find a special tea shop I'd never even heard of, despite being a frequent HK visitor. Every person I dealt with from concierge staff to front desk was efficient, and professional, but never obsequious. The other plus with this hotel is the Tai Chi class, 3 times weekly, with a highly professional and entertaining Tai Chi Master, and at the civilised time of 8am. The rooms are great, with everything you need, including a great mattress, and the toiletries are very classy. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't praise the Eaton enough”
Reviews.Author: joelouise75
Reviews.Content: There really isn't much more praise for the Eaton that hasn't already been stated. Loved the amazing staff , so efficient & polite - clean , comfortable & well positioned hotel within easy reach of everything. MTR & bus transport easy & convenient. Breakfast buffet very handy before hitting the streets & cold water at the concierge a great welcome back after a full day taking in as much as possible in fantastic HK. We are returning early 2012 & most definitely to the Eaton ..... can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here when we come to HK”
Reviews.Author: kirstenandy
Reviews.Content: Great stay as always - great location - close to markets and everything you need - catch a taxi outside, short walk to the underground, airport express bus etc. Travel alone a lot and as a woman I always feel safe here and around here anytime of day or evening. Great pool - small but always clean and quiet place to unwind - dont always get the buffet breakfast but when you do it is AMAZING - one of the best breakfasts around. Small rooms but clean and nicely decorated and good value for HK

Reviews.Title: “great service, friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: tourch
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel last year, and on our return found the service as great as ever. The Tai Chi lessons are a must, the teacher is inspirational, the rooms are squeaky clean, and comfortable (pillows the best in any hotel we've ever stayed in). What makes this hotel exceptional is the level of service provided by the staff, with great local "insider tips" about HK. The location is sensational, close to great shops, restaurants and the night market. Over the years we've stayed in many locations in HK, and different hotels, and this one is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Levash
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean an neat, staff spoke good english and were very helpful. Location was great as it is situated on Nathan Road, which is near the subway. Did'nt really try the hotl food as there are so many restaurants nearby. The concierge gave good advice on were to go, how far everything is and were to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: YvesInUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and travelled with family. Stayed in a deluxe room and it is considerately small but i supposed it is normal in HK. The room was nicely refurbished and has a 'Zen' look to it. It even has an ipod dock for audio and charging- absolutely convenient for Iphone users. Everyone loved it. If you are travelling as a couple and used to sleep in a king size bed- DO ask for twin bed. My parents weren't too happy with the double bed as they were always awakened by each other when one was tossing around. Remember to add in the request if you need a smoking room as they are pretty limited.hey have connecting rooms if you are travelling with family. Paid around HKD 800 for 4 nights under linger for less package- inclusive of breakfast and free internet access. Front desk staff was attentive. But took a bit tad long to check in as we had a long day travelling and it just became too tiring for me to deal with the paper works at 11 pm. Make sure u check the invoice for any extra charges as they tried charging my sister's room for things she didn't order from the breakfast room. Staffs seem a little bit blur on the internet charges- it was meant to be complimentary but told my dad it was chargeable even though it was clearly stated on the package. Male staffs seem moody- should smile more. Location: Fantastic. Opposite is the K1 route free airport express shuttle bus which takes u to Kowloon station where u can take the airport express train to HKIA. Tsui Wah- a famous local cafe is just opposite the hotel which opens till late serves good and cheap food. Must try the ' lai yau chu chai pau'- butter bun and milk tea. Jordan MTR is located on the next block but on the opposite side of the road which i only noticed on my last day. I used to walk 2 blocks on the same side- thinking that was the nearest stop. ANyway just hail a taxi if u are too late. It is only HKD 18 for the first 2km- considerately cheap! Ladies market is a good place to walk around during night time and it is just on the opposite side of the Nathan Road. Many good eating places around the area- you will always have McD right opp. the hotel too. Breakfast:- normal selection. Cereals, porridge, bacon, fruits, juice. They have a egg station where u could request for types of eggs u like. Great service from the staffs. Very courteous and attentive. Internet:- It was free for us in the room which uses ethernet. No wifi in the room. Only available in the lobby for hotel guest. But they do have 5-6 computers in the lobby for guests. Nice T-bar with delicious complimentary welcome cocktails. Swimming pool- small but better than none. A nice way to wind down after a tiring day. Gym- Small but sufficient for gym junkies. Overall- a strategic place for visiting HK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service even after we left!”
Reviews.Author: LudoFrancois
Reviews.Content: We booked room 1017 for 4 nights checking out on 28 May. We forgot an iphone charger in the room and when we reached Singapore we emailed the hotel to ask about it. The staff was extremely helpful. We are very pleased that not only the hotel managed to retrace the charger but they sent it to us all the way here by registered post! We are impressed with such service and dedication. Our stay was very nice there. The room was spacious (relative to some other hotels I have stayed at in Hong Kong) and the rooftop pool, while not large, is a great reprieve from the heat, especially after a long day of trekking the new territories or walking the streets downtown. The staff are professional and very helpful. To enhance our comfort, the hotel even has a free cold water dispenser at level one. And the location couldn't have been better. Right smack in the middle of Nathan Road. 5-10 mins walk to Jordan MTR, night market and Shamrock. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - a few pointers though”
Reviews.Author: crbguy
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed one night here in June 2011. It is a nice hotel, but our experience was mixed. I would definitely recommend it, but I also have a few criticisms/comments. First, we arrived very early in the day (8:30 a.m.) and they were willing to accommodate us and allow us to check-in early, but they only offered us a smoking room.
