If we wanted to wait for a non-smoking room, we were going to have to wait until the afternoon. We decided to take the smoking room because we were very tired and wanted to rest. The room smelled of smoke (no surprise there), but the real problem was that it was old and dingy. Apparently, the smoking rooms are not renovated yet. So, it was fairly depressing. We asked about paying for a better room, and they offered us a club room immediately. They quoted us a price, but failed to mention the 10% add-on (which isn't a tax but really is just a "service fee" that should be included in the rate because it is nothing more than additional money for the hotel). So, in reality, the room was 10% more than they quoted me. I took it before I knew that, so it ticked me off a little bit. But, the room was very nice and came with access to the club room. The rooms do not have internet in them, and so you have to go to the club room for the internet access. The club room is nice, but they have limited western options for food. They have an espresso machine which I liked a lot, though! Across the street from the hotel is a McDonalds, and a Starbucks is right next to it. They also have a very good coffee shop int he hotel, that has pastries and coffee. The Temple Street night market is also right across the street. The highlight of the hotel was the rooftop pool. It is small, but very clean and well-kept. It looks like a pool in an old Roman villa and it was a blast for me and my son. Even though we were only there one night, we went twice to it. He really enjoyed it. I had one other glitch while I was there. The concierge arranged ferry tickets for my son and I, and they booked the wrong class. I think it was a language miscommunication. I told them I wanted VIP class, but they booked first class instead. When I received the tickets and told them they weren't right, they initially tried to get me to take them and indicated they had purchased what I asked for. When I held my ground, they releneted and exchanged the tickets for the right ones. So, they remedied it without much difficulty. All in all, it was a good trip with a few caveats. They really should finish renovating the whole hotel. Also, they should be clear about their rates and get rid of the 10% additional charge, which misleads people. Finally, they should add more western food to their club room buffet. Other than that, I was pleased with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, we'll be back for sure - EXCELLENT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Sean_AustinTX
Reviews.Content: My kids loved the hotel itself, including the pool. My wife loved being on Nathan Road, a block from the Temple and Jade night market streets. I loved the fantistic room rates and that we were only a block from the Jordan MTR, and that we were on the K1 shuttle route for the airport train - the K1 stop is *at* the Eaton hotel. Even the two free welcome drinks in the "T" bar were memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Fhyure
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Housekeeping staffs are polite and helpful and acceded to every request with a smile. I asked for a floor towel and got it, along with 2 bathroom towels and toothbrushes. - Gym staffs were cheery and will greet you warmly when you get to Level 21 (where the gym is at) - Front desk staffs spoke good English and were keen to help in any way they can - Beds were firm and bouncy and i had a good night's sleep - Free bottles of water available Cons: - Pool not as big as expected - No free internet available Others: - 10mins walk to the nearest MTR station - 20mins walk to Ladies Market In all, a very good hotel for the price that you pay. It's comfortable and the service staffs provide good service and are helpful. It might not be very close to the shopping areas but it's near enough being located on Nathans Road. There's a 24-hours McDonalds located across the street and loads of shopping streets nearby so that's good enough !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: liked_copper
Reviews.Content: Fantastic find, we absolutely loved our stay here. The rooms are small, but are spotlessly clean and have tea/coffee making facilities which was great. The buffet breakfast is one of the best in any hotel I've been too. We ate in the beer garden one evening and the food was very good and not overly expensive. Location for us was the main thing about the Eaton Hotel. We loved being on Kowloon side of Hong Kong as we felt it was a real Hong Kong experience. We moved to Hong Kong Island for a night due to the flight disruptions due to snow in Europe but much preferred Kowloon. We loved strolling the busy streets to the markets all around. We loved Hong Kong and will definately stay in the Eaton again.

Reviews.Title: “False claim of a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Numnock
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the rating or previous rating of this hotel. It does not deserve 4-star rating. The room has flees and ticks in carpet. I am still recovering from the itch. The website pictures of the hotel were taken through magnetfying glasses to make the rooms, the lobby, and other areas much more spacious. The swimming pool is the size of my bathtub. I have never heard of a 4-star hotel that does not have wifi internet. Frontdesk and concierge services are rude and impolite. I would not step my feet back in this hotel again. There are plenty of other hotels along Nathan Rd. that are conveniently located near mass transit, shopping centers, and restaurants at much more reasonable price and much better service. This is NOT a true 4-star hotel. Whoever did the rating should have rated Eaton Smart Hotel in Hong Kong a 2-star hotel with flees and ticks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: customerservicequeen
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for 4 nights on our way to China. We stayed in a Deluxe Room which was well appointed, modern and clean although very small. In fact, it was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Beds were extremely hard but after a full day of sightseeing you should sleep well regardless. We packaged our breakfast with our accommodation - the breakfast was outstanding with a huge variety of choices, fresh and of great quality. The hotel is very well located for the Ladies, Jade and Temple Street Night Markets. Station is just down the road, and being on Nathan Road makes it easy to walk straight down to the ferry (it is about a 20 minute walk though). Loads of restaurants nearby, and a convenience store across the street. My teenage son loved the free internet in the foyer. The hotel was recommended to me by a friend and I would happily recommend it to others who want to be located in this part of Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST IN THE TOWN”
Reviews.Author: CALLINGYOU
Reviews.Content: Located adjacent to Nathan hotel and in front of Novotel.Best in many ways.Rooms were good.And Mtr is at walking distance.They have a bakery downstairs.I really enjoyed our stay.U have a Mall just opposite the road and ladies market and night market are at walkable distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Simply loved it”
Reviews.Author: gsuri
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in May 2011 on a business trip to Hong Kong. Eaton Smart was recommended to me by coouple of people and it was a really stay. Very clean and tidy vicinity and roof top gym and pool are simple awesome. The food is really good spl. the cantonese resturant. Eaton Smart is a place you would definitely come back to and recommend to your friends. Thank you very much for making our stay so pleasant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably attentive service”
Reviews.Author: gerardpu
Reviews.Content: I checked in early morning on my 50th birthday to be immediately greeted with a "happy birthday". Totally understandable, room was not ready yet but the hotel made every effort to have a room ready by 11 AM. We got upgraded to an executive room, which was indeed very spacious. Shortly after checking into our room, the front desk called to say they wanted to send up a bottle of champaign for my birthday. Who would expect that during a 2 night stopover stay in a 21 storey hotel in the heart of Kpwloon, Hong Kong? We thought it was amazing! Add the most convenient location, the really nice atmosphere and the lovely rooftop swimming pool as a great bonus in Hong Kong. Would recommend to everyone, especially on your birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Regular visitor”
Reviews.Author: paulbhatia
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Eaton now for 6 years for business and have always found the staff to be very helpful, all the way from the bell boys to the staff in the E club! (pay a little extra and get to use the E club- well worth the extra cost) Even when I went for a vacation to HK I stayed there with my family and they enjoyed the visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: rustman1
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The "Can Do" was excellent. The food in the restaurants was top grade. The room was well-fitted for our purposes although the security chain was missing. The hotel is very centrally situated and ideal for sightseeing. I did not like the fact that the security chain was missing.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: sarantino
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last summer. I left my iPod in the safe, the Eaton hotel immediately emailed me to let me know that I may have left something behind. They then posted my iPod back to me, thank you so much for the outstanding service!

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Smart deseve to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hachimancho9
Reviews.Content: If you want to be a welcome guest in Hong Kong. Stay at Eaton Smart Hotel and you're welcome to try to stay. Many friendly staffs will make your stay comfortably. Do not be hesitate to contact them. I believe that's an essential part of your stay and you'll feel at home. I would say that I love Eaton's staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff, perfect location at a very good price.”
Reviews.Author: RonaldFC
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Eaton hotel for four days and it was a very pleasant experience The location is fantastic, on Nathan Road in Kowlooon, only a few minutes’ walk to the subway (MTR), shops and markets, literally, just around the corner. You can walk along the road to reach Mong Kok, Yau Ma Tei or Tsim Sha Tsui. The staff is so friendly, attentive and helpful, highly knowledgeable and very helpful in their tips for travel in and around Hong Kong, service is second to none. The rooms are comfortable with big bathrooms. The facilities at the hotel are outstanding; I highly recommend the restaurant for breakfast and dinner. We are planning our return trip to Hong Kong and obviously we will stay again at the Eaton hotel. Great hotel, wonderful staff, perfect location at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, location and facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Nicolel05
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights and it definately was not long enough! The staff were so friendly and attentive and helpful. The rooms were great, with comfy beds and nice big bathrooms. The facilities at the hotel were oustanding, the gym was great and the restaurants and bars were well stocked. I highly recommend the e-club suite, and the staff there were highly knowledgable and very helpful in their tips for travel in and around Hong Kong. The location was fantastic, with only a few minutes walk to the train and the shops and markets are very close by too. We cannot wait to return for a longer stay to truly enjoy all that the Eaton hotel and Hong Kong offers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: peony249
Reviews.Content: A good location hotel. Near Temple street, walking distance. Hotel location in the middle of Nathan Road (long stretch), you can walk along the road to reach Mong Kok, Yau Ma Tei or Tsim Sha Tsui. Hotel staff service - average.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Guis
Reviews.Content: Located on the very busy Nathan Road in Kowlooon, close to the MTR. Reception very polite and helpful. Rooms are small, but functional. The air conditioning did not cool the room, just blew the air around, it was refreshing on a morning to open the door to the corridor to admit cool air. I reported this to reception who said they would have it fixed, but there was no improvement. Although the room appeared clean, it was very dusty, with a good layer of dust on most surfaces. Not good for allergy sufferers. Breakfast was very good, lots of choice, either Asian or Western. However, don’t try the fried eggs, ask for them to be cooked how you like them, they only ever come almost raw (or almost cooked) It was difficult to find suitable place to eat nearby, either ‘street food’ or Chinese Restaurants with menus totally in Chinese. Not their fault of course, we were the visitors. Hotel dinner was good, but to be expected, expensive. Late check out is available, at an extra cost, but stay too long and the full daily rate will be charged.

Reviews.Title: “The place to go to feel special - an oasis when away from home”
Reviews.Author: MarkFair
Reviews.Content: I've visited Hong Kong many times and return to the Eaton again and again. Recently has undergone an extensive revamp of reception/check in/restaurant and bar area and is looking better than ever. Greeted warmly and friendly the minute you arrive - concierge always right with you, smiling and welcoming. Up to reception and the same again - quick, efficient, warm and friendly. No requests to small. TBar - a great place to unwind and relax, have a quick bite to eat - fun and friendly - again fantastic staff. The small extra to cost to access EClub benefits is well well worth it. Free hot unlimited self service breakfast in the exclusive EClub lounge, then complimentary soft drinks and light bites throughout the day - until my favourite at 17:30 - Cocktail Time! Two hours of complimentary cocktails, spirits, sparkling wine, wine....hot food and canapés - all served by caring, attentive and wonderfully friendly staff. Housekeeping great - efficient and friendly. All in all a fantastic place to base your trip to Hong Kong, be it your 1st time, 51st time, business trip or pleasure. Thank you all to all the staff at The Eaton Hotel - you make the place amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - well priced”
Reviews.Author: travellingunderpants
Reviews.Content: Ask for a renovated room, they are much nicer. I've stayed there several times, upgraded to a suite once, it was roomier but at the time not renovated. The renovated rooms are a pleasure to stay in, yet small. Patio is very charming, and the staff is extremely nice !!! Preferred the patio to the club lounge as it was much nicer and had good ambience / cool music. Location - it's quite a walk to the MTR if you're dragging luggage with you, and better to take a taxi to the "hot spots" as there's not much around the hotel. As a place to come back to for a good night's sleep, it's perfect. Internet works well so working in hotel room or lobby or patio is a breeze. The only negative thing for me about this hotel is the location, I like to walk out of a hotel and go to a decent pub, or grab a bite to eat, however that the buffet lunch or anything from menu is decent. Since they've renovated the patio, I consider it to look / feel quite trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location right in the middle of it all.”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1811027
Reviews.Content: Our Rooms: The core to any stay in a Hotel is its rooms. You don't often stay in them much, but when you do, they have to be good. Ours were. Bedroom, resting and bathroom all top notch. Our rooms were on the end of the hotel looking up Nathan road. What a view. Front desk and Concierge: All staff we worked with were great and went beyond the call of duty. The knowledge of the Concierge was amazing and accurate. Food: We ate a number of times in the Metro Restaurant - the food was great. Coffee in the Main Street cafe was great, but the bagels could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Room and Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Morning_Star_98_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a wonderful restaurant and friendly staff. Location was superb as it is in the heart of a shopping area. Rooms were clean but abit small. The other thing is that the toilet/bathroom door are translucent. Great for couples but not when other family members is in the room. I loved the fitness center as all the equipments are complete and it is open 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,Good Food,Nice Staffs,Great Location in HK.”
Reviews.Author: angiebabytraveller
Reviews.Content: I love the staff being attentive and provided good service, very clean though small room,only thing i dont like is that I have to pay 130HKD for 24 hours use of internet but its free in the 3 computers in the lobby area. Food Service was great. It was my birthday & we were given cake and champagne.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ron188590
Reviews.Content: The Eaton hotel is a nice place to stay when you visit Hong Kong. There many nice hotels in Hong Kong but somehow I always return to the Eaton. The rooms are good usually book a club room with club service. But it is not the room that makes me come back. It is the people that work there. The service is with a smile but it is not over done. It is just right. At the reception, Restaurants, all good. Nice thing about this hotel is that they have an outside area where you can have drinks. This is a very relaxing place. Most impressive is the Eclub where you can have breakfast, free internet and free drinks in the afternoon. These clubs you find in many hotels round the world but the service of the staff in this one is the best I have seen ( and I travel a lot) They remember your name after one visit, know what you drink, remember what you talked about the day before and that with so many guests. I short a good place to stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service - you couldn't ask for nicer people”
Reviews.Author: Robyn31
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed in this hotel, and will continue to stay there every time I go to Hong Kong. On this trip, I was staying with my mother in law and my 4 month old daughter. I had to go for a conference, and was worried about my mother in law and my daughter whilst I was out for the day. I needn't have worried... The wonderful staff down in the e-club did everything they could to help out my mother in law, and were always helpful with local advice and a chat. She locked herself out of the room at least 4 times, and the front desk staff couldn't be more helpful in getting her back in. The conceirge and guys at the door were great help if you wanted to go somewhere, to tell the taxi's where you were off to. If you are looking for a hotel that has everything and wonderful staff, then this is it. I would highly recommend the e-club (if your room doesn't include it, then ask to have it - around $HK500/day). It is the best. It includes breakfast, drinks and snacks all day, and cocktail hour at night with some yummy hot snacks. Cocktail hour is the best, and something we just couldn't miss at the end of the day! Even just for the chat. I love this place, and will tell anyone standing still long enough how great it was! Maybe I should ask them about being an ambassador.... ;)

Reviews.Title: “PRICY!”
Reviews.Content: Nothing was included at Eaton Smart, even though we payed quite a lot for the stay. The breakfast was expensive, the internet was slow and expensive. However, the staff was vey helpful. Location was OK, but not great as you could hear al the noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for a quality hotel in central Kowloon, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Serious_JetLag
Reviews.Content: Eaton Smart Hong Kong is the best value in Central Kowloon when you are looking for a top quality hotel. The staff and service are very friendly and efficient while the rooms are comfortable and well designed. The Eaton is close to many great restaurants, shopping, and is a short walk to the MTR (subway) station. If you are traveling from the airport via the Airport Express train, a free shuttle bus (K1) is available from the Kowloon station to the hotel. I have never had a bad stay at the Eaton Smart Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “STill good, but tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: kieran1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12 months ago. The lobby and beer gardne are renovated- and it looks good. This time around, stayed in the deluxe room-s they are outdated and need a renovation. No Ipod dock like the other rooms, old TV and the paint was peeling and the carpet worn. Bed comfortable however and it is clean- I'd imagine the rooms are eearmakered for a reno. Again pauid $30.00 AUD a day top access E-Club. Marilyn and the team BRILLIANT! Small buffet breakfast, tea coffee and juice/coke etc all day with fruit and mini cakes, and 5.30-7.30 hot finger food and wine/spirits/beer served by the ondomitable Marilyn, Danny, Elaine and the crew. Close to Jordan station, this hotel is worth it! Also has a pool on the 23rd floor for a dip after the shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel will definitly stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Hel53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton for 5 nights , the hotel is in a good location for sightseeing ,shopping etc. The rooms are small but adequate , very clean . The breakfast is great plenty of choice . Overall a nice hotel would definitly stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: alans07
Reviews.Content: It's been around a year since I last stayed at the Eaton Hotel due to company travel planning however, how I've missed it! I travel quite a lot to the Far East on business and was always happy at the Eaton, everything about the hotel was always good but with the new facelift to many areas of the public space, it's really improved. The thing is though, there are a lot of hotels that have the right look and feel but its always the staff that make the difference. To be recognised by many of the staff after a year and welcomed by name really does give you a warm feeling, just what you need when you're away from the family. I can't fault the hotel in any department and I see it as good value for money too. I have to say that the Guest Services Manager-Marilyn is one of my favourite people in the world. Bad day, tons of e-mails, travel weary however bad you feel she somehow makes you feel special and welcome, but all of the staff are great, that's what makes the place special for me. Thumbs up from me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LauraMHull
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Smart hotel on a stop off on the way back to the UK from Australia. We found the hotel to be in a great location, close to the Night markets and MRT. The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful and there was plenty of choice at breakfast. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: aquaontherocks
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at Eaton and I'm sure to stay in this hotel everytime I visit Hong Kong. I'm very satisfied with the service I receive at Eaton and the hospitality. During my first visit, I had a free upgrade to a deluxe room instead of the standard room which I paid for (subject to availability). And this time round as the smoking room which I requested for has been converted to a non-smoking floor, I was upgraded to a Junior Suite. Honestly, most hotels will not go to this extend to make up for this. At most, they'd probably give you free cocktails or fruit basket or free laundry etc. But Eaton has done it and I'm very pleased with their sincerity in making customers feel comfortable at their hotel at all times. On top of that, the hotel is nicely renovated. The room is very clean and the front desk and concierge has very friendly staff to assist you in whatever you need. Other than their excellent hospitality, they are also located at a great location. It's a favourite location for me because it's near the MTR (within 5-7mins walk) and there are many great eateries and restaurants around Nathan road. 2 streets away from Eaton there is a Nathan Congee shop or something like that. It's a very traditional shop that sells great congee and noodles. I recommend the century egg congee and abalone congee, beef brisket noodles, and poached liver and kidney in special sauce. And then a street away there is Starbucks, and next to it there's a Chinese Restaurant called Dao Xiang (稻香 in Mandarin). It serves delicious dim sum in the morining till noon, and great steamboat for dinner. Go after 9pm as they'll have special prices then. Recommended soupbase is the pork bone soup.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Club level”
Reviews.Author: mfhmfh
Reviews.Content: We has a suite in the Club level. The suites were small but comfortable. The Club level allowed for complimentary breakfasts. And free drinks and food for 2 hours each evening. It was one of the best value hotels that I have stayed at for a long time. The service was top shelf (in the Club lounge). I have stayed at many hotels in HK. But will return here, due to massive value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: First of all the lobby was under renovation when I stayed there, but was not an issue, personal was very helpful. The rooms look like they were renovated recently, so they do look pretty chic compared to other hotels I have stayed before, and the size of the rooms were about the average of the hotels on the same area-price range. Location is a big asset for this hotel very close to the MTR stations and the Temple street night markets if you are into that. The only complaint I have is the elevator system, it is VERY slow, took almost 10 minutes to get to the street; it didn't help that there was a soccer tournament in town so a lot of kids were all over the facilities straining the already weak elevator system. I know I may sound picky, but I was on the 9th floor, and call the elevator down and after I got inside it would go up to the 11th to pick people up and all the way until the street level. It didn't help that there was no AC inside the elevator cart so it was annoying. The pool on the roof looks nice, but it was a little too small for my taste, again it didn't help having 15 kids jumping and splashing around, but by yourself it would be a nice pool. Other than that it is a decent hotel for your money, but I don't know if I would stay there again, other than for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kat44007
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, could not grumble. It was a 3 night stopover on the way to Australia. The Hotel was situated on Nathan Road, which was very central. Lots of resturants nearby, but we ate in the Hotel as the food was very good quality. Found Hong Kong in general very expensive, even the taxis, but we were probably in the tourist part. Nathan Road is very long and my only complaint could be that I would have prefered a hotel closer to the Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Stay Again !”
Reviews.Author: teanutSouthWales
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by friendly concierge and reception staff. We were told we were being upgraded. Room was very small, but this wasnt a problem because we were hardly in the room. The room was spotlessy clean and bed was very comfortable. We paid for a late check out on day of departure, but on leaving the room 10 minutes before deadline, there were 3 housemaids waiting right outside the door, hardly giving us room to get through the door ! We felt rushed and didnt like to go back and do the final check of the room. We really enjoyed our stay, though and will stay again. The Eaton is in an excellent location, with the MTR station only a short walk away, and markets all nearby. We visited the Big Buddha on Lantau Island. We made our own way there on the MTR and then the cable car. It was a full day and we would highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very very happy”
Reviews.Author: greenpapaya
Reviews.Content: Firstly the trip from the airport into Kowloon on the airport express was simple and swift. Follow the signs to the airport express train counter, and pick up the convenient pass. We bought the return tourist card that included 3 day unlimited rides on the MTR (local subway). The train took us to Kowloon station and then we followed the signs to the K1 bus. Eaton smart is the 7th or 8th stop, but it did not take longer than 20min on the bus. (note: on the way back, it took less than 10 mins to get to the airport express train station). The lobby of the hotel is above the road. We booked the hotel through Hotels.com and we had no problem checking in. The room, as expected in HK, to be small. BUT it was comfortable, and suitable for a couple. The bathroom had good water pressure and the water was warm consistently (not intermittently, depending on the time of the day you shower). When we requested for an iron and a board, it came very quickly. And I am happy that the room was cleaned up during the day while we are away. We never saw the cleaners and they just seem to come by when they know we are not around. Personally, I do not like to hear the cleaners standing outside hotel room doors chatting loudly nor pushing their carts noisily especially when you arrive late at night, only to be woken by them at 7 in the morning with a knock and "Housekeeping!" Breakfast buffet was great - a good spread of fresh fruits daily, and juices. The breads were fresh too and my husband was happy with the hot foods selection. It is a very busy restaurant in the morning, hence the waiters (especially the one at the front desk) was sometimes hurried and could use a smile or two for the guests. But the waiters serving the guests inside the restaurant were nice and attentive with tea, coffee, water servings. Travelling around was easy, 8 min walk to Jordan station, a Starbucks just outside the hotel, an easy walk to temple street (night market). Only 2 stops to Mongkok ladies market. And a 30 min walk to star ferry - although we hear that its boats will shuttle people for the last time this Friday, which I hope the government will change its mind and bring it back again real soon. We will come back to the hotel again if we are back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Livetotravel_11
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel in October 2010 - I found it great value for money, in a fantastic location (close to markets, waterfront, tube stations etc). The rooms were fantastic - clean and modern. I would highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location.... small (but adequate) rooms”
Reviews.Author: SomersetKatie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location...... a quick, cheap taxi ride from Kowloon station for arrival and departure. It is situation on the busy shooping area of Nathan road, close to an underground station and an easy walk to the night market and waterfront. The hotel room was small but perfectly adequate for a short stay but little or no wardrobe space. There was a small in room safe, a good selection of bathroom products, a mini bar/fridge and freebottled water avaiable both in room and from a large fridge in the lower lobby.... a nice touch! The breakfast was excellent; a good selection available every morning..... english, continental and asian cuisine. The bar prices were on the expensive side. The gym is very well equiped and next to the small outdoor heated pool. There are small changing shower rooms and plenty of towels available. Swimming, at the 21st floor pool, overlooking the city, was an excellent way to unwind after a days sightseeing! The staff were all very helpful, courteous and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel. Great location, great room, great service.”
Reviews.Author: flyrob2000
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive room with inclusive breakfast. The room was bigger than expected with modern decor and very clean. Breakfast buffet was really good, restaraunt service was good but a little scrappy when it got really busy which is understandable; full tour groups seemed to arrive for breakfast all at once which didn't help. Overall we were extremely happy with the hotel and will book again without hesitation next time we're in Hong Kong. I think some of the negative reviews are probably from people who booked standard rooms. Go for executive - really good value. Negative comments would be the expensive 'in room' internet. Free internet in lobby provided. I think local telco PCCW gives a free 24 hours wi-fi trial to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “great location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: thebigmushroom
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel, just along the nathan road with easy access to the mrt and the night markets. The downside here is the size of the rooms.. i was shocked as we had an upgrade...i wasn't too keen on the blinds in the bathroom either as it is possible to see who your sharing the room with on the loo... lucky i noticed this before i needed the facility !!! Breakfast in the morning was lovely though...but i'm sure you can find a hotel with better sized rooms for the money

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but small rooms and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Jusboro
Reviews.Content: Was put into single room but moved to double room. Room was very small with no space for a case or many clothes. Smart decor and attentive service, with great breakfast buffet. Restaurants not great and slow service. Great location for shops and near to metro and markets. Minibar very expensive, but shop just over road which serves great fish balls. Consierge staff very helpful and great spoken English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel which has maintained its standard and is going green”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey08
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the hotel which has changed its name to Eaton Smart Hotel. Other than this, generally it has maintained its standard of service and rooms. As the hotel is going green, I realised a lot of things e.g. toohtbrush are no longer provided initially. But the hotel was prompt in providing us with one upon request, good job! The hotel is well located along Nathan Road. It is also within a 5 min walk to Jordan MTR station and the Temple Street Market. It is also close to the Tai Ping Koon Restaurant which sells very good swiss sauce chicken wings! Nathan Congee is also nearby which sells excellent Jidi congee. I will definitely continue to stay at Eaton and support it's initiative to go green.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our budget - and fab decor!”
Reviews.Author: planetc_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel, booked through BA Holidays, and it was brilliant for the money we paid! :-) Our room had a view of Nathan Road and had gorgeous contemporary decor - it all felt new & lovely. We both slept like logs every night! The only 'niggles' were the small number of clothes hangars and not having a music channel on the TV - although it had CNN News, BBC World News and plenty of other English-language channels :-) The breakfast buffet was a brilliant way to start the day and had everything we needed - including tons of tea/coffee refreshes from the nice staff. (All staff were lovely - form the man that met us off the free airport shuttle bus and offered to take our suitcases to our rooms, to the maid staff, to the bar staff - bless them) We ate twice form the Metro restaurant and the food was reasonably priced and good sized portions :-) Loved the heated rooftop pool, plus the outdoor bar area! Great to have 6 free internet terminals to keep in touch with family/friends. Tempest Street market being just 2mins from the hotel was brilliant, plus having a 7-Eleven and a Starbucks right on it's door-step was fab. And it was so handy for either Jordan or Yau Ma Tei MTR stations, so getting around the city was very easy. Would definitely stay here again! :-))

Reviews.Title: “Upgrading in progred”
Reviews.Author: rclason
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in 2008 and had to complain about the room they tried to give me as it was nothing like the picture on their web site. At that time was advised they were upgrading the hotel. Surpise 2 years later they once tried to put me into an old room. If you are unlucky to get one of their old rooms you will be disapointed as they are old, dirty and dated. The new redecorated rooms are fine with no problems. Another thing you need to watch out for is some rooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Book eleswhere”
Reviews.Author: david1933
Reviews.Content: Twin room out of date, chipped paint, stained headboard, TV inaccessible to view and from the dark ages. Very shoddy house keeping. Floor never hoovered, revealed. Toe nail from previous occupant. After complaiining moved to a better room Metro bar/restaurent gor order wrong. The only saving grace beeing trhe location and the E club- which cost extra. In fairness we did receive a gesture of good will for the very poor experiences

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, GOOD LOCATION & SERVICE !”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-in-Cheshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and teenage son for 10 nights and we all had a great time. Yes the hotel rooms are on the small side but when you're staying in Hong Kong with all the sites to explore does it really matter! We did stay in a refurbished suite which was absolutely fine, it met our requirements. The buffet breakfast was great, there was everything for everybody. The gym and swimming pool on the roof terrace was great too. We encountered no problems at all with the service levels of staff, in fact we found them all to be really helpful and friendly. I would like to say a special thank you to Connie Ng, what a lovely lady - professional, courteous and very helpful! Would I stay at the Eaton again - yes definately!

Reviews.Title: “No fuss”
Reviews.Author: Freddie123Sydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton hotel for one night and found it convenient. The room was small, but clean. Only disadvantage was that I could hear the guests above me watch TV until late. Check in and out was quick. I did not use the breakfast facilities as I had to leave before it opened at 6.30am.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Raxx97
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in Kowloon this hotel is in a good location. Right near a metro stop (Jordan) so easy to get to HK Island, and the main tourist spots in Kowloon Bay are a 20 minute walk down Nathan road. It's near the night markets so it's an ideal base for soaking up Hong Kong at night. The room was pretty small, don't stay if you're planning on spending much time in your room but it was clean enough. The hotel staff were attentive and welcoming. Just off the lobby is a decent place for breakfast and they've got a sushi place too but it was empty when I checked it out. There's a nice, sheltered outdoor area that was prefect for a late drink.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TravellerWirral
Reviews.Content: For the first time ever we had an upgrade from a standard to a de-luxe room, I dread to think what size the standard was but the de-luxe was tiny, I was so disappointed. However we were only there for 2 nights on a stop over and normally would only have needed to put our heads down but the weather was freezing one day and freezing and pouring with rain the next so it would have been nice to have been able to have a bit of space, the only area downstairs to sit was in the bar area. The bed was brick hard, there was no ironing facilities in the room and no access to a decent news channel eg. Sky News. The pool was great - heated to 30 degrees so even when cold and raining it was fun to swim. We had to take our own cases up to the lobby and then to our room. There was free broadband internet in the lobby but if you wanted to use WiFi on an iPad it was only available in the lobby and you had to pay for it. We liked the location but it was quite a way from the harbour (1/2 hrs walk), right by the Jade Market and Night Market though. We wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all....”
Reviews.Author: Trial101
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we stayed in this hotel couple of weeks ago and our experince was just so bad I had to complain several times for the dirty room, hoever I had no reply from anyone. Maybe it was weekend and their manager was not on duty, but it was overall terrible including the restaurant and room service. I just cannot understand why they employ grumpy looking people and non of the employees we came in contact with was a happy looking. HK$1100 you can do much better in HK. From quality of the room carpet and room size (which is the smallest hotel room we have ever stayed!) and quality of service we thought they have a long way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Look this one up for sure”
Reviews.Author: philandcathy
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of its affordability and location on Nathan Road. Good move on both as it was great value for money and in a great location. Whilst its a little walk to the Big shops and Star Terminal it is very near all the street markets and lots of great and cheap eateries. The staff at the hotel were excellent and friendly and the buffet breakfast set us up for the entire day. The rooms are small but everything is there. Bit disappointed there was no music channel or up to date movie channel but as we didn't spend a lot of time in the room it wasn't a huge problem. This is a hotel I will recommend to my friends who want a standard without the big bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in room 1401 or any of the non refurbished rooms Eaton hotel Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: GaryNic101
Reviews.Content: My Wife & I were taken up to room 1401 (Eclub room) what a disgrace. The room stank of water damaged carpet, the furnishing were in poor repair & the walls were patched up & unclean. The Toilet cistern was hanging off the wall with the blue raw plugs exposed. The rooms Standard lamp was held together by sticky tape & falling over. I immediately asked to be given another room was shown an odour free room on the 15th floor but again this room was filthy & in poor repair. I asked what it would take to get a clean room or should I relocate to another hotel (Langhams is nearby). I was then offered a recently refurbished? room which would become available the next day, as we had booked 8 nights here I was greatly concerned. The next night we were moved into the the this room & it was satisfactory although nothing special. Staff were the only saving grace in this establishment. I would never recommned this hotel to anyone as anything more than a 2-3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a 1865 Voyager member, but I AM DONE WITH THEM! Never coming back!”
Reviews.Author: g0lf_vacati0ns
Reviews.Content: I must say my previous stays with the Eaton has been good. I used to stay there every month when I travel for Business, that's how I got my 1865 Voyager Status. The hotel then underwent renovations and I stayed at other hotels instead. Now that the renovation is completed, I was anticipating going back to the Eaton. My sister and I travelled to Hong Kong on 8-11 Jan 2011 and we chose Eaton. The rooms were very expensive - a standard small room costs almost 1800HKD a night without breakfast. I though since it was newly renovated, its probably worth the price. Besides, I was given a SUITE Upgrade voucher for my membership status, I figured that I'd use it. The horror began. Check in was ok, Eaton's service standard has always been good. The horror began when I opened my room door. The so-called suite was PATHETIC! Ok before I go on, please bear in mind that the normal going rate for a suite in this hotel is 3685HKD a night! I was expecting something grand, but NO! Instead the so called suite was so pathetic and in my opinion a piece of $#%@ that in my honest opinion, a Deluxe room would look nicer. What's bad about the suite: - The furnitures were OBVIOUSLY old and worn and tired! - The bathroom was so small and the ceiling was peeling - The carpet and curtains were old and dusty. I have very sensitive nose and I immediately got sneezy and itchy eyes - The TV in the room was pathetic - The phone on the executive working desk was not working....same for the lamp, not working! - The sofa was spoilt. The whole damn thing would 'sink in' and my butt hurt!!!!! - The hair-dryer....was the biggest joke! The whole damn hose fell off. (their hairdryer are the ones mounted in the bathroom walls)We called housekeeping....they fixed it. Then, still....the power of the hairdryer was so weak! It took like 5 mins for the hairdryer to heat up, then at the rate the air was blowing weakly, it probably will take 1 hour to dry your hair! We asked for a seperate hairdryer (standalone ones)....no difference! Takes time to warm up and the stupid air was blowing so pathetic....come one folks! A hairdryer is not expensive! Why can't you invest in a decent one for your guests who are paying so much? I was totally horrified and disappointed with my stay. I am a Voyager member, a loyal guest of the Langham brand and I feel like I am being treated like crap! Even with a suite upgrade, that place was like a pig sty! The bed was small and hard as stone! What puts me off even more is the cost of the room! For that price I pay and to get such a room? No way! That's a ripoff! I dont care even if I am a member of the hotel's loyalty program...I won't go back there again. Its totally not value for money for the price I pay. I will stay at Harbour Plaza 8 Degrees for my next trip. The hotel is new and much cheaper. Although the location is not great theres free shuttle bus and taxis in Hong Kong is cheap! At least the furniture and room is clean and new and not eerie....at least I see value in the money spent instead of feeling like a sucker. The last time I stayed there I was given a E club upgrade and it was fantastic. The gym rocks too! All new equipment Sorry Eaton Hotel.....you look like a cheap skate budget joint now. I'm sure other guests feel the same

Reviews.Title: “E Club”
Reviews.Author: DavidA200
Reviews.Content: well looked after in the e club, rest of hotel was fine. large room with big window and good views down the road. Convenient for the shops, Kowloon Park, Jade market and Hong Kong in general.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: happychako
Reviews.Content: Checked in on New Year's Eve with my family of six. The 2 suites given to us was not the same as I was told by Hotel Reservation Staff when i called them, because i was told to refer to hotel website to view the suites i was booking for. Instead of newly renovated suites with flatscreen tv, we were given 2 suites (624 & 625) which was not newly renovated, with box type TVs and worn out furnishings. E-Club staff especially Magdeline and Reception Supervisor Else tried their very best to solve our problem. As the hotel was running full, we were offered 2 Execustive Rooms with extra beds (912 amd 1012). These Executive Rooms are newly renovated and were great. My daughter left behind her iPod in her room after we checked out. Called the hotel to inform them about it when we were at the airport and was told that they had found it and it was left with the Lost and Found Department. We also received an email from Assisstant Manager, Mr Andrew Lee, confirming the lost iPod. Was really impressed by the staff's service and efficiency. Great hotel with great staff and centrally located. Also must try the Beef Burger from the T-Cafe at Level L, one of the best Beef Burgers we ever ate. Will definitely return with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Way to expensive and low cleanliness. You can suddenly do better in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: sunem70
Reviews.Content: The deluxe rooms are not very deluxe at the cleanliness is not very good. We found several cut off nails on the floor and it was dusty. The rooms were also very small compared to other Hong Kong hotels. Breakfast is quite ok but also in the expensive end of the scale. Tip: go to Starbucks and get your breakfast there. Pool on the roof was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Single Travellers Beware”
Reviews.Author: ujusmile
Reviews.Content: Felt discriminated for being single traveler. Check in clerk said I was upgraded from Superior to Deluxe, but I think they were speaking of floors, not size. Stuck me in the smallest room in the corner with single bed & night stand (that's all the space there was next to the window; although bathroom was ok. Walked around the block to think about canceling this shoebox room (200 sq), but they informed me this room was prepaid, so I'm stuck. You see, I read online there were newer rooms that were larger, but they didn't offer that. Ask for a room upgrade, but they said the only rooms left were suites. Upgraded to the suite. However, when I passed the hallway and peeked in the doors of other rooms that were being cleaned, the room was definitely wider, at least, not cramped like mine. The cost for single or double room is the same, so if you are a single traveler and don't want to be stuck in a shoebox like I was, lie and say 2 people are traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for break in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: PurpleHazeUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton for a few nights during a stopover in Hong Kong whilst on honeymoon. Our general impression of the hotel was good. Our room was small but stylish, clean and comfortable. Check in was a bit chaotic as there was no queueing system however i believe they were doing some building works and this was just a temporary area. The breakfast buffet was nice with plenty of choice. The hotel is in a great location for exploring Hong Kong by foot. It is very close to the Temple Street Night Market and the hotel even offers a free tour if you are new to the area. My only criticism of this hotel is the service. We decided to eat in the hotel bar one evening and after being shown to a table by a friendly helpful waiter from the restaurant, we were completely ignored. My husband tried to order at the bar but after waiting some time was told someone would come over to us. However they didn't. Eventually, someone came over and took our drinks order. After quite a delay, my husband's beer came followed by our food but my apple juice was no where to be seen. We could see staff being very attentive to other guests and serving them several drinks before we noticed someone walking to the bar with some apples. By now I had been waiting maybe 30 minutes. I went to the bar to ask if my drink was on it's way and was given no apology, just told that it was coming and took time as it was fresh. Eventually my drink came after I had finished my food and still no apology. When we came to pay the bill, we said we were not happy with the service and wanted the service charge taken off the bill which they did but still no apology. It was not until we were in reception that the manager came and apologised. We experienced similar service the following morning at breakfast when everyone else was served coffee except us. It was a shame we experienced this bad service as it meant we are unlikely to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WirralLiverpool_UK
Reviews.Content: Rooms very modern although on the smallish side and I booked an executive room so god knows what a standard size room was like, the hotel charges for use of Internet in the room which is ridiculous this should be a free amenity although they have free use in the lobby. Nice Pool on the roof but if you want to sunbathe do it early morning as you wont get sun in afternoon, the restaurant was good for breakfast and evening meals good quality and very reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Value For Money!”
Reviews.Author: Kellyansapansa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic value for money. It's in a great location, within walking distance of a number of attractions, with the Jordan MTR station right nearby. The hotel rooms are small, but this is understandable considering how expensive Hong Kong real estate is. The bed was very firm but extremely comfortable and the pillows were very good - my husband and I both slept very well throughout our ten nights in this hotel. As a honeymooning couple, we were upgraded on arrival from a standard room to a deluxe room. We also received a complimentary bottle of champagne on our first night there, which was lovely. The service at this hotel was excellent. The rooms were very clean and serviced daily. The laundry service was also very good, with same day return even when we did not choose the express option. The included buffet breakfast was excellent, with a broad range of local and western foods to choose from, plus an egg station and fresh pancakes and waffles cooked to order. The room service menu is limited, but the food is very good and served very quickly. The concierge desk was extremely helpful with directions, suggestions and even posting parcels home for us. Although there was a charge for the in-room internet service, the speeds were good and the daily rate was reasonable. We would definitely stay in this hotel again - it was very good value for money for a mid-range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “...after a year and 75 nights”
Reviews.Author: tablank
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Eaton some 75 nights since December 2009 and I haven't regretted it. The time during the Lobby renovation was a bit painful due to the closure of the Restaurant, but the new design, new menu and the continued good service of the staff make up for the wait. I am looking forward to 2011. Thanks to all staff at Eaton that made life easier and the frequent stays pleasant ones.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location to see the whole city with good transport.”
Reviews.Author: Pommy4
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff very helpful. Rooms a little on the small side but fine for a short stay. Beds were clean and comfortable and breakfast was very good. Gym and pool on the roof were a bonus although water temp in pool could be lower! Us travellers from the north are not use to swimming in water temp over about 27 degrees - so 35 degrees was more like a bath!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beaware of room you book”
Reviews.Author: kevinbrooks7
Reviews.Content: We booked a City Club room and it was grubby. We were then shown a number of other rooms. It was apparent that some floors have had a makeover and the rooms are contemporary while some rooms seem to be from the 1980's. These rooms are tired and the carpets are grubby and worn. After 5 rooms we were given an executive room which was modern and of good standard. It was worth having access to the E room as you get breakfast (as good as the dining room) and from 5pm access to all drinks and food. Good value. Staff are helpful. If you don't like the room complain as they try their best to please.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Smart”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia P
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights. I must say its not that smart as i thought, there was a facility called the E-Club access where they had free snacks and internet. there was no free internet access for rooms. i was in a 10th floor and had to come down to 1st floor to access internet. and most of the time its crowded. i still found the place to be cramped up and not comfortable. just like the rooms are too small, not good for long stay whether its business or leisure. finding the way around is easy however not the best location.

Reviews.Title: “As near to perfection.............”
Reviews.Author: CCTVMAN
Reviews.Content: The EATON SMART turned out to be one of the very best hotels we have had the priviledge of staying at. The room was most comfortable,(.Like a previous reviewer,would love to take the pillows). and the shower/toilet both clean & efficient.Pay the extra for an Executive room.It is well worth it. The buffet breakfast is very good and plentiful. Try the in house evening meal/s.The wine quality is superb.The staff are exceptionally pleasant and helpfull.Nothing is too much trouble for them.Booking in and out was so easy.Location could not be better to access Nathan Rd.and all markets.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, helpful staff, great room, good location”
Reviews.Author: princessamulatta
Reviews.Content: As a female traveling alone on my first trip to hong kong i was a little anxious. On arrival i had the fastest check in, i booked a city suite room and it was lovely. This hotel was such good value and i had booked direct so even got access to e club for breakfast and free wifi. Consierge were delightful and very helpful. I loved my room, the view (ceiling high windows wall to wall), the most comfortable bed, ipod hub, spotless bathrrom! very clean, very nice. for the price i didnt expect extras but i always had bottles of water everyday and fruit in my room, magazines, maps... location was great, walking distance to the night markets, close to the ocean plaza where you can catch star ferry and see symphony of lights, shopping and food etc easy traffic for taxis which are cheap and i just walked to catch the super clean underground. I hope to return to HK as i loved it so much, and when i come back i will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great staff. Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveller255097
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. We had a suite so our children could sleep on the fold out bed and we were in the main bedroom. The hotel is right near the night markets which are lots of fun. We had access to the e club which was well worth it. We could access free wifi all day there and get a drink and snack whenever we wanted. Very handy with young children. Roof top pool was good as was the gym area. The only down side for us was needing to catch a train to get down to the harbor. In saying that it was only a couple of stops, it was sometimes an effort later in the day with the kids as they get tired. Regardless of this I would stay here again. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, friendly staff, excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: rosrigby
Reviews.Content: Great location in authentic Chinese neighbourhood close to the lovely Jade Markets. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: vancouver_shopaholic
Reviews.Content: Hotel was within walking distance of MTR (~10-15 min) and steps away from the night market. Free internet available in the hotel lobby but it can get busy, even though there's a "15 minute time limit". It's not strictly enforced. Rooms were small and cozy with a weird shade over the glass that separates the shower and bedroom. Sufficient t.v. channel choices. Staff were friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - get an "e-club" room if you can.”
Reviews.Author: TheBabbler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package holiday so were given it by the travel agent. It didnt disappoint. We were there for 3 nights on honeymoon... The rooms were clean. The breakfast was excellent - with eggs/pancakes/omelletes cooked fresh in front of you (if you have the buffet breakfast included that is). We also had "e-club" as part of the room package. This meant access to a room on the first floor with free non alcoholic drinks (and alcoholic between 5 and 7pm), as well as free wifi and computers with internet access/printers. Great for relaxing! Can sample the evening meals too in this room. The lobby was stylish and the lifts had a view of the main street (nathan road). Location was good - about 5 mins wak from the night markets and 10 minutes from the electrical shopping streets. We had to leave early on the last day so we asked for a take-away breakfast and were provided with a breakfast box. All in all a great hotel :) To get there from the airport cost $250 hkd which worked out around £21. Not too bad. Bus however is $80 each.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Vanessawick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite which was a good size and terrifically appointed for a family of four (two youngish children). The room was spotless and the service very good. The children enjoyed the rooftop pool and other amenities. The highlight, though, was the E-Club. A veritable oasis with food, drink, nice lounges for just hanging out and internet access. The food was terrific with full breakfasts and a range of cooked food and finger food of an afternoon. Also, of an afternoon, was happy hour with beer, wine, spirits and cocktails. A lovely way to prepare for a Hong Kong night. Adding to this was the service in the E-Club which was super - attentive, friendly, professional. A real treat. We will stay at the Eaton again and would recommend it to anyone particularly as an option for those with a young family.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: tourch
Reviews.Content: staff are exceptional, friendly and knowledgeable. rooms and general area are spotlessly clean, there are several restaurants and cafes of differing types of food and price range, including a stunning Chinese restaurant. wifi available in lobby. Tai chi lessons are great, and really add to our stay. Loved the swimming pool on the roof. Beds comfortable, and all the usual requirements for a HK hotel room are there, including a kettle for tea and coffee. We'll be back. Location perfect for shopp[ing and exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DaveHampshire
Reviews.Content: recently refurbed this is a nice comfy place to stay. Surprisingly quiet being just off Nathan Road. Nicely decorated, nice bar and restaurant - very good breakfast, which was included in our rate. Lovely helpful staff. Rooms on the small side - we had a deluxe- but well designed and very good use made of the limited space. Comfy bed and pillows. About 20 mins to Victoria Harbour, but really handy for Temple Street and Ladies / Mong Kok markets. Tube close by. All in all would definitely recommend the Eaton.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wisesarah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week as my husband was doing a course here. I found it a great base for exploring Kowloon and the New Territories. Many places were in walking distance and the metro was close by for trips to Hong Kong Island and Lantau Island. The hotel was very busy with a real mix of business visitors and some tourists. Space everywhere in HK is at a premium and I thought the rooms were very little. We actually struggled to get our suitcases into the room and the bed took up nearly all of the space. However it was clean and was fine if you weren't spending too long in it. The food was expensive at the hotel and we didn't even have breakfast there. There is a nice cafe on the ground floor which was handy for checking email and having a cake. I probably wouldn't come back here but it served a purpose,

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: agupta_123
Reviews.Content: Neat & clean, courteous staff and nice location.Overall value for money hotel, I was their for a business meeting and stayed for 2 nights, the stay was very comfortable, the rooms were clean and cozy, the sleep quality was good as external noise was not present. would recommend this hotel to others also

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Nathan Rd”
Reviews.Author: travellingjenks
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe club twin which was a good size. It also had a good desk and chair as well as a sofa. Some reviews I had read on this hotel complained of very small rooms with limited wardrobe space. I was travelling with my sister in law and we shared the room, spent 6 nights in Hong Kong before going to China for a further 5 nights the double wardrobe with shelf gave us ample space as well as extra drawers (and neither of us travel light!!). The bathroom was also a reasonable size and contained a bath, separate shower as well as the usual toilet and basin and extra drawers. Would recommend the club lounge for the breakfast and afternoon canapes and drinks. The E Club staff in particular were excellent, giving both great service and invaluable tips and pointers of the area. The hotel does recycle and asks you to put anything for recycling next to the bin - could I suggest to the hotel that it may be easier to put a green recycling bin in each room - tidier for the guest and easier for housekeeping to empty as well as acting as a reminder. The roof top pool although small was great as was the gym (pity I didn't have my trainers with me!) Will use this hotel again if in Hong Kong. (The hotel was undergoing a refurbishment of the fourth floor during our stay but we were not affected by this at all).

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality, comfortable hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: AussieDave25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on the way to Australia. Room was very clean, well air conditioned, comfortable though marginally small. The hotel is renovating but this did not affect the stay. Very close to Temple Street Night Market, Jordan train station and the Ladies Market. The street food stalls in the markets were great with loads of flavour and bargain prices. Avoid Sunshine City Camera Shop on Nathan Road at all costs as they use deceitful tactics and actually cheat you after you have agreed the sale.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: PJswan
Reviews.Content: The Eaton is an excellent choice of hotel while staying in Hong Kong for a variety of reasons. Firstly, the location up Nathan Road is good and central to Mongkok and Jordan MRT station. Secondly and most importantly for us, was the convenience of upgrading to a Club Room which gives you access to the excellent E Club on the 1st floor. Here you have free internet access, continental breakfast (more than adequate) and best of all free drinks and snacks from 5:30 to 7:30 each night. Being able to go somewhere to relax and have a drink at the end of a day's sight seeing was great. The staff are fabulous and very accommodating. I had emailed ahead to see if I could get some gluten free bread for breakfast and they had it there each morning for me. Thirdly, the Eaton is value for money even paying that bit extra to stay in a Club Room. The rooms are bigger than the standard ones which is a welcome benefit. Check out was at 12 noon which is better than the usual 10am. Currently there are renovations going on but besides a cramped check in counter, it isn't a problem. Being on the 17th floor, we certainly didn't hear any noise from the machinery. We had a cup of tea at the downstairs Main St cafe on the last day and this too looked really good for breakfast and meals. I had my doubts when I read about the renovations being done at the hotel but am glad I stayed. They should be finished this month but maybe next month by the look of what's still got to be built.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LakeGardaBride
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, we were bed & breakfast – food was delicious. Such a big variety and was always fresh. Rooms were clean and well looked after. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a stopover in Hong Kong for the location, food and quality of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Close to a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: RLBSpain
Reviews.Content: Eaton hotel is not what you expect. Believe me. We have to change 3 times our room because the wc was not working properly. At the end we had to settle for an inferior room because the hotel staff were unable to solve our problems with the rooms, instead of trying to find solutions they were always lying. The location of the hotel is not bad... if you are interested in the more chinese part of HK. But the noise and smell is almost too strong. If I were to come back, I would try to find a hotel in HK Island instead of Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: 101holidaylover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 5 nights in rooms 1729 & 1730. As a family travelling we where very happy to get inter-connecting rooms as it doesn't happen very often when first checking in. Location is also great. The foyer/check-in was still being renovated but this didn't affect us in any way. The staff very efficient on check-in & check-out, very polite & helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Even happy to help with how to get to places the best & quickest way. The rooms are small but very clean and well maintained. House-keeping did a great job daily. Mini bar fridge very little and I think they shouldn't stock it with items - just keep it empty for visitors to use themselves. Breakfast was great and plenty to choose from, service was great and staff very polite & friendly. I would return to this hotel and would like to recommend the staff on how helpful they are, on their politeness and also how well they spoke and understood English. Well done Eaton Hotel and thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and efficient in a good location - great value”
Reviews.Author: dan19460
Reviews.Content: My wife and I know Hong Kong very well, having lived there for a while many years ago, and we have been back many times since. Usually we stay on HK Island, but as Kowloon was less familiar to us, we thought we’d have a change and use the Eaton. We enjoyed our week in the Eaton. I agree that our deluxe room was smaller than I would have wished, but actually quite functional once you got used to it. Good bed, fairly quiet in the corridors and, on the 15th floor, no hint of traffic noise. Apparently no wifi in the room, but you could I believe cable-connect your laptop (at a bit of a steep rate it would seem) in the room. However the basement internet area offered free computer internet access. Also free use of room safe. Room was cleaned thoroughly and very efficiently. The hotel is in a good location, fairly close to Jordan MTR. OK, it is annoying having touts approach you about suits or watches every time you head for the MTR, but that is a fact of life anywhere on Nathan Road, and probably only on Nathan Road and nowhere else in HK. The Eaton is close to Temple Street night market, the Jade Market, and Ladies Market (by MTR) in Mong Kok. The main problem at the moment is with the lobby being rebuilt, temporary arrangements for reception/lounge are in place - so initial appearance will undoubtedly be better soon! Not sure if it is directly as a result, but the breakfast dining area, café , bar and internet café can be a bit cramped just now at peak breakfast time around 9.30 am. Under the circumstances the staff do exceptionally well, and it is amazingly slick the way tables are reset after breakfast and the area reverts to a Japanese Restaurant and bar in the evening. The breakfasts on offer should cater for all tastes and are as good as any. By the way, I would also recommend the Japanese restaurant (Wagura?) in the hotel. Not the cheapest, but really excellent food. I am not a fan of “roof top pools” in general. The Eaton’s is nothing special – I wouldn’t bother. If you really want to sun- bathe in Hong Kong, get yourself over to Cheung Sha Beach in Lantau, or even South Bay on HK Island! Concierge staff and waiters were brilliant, very helpful. All in all, this is a good quality hotel. Of course there are classier hotels in Hong Kong, which has some of the world’s finest, but not at the Eaton prices! If you want a similar hotel on the Island, there is the City Garden. It too is perfectly OK and good value, but in my view The Eaton is in a better location and is perhaps better set up for Western tourists. If you are not that familiar with Hong Kong and are looking for ideas of what you you can do beyond the standard Star Ferry/ Peak/ Aberdeen/ Stanley Market trips (great though they are), and you are prepared to be a wee bit adventurous and do a bit of exploring, I would recommend the following: On Kowloon side: - visit the Chi Lin Nunnery (free) near Diamond Hill MTR station. Oasis of peace amongst the high rise blocks! - stroll along Bird Street, (not far from Prince Edward MTR) and see the locals walk their caged birds by the hundred. Next to the beautiful displays in the nearby flower market. On the Outlying Islands : - visit the stilt village of Tai O on Lantau (ferry from Central to Mui Wo then bus). Take the launch out in the bay to see the pink porpoises. On the way back stop for a beach walk at Cheung Sha. - take the cable car up the mountain to Po Lin Monastery on Lantau (start from Tung Chung on the MTR) - do the Lamma Walk from Yung Shue Wan to So Kwu Wan. (ferry from Central) The walk is a bit hilly in places and takes a couple of hours. But worth it for the views and the wonderful seafood at So Kwu Wan before getting the ferry back from there. Enjoy Hong Kong – it can be a magical spot - and the Eaton’s a good hotel from which to explore and provides really good value.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis”
Reviews.Author: Kinswick2
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Eaton Hotel. The suites, though small, are spotless and comfortable. The staff are friendly and the food very good, do have the breakfast and try to catch Happy Hour in the downstairs bar!

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: E.S.F
Reviews.Content: Arrived here on 14th Sept for 3 nights, the hotel is currently building a new lobby and doing other works. Check in took some time and the staff are currently working from a make shift reception. The lifts are very slow and when we arrived at our room on the 14th floor we were very dissapointed as we had been upgraded from a standard room to a delux room. The room was clean but very ordinary not delux, at all, it was very small and very noisy from the traffic outside on Nathan road (no double glazing). No chance of sleeping without earplugs! The breakfasts were very good but compared to other 4* hotels we have stayed in this one does not compare.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SamT5
Reviews.Content: Having read such positive reviews of the Eaton I chose to stay there for 9 nights; apart from the room decor being quite old and dated it was everything I had anticipated and I enjoyed my stay there. We arrived at the hotel on Sunday morning at 10am, but the gentleman on the reception desk was extremely gracious and accommodating and checked us into our room early, at no extra cost! We stayed on the sixth floor and didn't hear any traffic noise; however the room was directly opposite the elevators so the "ping" of the bell as the lifts arrived, coupled with the loud chatter of high pitched women/ excited children each morning meant we also got woken up as early as they did. My only complaint about the hotel is that it seemed as if only one or two lifts were operational during the day, despite there being 4 available; by mid-morning it looked as if only one lift was in use, and by the time it arrived on the 6th floor it was always rammed full. We ended up walking down the stairs and past all the renovation work, which was fine because it was clear at the time of booking that this was taking place. Overall a good place to stay with really nice, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: janlaw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for shopping, but that's about all it has going for it. The deluxe room we stayed in was very small. There was barely enough room to walk around the end of the bed. The staff at the front desk were not very professional when I expressed my complaints about the room's shortcomings. Most of the restaurants were not open during my visit and there were long waits for the lifts because only two of the four were working on a couple of days. Staff on the front desk did not appear to understand the hotel's systems. On the positive side, the breakfast was excellent and the staff there were friendly and efficient. I was very disappointed with my stay at the Eaton and many other guests expressed similar shortcomings during brief conversations with them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irvine33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton for a week starting on the 20th of August. Arrived at the hotel at about midnight after long flight was made to feel most welcome and check in was very good. The staff there are most helpful and nothing seems to be too much trouble for them. The hotel was undergoing some renovations when we arrived and all but 2 of their restruants were closed also reception had been re located to ground floor. The location of the hotel is good as it is only abourt 2 minutes walk to the Temple St Markets which are well worth a visit. Just across the road is a 711 and next to it is a restaurant called Tsui Wah which is worth visiting the meals are good and cheap. Try their set menus they are good especially the mixed grill it includes soup main meal and a tea or coffee for about $75HK ($10aust) can be a little chaotic but is good value. Rooms at the Hotel are a bit on the small size compared to other places we have visited and the breakfast menu is the same each day but well prepared. All in all good value for money good location and good staff. Tip Beware the tailors and hawkers trying to get you to come into their stores they can be a little aggressive at times if not interested just keep walking and say no thankyou. Light and Sound show each night on the harbour a little disappointing when compared with photos in the travel brouchers but worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Clean Rooms & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Yiie
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are a bit tiny. However, they are clean, modern and better equipped with facilities and amenities than other hotels with larger rooms. The rooms were Japanese-inspired and I liked the small details that utilised the available space. The concierge was helpful, although they spoke limited English. The location was great as it was quite close to the MTR. The busy streets of Mong Kok was just a stroll away. A cab ride back from Lan Kwai Fong after a big night out was only about $10 US. For the price, the Eaton Hotel definitely exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Always my choice so far no matter what”
Reviews.Author: g0lf_vacati0ns
Reviews.Content: I travel to Hong Kong once a month and when I do, I put up at the Eaton. I have stayed so many times there and I think its fitting I finally dropped a review. Everything has always been perfect expect for one occasion where the messed up my loyalty program during check-in. I was pretty pissed but everything was rectified within the next day. I got a call and note to have the problem resolved. This shows that they actually have service standards. Not bad. The rooms are usually clean, except for once I do not know why the bathroom was so smelly. I actually put up with it since it was only for 1 night, LOL. The bathroom smelled of crap. I think the crap from upstairs came down or something. If I had stayed longer I'm sure I would request for a change but it was only for 1 night and I decided to 'live with it'. Everything else was great. To be honest I never tried the breakfast there. I usually get free breakfasts with my room rather but I always wake up late! I tried the buffet lunch and it was awesome.
