One thing good is the always change their room service menu once in a while. Its great...I always go back to see a different variety on the menu. I love the fitness center! Its 24hours! I usually work out alone in the gym at 1am and its just me! The hotel is undergoing renovations now and its a bit inconvenient. At the mean time I may choose to stay at the Langham instead until the renovations are completed. Eaton would still be my choice in the long run

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: VivienLee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at their city club room for 3 nights in the end of August 2010. The lobby is under renovation but we didn't hear any noises at all maybe because we stayed at the 18th floor.The first day when we arrived, I have a very good impression for their services. The front desk lady who named Anthea who is so helpful to view the city club room one by one patiently with me. At first, they gave a lower floor, then a room faced highway. I'm a kind of selective but she still accompany with a warm smile until the room meet my requirement. Thanks a lot to her! The hotel is located conveniently in the heart of Kowloon. By walking for only a 5 minutes, you can reach Jordan MTR that takes you everywhere in Hong Kong. Walk for 5 min, you can reach Temple street. There is a free shuttle bus K1 from Kowloon station that drop you right in front of the hotel with only 30 minutes journey. The bus will pick you up in front of the hotel in every 12 minutes. It takes about 10 minutes to go back Kowloon station which I think is an added advantage. It means you only paid for HK140 for the airport express for 2 persons in a single trip compare to the taxi fare that cost HK280. It was a warm season in August. The hotel is so considerate to provide free cold water at their main entrance in the freezer that you can have a cold water anytime you like. They can also provide extra services especially anyone who has late flight. You can visit their gym or swimming pool at 22nd floor after checking out and take a bath before leaving. Most of the hotel staff are very polite and helpful if compare to other hotel in Hong Kong. Strongly suggest this hotel to everyone and will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Surreyfamily89
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable rooms, typical for the city. Good location in Kowloon, but if you are only staying for 1 or 2 days, you might be better off staying on Hong Kong island and visiting Kowloon on a day trip. Excellent swimming pool on the roof, which is a bonus after a hot and sticky day out, and also an excellent place to pass time after check out if you have a late flight, especially with children. The flyover is very close to the hotel, but - seriously folks - the windows are double glazed and how much time will you be looking out of them?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: BanoraPointBazza
Reviews.Content: Initially booked a City Club Room, found it too small, moved to a Club Room. No free internet in the room that the booking sites imply. Free internet in the Club, your computer or theirs. Found the staff very helpful and pleasant, no problems with check-in. Hotel in a great location, one block from the Temple market. Great shopping everywhere. Easy to get around Hong Kong, purchase a Octopus Card, use it to travel on Buses/Trains/Trams/Ferry and buy things in certain shops just top it up at Jordon Station. Airport amazing, catch the Airport Express train to Kowloon Station and cab to the Eaton, reverse when leaving. Make sure you see the Pandas at Ocean Park and have a meal at Bubba Gumps at the Peak. All in all an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair User”
Reviews.Author: rugbytommo
Reviews.Content: For wheelchair - good once we were upgraded. Bathroom - not accessible. Size of room - excellent ( the upgrade ) Breakfast - excellent. Facilities - very good. Location - handy to city and sights. Overall impression - very good for our requirements

Reviews.Title: “Overall ok experience, lobby was under maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Gerald88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton for 3 nights while visiting my friends in HK, and I stayed at the city club room, paid around 160 SGD per night, which was a pretty good deal. Pros: The room was fairly large and clean, toilet was very nice and toilet utilities were changed every day. Staff were friendly. Free water. Good location for the night market as well as shopping. Cons: Lobby under maintenance, the makeshift lobby was not up to standard. There was a cupboard in the room that was totally run-down, the interior was a hollow space that did not have any surfaces to place clothes or any stuff and the walls were concrete inside the cupboard.

Reviews.Title: “small”
Reviews.Author: melpas80
Reviews.Content: The eaton hotel is located in a really central part of Kowloon. we arrived in the midst of a typhoon so everything was wet and rainy. The hotel itself is very nice and well presented and clean. when we checked in i was extremely disappointed to be upgraded to a deluxe from a superior room and found we could barely fit our suitcases in the room. i could literally step from my bed into the bathroom. if this was the upgrade i would hate to see the superior (which im assuming is the one below). I know i must not be so critical assuming space is a rare commodity for this part of town but i think for the price i was paying and considering where i was staying i thought it would be bigger. anyway the service was moderately ok. not so helpful to relatively helpful. the room was regularly cleaned and the bed was comfortable as well as the view magnificent. the breakfast was yummy with a good selection to pick from. the concierge was downstairs was also helpful. this place also has basic gym facilities which is passable for the average exercise junkie. would i stay here again? only if i had a bigger room!

Reviews.Title: “good location, very good value”
Reviews.Author: tuckpendleton
Reviews.Content: right on nathan road, beside metro stops.. lovely roof top swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 1Angie
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable two night stay as a stopover; our room was upgraded to a reasonably sized room. Very clean, well furnished and located in shopping district. Nice restaurant (standard pricing) and the pool was lovely at night. We felt safe and comfortable. Located close to MTR and markets. Would stay there again and recommend particularly to couples and for stopovers.

Reviews.Title: “A delight to stay at refurbished Eaton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcusLiSGP
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently renovated, in fact the reception was still under renovation so we had to put up with a temporary check-in counter which had no air-con. Great location - the hotel is 5 minutes walk to temple street night market and 10 minutes walk to Jordan MTR station, and did I mention there were shopping centres along the way? Great food - lots of eateries within walking distance and reasonably priced too. Back to the hotel, the rooms were decently-sized by Hong Kong standards, well- appointed with the usual amneties and new LCD TV + Ipod docking station (not a Bose, unfortunately). The gym is pretty well-equiped and there's a small open air swimming pool (rooftop). Mainstreet cafe at the basement serves good coffee and croissants, with free internet stations. There's also a Japanese and Chinese restaurants within the hotel. All in all, good hotel to consider if you intend to stay along Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “One of my Favorites in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: arthursiew
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in numerous hotels in Hong Kong such as the Langham Place, Nathan Hotel, Excelsior, Harbor Plaza Metropolis, Cityview, Butterfly on Prat, and many more. The Eaton Hotel was one of the first ones I stayed in after a period of time I did not go to Hong Kong. We booked a Club Room during that stay and just loved it. The E-Club was fantastic and the rooms felt pretty spacious for Hong Kong and had enough space for a larger family. That experience was not forgotten as it was just incredible. Three years and many different hotels later, we finally decided to return to the Eaton but decided to enhance our stay by booking the Suite. When we first arrived, I expected to have the same private check in/out at the E-Club or somewhere else but to my disappointment, it was gone. There was no more private check in/out and the lobby was in renovation, so we had to line up for a long twenty minutes to check in at a very cramped temporary lobby. However, the service still felt the same as before. Check in was done fairly quickly and we were off to our rooms before check in time. The room was pretty large, but felt a little squishy because of the layout. The suite was a little bit over 400sq ft which is pretty small for a suite, but large for a room in Hong Kong. There was a queen sized bed, which looked smaller than a queen, and a sofa bed in the living room. The sofa bed felt pretty hard, but I slept very well that night. The room looked a little dated, but it was very clean and bright, unlike the Nathan rooms at the Nathan Hotel. The bathroom was clean, but I disliked the sliding doors. The view from the living room was great as I liked looking over Nathan Road at night. Overall, I was pretty happy with the room. After settling down in our rooms, we decided to head back to one of our favorite clubs, the E-Club. This time, the E-Club felt more private as there was a glass sliding door that can only be opened by inserting your room key. Not all rooms have access to the E-Club, but I heard it can be added on separately. They still had the drinks in the refrigerator, the snacks and food on the counter and all the service we loved during our previous stay. However, one thing that changed was the service. The service was very personalized and excellent. They would always come to check on us if we wanted our plates cleaned or if we needed to print something from their computers. They had free wifi in the club and computers that you can also use if you didn't bring one. One thing that wasn't present during our previous stay was the iMac. I enjoyed the evening cocktails which consisted of foods from restaurants in the hotel. I missed the breakfast though, so I can't comment on that. Overall, I thought that the E-Club felt the same as before if not, better. I have no comment on the swimming pool and fitness room, but I know that the pool is pretty small but located on the rooftop. The service was a little all over the place during this stay. The E-Club was fantastic, but the Front Desk staff was a little mixed. During check-in, I thought that she was nice and very courteous. However, the one who checked us out was not very pleasant. She said we couldn't stay at the E-Club until our flight which was pretty late at night even though I made a deal with one of the Reservation staff. She also deactivated our key at 12:00pm when we requested to have a late check-out at 1:00pm. After a pretty short talk-over with her, she gave us the access to the E-Club but she looked pretty unhappy with that. I would have given the service a three out of five, but the E-Club staff made up for it. I hope that the service would be better once the new lobby opens. The housekeeping staff was pretty fast too when we called for pillows. Overall, my stay at the Eaton was fantastic. It was almost like my previous stay and I hope that things will be a little better once the new lobby opens.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are very small”
Reviews.Author: dollar1055
Reviews.Content: staff friendly. rooms very small, some rooms are overlooked so you have to have the blinds down and put the lights on in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Would be great...except...the fire escape was blocked”
Reviews.Author: JonasCh
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Hotels.com and got a pretty good deal, we wanted 2 rooms since we have 3 children and needed the space, booked a e-club suite, which was included breakfast and free access to the club. The choice to stay at Eaton came because of we wanted a good hotel with pool and a good deal. First when we came they were renovating the reception area at floor 4, we knew this so it came as no surprise but it was a little bit noisy during the days, the first room was dated it gave us a feeling of old and very used, the second room was really nice, a corner room with a great panorama view over the city, the only thing is that when entering the room we could smell mould everytime. Overall the breakfast was ok and the staff friendly, it was the last day our daughter called us up to the room and said the firealarm had gone off in the clubroom and there was coming smoke and she had to get out, we didn´t hear any alarm on our floor (18:th) we grabbed our closest things and went down the fire escape, but when coming to the 3:d floor it was blocked with tools and machines, so we had to get up again 2 floors to take the elevator down...???? We later found out that the firemen had checked and there was no fire??? But if it would have been all people using that fire escape would have been trapped...We talked to the manager and of course he apologized, I demanded they went through all fire escapes and made sure they were free...but I would not stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is under construction”
Reviews.Author: Vtro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is currently under renovation, they do mention this on the hotels booking site, but it understates the extent of renovation that the hotel is going under. The rooms are small but fine and I think the hotel would be great if there was no renovation happening. Currently there is no breakfast venue, dinner is by your own choice at one of the restaurants on the ground floor and there is no cozy bar or area to just sit down relax and get away from the crowds for a while other than your room. I would not advise staying at this hotel while they are under renovation, perhaps when they are finished it might be nice but currently you will not get your moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnboy060
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well positioned in Kowloon just a short stroll to Jordan MTR Station. The rooms are well appointed, clean although as is typical of Hong Kong a little on the small side. The Breakfasts were enjoyable with an excellent buffet every day. There was a little disappointment during our stay as the reception and Bar/Lounge area was being refurbished however staff were extremely polite and attentive and our whole stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, awesome city!”
Reviews.Author: moesteve
Reviews.Content: We came across this hotel after struggling to find something within our budget whilst also of a safe-clean-location friendly criteria. I'm glad to say we made the right choice by picking Eaton. Upon checking we were given free upgrade of both our rooms. One was to a club suite which was the real deal up on the 13th floor. The other looked like a deluxe double on the 10th floor. We would of had 2 club suites but they were short on rooms apparently. The location of the Eaton is very good - it's on Nathan road in Kowloon, I'd say about half way up or so. It's about 20 min walk to Star Ferry and the Jordan MTR station is about 2 mins away. Both rooms were incredibly clean and I can't fault the house keeping staff at all. No traffic noise whatsoever in either rooms. There is a rooftop swimming pool which is open till around 10-11pm (there is a conflict of info on their website, in the elevator and on the notice board up there). You can see a lot of Kowloon from up there; it's a sight to see. It's not the biggest pool ever but we never had a problem with it being too busy. Along with the pool they have a 24/7 gym which is actually a pretty decent sized gym for a hotel with quite a variety of machines & free weights. It is staffed during the day and then in the evenings you are on your own. (not a problem if you know what you're doing). On the lower ground there is a restaurant and a coffee shop area. Within the coffee shop there are 4 computer terminals which give 20mins free internet browsing, after your 20mins is up the machines will log you off. We found these very useful for a quick check of emails & the usual social networking sites in the morning. Just be wary they do get busy and some people will simply re-log back on after being logged off after the 20min period but the staff do try and enforce it as much as possible. You can get a basic breakfast in the coffee shop - bagel or croissant. I had a bagel most mornings, as far as bagels go, it was pretty good & light enough for breakfast. We found the staff to be very useful at the hotel. On the first night we couldn't sleep no matter how hard we tried so we went out for a few beers from the local 7-11. When we got the beer bottles back up to our room we realized we didn't have a bottle opener. Epic fail. We went down to reception and they advised us they would send us one up. Just moments after getting back in our room the guy was at the door opening our bottles.... service or what. Very impressive. (at 4am in the morning too!) By far the coolest feature of the hotel has to be the glass tube lifts where you can see Kowloon road in action, very cool. There is a 7-11 across the road from the hotel which never seems to be closed, there is also a Starbucks on the same road & a Mc Donalds across the main road. They are doing some building work on the hotel - I believe they are re-doing their reception/lobby area. Although there was a bit of noise during the day (why are you in the hotel during the day anyway?) the actual disruption was not seen whatsoever. This didn't affect our stay in the slightest. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I'd come back here with no hesitation. Hong Kong is a really lovely city and I'll be back in a couple of years. Don't hesitate to contact me if you need any help or advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic value for money!”
Reviews.Author: jaynp
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Eaton on a family holiday and would very happily stay there again. The location is brilliant....less than five minutes walk to the Jade and Temple Street night markets, and lots of interesting shops and diners very close by, including a 7-11, Starbucks and McDonalds for those who miss their Western comforts. Our one bedroom suite was tastefully decorated in modern Chinese style and the king sized bed was very comfortable. The solid wood shutters on the window were great for blocking out the lights and noise from Nathan Road, so we could get a good night's sleep. The bathroom was small but an excellent shower with good water pressure. The airconditioning worked very well....which was a relief as the weather in Hong Kong in July is very hot and humid. We found all the staff very friendly, helpful and efficient. Melanie in reception was fantastic in sorting out a booking problem with minimal fuss, and the E-Club staff, particularly Christine, Marilyn and Andrew, were great for advice on what to do each day in Hong Kong and how to get there. E-Club access is definitely worth getting...free internet in the club; all day coffee, soft drinks, biscuits and cakes; drinks and hot and cold canapes in the evening; and the E-Club complimentary 'continental' breakfast - which was more than adequate and to our surprise included a few hot items each day. Apart from breakfast, we ate at the hotel twice - a dinner in the Japanese restaurant and a dim sum lunch in the Cantonese restaurant. The meals were of a good standard, with prices reasonable for hotel restaurants (although eating outside the hotel was much cheaper). The service in the Japanese restaurant, though, was a bit erratic...probably because the current refurbishments have placed an extra burden on it as the main casual restaurant is temporarily closed. The only down side was that the current refurbishments have meant that reception is temporarily located in a cramped area on the ground floor. Check-in and check out are very slow as a result. But our E-Club access allowed us to check out much more speedily through the E-Club provided it was before 11am. All in all, a very pleasant stay and the Eaton is a great hotel for its price range!

Reviews.Title: “Just short of 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: PettRuss8
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is excellent, and guests will find many interesting shops and restaurants in the neighbourhood. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and well-designed. Service personnel are alert and helpful. The only minus is the cramped reception area that guests have to put up with, during check-in and check-out. Hopefully, this sorry situation will be remedied when the renovation work on the Four Floor Lobby is completed. The Roof-Top Swimming Pool and Gym are a most welcome feature in Kowloon's hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “service personified”
Reviews.Author: brookmac
Reviews.Content: Returned for our second visit in May, having previously stayed at the Eaton in October '07.The service was again excellent.. On this occasion, when at the Airport, just about to leave Hong Kong, my wife discovered she had left her phone back in our bedroom at the Hotel. On calling the Eaton they immediately located the phone and posted it back to her in Ireland without delay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean classy hotel, in the centre of Kowloon, relaxing rooms and a good "Getaway"after a long day of sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Kirkwinger14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days on second leg of our honeymmon. Our agent Travelbag suggested it as there are literally thousands of hotels in Kowloon and Hong Kong and were really pleased with it. Yes it is a long walk down to the boat to get to ferry over to Hong Kong island, but just get a day pass and go on the metro. This is quick, cheap and an easy way to get round. It's also a lot of fun and add's to the whole experience of staying in a big city. The hotel was clean, nice rooms, they weren't massive but we knew we were only there for 3 days and weren't going to spend much time in our room anyway. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice. Also free internet access available on the computers. My best tip is to get a 3 day pass for the 'Big Bus company'. This is the best way to see the sights. You have an audio tour guide telling you what to see and when as you get driven round the mad streets of the city on an open top bus. They offer 4 trips and we did all of them. The Green route is great as well as the Kowloon night tour. Go and see the light show down by the harbour at 8pm every night. Also go and do the Peak Tram visit and combine it with a trip to madame Toursords. My second best tip would be to buy a "Lonely Planet" guide for Hong Kong. It reccomends all the best places to go to and also eat. We went to this bizzare small and un-tidy looking noodle bar but the food was excellent, cheap and added to the whole experience by eating with the locals. Eaton hotel offers everything you need for a city sight seeing trip like ours, it was a 10 minute walk to the Metro station, service was great and the Concierge's were very helpful and always had a smile on their faces......which goes a long way!

Reviews.Title: “The breakfast is the best part”
Reviews.Author: Ros1963
Reviews.Content: Service is not a key-word for this hotel; I had to complain twice about a broken door of the wardrobe, noting was done about that. I complained three times about the lousy internet-connection and they offered me another room, really an upgrade because the room was great, much bigger with a much nicer look. The difference in rooms is too big. When I asked for some extra sachets of nescafe-coffee, the lady from reception just answered "no", I even offered to pay for them. I was unpleasantly surprised. The breakfast however is one of the best I ever had in Asia, the breakfast-lounge looks great and the staff in this lounge is very friendly and efficient. It is really a long walk 'down' to the river, too far. My advice: find a hotel closer to the ferry with a better service or get an 'upgraded' room in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel: friendly, convenient, clean, quiet & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TetoNau
Reviews.Content: Friendly concierge & front desk. Arrive the hotel at noon and the front desk happily check us in and we go straight into our rooms and took a rest after a very early morning flight. The rooms are newly renovated, very welcoming, a good size for two adults & a child (under 12). The rooms has everything for business and leisure travelers. Upgraded ourselves for club facilities. Get continental breakfast every morning and evening cocktails, drinks, internet and a place to unwind after shopping. The upgrade is worth it. Very Convenient: 7-11 and a typical Hong Kong Cafe is just across the road - serve delicious typical Hong Kong meals up till late night. A delicious Cantonese Cuisine Restaurant & Starbucks is just around the corner. The MTR is just a 10 min walk. There's nothing i dislike about this hotel...just that the bed is a little too springy/soft for my liking. But will definitely go back to Eaton for my next stay and next stay and next stay...

Reviews.Title: “Always an Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelsAsia
Reviews.Content: One of my Favourite hotels!!. Staff are polite and Courteous and always willing to help. Rooms are always clean (important !! ) and housekeeping do a great job. Check in can be a little slow when hotel is busy. If you are there on business - Internet connection is strong , and laundry services are pretty much perfect. Area is also good for shopping (TST and Mong Kok, temple St market) and of course plenty of places to eat. 2 minute walk to jordan MTR. Not sure how the hotel will fair during its refurbishment - as the outdoor terrace is great for a snack, coffee or drinks, however will be looking forward to it's reopening in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: RajBajwa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel on our return trip from Canada. I had done the bookings via online website. The room was everything that we could have asked for in a space-constrained city like Hong Kong. It was very cosy, clean and neat. The location of the hotel is very central too, only 5 mins. walk from the nearest MTR station. If I were to return to Hong Kong, this hotel would definitely be on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: claireharbor
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because of it's loction right on Nathan Road. 5 Mins walk to Subway, mins walk to Night and Jade Markets. Shops and resturants right on the door step. Hotel was what you'd expect for a 4 star. Lovely rooms, clean , staff were friendly and efficent. It looked like a great place if you are travelling on business (there were lots of confrences going on while we were there ) One point- if you do stay here don't waste you money in the sushi resturant, service was alfuw and so expensive (£4 for a bottle of water)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MGABZ
Reviews.Content: Having read the great reports that this hotel received prior to the trip, I must say it certainly does live up to its reputation. Ideally situated on Nathan Road it is only a 5 minute walk to the Jordan MTR station in the north or Yau Ma Tei Station for the South. Also it is only a 20 minute walk to Salisbury Road at the promenade in Tsim Sha Tsui. The hotel offers a Shuttle Bus at 130HKD (approx £11) one way, which takes 1 to 1 1/2 Hours from Hong Kong International, however the Concierge actually recommended a Taxi which only took 30 mins and cost 230 HKD (approx £20). Most of the Concierge's which we dealt with were efficient and very knowladgeable. Hotel has ample eating establishments, with the Metro Grill serving international cusine at a very reasonable price. The Fitness Centre (Open 24 hrs) and Swimming Pool (Open 0700 to 2200) is excellent on the Rooftop and makes for a great unwind after a long day sightseeing or shopping. The Main Street Cafe on the Lower Ground Floor, also offers 20 Mins Free Internet access if you make a purchase. Rooms were generally small, however very well equipped and kept very clean. Overall, after seeing some of the other hotels on the Island, I was extremly glad we choose the Eaton and should I return to Hong Kong would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good service when sorting out a problem with the room”
Reviews.Author: InTheWorldCec
Reviews.Content: I had booked a standard queen bed room for one person, on checking in for my 3 night stay I was asked how many people were staying and I said one. I was given my room key and when I got to the room, it had one single bed. I spoke to reception who said they were full and could not move me but should be able to the next day. I questioned why I had not been given what I had booked but was just told they were full. After breakfast the next morning I spoke to Teddy on reception and very quickly he arranged to move me to a deluxe queen bed room and even came with me himself to move my stuff. Rooms were on the smaller size (as are many in Asia) but clean and had safe, kettle, good lights. Breakfast was very good plenty of choice. 3 computers in the bar which were free to use to access the internet with a limit of 20 mins per session which meant that you never had to wait long for one to become free. Nice pool on the roof and a gym. Good location at the top end of Nathan road within 5 min walk of Jordan metro station and 5 mins from Temple St night market and the Jade Market. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton for 3 nights as a stopover on our way home to Brisbane. It was extremely central to shopping and the markets. We were given a city view room which had wall to ceiling glass and views. We took the club room package which included breakfast and afternoon drinks and canapes including alcohol! Free internet. We thought the staff were very friendly and helpful. The concierge was very knowledgeable about how to get to places and how much the taxi should be etc. We would recommend the city view room, we actually looked at the club room and the suites and weren't as impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tokyo16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 3 nights. The location was fabulous and the service was wonderful. The staff were friendly and component. The room was really nicely designed and comfortable. The restaurant and bar on the 4th floor (the reception floor) are elegant and warm. The breakfast buffet is super. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Tip Top”
Reviews.Author: moi76
Reviews.Content: A good location hotel. Array of good food and Temple Street is nearby. Accessible by sub way (10 mins walk to Jordan MRT). Courteous and very informative staff. However, the sofa bed required fixing. Note that extra bed is only suitable for kids size only.

Reviews.Title: “great! best pillows! staff very friendly, no complaints from me!!”
Reviews.Author: rexPerth_australia
Reviews.Content: Well, what a great holiday we had, the location of the Eaton, is ideal, close to train, shopping, restaurants, ladies markets. Staff very friendly and accessible. and the pillows!! wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: NurseyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: A lovely boutique hotel on Nathan Rd close to everything. Wonderful friendly staff and an excellent morning breakfast. Rooms spotlessly clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Lynette27
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed 12 nights at the Eaton & were very happy with it. The room was on the small side but we expected this in Hong Kong and it was big enough for our needs & was clean. There was a small problem on arrival when we found the room we were given was one that someone previous had smoked in, but this was sorted with a mimimum of fuss and we were given another room within 5 minutes of speaking to reception about it. We arranged for breakfast to be included & there was a good range of food at the buffet each morning. On the occasions we had the buffet dinner it was very good also - the staff were attentive & pleasant. We had dinner in the atrium area several times & while there was not a large choice of meals it was adequate & the meals were good. We found the location of the hotel to be very good - was close to Nathan Road, several markets were nearby & it was only a five minute walk to Jordan train station - we used the rail system to go just about everywhere - is convenient & not expensive. We used the pool a couple of times - was good to go there at the end of a busy day. All the staff were friendly & pleasant, we would stay there again if we ever went back to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sigold
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in early April. We had a suite with club access. The club made this hotel outstanding with the breakfast, free wi fi, cocktails and appetizers. The staff was extremely attentive and we loved the central location. We were on an upper floor so we had no street noise. Compared to other hotels this one was a great value. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem in hk”
Reviews.Author: mcqe
Reviews.Content: Just got back from HK yesterday and it was a wonderfully hectic time we had there. We were able to go to a lot of places with our kids. Thanks to the nearby location of the MTR which was just a walking distance from the hotel's location. The hotel staff was great, from the time we check in til the time we leave, service was consistently commendable. All were very attentive and approachable. We had a pleasant surprise when we were given a club room without extra charges. The first night we were there, we found some apples and chocolates waiting for us in our room.This definitely made our stay in HK more memorable right from the very start! All the details in the room were very well thought of. Beds and pillows were comfy too. Starbucks, Mcdonald's and 7-11 were just nearby in case you need something quick and familiar to eat, especially when with kids. Too bad we didn't have time to try their pool on the top floor w/c had a great view. Would definitely recommend Eaton to everyone! Can't wait to be back :))

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Vansmith
Reviews.Content: The Eaton is situated right off one of Hong Kong's main shopping streets, Nathan Road, and is useful for the nearby Lite Market, It is roughly 30 minutes from the Airport. The hotel was clean and nicely furnished, the beds were comfortable, and for once we had lovely pillows on which to rest weary heads. The staff could not do enough to help and the Restaurant and bar were both reasonabley priced and had an extensive choice of food and drinks. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for a three night stop-over”
Reviews.Author: vegetariantraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in March en route to New Zealand. We were impressed with the hotel and felt it was good value for money. Breakfast in particular was excellent with plenty of choice at the help yourself buffet ranging from cold meats and cheeses through to full English with freshly cooked eggs or dim sum and noodles. Coffee/tea is served at your table and plates are cleared away quickly. Staff seemed very efficient. Nice to get free internet in the lobby. Impressive swimming pool and gym on the top floor for energetic guests. Only downside was small bedroom with very little storage space. Bathroom was also small but it contained the only bath we saw for another month! Everything very clean and sheets changed after two nights. Fresh towels every day. Window couldn't be opened which was probably just as well as we were on the 13th floor. Hong Kong was pretty humid during our stay (26oC) so it was probably a good thing the air con was on all the time but the noise was a little irritating at night. Bed very comfortable. Lighting was very dim in the room but we weren't there much. Lots to do and see in HK. Could walk easily to the Star Ferry to get over to the Island. Very very cheap. Nathan Road area very noisy, colourful and crowded. Chinese people very polite and helpful. Kowloon Park pretty and peaceful just off the busy Nathan Road. Don't bother with the Big Bus Company tour of HK Island - a real rip off. Same as in London actually so we should have realised in advance. The ride to the top of Victoria Peak was great with a beautiful circular walk around the Peak with views over the city. Lots of interesting trees and plants. Had a day trip on a ferry to Lamma Island - took about 25 minutes and cost very little. Very hot and humid that day with everywhere shrouded in mist so didn't walk as far as planned on the island but nice to sit by the sea. Felt more Chinese than HK itself. Would recommend Woodlands Vegetarian Curry House in Mody Road, off Nathan Road, and also Paramita Chinese Restaurant in Haiphong Street.

Reviews.Title: “Experienced Staff that knows how to take care of US Guests”
Reviews.Author: khauboy
Reviews.Content: I traveled to HK for the first time by myself and this was a great hotel for that experience. Situated in the heart of Kowloon, you're away from the really busy parts of HK (Central, TST, Hong Kong St.) so you can really enjoy the city at your own pace. The hotel staff was very attentive to my needs. They are responsive to all requests and make sure your stay is worthwhile. The rooms are typically small in HK, and this hotel proved to be no different. There are many amenities that come with the hotel (Happy Hour at T-bar, rooftop pool and gym, business center) but unless you take advantage of them, the value of your stay isn't maximized. Buffet is great - but pricey. The sushi restaurant on the LG floor is also stellar but pricey. But it's cause there's affordable, tasty meals sold just minutes away at Temple Street Night market. There is a 7-11, a late night food joint open till 3am, and a 24 hour McDonalds right next to the hotel. If you take time to explore, you'll find some cool things hidden around the area. Convenient location if you wanna get around fast without dealing with busy city people. Everyone in the hotel speaks English - so as a Chinese guy who doesn't speak any Canto or Mandarin, this was a user-friendly area. Taxi drivers are a bit harder to communicate with sometimes. The staff is friendly and will cater to all your individual needs. Just be sure to let them know. Chinese hotel culture tends to "leave the guest alone" for the most part so make your requests early and clear. The lighting is very modern. I was very impressed with their chic furniture and art. And there is an innovative button inside where you can set it to DO NOT DISTURB or MAKE UP ROOM so Housecleaning can do their thing at the appropriate time. Jeffrey Jin Khau

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Throstle
Reviews.Content: We had four nights at the Eaton and found it excellent. Good location near the markets and MTR underground network. The breakfast buffet was superb and included in our rate so we made the most of it. Rooms a little small but this is Hong Kong and perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, typical Hong Kong standard”
Reviews.Author: RobbieGregg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton Hotel for a friend's wedding. The location is okay but considering price good enough. Have also stayed at North Point on Hong Kong Island before - preferred Eaton Hotel location on Nathan Road. It is situated just north of Kowloon Park and near to many street markets. When we arrived we were 'upgraded' to a superior room from a standard - not too sure whether everyone is told that! The room was situated on the 13th floor overlooking Nathan Road. We could hear just about hear the traffic but it low enough to have a good night sleep. The room was small by UK standards but having stayed in HK before, I knew what to expect for the money - in order to get a larger room expect to pay significantly more! The room was nicely decorated and the bed was comfy (see pictures). It looked as though the room had been recently renovated (perhaps in the last 1 or 2 years). The room had a network connection for a computer (internet connection) however it was not free (in fact the internet price was on the steep side). There were cheaper places situated near by (best rate was $8 per hour - 80p/hour). The hotel also has a nice swimming pool which was hardly used by anyone but us! It was on the top of hotel and outdoors so there were great views. The pool was heated and was very warm - like swimming in a bath. There was also a gym which appeared to be well equipped (ergos, running machines and even a Nintendo Wii!) however we did not use the gym. We had the hotel breakfast on one of the mornings we were there. The food was very tasty and they had a good selection of foods (chinese, dim sum, English, sausages, hash browns, eggs, etc). nb. if you need to use internet, there are 3 computers situated in the hotel bar (past the hotel lobby). They are free to use but sometimes log you off if you have been on for too long. The food prices in the hotel bar did seem very expensive (£15 to £20 a dish). Street market restaurants are by far bettter value (£3 per dish), far more authentic and way more tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Room was a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hunbun81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel for the first of many locations on our honeymoon. Having arrived about 10am HK time we were a little annoyed that not only we had to wait 5 hours for our room to be ready (surely they weren't full or could have planned long haul arrivers better) we didn't have our honeymoon acknowledge in anyway and our room turned out to be disapointing as it was smaller than a travel lodge room! The bathroom was infact a tad nicer than the bedroom, the road noise from outside was a constant hum due to single glazzed window. The breakfast choice was ample, the hotel amenities were good, and the communal areas rather nice, just the room let it down for us. Location was great. If you want to avoid the Nathan Road suit sellers, which are found on every corner possible then take the underground where you can. A visit to the peak is a must and also the light display which you have to view from Kowloon harbour is also a must. Light shows started at 8pm HK time when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up for Eaton”
Reviews.Author: CookieLugue
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a HK holiday. I was fortunate enough to get the Club Room promotion at the Eaton Hotel and payed only for 2 nights and stayed for 3 days. Upon arrival we were informed that they were upgrading us to a 1-Bedroom suite which meant that the 2 kids would have their own bed in the living room. The extra space was a blessing since we planned to go shopping and we needed the space for our bags. The room was very comfortable. We also had access to the E-Club which my kids absolutely loved. Breakfast at the E-Club, although unlike the enormous hotel buffets we are used to, was wonderful. We always use our kids as our raters and when they are comfy and happy in a hotel then so are we. If they had their way, they just wanted to hang out at the hotel rather than go out. Would we stay here again, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: treddd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the clubroom for several night. Great location on the Kowloon side, hotel served its purpose (but not more), would happily consider other hotels at a similar price-range as the stay was unmemorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-range option in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Parlonny
Reviews.Content: Eaton is located on the Kowloon peninsula, opposite Hong Kong Island. A mere 3 stops away from the central part of the city on Hong Kong’s subway, the MTR and, a comfortable walk from the harbor and some of Hong Kong’s most spectacular views. Famous Temple Street night market is also just a mere few blocks away. Getting to Eaton from the airport is pretty easy and relatively quick. You have the choice of the taking the Airport Express right into the heart of Hong Kong (journey takes approximately 24 minutes), then transferring to the MTR (the red line—Tsuen Wan) to the Jordan stop. Eaton is a few blocks north of Jordan, right on the main thoroughfare, Nathan Road. Alternatively, and perhaps more suitable after a long flight, Eaton provides shared shuttle or personal luxury car service from the airport directly to the hotel. See one of the attendants under the Langham (Eaton is part of Langham hotels) signage as you exit baggage claim. Eaton’s lobby is on the 4th Fl. There’s also a restaurant with outdoor sitting and a bar on this floor as well. The rooms are on the smaller side but adequate with internet connection (extra charge), iPod/Phone dock and complementary bottled water, coffee and tea. The outdoor pool and fitness center are on the top floor. The breakfast buffet’s pretty decent, boasting Chinese, Continental, English and American options (yes, you can order pancakes if you miss those stacks but beware, don’t be disappointed if they’re not quite like what you’re used to getting at IHOP.) The cost at this writing is HK$138 (roughly $18 USD) if it’s not already included in your reservation. Tips: Eaton has partnerships with most major airline mileage clubs, so you can earn miles for your stay (500 per night with AAdvantage). Treat yourself to a drink or dinner at The Peninsula’s Felix on Salisbury road, or Sheraton’s Sky Lounge right on Nathan road, down at the harbor, and take in the picturesque views of Hong Kong island.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: CherylUK
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the Eaton. The food is delicious, we ate on the terrace, in the absence of any european restaurants nearby and we were unsure of the many chinese restaurants in the area because the menus were all in chinese. The rooms were soundproof and very comfortable, the breakfast was all you could want. The location is in the heart of Kowloon which is the chinese side of Hong Kong.It is near the night market, well worth a visit to haggle for fake bargains, and the jade market. A 15 minute walk down Nathan Road to the star ferry, via Kowloon Park, means that HK island is accessible. do not go to Gaylord Indian restaurant as recommended in the guide books, food awful. From the airport you can catch a cab for around 220Hk dollars or take the express train to Kowloon. Once there you exit to the buses and take the K1 bus to the hotel ( via other hotels) for free if you show your train ticket. We went to Stanley market on the bus from HK Island which was worth a visit, sit on the right hand side of the bus for a spectacular view of the coast on the way, a different HK with beaches and a seafront. We found the market less "haggly" than others and with more of a variety of higher quality things to buy. Watch the laser show from the clock tower at Kowloon at 8pm each night, especially on aclear night. All in all we could not be more satisfied with the Eaton in terms of service, quality, value and location. A shame it was a bit too cool to enjoy the rooftop swimming pool. Oh and the happy hour is very good value! Free internet in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Holel- Loved the E-Club”
Reviews.Author: slmat22
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the Eaton for 6 nights. When we arrived we easily booked in and were given advise on where to go in Hong Kong and were also given a good map. We went straight up to our room on the 10th Floor. We had booked a standard room although they had a special deal where we were upgraded to a Delux twin room. Unfortunatly these rooms are very disapointing when it comes to space, I have never seen a smaller hotel room, hardly any room for hanging clothes, a tiny bathroom, almost no room between the beds and a very small window. We were straight on the phone to see if we could upgrade to a larger room. We were in luck as they had a twin club room available, unfortuntly it did cost us an extra $770 HKD per night, but it was a price we were willing to pay. The new room was much bigger with a couch, heaps of floor space and a much bigger bathroom. The club room also came with entry to the E-Club which made it extra money worth it, you get breakfast (we didn't use it as we already had it included in our original room rate), free drinks and snacks all day and at 5.30-7.30 alcohol and snacks from the restaurant which was enough for our dinner most night. The Breakfast were good and we also ate in the Metro Bar, had room service and ate at the Japanesse restaurant which was nice. The location was great within a short walk to Jordan MTR and easy to get a bus or Taxi very close by. There was a few problems with our stay, the shower blocked and we had to have it fixed although this was done straight away. The other thing was that the beds were really firm and a very thick doona. And it was very noisy in the rooms at night with the traffic outside, most of the noice came straight through the window. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Eaton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nanetterae
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were on the small side, they were well planned, comfortable, and very clean. Excellent use was made of space in furnishing and decorating the rooms also. This hotel's best asset is the friendly and competent staff. I am an elderly person travelling with my husband and two (adult) children, and the staff at the Eaton went out of their way to make our stay with them a happy one. Praise must be given to Christine in E Club for her thoughtfulness, brights demeanour and total friendliness. In fact all the staff were extremely kind, thoughtful and completely professional . the geographic location of the hotel is also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel with great staff...”
Reviews.Author: kieran1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eaton with my older parents (70s) and older sister. Central Nathan Rd location with a 5 minute walk to Jordan station MTR. The rooms are small, but thats ok. We paid extra $25.00AUD for breakfast in E-club lounge. Now the daily buffet is $20.00 AUD but the E-Lounge is $25.00. for that you get a breakfast buffet that is smaller than upstairs but there is LOTS of choice, free internet, tea, coffee and soft drinks/juice/water available all day, afternoon tea bits (cake, biscuits etc) and then at 5.30pm, out comes the drinks and early evening nibbles. This was awesome value, because a drink alone in the bar near the lobby was around $5.00 AUD. Staff in the E-Club, especially one staff member , Christine, went beyond the role of duty, friendly local tips and ideas, chatty, suggestions, always identified things my older mum could access. I would stress anyone who stays here and doesnt have automatic E-Club access to pay the extra- damn worth it. Hotel VERY clean and other staff very good at Concierge and lobby check in. All staff ALWAYS wanting to be helpful. Also has a midday checkout which is great! Will definately stay her again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good by a little squeezy”
Reviews.Author: WineloverMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The Eaton has recently been renovated and the rooms reflect the face lift. The only problem I have with the room was it's size. I was saying with my wife for six nights and found the room limiting. We had a delux room which I mistakenly thought related to bigger, it doesn't. There was a half wardrobe for hanging space and basically that's it. When I travel and are staying for more than one night I like to unpack and make it is comforable as possible. As it was we had to leave our suitcases on the floor and live out of them. The room would be ideal for a single traveller for a couple of day's. The food in the restaurant was good both the breakfast and dinner. Happy hour was also execellent. Buy one and get one free. The servings were also genereous. Location is good in the heart of Nathan road. There is a small chinese restaurant across the road that served sizzing prawns for 65 HKD, excellent food and value.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT VALUE WILL RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: ping066
Reviews.Content: We had a great time very good staff helpful. The location works very well nice and handy for getting out and about not to mention the markets quite close.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal first taste of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: carolyne1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just off one of the main streets in Kowloon. It is within walking distance of the Jade Market and is close to plenty of restaurants and the food (live!) market which is an experience in itself, The hotel has a very good bar which serves lethal cocktails and has comfy seats for just chilling! The breakfast is superb as there is so much choice. The staff were friendly and willing to offer advice and directions if required. Rooms are very clean and although there may not be a wonderful view from your hotel room-after a very long flight it is not the view your are wanting! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: petporter
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 11pm with no hassels, other than not being able to have a non smoking room as requested, however if you check in late to a hotel i guess you are left with whatever rooms they have available. The room - small but big enough for two people max and probably for no more than two night stay as there wasn't alot of space...not even for luggage (two bags max) it was quite, no sound transfer between rooms or the hallway. It was clean, infact i think it may have been reburbished in recent months. the bathroom was small but clean, had shampoo, conditioner, soap etc provided along with a hair dryer. the bar downstairs is comfortable and fairly well priced for a drink, didn't bother with breakfast as we headed out into nathan road. check out was at 12noon, which was great. The staff (in all areas of the hotel not just reception) were freindly and helpful. overall this is a good choice for location, cleanliness, comfort, freindly and price for one or two night stay. wouldn't suit a family unless they have rooms with are larger. however i do think they had adjoining rooms. Taxi to the hotel from the airport was around $250 hong kong dollars.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better.”
Reviews.Author: paulitheism
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this hotel. It's mediocre all the way around. Rooms are tiny. Fitness center is crap. Business center is advertised, but does not exist -- instead, they have a couple computers with a 20 minute time limit sitting in the lobby. Pool is tiny, shallow, and full of pasty middle-aged european tourists. Location is middling at best. Wifi is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ghamaryllis
Reviews.Content: Ideal for a few nights stopover if you want to be in the heart of Kowloon next to Temple and Jade Markets. Cheap taxis $20 (about £2 ) down to the harbour and jump on a ferry about 25p to Hong Kong Island. Food and Service is excellent as are the really friendly and helpful staff. Would recommend this hotel and would definitely return if back in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: windsurfer9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights £360 including breakfast. Good location on Nathan Rd. Keen walkers would get to the harbour in approx 20 mins-worth doing to see the shops/sights. Otherwise the bus is cheap and easy. Good rooms but there are no views worth having. Breakfast and dinner were excellent and good value. Nice pool on the top of the hotel.Good service all round.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: probativev
Reviews.Content: I come to HK for personal visits about once a month and often opt for hotels in the US $150-$250 price range, on the Kowloon side. If I'm with husband we'd stay either at the Renaissance Kowloon or the Nikko. Have stayed in the Park Hotel and the Butterfly on the Prat and am not impressed. Was here by myself a few weeks ago and Eaton going rate online was US $95 per nt so decided to give it a try even though it's in Jordan. It is not my favorite HK hotel, and I will come here from now on whether by myself or with husband. The rate was so great for what you get. Last 2 times I paid $130 for the Park Hotel and $145 for the Butterfly (at corporate rate too!) and neither comes close to the amenities at the Eaton. In fact, the Eaton is the same caliber as the Renaissance, but better! The interior designer definitely put lots of thoughts into designing this place. The hallways are modern Zen, which is so nice when you're in a noisy buzzing city. The room decor is incredibly tasteful. FIrst thing I noticed was the Ipod player. Sweet! Was in the standard room and room was small but the layout was so well thought out and functional, unlike the Renaissance where rooms are also small and you're always squeezing yourself like toothpaste to get around the room. From bathroom to desk to bed to the placement of the outlets and the refrigerator, all were functional so you immediately feel relaxed upon entering the room. The bathroom was marble and porcelain so it's an upscale feel. Well placed hair dryer (in many hotels you have to scavenger hunt for it). Good quality bath towels. Leather desk chair. Big flat screen TV. No curtains--you get a wood panel instead--such as great way to save space AND keep room clean (you always wonder if hotel curtains that looked 100 years old were ever cleaned). Very nice bed linen. No icky bed cover. Very quiet. I just can't say enough about the room. The lobby was on the 2nd floor and the staff was incredibly nice. There's a restaurant with outdoor seating also on the 2nd floor by the lobby so sitting outside you're shielded from the noise and rush of the streets. They have a very nice gym and an outdoor swimming pool on the top floor. The pool was not big but the pool area was very tranquil. I went to take a look and there were people lounging and reading by the pool. I so wish I'd brought my bathing suit. The location was quite convenient. Just 3 blocks from the MTR. There's Starbucks right across the street in the Nathan Hotel. There's also a diner across the street where you can get a nice breakfast much cheaper than the hotel breakfast rate. HOWEVER, I have to give Eaton's room service two thumbs up. I came back close to midnight one night and hadn't have dinner. They offer their regular extensive menu throughout the night, not just the late nite snack menu. Plus they have great vegetarian options!!! I had the most incredible tasting veggie curry in the wee hours delivered to me. It was delicious. Yes still hotel room service rate but it's great to have such quality and accommodating option when you need it at odd hours. I am so staying here from now on if I come for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: djbcamb
Reviews.Content: Used the Eaton as a stopover on the way from UK to New Zealand and was not too sure what to expect. Actually, it's pretty darned good, with excellent rooms, good service levels, a first rate eatery, top breakfasts and free Wifi. Swimming pool on the roof is a nice touch and was, amazingly, unoccupied when we were there. Used by lots of British tour parties as their own stopover. It's a bit of a trek to walk to the Star Ferry (half an hour) but it's only just up the road from a tube station. The whole place looks classy and it got our holiday off to a promising start. Very helpful concierge operation, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Ribbid
Reviews.Content: Eaton is located in Jordan. The hotel is a five minute walk from the Jordan MTR station. Jordan is one station away from TST which is the main shopping area. The standard rooms are clean and sheets are changed everyday and general house keeping is good. Flat screen tv and mini bar is standard. view from our room was not great but nothing bad, just a view of the shopping mall in front of the building. Concierge staff are great! They helped us with directions and with getting a taxi as well. The gym and swimming pool are both great, but due to the cold weather we weren't able to take a dip. Check the weather before you land in Hong Kong as the the quality of the views and overall experience will depend a lot on the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great, central location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: atwoodexplores
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel for our first two nights in Hong Kong and Asia after arriving on our flight from San Francisco. We were very confused and tired out by the time difference, but the staff was professional and helpful in every way. We had reserved a Club room with access to the "E Club" which really made our stay. Normally this would be quite a splurge for us, but we wanted to be in good comfort for a few nights to sleep well and get over the jet lag. We were not disappointed. The E Club with generous breakfast and appetizers and drinks in the afternoon were great for us. It allowed us to take our time, enjoy good food in a relaxed environment. The hotel is on Nathan Road and its very easy to get around by the subway or by walking. We were also just a few blocks away from the late-night markets which we took in one night. Very fun, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Pay up for 'Deluxe' Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bognor
Reviews.Content: I thought we had picked a poor hotel when we got shown to our compact, rather shabby Standard room. We cheered up a lot when we saw a recently refurbished Deluxe room which did not cost much more so we upgraded and I would suggest you do the same. The Deluxe rooms are still pretty small but very nicely decorated and equipped. Nice walk-in showers but no bath. As other reviewers have stated the hotel is very well situated for sightseeing with restaurants nearby including a McD which is handy for breakfast. Excellent service and a very useful Happy Hour with half price drinks 5.30-8.30. Overall we thought we made a good choice and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: sparklerAustralia
Reviews.Content: On our arrival we were treated very badly by the check-in staff. This was 10a.m. and we were sent away until 2pm. Our deluxe room was VERY small, but kept clean. Meals OK, but a lot of times there was not any room for us to have breakfast in the main restaurant, and we were offered a substandard breakfast elsewhere. There messaging service was pathetic. We have been to Hong Kong a number of times and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoe_liang
Reviews.Content: great hotel with a lot of facilities at great prices,it's locate in the center of hongkong .. easy to travel around ..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: RedhenUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on my way back from Australia. The staff were very friendly and helpful and allowed me a check in of 11am which was a big help as my flight arrived very early. The room I was allocated (701) was smallish and the bathroom could maybe do with a bit of an update but was perfectly adequate with a comfy bed. Breakfast was very good with a large choice of pastries, fruit, dim sum and noodles and traditional English and American breakfasts, the snack/dinner menu was also quite large and fairly good from what I tried. There is a pleasant bar area including computers with free internet access (very useful) and a pretty looking terrace (although I didn't use it due to bad weather). The hotel is located on Nathan road which is a bustling mile of neon which is quite something to see at night. It is handy for the markets and also for the MTR Jordan station or you could take an interesting 15 min walk down to the Star ferry. I was a female staying on my own and felt very safe wandering around the area late at night. Overall I liked this hotel and would definately stay there again. I may consider upgrading my room next time as the prices generally are very reasonable. To sum up, very friendly, lots of amenities, great location.

Reviews.Title: “An extra day in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: PaulM75
Reviews.Content: What a lush hotel - got an upgrade to a suite after a booking cock-up, the staff were very helpful through the mess and very friendly. The food was amazing, especially on the terrace with the view of a lifetime

Reviews.Title: “Compliments to the excellent staff at the Eaton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussie12Syd
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed (1 to 5 Feb 2010) at the Eaton and had a very enjoyable stay, which was made exceptional by some of the staff. We booked an E Suite through Expedia and took up the E-club option. We found the club rooms amenities, food and drinks excellent. In particular however we wanted to mention the professional, friendly, courteous and very serviced focused staff in the E-club, who made out stay effortless! Notably we wanted to pass on our thanks to Teddy and Christine in the club for their exceptional service. Nothing was ever too much for both these employees. The were always eager to help in anyway, even providing direction to the best shopping locations and recommending and making reservations to great restaurants. The E Suite room was huge by Hong Kong standards and had a great view of Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “4 out of 5 hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wellygal
Reviews.Content: Eaton Hotel is located in the heart of Kowloon. Checking in was quick and my bag was already up in my room after i received my key card. I got one of the top floor (City Club Room) with a 180 degrees view but there weren't much to view at night because most of the buildings did not have their lights on. My room could be considered just a little bit small but i suppose it is still just as nice for one person or two. It has a very comfortable bed because i manage to sleep extremely well every night. Im very particular when it comes to bathrooms but theirs was fairly new with complete amenities. A very clean hotel indeed. Access to the E-Club room with many seats available, computers for internet access and printing, all day snack and drinks as well as breakfast and evening cocktail was very pleasant. The staff were helpful and makes you feel very welcome. I like in particular how they manage to make the fairly small hotel feel very comfortable as the limited space was well laid out.

Reviews.Title: “No Free WIFI”
Reviews.Author: icarolyap
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Eaton because I organize a training there.They didnt provide FREE internet in the room and the meeting room.(The Starbuck across the road only provide 15 minutes WIFI FOC, after that, you need to buy the WIFI service) You need to request the house keeping for slipper,shaver,toothbrush and toothpaste.I stayed in the Deluxe room,just newly refurbished,with Ipod Radio and flat screen TV,but very noisy.The location is convenience because near to MTR Jordon Station,shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: auks
Reviews.Content: stayed 7 nights in ajoining rooms, myself and wife in one and my mum in another.The rooms are small but are well presented and clean and tidy.Small fridge tea and coffee making facilites,hair dryer.Nice hotel lobby on the 4th floor as well as restaurant and bar,nice outside area off bar and restaurant good for smokers like me to take in the veiws and still be able to have a smoke with a meal or a beer.Swimming pool on roof not huge but well presented also heated.Good restaurant the metro good mix of western and local cuisine and good beer and wine prices.Meals range from $90hk to$200hk and are quite large and very nice,we ate here most nites.Breakfast was included and were most impressed chef will cook eggs any way you want while you wait ,bacon pastries the works very nice.Good location across the road from temple st markets and 2 mins walk to jordan MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton, Hongkong”
Reviews.Author: Glooey
Reviews.Content: Best value for a four star. Centrally located. Great service and knowledgeable staff. Look for Alex, the concierge, he will hook you up with the best tours and places to eat. I would definitely come back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Feel Factor”
Reviews.Author: JAPLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton Hong Kong on the return leg after family holiday in NZ. Went to the hotel desk at the airport and enjoyed hassle free limo to the hotel. Had booked 3 club rooms after reading reviews here that that rooms were small. We were all upgraded to suites, so plenty of room and very comfortable. Had access to the Club Lounge, which is one of the best of its kind. Wonderful service by Teddy and his friends. Good cafes/restauraunt in the hotel and ate their twice. Rooftop pool and gym/spa was quiet and relaxing. The staff at the Eaton helped end our month long holiday on a high. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, well organised, well positioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mountain_gote
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel with no effort at all using the free Airport Express Drop-off bus service which stops right outside the hotel, tell the guys at the Kowloon station you're staying at the Eaton and they will direct you to the correct bus. Check-in was quick and after arriving early we were lucky enough to receive a free upgrade to a deluxe room. The rooms are small at +-21 sq metres but I imagine this is standard in built-up Hong Kong. The rooms are very comfortable and modernly decorated with an Ipod docking radio/station on the side-table along with a Flat screen TV. The hotel is well positioned on Nathan road and is a quick walk to the MTR undergound. The hotel staff are very helpful and we found the hotel to be very good value for money. We didn't pay for the breakfast as we found it to be a bit pricey but there is a Starbucks next door and a 7eleven across the street.

Reviews.Title: “family bonding made perfect at eaton”
Reviews.Author: kingcrab407
Reviews.Content: front desk staff greeted us warmly upon registration. they were helpful in giving directions and taxi estimates to places we wanted to see. the lady cleaner assigned to our room, # 512, was thorough and ever-smiling. although the roomwas quite small for our family of three members, the amenities and cleanliness made up for it. Budget- friendly rates, accessible to public transportation and shopping malls, near restaurants and local food kiosks for light meals. safe and peaceful neighborhood. would certainly book here again if given the chance to go back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: aquillegia
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. E-club staff nothing was too much trouble. Great place 5 mins walk from Jordan station, 2 mins for bus to Star Ferry for HK island and conference centre and walking distance of Temple Street/ Jade and local markets. Paid extra for e-club room, great view and relaxed breakfasts. Could be noisy if you get room very near road but glazed. Pool abit windy, but have had a cold spell....15 deg

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManiJain
Reviews.Content: All is well hotel. Rooms are small but very comfartable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, location,rooms”
Reviews.Author: mickey65
Reviews.Content: Hi myslef and my daughter stayed at the Eaton form the 27th December to 4th January. We had one of the larger rooms numbered 01 to 10 on each floor. The decor in these rooms is outdated but the size more than makes up for it they all have a bath a lounge area a large desk and lots of wardrobe space. We also had the E-Club Access this is the best way to go at the Eaton, breakfast was 7 to 11am and had a good avriety different each morning with a great coffee machine, after 11am cakes & bickies and drinks were available all day till 5:30pm, then it was drinks and canapes, the drinks were red,white & champers, or most major spriits and they refilled them as quick as you could drink them. The canapes usually consisted of 2 hot dishes like chicken and dumplings and lots of breads biscuits and cheeses. This finishes at 7:30 just ion time for the shopping or dinner if you can fit it in. The staff at the E-Club are incredible, so helpful and friendly. Location you are 2 blocks from the ladies market and electronics area, 2 blocks from temple street night market one block from Jordan MTR and far enough from the "tailor madam"and "copy watch"people. The concierge is great full of knowledge, there is a very cheap laundry the Grand laundry just 2 minutes from the exit. $59HKD for 14Lb of laundry. The staff on the front desk need some lessons from the other staff of their attitude would be my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive for what you get. Indifference.”
Reviews.Author: ekam
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Eaton Hotel i was pleasantly surprised to be told i would be upgraded from a Standard room to a Deluxe. I do not know what the standard room looks like or how big it is but the room is very small. The Bathroom is reasonably clean. It is very hard to find the mini fridge hidden in a side table. I looked for the Hotel Slippers but there were none. There were NO Toiletries whatsoever including NO SOAP. I went out to the corridor to look for cleaning staff but could not see any. I called the Operator and asked for housekeeping and told her we were missing the basics above. The Operator told me she would let the Housekeeping staff know and they would bring the items to the room. I was in the room for the next 2 hours and NOBODY arrived. I called the front desk next and told them about it and they said someone would be up. I advised them i would go out for dinner and was told my basic essentials would be sitting in the room when i got back. I came back late and there was still nothing in the room, NO SLIPPERS, NO SOAP, NO TOILETRIES. I had to go on a Witch hunt and find some. This is NOT SERVICE. You cannot tell a guest you will do something and not follow it up. Its becomes a downright lie. Upon checkout i advised the front desk of the circumstances and they just had a look of indifference and i got "Oh Sorry". That was it. For this the Hotel Gets 0 out of 10 for me. This is not good enough. Don't waste your money try something else. This Hotel represents nothing special at all and lacks service.

Reviews.Title: “good size room, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: littledogling
Reviews.Content: good size room, convenient location, good service plus very help staff! sure will recommend to friends. the best is they do have many computers in different locations for guests to use.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated!”
Reviews.Author: Orang_County_greg
Reviews.Content: I was drawn in by a great price but was very disappointed. The room was large by HK standards but very outdated. The things I liked was a convenient location and good amenities at the floor level of the property..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Karldax
Reviews.Content: They couldn't do enough for us from freeing up our room early to an encyclopedic knowledge of the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Cats_123
Reviews.Content: Arrived Dec 24th and reception was welcoming and efficient. Room was small (as others have warned) but well appointed. The hotel is in the ideal location, within 5mns walk of Jordan MTR and very close to the Temple Street and Jade markets. For the longer trips a taxi can be obtained from the concierge. We breakfasted once, not because it was expensive (which it was relatively) but because we had eaten too much elsewhere the night before. The breakfast room is pleasan and has a good range of cooked and buffet style food. We also eat at the grill bar on one evening. Well presented and cooked food with god service. The bar has happy hours between 5-8pm when you get 2 for the price of one!!! Alternative breakfast arrangements can be found just outside (Garfunkels/Main St cafe etc). Room service was excellent Internet access in lobby but you have to pay for Wired internet in rooms (although the charge is hardly punitive it is strangely unnecessary in such a decent hotel). Said to have a fitness centre and pool on the roof, but we did not try this so can't comment. The concierge held our cases all day on the final day at no cost - A nice hotel that we would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Just once and Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Heidi03Red
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Eaton hotel for 3 nights in Dec'09. Due to peak season, our room was given to us after 4.30pm, which is two and half hours later than its stated check-in time! For the first 2 nights, room allocated to us was okay but unfortunately we were given smoking floor despite our request for non-smoking room. Further the kettle was very dirty which previous guests might have used to cook instant noodles. We left our luggages with Eaton Hotel to travel to China as we will be returning to stay with the Hotel for the last night. Unfortunately luggages were charged HKD30/pc per day. This is poor policy as hotels in international cities I have had travelled to so far such as London, Tokyo, Seoul, do not do that to their hotel guests. Upon traveling back from China, we rechecked by the Hotel but was given a poorer grade room which looks like it was done since 70s. To pay the price for Eaton Hotel I would have choosen a better qualtiy and location hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Kowloon hotel”
Reviews.Author: ErnoP
Reviews.Content: Located on the golden mile and close to MTR station (Jordan). Though noice was not any problem. Take advantage of complimentary shuttle service from Kowloon Airport Express Station as that's most convenient and fastest way to get there from airport, 40-50mins (160HKD return). Hotel has friendly staff. Restaurants are a bit expensive but there's lots of dining and breakfast options close by. Pool at the roof also a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: killertofu
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline.com and got a good price for Eaton Hotel for our four-day stay in Hong Kong. The hotel is conveniently located on Nathan Road, about a 5-minute stroll from the Jordan St. MTR subway station. Plenty of familiar stores nearby.... a 7-11 across the street and a Starbucks and McDonald's 30 seconds away so you won't feel too far from home. The check-in process was smooth and the staff were very polite. They accidentally gave me a smoking room, but were quick to move me to a non-smoking room the following day (they moved all my luggage over themselves while I was out). Service in general was very good and commendable. The rooms were clean, well-lit (including the washroom), very modern, and comfortable. We had a "standard" room and it was enough for the two of us. Our room felt cozy and the bed was very comfortable. The view is typical... just a view of Hong Kong buildings (i.e. no harbour view).
