Rooms weren't spacious but that's also typical of most Hong Kong hotels unless you an afford to stay at the Conrad. Getting to the hotel was easy. We took the train from the airport to Kowloon station, and then the free K1 minibus directly to the doors of the hotel. One-way costs 90HKD and took about an hour (the hotel is one of the last stops for the minibus). You can also take the taxi which costs around 250HKD one-way. The hotel overall felt very modern and clean. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this to my friends and family. The location, service, and modernity of the hotel and rooms makes this an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quality hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: cindy168
Reviews.Content: Nice and neat hotel conveniently located off Nathan road. Do not expect big rooms, because you are in Hong Kong. But the rooms have nice setup and are pretty clean. It has easy access to subway, restaurants, and shopping places.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton - Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: 365ucr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on the way back to UK from New Zealand. We have gone out via Hong Kong and stayed in Mongkok. I much preferred the Jordan area. There is more sophistocated shopping, easier access to the waterfront and HK Island, plus a large park nearby for when you feel the need to get away from the crazy stuff. Lots of restaurants around but not much in the way of bars - the way Brits think of a bar, that is. Beer seems to be expensive in HK, even in hawker type places. The hotel was pretty swish. Fantastic breakfast included. We were lucky enough to get a free upgrade and the room was modern, although small. We had a 26" LCD TV wall mounted and a nice desk area which helped provide some space and make up for the smallness (and funny shape) of the room. It has elevators that are partly on the outside of the hotel front, good for views over Nathan Rd below. Free internet access was also a plus point. They limit you to 3 mins. The bar was plush but was always empty. Lovely pool area on the roof but it was damp when we were they so didn't use it. Best thing was....breakfast....breakfast....breakfast. Excellent service all round. Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BCRML
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous 4 days at the Eaton. It is ideally located within a short walk of at least two of the major market areas and the Jordan MTR (underground), so getting to other areas is a breeze. The hotel's rooms are on the smallish side (we had an adjoining room which helped), however they are comfortable, clean and well appointed and well deserving of 4 stars. The staff were excellent. Polite, accomodating and efficient. We used the gym and pool and both were good. Broadband access is available in each room, although at a cost and we chose to line up and use the free internet computers in the lobby (limited to 20 mins at a time!). Unfortunately if you have a laptop the hotel's basement cafe doesn't have free wifi either (however there is a Starbucks across the street). Despite the internet restrictions the Eaton was great and we would totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the star rating”
Reviews.Author: gecentral
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is great, close to all the transportation to get you around HK and great restaurant or fast food within 5mins walking distance, also has 24hr McDonalds and a 7-11 across the road. Room was very disappointing, old and tired with several issues with electrical devices in the room. Our room was on the 11th floor facing the highway which was very noisy until 3am. The TV was the most disappointing, it was a very very old 20inch crt which I thought was only found in small road side hotels! Best about the hotel is its location and I would say there isn’t anything I liked about the room we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tablank
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton for 2 nights recently and were surprised about the good value for money. yes, the rooms are rather small, but well organised and clean. The Restaurant was good, the menu long enough to find something, the quality of food very good. Staff was friendly and the location is great, as the subway is only a few minutes walk away. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but Location Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FordyPerth
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe room and the rooms are decorated very modern, but the rooms are a little on the small size but not unbearable - when you think about it you are only really sleeping there, but we loved the Eaton and are returning again in March 2010 but will need a bigger room as taking our son with us. Ideal hotel for a couple but with children I would not recommend a deluxe room would need to go to an executive room and then of course the cost factor comes into it. the staff were very helpful and at times were very busy at the reception area, but were quite prepared to stand there and help you. Location is perfect and we used the public transport from this location all the time but taxi's are also very cheap so used to get a taxi to the MTR station most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: sainttom
Reviews.Content: The Eaton Hotel is in a good location for seeing the sights of HK. (Buy and Octopus card it can be used in 7-11 and on all transportation). The Hotel rooms are very small but very clean and well kept. The gym is ok and the pool, not really a pool but a space where u could do a couple of lengths only. The hotel charge you for everything and the £11 charge for 24hrs of internet access is high as is the the fee for breakfast if not included in your rate. The breakfast area around the buffet is dark and busy and not relaxing with only a medium choice. But after all that the rooms are clean and well stocked and the staff are helpful. An area i would rate them high on , is that for a moderate rate of 55HKD (approx £5),an hour you can extend the room. This was good for me with a 2130 flight out of HK. I think with a little few more personal touches the Eaton could be a great place to stay rather than just an OK place to stay. I would recommend it though, as safe and clean with the majority of staff keen to help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at hotel - great accommodations & great staff”
Reviews.Author: Cdnclan
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a 'mystery hotel' deal through wotif, so it was an incredible deal (50% off). I stayed here after a month of backpacking & the extra luxury, hot water, cleanliness was worth it! Loved the room, the staff, the hot shower, the location - all great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: lasvegaskid
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great overall. It was in a nice location with a Starbucks & McDonalds nearby (if that's your thing). The hotel is on the Nathan ' you need a tailor sir?' Road which is pretty busy but a short walk from the local markets and the star ferry. The only negative points were that the beds were extremely hard and the walls were paper thin so you could hear every conversation etc from the next door room. Yes the rooms are on the small size but that made them cozy! You could see right through to the bathroom from the bedroom (via a slatted blind) but you can put a blind down to protect your modesty ;-) The rooms come with a nice push button lighting scheme and you can request 'do not disturb' from here. The staff were very helpful and although you don't get free internet access in your room, you can use the free internet in the bar or cafe downstairs. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped but a good spot”
Reviews.Author: Annali
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 10 nights in a room that was a tight squeze for two people, let alone 2 adults and a 4 year old. The hotel itself is situated on Nathan Road which is a very busy road and close to everything including the Night Market,a Mc Donalds,7-11,restaurants,shopping and a subway whic is 2 blocks away.Service here was very good, the breakfast was excellent although it lacked variety and the concierge, who helped with all travel plans knew his stuff and was very helpful.My mom became ill and the staff was very ubderstanding and helpful in getting her soup etc.to her room.Thehy also assisted with a wheelchair which they lent to us.It was safe(the whole Hong Kong felt safe)and I would recommed this hotel to people on business trips and travellers who are travelling in parties of 2 at a time.Don't expect space though!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but a tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: dgrbleu2
Reviews.Content: My company uses this hotel often and I stayed 6 mights whilst on business last month. I was put into a deluxe room which was on the 19th floor and recently renovated. It had a large bed, which unfortunately took up the majority of the room. There was a desk and office chair and minibar crammed in, and the wardrobe was too small for 6 days worth of clothing. The bathroom was, however, a decent size. In spite of the tiny room, the service was excellent and the bed was very comfy- not rock hard like you usually find in Hong Kong and China. I skipped the breakfast (HKD 138 per person) in favour of the McDonalds across the street. Wired broadband was HKD 130 per 24 hours, or HKD 650 for one week- only worked for one laptop, had to pay again for the second one. Location was good, farther up on Nathan Road and the K1 bus connection from Kowloon Station (where you exit the airport express train) stopped right at the hotel. I found the location convenient for dining and shopping both (Jade Market about 5 minutes walk). Note this is a popular hotel for weddings at the weekend so there seemed to be a lot of people coming and going. Also appeared to be used for some American tour groups. There is a rooftop pool and fitness centre, but I did not have time to see them for myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location with great staff but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: hotelindustrypro
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the eaton hotel for 6 nights. We were very impressed with this lovely hotel. I work in the hotel industry so understand hotels. Since we aren't difficult guests we only needed to visit the reception for check in and check out and at no other time. We had arranged a request in advance which was met. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We booked a room only rate because it would have been too expensive to book with breakfast (you can eat breakfast outside). It was in a great location close to the subway system and close to great shopping and night markets. We had a sleep in every morning but our room was still cleaned when we went out for all of the afternoon and evening. The only thing was that the room was very small. Our suitcases had to stay on the floor and there were no drawers to put clothes in and minimal wardrobe space so had to live out of a suitcase for the whole stay. And this was a deluxe room which is the same size as a standard room. The concierge staff were very helpful and knowledgeable which made it overall a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a funky touch!”
Reviews.Author: LaGitana30
Reviews.Content: Reaaly liked this hotel. Stayed for 2 nights in October 2009. Good location on Nathan Road, close to shopping and attractions. Executive room really nice and well-appointed. Loved the touch of lime green in the decor and accessories! Really appreciated having a glass of champagne each evening at the executive club lounge. Personnel very nice, sometimes a little bit slow but willing to please. Nice swimming pool and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice pool, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Laura032
Reviews.Content: The Eaton hotel is in a great location on Nathan Road, which made it easy for us to find our way around. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby, I would recommend going down the side streets to find cafes with good food that are much cheaper than places on the main road. The hotel has a gym and an outdoor pool on the top floor which is very nice, also the bar has an outdoor terrace area. The rooms are small with not much room for your luggage, but very clean and well equipped. We got the airport express train from the airport and then there is a free bus service between the train station and the Eaton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not fantastic, but not too bad”
Reviews.Author: ZZZSG
Reviews.Content: overall not too bad, room was tiny, as expected in hk, service was the best for this whole stay. location was good enough for me, the daily walk to the mtr was easy and taxis were easily available. bad thing: i found a half eaten dried up lettuce on a fork under my bed and although housekeeping was prompt and efficient, you'll realise that they only make the beds and changes the towels, besides that, the dust in the rooms are quite cumulative.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: sdigian
Reviews.Content: Eaton Hotel is in Kwoloon and is centrally located on Nathan Road. It's close to the Temple Street Market as well as the Ladies Market (about 10-15 min walk). The hotel has excellent facilities for drinks and dining. The rooms are comfortable, although a bit small, which is typical for Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “This was a really great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angie_Paul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and i must say we were extremely happy we chose this hotel! On arriving at the airport we went to get the shuttle bus (which we pre-booked) and were taken care of from then on! We were given a bottle of water, our tickets, a sticker identifying us (very organised!) then shown where to sit, collected and taken to the bus, which was quite lovely, very roomy and with leather seats! Check in was easy, the room was just gorgeous! Some might say its small but thats by european standards, it has everything you could possibly need and the walk in shower was fab! Breakfast was great too, eggs and stuff cooked to order, lots of fresh fruit, lots of types of breads, pastries, meats, even smoked salmon! Coffee was a bit slow in being delivered but hey, they were very busy! The staff were also very helpful, including the English head chef! Very friendly! The hotel is ideally located in the centre of everything, the night markets are a couple of minutes walk away (great if you can haggle!) the botanical gardens and zoo are a short walk away and to get any where else the bus station is right next to the gardens. Oh, get a taxi if you're going anywhere in the city.... WELL cheap by UK standards, we worked it out a £1.30 to go from the peak all the way to the harbour, bargain! The ONLY thing that bothered us was that on pre-ordering the shuttle bus with the booking online, we werent apparently charged for this and had to pay this on arrival, which isnt a major thing but when you think youve paid for the whole stay... it was a bit of a surprise! All in all though if we ever go back to Hong Kong we would happily stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoatersLeftShin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Eaton on the first four nights of our honeymoon and the hotel is great. The location is really good as even though you are on Nathan Rd, it's very quiet and only a 15 min walk to the harbour. The rooms were very clean, and the hotel was great. Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Irislum
Reviews.Content: The check in staff was very nice. The hotel location is what prompted me to pick it, it is located right above the MTR (subway) system so it is extremely convinent to go to other places. Everything is right down the street, including a laundromat just behind the hotel, and they charge you by lbs, not per garment.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in a central position”
Reviews.Author: Ally026
Reviews.Content: We stopped off for two days in HK en route to Australia, and were very impressed by the Eaton. We had ordered a deluxe room which was unavailable at the time of arrival, so they upgraded us to a suite. Great start! The hotel is handy for most aspects of Kowloon, and has good bars and restaurant. Breakfast was especially worth having. The coffee shop in the basement is very welcome too, as there seems to be a great shortage of them in Kowloon. Staff were very courteous and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SuzyWho
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of September. We used the limo service from the airport and after a long flight from UK, this was the perfect way arrive and well worth the money. We were given a bottle of water each as soon as we approached the desk at the airport and were taken down to the car. The driver gave us a great commentary during the journey to the hotel and we were able to just chill and relax all the way. From start to finish, the staff were absolutely brilliant. All spoke English very well and Christine from Reception / eClub was especially helpful. We stayed in a club room and bought the eClub package. The eClub was like being in the first class lounge and was worth every penny. The hotel is modern and exceptionally clean. In an excellent location on Kowloon close to the shops and Temple Street market. If I ever get to Hong Kong again, I would choose this hotel without a second thought. We thoroughly enjoyed out stay here and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “so enthusiastic but WHY?”
Reviews.Author: PL_thomas
Reviews.Content: Gays, you are enthusiastic about this hotel, probably you forgot how hotel have to be. Totally small rooms – no space for your luggage, not so clean, much too expensive! This hotel have some business equipment and seems to be for business – but is NOT. Truly its very good hotel for persons who apply to be businessman and to whom it gives satisfaction to say – I slept in Eaton HK! – only. And one more point – internet for 130HKD !!! – you can buy GSM pre-piad card with anlimited access for 38HKD daily!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated. Rooms are incredibly small!”
Reviews.Author: Trenice
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Eaton Hotel was disappointing as we had chosen the hotel because the reviews were good. No assistance given to carry our luggages when we arrive. Even though we had made reservations one month ago, and had arrived at 2 pm, rooms were not ready. We waited for 45 mins before one of our three rooms is ready. And there was not even a single person to help us with the luggages. The lady at the check-in was unfriendly and not helpful; we had to constantly check if our rooms are ready as they were so inefficient at clearing the queues. Worse, one of the rooms stenched with smoke even though it was a non smoking room! When we requested to change the room, the reception was unhelpful and we were turned down flatly, giving the excuse that the hotel was fully booked. Although they sent someone up to spray the air freshener, it was hardly of any use. In the end, we had to bear with the smell and constantly open the door (every 30 mins) to dispel the smoke stench. The rooms were incredibly small; hardly any space to put our luggage. The bathroom can't even stand 2 persons! And with our two children in tow, it was unbearable. The shower was also not appropriate for children as it had a very short extension cord. Amenities were average. No slippers, no newspapers, no toothbrush etc. Just one small bottle of shampoo, bath gel and a soap. You can forget about the swimming pool and gym; tidy small and cramp that I don't even find a single person there. Contrary to what most claimed that the location is superb, one has to walk 4 streets from Jordan MTR which takes about 10 - 15 mins. You might think 10 mins is nothing but I know of other hotels which are even more strategically located near MTR. In Hong Kong, there are lots of hotels which are 3 mins walk away. With the rate I'm paying, US$140 without breakfast, I think other hotels would be able to offer a better experience. I will not go back to Eaton Hotel again, nor recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyholiday66
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely fantasic, it is a little away from the main tourist area but good public transport makes it easy to get around. The staff were great, very friendly and would do anything to make the stay great. The roof top pool was fantastic and not over crowded. The restaurant at the hotel was clean and the food was good, the rooms were small but very clean and modern. The staff went out of their way to make the stay great and the price is reasonable. This has been my favourite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: teach01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 7 nghts and had a great time. The room was clean although small but the hotel's location was excellent. We found the staff helpful and friendly and the rooftop pool was very inviting at night. The breakfast buffet contained plenty of variety and overall I would definately stay again if I was going back to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: canadiantrotter
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in H-K, and yes, the location is great...but next time will defenetely be closer to the Star Ferry/pier aera, wich I consider the best location in Kowloon... The room we had reminded us of the Monterey in Kyoto, in terms of size...Enough for 1 person, but way too cramped for 2 with luggages....So make sure that you book a "big" room before going... The hotel is quite well maintained and efficient, but had a claustrophobic feeling about it... dark and cramped... The breakfast was good, but of course, quite pricey. As for dinner, the food is very good, but can be quite long to recieve somethimes...You can have dimsum at Nathan Hotel just on the other side of the street...There's a Starbuck just at the corner of Nathan Rd ( about 20 seconds walk). For laundry, there's a very efficient one at about 3 minutes walk from the hotel, and is on an isolated street. I had about 10-15 lbs of clothes and costed about 5$us...ready the same day.... The concierge staff was very efficient and friendly.... All in all, it was worth the price we paid, but didnt feel anything special about this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, with roof terrace and modern room!”
Reviews.Author: DanielleNetherlands
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, nice neighbourhood, temple market around the corner, close to MTR which is very easy to use with the Octopus card. The deluxe rooms have the same size as the standard room, but are refurbished and very modern. The rooms are not big at all, but all the things that you need are there. A very comfortable bed, nice bathroom, big tv. A great feature of the hotel, is it's roof terrace! It's so lovely to sit outside in the afternoon/ evening with a drink or meal. The breakfast is directely followed by the lunch buffet, nice if you didnt booked breakfast and are too late for breakfast. The lunch buffet has a great variety of food from all over the world for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, good location, room a bit small”
Reviews.Author: qwertyPhilly
Reviews.Content: Service Service at the front desk was good. They were very polite on check in. In the restaurant, the service was ok too. Nothing too good or too bad. When we wanted to pay the bill there was noone to be seen and we had to go to the till ourselves, but it might have been because it was late. Room I thought the room was quite small really .A double bed, a desk next to the head of the bed on one side (with no space at the side) and a small bedside cabinet on the other. At the end of the bed between the bed and the TV there was probably about a foot. Not really enough space to put two suitcases down. There was a big TV on the wall which was nice. Bathroom was nice and clean, although there were some stains on one of the towels. Location Great location just off Nathan Road. Very near the Temple Night Market. Wasn't too noisy. 7/11 just across the road and a reflexologist where I went for a nice foot massage! Starbucks on the corner too. Amenities Didn't really use any of the hotel amenities apart from the restaurant one night. The food in the restaurant was nice and they had given us some vouchers on check in for a discount which we used. I noticed when I was checking out that there were some computers for communal use in the lobby. Liked best Location, and reasonable value for money. Liked least Small room and the fact there was no wireless in the room. There was internet through a cable but you had to pay for it and no wireless.

Reviews.Title: “great location for first hk visit”
Reviews.Author: gs89
Reviews.Content: stayed here on my first visit to HK. Double room was very clean and big for asia standard. Cleaning staff was good. Location on Nathan Rd walk to all shops and restaurants. TST and harbour area all walking distance. MTR very closeby and bus stops. Laundry very expensive, take it to local laundry mat closeby or pay lots $$$. paid $80CDN per night 2 years ago, now after the renovations it's very expensive for stay. like double the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Dunfysink
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 4 night stay at the Eaton Hotel, Kowloon and can only report back positive things from my experience with this hotel which I have summarised below: ~ Easiest way to get to the hotel is by Airport Express MTR to Kowloon station and then on the complimentary shuttle bus K1 from the station, that take you right to the hotel. 1st bus is 06.12 and last bus is 23.12. These run frequently between the station and a loop of 6 hotels of which the Eaton is one. Cost for train and bus is $120 HK. ~ Hotel is ideally placed in the middle of Nathan Road. A ten minute walk north takes you to Ladies Market and the Jade Market. A five minute walk south takes you to Temple Street Night markets. The hotel is also well within walking distance of the ferry terminal, waterfront and Avenue of the Stars. ~ The hotel itself has a concierge area on the bottom level, and reception is on floor 4, so the impression you get when you arrive is not the best. Once you are inside and at reception the impression does change markedly. ~ Reception staff were very pleasant and informed us that we had been upgraded to a Deluxe room which was a bonus. ~ The Deluxe room overlooked the Nathan Road and the view was excellent at night with a mass of neon on show. The room was small, however did not lack in facilities, there was also a nice touch with an Ipod docking station next to the bed. ~ Linen was changed daily and room was made up each day to a high standard. The corridors and room also looked like they had just been renovated. ~ Hotel is within easy access of Yau Ma Tei and Jordan MTR stations so travelling about the mainland and HK island is also very easy. All in all the experience of the hotel was very good, and the location enhanced our stay in Kowloon. Having chose to eat and drink away from the hotel, I cannot comment on this aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Broken room facilities, chaotic check-in & payment settlement”
Reviews.Author: KeepDiscovering
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 3 nights in late July. I booked with an Asia Miles promotion offer, which offered complimentary in-room internet connection and double mileages. However, they seemed not to be aware of my booking and insisted that there would be no complimentary internet connection. It was until I made several phone calls and showed the actual terms that they knew it was a mistake. It's not the end of the world but it was annoying. The double mileages were also not honoured. My latest Asia Miles statement showed that they only credited me with 500 miles instead of 1000 miles (double). Payment settlement was chaotic. My credit card had been credited and debited three times for my hotel payment. I was not pleased that they kept charging my credit card without even advising me the reasons. The hotel's infrastructure and services were generally up to standard. Unfortunately the room facilities were not well maintained, e.g. some lights in bathroom were broken, kettle did not work, key cards did not function, etc. I would have expected that there were regular maintenance. I originally planned to stay there on my next HK visit but after my first stay I have decided to shift to another Langham property instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: obione_98
Reviews.Content: The Eaton is superbly positioned for easy access via bus, MRT and Octopus Card; to everything. Rooms are small - as in most HK hotels. The hotel is quiet (no slamming doors all night) and efficiently managed. They offer free internet access and availability of computers and printer - free. Breakfast is NOT included; but there's a Starbucks within 15 metres of the hotel and a Macdonalds just across Nathan Rd. The Temple Street Night Market and all it has to offer are within15 minutes stroll, as is the Jade Market. Two commercial laundries are within 10 minutes in Woo Sung Street - both offer same day service at a fractionof the hotel price. There's a 7/11 just 60 seconds away from the side entrance - and nathan Road and its huge range of everything is right there! In Summary - a Great holiday hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Some Room Issues”
Reviews.Author: Tygaman
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives. The hotel was excellently located on Nathan Road only a short walk from the Jordan MTR station and a 10-15 minute walk from the Star Ferry Terminal. If you take the Airport Express train there is also a free shuttle bus included in the proce that takes you from Kowloon Station to the front of the hotel. The first room we had was a recently renovated one and although small was very nice. Breakfast was good with a wide selection of food and we never had any issues getting a table. The breakfast room staff were friendly and efficient. Check-in was fast, friednly and also efficient. Now to the negatives. The room noise is quite bad and I'm not talking about from outside. The way the television is mounted into the wall means there appeared to be only a thin strip of metal between the back of your TV and the back of the TV in the adjoining room. This means that if your neighbour wants to watch TV all night, you get to listen to it. Same deal if they use the iPod port in their clock radio. This brings me to the other issue. I'm not sure if it is a Hong Kong thing but we had a few issues that were handled the same frustrating way. Our first room had a broken toilet meaning everytime it was flushed raw sewage came up into the toilet stinking out the bathroom. We raised the issue the next morning as it was late when we realised what was happening and were told someone would fix it while were were out for the day or we'd be moved to another room if it could not be fixed. We returned and the toilet was still broken and there was no message or note to suggest anyone had even looked at it. We went back down to reception and were asked if it was fixed...we said no and they then moved us to another room which was one with older decor but a working toilet. Our first night the TV noise became an issue as our neighbour decided to watch movies all night. At about 11pm we called reception to ask if they could request the neighbour turn their TV down. We were told they'd investigate and get back to us. Half an hour later and no update and no reduction in noise we called reception again to which they asked "Has the issue been resolved?". We said no and they finally sent someone up to tell our neighbour to turn it down, which they did. As it turned out we had a different room the next night due to the toilet issue so looked forward to a quiet night. Our optimism was misplaced as our new neighbour was a fan of dance music which penetrated the wall and drove us insane. We went through the same routine as the night before. First request for assistance ignored and again being asked if the non-action had resolved the issue. After being told the hotel could not tell guests to turn their music down until 2am (?) by the duty manager they eventually asked the neighbour to turn it down and told me we would get a free breakfast for our inconvenience whcih was duly removed from our bill. The frustration at going through the routine of asking for assistance, being ignored in the hope it would go away and then eventually doing something just got too much. At checkout we were then told we had to pay for a breakfast they could not provide because we had paid for it as an add-on to our accommodation booking. We went on a day trip that meant we left before the breakfast opened and after some haggling we had the charge removed. Overall, the hotel is in a great location and had it not been for the broken toilet issue our experience may have been a more positive one. Looking at other reviews we were perhaps just unlucky. We aren't people who generally complain without reason but feel the minimum requirement of a 4-star hotel is a quiet and comfortable sleep which we could not get for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Find!”
Reviews.Author: jphnyc
Reviews.Content: I visited Hong Kong for two days with my mom. It was both our first time there and so I picked the Eaton Hotel as it was recommended by my handy Frommer's travel guide. It was indeed a good find, as it is reasonably priced at a little over $100 a night. The room, though small compared to American hotel rooms (most Hong Kong hotel rooms are apparently smaller than their American counterparts anyway), was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and clean as well. The hotel staff were very cheerful and helpful. Also, the location of the hotel on Kowloon's Nathan Road is pretty superb. It's a short walk to the Temple Street Night Market and the Jade Market. It is also close to the Jordan MTR station. Lots of shops and restaurants and other hotels are nearby as well. If you like to walk, then you can stroll down Nathan all the way down to Tsim Sa Tsui and the promenade that looks out to Central Hong Kong's skyline in about 20 minutes time (well, longer if you end up stopping by the numerous stores on that street). My only "complaint" about this hotel though is that it charges you even for local Hong Kong phone calls, but that's a pretty minor gripe. In the end, I would probably stay at this hotel again when I come back to Hong Kong in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rustycrankshaft
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days with my wife and was very impressed. I opted for their shuttle service from the airport which takes 90 mins according to their website, however it really took only 35 mins and was cheaper than the express train. I was expecting a standard room which was 699HKD per night but on check-in was upgraded to a suite on the 18th floor which was fantastic. The room was great and had fabulous views of Kowloon if your not scared of heights! We paid for the breakfast which was good quality although a little pricey. Delaneys Irish bar is only 15 mins walk down the road and we ate there for most of the trip. Altogether I found the hotel and staff excellent and would definately stay there again. My tip is to book with them directly on their website as this was much cheaper than using a booking agency.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and efficient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mohanherle
Reviews.Content: FIrst things first. Size is a relative term. When you are in one of the most crowded cities in the world the term size is relative. Hong Kong is a very efficient city and little expansive. Take a window seat in the plane as landing on a airport which is built on partially reclaimed space from sea is a good experience. The airport is one of the best in the world with respect to design,efficiency and experience. The immigration process is very quick and smooth. Before you realize you are at the door steps of a metro (within airport) which is waiting for you. (6 Minutes frequency). Though it is very fast and convenient I suggest you take bus instead, for two reasons. You can see most of the Kowloon Island on the way to Hotel and it is economical. However, you learn fast that always you should have correct change in Hong Kong for transportation. Octopus Card is a must which is a kind of credit card you can use for all modes of transport like ferry, tram, bus, MTR (metro train) and most of the shops including 7 to 11. Pick up few maps of he city which are available in the airport. As you come out of the airport walk to your right to bus stand. I suggest take a seat on the upper deck to see the city(Most buses are double Deckers). Bus has a electronic display which clearly indicates current stop and next stop and other important places near the stop. Incidentally Eaton Hotel is displayed and the stop is right at the door step of the Hotel. Initially I was at a loss to find the main entrance of the hotel as the hotel's reception is on the 4th floor. You can reach the reception by elevator, escalator from different points. Check in and check out is very quick. The staff is very professional and courteous. I have booked the room through it's website which was quick and reassuring. Queries were answered promptly. ( They could not accept Debit card and I had to book the room using Credit Card). Room was bit small comparing to other hotels in different countries. But the smart design, clean sparkling bathroom, attractive toiletries provided, gadgets like light controls with Ipod dock next to bed, well stuffed fridge, hair dryer, weighing scale, pressure plumbing, LCD TV,.....you would not miss a thing. I suggest you use items in the fridge and replace it from the 7to11 store which is at one of the entrances of the hotel. Basically Hong Kong is a model city for it's transport system. Generally, where ever you stay it should not be a problem to reach any part of the islands(Kowloon and Hong Hong). There are few bus stops in all directions near the hotel. Famous MTR point is just few buildings away. Hotel is surrounded by many attractions like Temple Street, Ladies Market, Jade Market, TST, Star avenue, Kowloon Park, Star Ferry, Malls, etc., all within walking distance. It's a great experience to have simple breakfast at nearby Australian Dairy. You can see reviews of the place in Travel Advisor. It is really crowded with locals and totally crammed, but you will have a different good experience of Hong Kong with local population. Adjacent to Kowloon Park there are many high end Shops with branded merchandise. You can go to Macao from the Star Ferry dock. Using very inexpensive tram service in Hong Kong is a good way for sight seeing and relaxing. Good value for the money and total satisfaction is how I would summarize my stay at Eaton Hotel Hong Kong. (Actually it is in Kowloon Island) However, poor TV reception is the only negative aspect which I can recall and it could be an isolated issue to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: kitkat_UAE
Reviews.Content: Superb location, clean rooms, accomodating staff and airport express free bus transfers. No free wifi and breakfast is expensive. But, the deal is superb. A Four Star Hotel ambiance in a cheaper price. The Eaton Hotel website offers promotion for a free night for a two days stay. The Hotel is located at Nathan Road with a walking distance at Jordan MTR that can lead you through all the sights in HongKong. Chinese restaurants are sprawling around the corner for a cheaper breakfast treats. The hotel is located near Jade Market and the Night Market. An excellent place if you are up for shopping. An MTR ride to high end stores of Channel and LV, amusement parks like Disney and Ocean Park. The room size is okay considering HongKong's room sizes. The comfort room is sparkling clean. The linens and towels are new, clean and comfy. Cable TV and IDD is included.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: deb_doug007
Reviews.Content: just returned from 3 day shopping expedition. This hotel is great. Booked deluxe room but upgraded to suite on arrival (corner room overlooking Nathan Rd). Well situated hotel close to all the action. Walking distance (20 min ) to ladies market Mong Kok and the K1 b us from airport at the door. All staff are excellent and the amenities are good

Reviews.Title: “Well..its pretty ok.. i guess”
Reviews.Author: ctinas
Reviews.Content: the value is definitely good for such a low price.. the location is really convenient, like its near to the temple street, and theres one 7-11 and a really famous chain hk local restaurants right downstairs.. theres a starbucks right at the corner.. and mcds right across the street.. and some famous seafood reatuarnts nearby..and a couple mins walk to the nearby subway stations..definitely really convenient location... the room design is really cool too, small but smart designed, and the washroom is clean ..(oh yah.. remember to book the deluxe room though)... the swimming pool is tiny but realllllly nice and the the fitting right besides it is relatively big and new:D but one thing i have to say, i had jet-lag, so i woke up really early like 4-5 am everyday.. at the second day, i broke my phone, so i had to go to the business center to use the internet to contact my friends.. and when i was trying to buy an internet access card, a bunch of drunk teenagers came to the lobby, and they were talking about approaching me or sth in cantonese.. well, i was lonely young lady..so i was actually kinda scared.. and there was only one receptionist at the front desk, who was talking to someone on the phone and ignoring my situation..yah.. the location is definitely convenient.. but its a little sketchy, and apparently i heard from somewhere says its or it was a red light area.. so yah.. it would be perfect if they have more security guards... or even a couple more staff during the early morning..T_T About the tv channels.. well.. i dont really like sports.. so i felt like i had nth to watch on tv.. like seriously.. i didnt bring my laptop with me, so i felt sooooo bored during the early mornings.. but one good thing is they have a ipod player there, u can charge ur ipod and play the music.. its kinda nice.. About the view.. theres no view.. at all..haha.. tiny window.. but since i didnt expect to have a view cuz i had done lots of research before i actually booked the hotel..and the lobby is at the 4th floor.. kinda weird.. but well.. i dont really mind, cuz the elevators are cool..:D well.. its a nice hotel overall.. good price and convenient location..

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant 3 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: SparklyJuanita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton from June 22-26 and I must say it was a perfect stay. Check in after our 17 hour flight was quick and easy , and it turned out that our Room only booking was actually B&B which was an unexpected turn up! The room we had was small, however it was very nicely decorated and to be honest was plenty big enough for getting showered, changed and sleeping which is pretty much all we used the room for. Plasma TV and tea and coffee were provided in the room, and lovely toiletries in the bathroom. The power shower was great too. The breakfast buffet in this hotel is worth the money if you cant be bothered to trek out and find food, there is a good selection of fruits, breads, pastries, meats, cheeses and a hot counter with bacon, hash browns, and the obligatory 'egg' chef who will do any kind of egg you would like. ALso a good selection of asian and chinese breakfast items. If you dont have Breakfast included, just outside the hotel at the end of road literally 25 metres is a starbucks and just across the road (nathan road) there is a McDonalds. If that doesnt foat your boat the hotel is about 100m from the tube station are there are a few shops in there that sell juices and breads and things. I personally think this hotel is in a great location in Kowloon. YOu can walk the length of the nathan road to the avenue of stars in about 25 minutes which we did a couple of times no problem, otherwise jump on the tube and For about 40p you can get off at Tsim Sha Sui which is right by a mall for eats or shopping. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from temple street night market, which is literally across the road and we ate there 2 out of our 3 nights...great seafood and veg dishes. The market is ok too for wandering around. The gym at the hotel i thought was great, had a cardio section with cycles, 2 treadmills and a cross trainer, and a weights section. More than enough to keep the rust off! the pool is lovely too for a half an hour escape! I would thouroughly recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKylie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights but actually used the room for 7 days. We arrived early at 8am and our room was ready, we asked for a late check out and were given till 1pm at no extra charge. We then paid for another 3 hours at only $55HKD an hour which is less than $10 AUD per hour. Get your breakfast included in the tariff as it includes everything you could want to fuel you for the day. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. You can get the A21 bus from the airport which pretty much stops out the front of the hotel and costs only $33HKD, so less than $6 AUD, its air conditioned and very comfortable. You can catch the same bus to the airport but you will need to cross Nathan Rd, we managed with heavy suitcases. The hotel is well maintained and close to the Jordon MTR, only a 5 min walk. The room is small but was cleaned everyday and the bathroon included a bath and was a good size. Didn't have time to use the pool but we did check it out and it was beautiful, the gym also was fully equipped. Temple street markets just across the road, 5 min walk and so is the Jade market and Mongkok markets just a quick bus trip up Nathan Road. Excellent location for shopping, easy to catch a bus or train. We used public transport to cross the border into Shenzhen and also into Maccau.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Traveloat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room for 13 nights - it is smaller in general than Western hotels, however we found the room big enough for us and our stuff, the bathroom was lovely and had a bath, aircon worked well and not noisy, bed was very comfortable and as we spent the majority of our time around Hong Kong, or using the decent gym and small pool in the hotel we didn't find the room too claustrophobic - but if you like spending a lot of time in the room maybe opt for something a little larger. The staff were always very friendly and the room cleaned superbly every day. We didn't try any of the restaurants as we were on a bit of a budget so ate out in small local restaurants of which there are numerous nearby. We got the normal bus service to the hotel and it stopped within a couple of minutes walk from the hotel - and is only $33HK so very cheap. Jordan metro station is within 5 minutes walk and Temple Street night market and a fruit and veg market very close. Would highly recommend this hotel - we got an excellent deal through wotif as a secret hotel - only $440HK a night and considering everything we felt it was well worth it! Only slight downside was the cost of in room internet - $130 for one day for the most basic package - although the connection was fast unless you want to do personal banking etc (which we did) the rest of the time we waited downstairs by the main street cafe where they have 4 computers with free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location exactly as the reviews & pictures show”
Reviews.Author: TravellingKiwisNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe double room with a view which was a bit smaller than expected but just right for 2 people. Modern facilities, very clean, comfortable. Hotel had a rooftop pool which was small but it was still nice & we never had a problem finding a space to swim or sit. Free internet access at hotel cafe. Metro Bar & Grill restaurant on hotel 4th floor is recommended. Hotel location was excellent, right on the main road Nathan Road in Kowloon, seconds away from shops, restaurants and a couple of minutes away from the Jordan MTR train station. The hotel looks exactly like the photos on their website!!! Only issues with hotel was; 1) We found the staff and the food on the lower ground Main St Cafe in the hotel were below standard & let down the rest of the wonderful hotel facilities & service. The service at Main St Cafe was terrible because the staff didn't seem to want to be there & were rude & unhelpful on more than one occassion. The food in particular the mushroom chicken pie was very dry, tasteless & gave us food poisoning. We asked them to warm up the pies and the pies were still cold so we had to ask again. The muffins were also dry and tasteless. We recommend the Starbucks cafe which is 10 seconds away from Eaton hotel around the corner. The staff there are friendly, efficient & the food is better than the Main St Cafe - wouldn't say its the best Starbucks food we've had but it is good. 2) On our last day when we paid for a late checkout room wasn't cleaned or towels at least changed even though we requested it AND we were woken up at 5 am in the morning by a hotel staff member banging on our door by mistake even though we had the do not disturb button on. 3) Hotel has free umbrellas however umbrellas are on a first come first serve basis and most guests failed to return umbrellas at the end of the day so we waited 5 days for an umbrella. To ensure fairness for ALL guests we suggest hotel has a procedure put in place for umbrella usage and return so all guests can have equal opportunity to obtain an umbrella. Otherwise bring your own. *** Travel tip: catch the airport express train from Hong Kong International Airport to Kowloon station for $70 Hong Kong dollars per person. From Kowloon station Eaton Hotel is only 5-10 minutes away so you can either take the free K1 route connecting shuttle to the hotel OR a taxi. Note the free K1 shuttle took at least 1 hour because Eaton Hotel was the last drop off. However a taxi should cost $30-35 Hong Kong dollars and is the quickest option. **Travel tip: the MTR is fast and easy to use. $4 Hong kong dollars per trip for an adult.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again! and again!”
Reviews.Author: PhilFox47
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. Lovely hotel, excellent staff, excellent food, especially the breakfast ( Thank You, Lorraine, Head chef, for the duck eggs one morning!!) Spotlessly clean hotel, comfortable room and recommend the E service. My partner enjoyed the cocktails in the bar too! Nicely situated and near to the market. Great shopping! Our first trip to Hong Kong. A wonderful , memorable holiday. Would certainly return and definitely stay at the Eaton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but small deluxe room”
Reviews.Author: royalton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our young child, in a small (deluxe) room - the desk took up so much of the space we were unable to keep our bags open and had to fold up our buggy each time we came in our room. there was no bath in the bathroom was it didn't score well for a family room ! We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and the breakfast is a buffet style with everything you could want. There was a rooftop outdoor swimming pool but unfortunately we were unable to use it as it was closed because it was raining. For the night markets this is a very good location (5 mins Temple St Market) and there are plenty of restaurants near by as well as convenice stores. We'd recommend a Chinese restaurant called Cheers around the corner (don't be put off by the name) good value for money very tasty chinese - the fish are taken live from a fish tank straight to the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good and great location”
Reviews.Author: TN2166
Reviews.Content: We went to Hong Kong and Macau on a whim from Sydney for a couple of weeks of snap hols. Booked the Eaton which was on Nathan Road because they had a great special, it came to around $AU90/night for the five nights were were there. For that price we didn't expect much, but we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was small (but all HK hotels are) but very comfortable with great comfy bed and even a courtesy international power adaptor plug. The room was the standard (lowest) for the price, so we only got a small CRT TV. The bathroom was large and very clean. And it's in a great location in Kowloon near Jordan MRT, near the Temple st markets and right on the Nathan Road shopping strip (although you should head to TST or the other way to Mongkok for more shopping). The rooms were very well insulated from the noise of the neighbouring rooms too. The swimming pool and gym on the top floor were good too. We would highly recommend the Eaton. It didn't surprise us when we found out it was part of the Langham group. The only minor let down was that the hotel's reception is on the fourth floor and so the ground floor was just a series of lifts, minor but it just didn't look much like a hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: natashaparmesh
Reviews.Content: It is good Business hotel . It is located in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelleywLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great stay at the Eaton Hotel over Easter this year. As with all Hong Kong hotels the rooms were small but perfectly formed and extremely comfortable, the room service breakfasts were huge (so big in fact we shared one breakfast between two of us) but its best point had to be the staff; they were fantastically friendly and very helpful, which is unfortunately not always the case in city hotels. The location was great for us too, within walking distance of plenty of restaurants and the Temple Street market and just a short MRT ride to the numerous other attractions. It was also part of the MRT/bus shuttle service to the airport, which worked out much cheaper than a taxi. While staying at the Eaton isn't cheap it is certainly great value for money and we will definitely be making a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: huow
Reviews.Content: === Stay : 3 nights at the Eaton hotel in May 2009 === Location : located in Kowloon, on Nathan road mid-way between Jordan et Yau Ma Tei stations. The location is good, on the lively area of Nathan road, less than 5 min walk from Jordan station. === Room : Deluxe room #1414 on floor 14. The room is small but new and clean, simply decorated. Room size can fit 2 persons if only for sleeping, not for living in. The bed is comfortable. On the 14th floor, the noise coming from the street is a small issue, the main issue is noise from the corridor as the room is not well soundproofed. === Bathroom : like the room, the bathroom is on the small side but clean though. No shower cabin, only a bathtub. === Amenities : in-room safe but too small to fit a laptop. Plug adapter is complementary. Network cable for laptop is complementary. In-room internet is charged about HK$ 140 for 24h. Swimming pool and fitness room available on the top floor of the hotel. === Service : staff was polite and helpful. === Conclusion : good hotel, good location. Would consider to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent middle of the road hotel”
Reviews.Author: extra_leg_room
Reviews.Content: I am quite surprised by some of the photos on this page,as it bears almost no resemblence to the room I stayed in. Our room was very clean, and of typical HK size (I imagine), and served the purpose of what we were looking for in a hotel for a four night stay in HK. Close to markets, 3 block walk to Metro (past about 100 'tailors' offering you a special deal on a suit which gets pretty annoying after day two!), and a decent enough bases if you don't mind staying on the Kowloon side of HK. The location is probably reflected in the price- but if you don't mind walking/taxi-ing/metro, then it represents not bad value I feel (we got our room for around $110 a night direct with hotel). Found the staff to be helpful when needed,and they were very accomadating when our onward travel plans were disrupted and we actually had to stay 8 days in the end (which was probably too much in hindsight!). In short, if you don't mind being Kowloon side, and you get a refurbished room, this is a decent enough 'mid-range' hotel to opt for during a short stay in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel which is a bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: wimbli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the second week of May for 5 nights in a City Club room with access to the e-club. After arriving at 11.30pm by taxi from the airport for HK$260, check-in was relatively smooth and quick. Our room was quite small with floor to ceiling windows with a 180 degree city view. Pity the view was of the back overlooking a few old buildings, nothing exciting. The bathroom was tiny and old, even though it was clean. For the price we paid, I was rather disappointed with the room. It was quiet though, and we couldn't hear anyone or the traffic. On our last night, the bathroom stunk a bit and we couldn't sleep because of the smell - it smelt like sewerage. The saving grace was access to the e-club. Breakfast was nice even if there wasn't a lot on offer - toast, bread rolls, croissants, pastries, cold meats, a variety of cheese, smoked salmon, cereals, boiled eggs, fruit platter, apple and orange juice, and tea and coffee. Everything was fresh and topped up by the attentive staff whenever anything got a bit low. The fridge contained soft drink, juice and water, and you could grab a drink at any time, even if you were heading out for the day. The evening cocktail and canapes was great. Even though they didn't offer cocktails in the technical sense of the term, you could get beer, wine or liquor. The food consisted of a selection of finger food from one of the hotel's three restaurants and all were very high quality and delicious! We relaxed in the e-club before and after our day out. The staff there were great - very friendly and attentive, they would clear your plate/glass quickly and help you with any problems. There was also two windows pcs and even a mac pc with internet access available, and a bunch of newspapers and books to read. We ate at the Japanese restaurant on one of our nights there. It was pretty expensive and I probably wouldn't go there again, but it was quite nice food. I don't think the location of the hotel is THAT great. It is on Nathan Rd in the middle of Jordan and very close to the Temple St night markets and Jade markets. But it is about three blocks away from the Jordan MTR which is fine in the morning, but it seemed quite far at the end of a few very long days of non-stop walking and shopping. Next time I think I'd pick somewhere closer to an MTR (which incidentally are so easy to use and very clean). So based on the room and location of the hotel, I wouldn't stay here again the next time I visited HK. It isn't too bad, but not worth what I paid in my opinion and there are probably better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Sulpice
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Hong Kong for the first time on our 40th Anniversary and the management and staff made our one week stay the best ever. The E-Club lounge staff were of great assistance for planning our daily excursions each day and were always welcoming at morning breakfast and afternoon cocktails. The location is a short walk to the Jordan MTR station which made our city travel easy. Will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: theccc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 7 nights on a business trip. I picked this hotel based on the reviews I found on TripAdvisor, and found most of the reviews pretty accurate. The location is in Jordan, not Tsim Sha Tsui as the hotel says - so it's not a great location for tourists who don't know their way around, but it is a short walk to the MTR and Temple Street market. Rooms were larger than I expected, and I was upgraded to a City Suite upon arrival. E-Club access isn't worth the extra money unless you plan having the free Happy Hour drinks (breakfast is very minimal) every night, but if it's already included in your price it's great. Buffet breakfast in the hotel was good and only 50HK. Gym facility small, but clean/new. Overall, a very good value for the price paid ($120USD/nt) .

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJ888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, i chose the dexule room as it was on offer. The location is not bad, just next to temple street, however i didn't know jordon is a mini red-light district, which did affect the mood there abit. The room itself is clean and roomy enough to place my lagguage and stuff(hk rooms are all small so comparatively this is better), but all the stuffs in the hotel are expensive, the room service, restaurant, internet access in the biz centre, idd call, pay movies. The tv channels are also limited. But maybe its just hong kong standard, that everything nids money, unlike shenzhen and guangzhou. but the hotel do give u a sense of security, and the hotel staffs are all v helpful and nice. n there is a tsui wah restaurant just next to the hotel which serve really good food, must- try when u're in hk!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and hotel”
Reviews.Author: zefferttlisa
Reviews.Content: Great service, hotel upgraded us on our arrival to a bigger room and on my birthday gave me a cake on my birthday, unrequested. I really appreciated the personal touch. The hotel was good value and was in a great location, close to the MTR station. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: vicnzsa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and paid HK$590 through a competitor's web site "mystery deal" So it was good value for money in HK. Location was I thought quite OK, mid way between Mong Kok and the Kowloon Star ferry. The Jordon MTR subway was only a 10 min walk down Nathan Road and I think the Yau Ma Tei MTR about the same up the road. Once in the MTR you can get almost anywhere. From the Airport just get the Airport Express train to the Kowloon terminal (about HK$160 return) and then up the lift to the free shuttle bus (Number K1) to the hotel door. I did find although that as this was the last drop of on this route that perhaps a taxi might have been a better idea after a long flight. On the other hand on the way back to the Kowloon terminal was very quick. My room was small but comfortable and I slept well. No breakfast in my cheap deal so a great cup of coffee and sandwich at Starbucks next door was good. Left my bag with the concierge for a few hours which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain”
Reviews.Author: Coffeeman1960
Reviews.Content: We visited the Eaton for 6 nights in early April. We had two rooms, one an executive room with a double and divan for our daughter, the other a standard twin. Both rooms were unrefurbished. We were informed that only the deluxe doubles were available refurbished, so these didn't meet our needs. The older rooms were not bad, just a little dated versus the boutique style of the refurbished rooms, the carpet could be declared somewhat worn but that would be nit-picking. In fact the rooms were perfectly okay, clean, beds comfortable, quiet, well-serviced though somewhat small as others have observed. There was a curious smell on our floor, though not in our room. The e-club was a great benefit with breakfast, daytime drinks and snacks and evening drinks canapes available free. We only found it occasionally busy and certainly not cramped as others have commented. Free wifi and PC/internet access made this a regular place to visit. Nicely done. We ate twice in the cafe-bar restuarant. Not cheap but we voted the food of high quality. Drinks in the bar are ridiculously expensive if you drink outside the happy hours so watch out before you order (an average £7 per drink for a round of beers and soft drinks). The Main St cafe in the lower basement was also good (a million times better than Starbucks on the corner - Avoid!) and also had free internet access. Service in the hotel was good and couldn't really be faulted. The gym was well-equipped and even if the rooftop pool was small it was pleasantly refreshing. The location is right in the heart of bustling Kowloon and a very different location from many of the other hotels (more expensive) in the more touristy parts of the city (Kowloon and Hong Kong sides). The Night Market and Ladies Markets are within strolling distance. Access to Metro, taxis and buses is perfect. A taxi ride to the harbour front for restaurants, sightseeing, hotels and Star Ferry is $18HK or less than £2 (and this is the most expensive way to travel). Otherwise we got an Octopus card for $150HK and used the public transport with ease. Overall we really couldn't complain, though we wouldn't rave about it either. There are certainly swankier hotels at suitably inflated prices but overall the Eaton fulfilled a role and did it at a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: atishay78
Reviews.Content: Great location.. in the heart of Kowloon district..with shops just a walking distance.. Taxis easily available at the hotel.. The staff was very helpful.. The cafe has delicious food.. It has computers with free internet service at great speed.. Even though hotel rooms in Hongkong are small in size.. this hotel had quite spacious rooms with enough space for an extra bed.. Great place to stay..

Reviews.Title: “Even better than I'd hoped!”
Reviews.Author: Belinda4
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews on this website before we went it was clear that opinions were divided over the rooms. But our standard room was very clean and was presumably one of the renovated ones. Yes it was small-ish but why would you need a bigger room anyway?! Couldn't fault this hotel at all...it was clean, the public areas were very glitzy and the staff were very friendly and efficient. They do great cocktails in the bar! You must try the all-chocolate afternoon tea at the Eaton.....£10 for a chocolate fondue and then as much as you can eat from the buffet of the most delectable mini chocolate desserts and cakes....plus tea served in china cups with teapot, strainer etc! We had breakfast at the Starbucks opposite every morning. Evening meals-wise we ate several times at pretty basic Chinese places on Nathan Road for next to nothing. More Western food was often a lot more expensive. The location was excellent. We were here for a week and as we were going into the New Territories and Lantau Island as well as Hong Kong island itself we were ideally placed , being in Kowloon. Don't think you're missing out because you're not on Hong Kong island itself. The MTR station on Jordon Road was only approx 5 mins walk away. Top places to visit....The Peak, the Giant Buddha and Tai O Fishing Village, the heritage trails and the Heritage Museum in the New Territories, the giant escalator (near lots of great restaurants), the harbour, the free light show (we went on a Star Ferry Cruise to see this but not really worth the money in our opinion i.e just as good from the shore for free), the Hong Kong History Museum, Stanley village, Temple night market......Happy Valley Racing on a Weds night is a must! The MTR is brilliant...and if you're staying for a week or more get an Octopus card which works on the buses and the trams too. There are lots of organised tours which are pretty pricey...fine if you have limited time or mobility....but otherwise the public transport is so good that I strongly recommend you do your own thing. I am not an adventurous traveller at all so if I can do this anyone can! Great holiday and great hotel...would definitely use the Eaton again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - professional staff, and good location. Would definitely stay here again. Clean comfortable rooms with”
Reviews.Author: crackerjackLincs_
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with professional helpful staff. Very good location in Nathan Road for shopping. Would definitely come back to this hotel. Rooms comfortable clean with good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: doddi
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night on way home from Australia. Not sure why other reviewers said rooms to small as basic room more than adequate with room to move around easily. View from window was over Nathan Road and was great to see the neon lights down the road, and great views of the glass elevators which we did not realise the hotel had untail we looked out of the window. Great position for markets - night and local and about 30 minutes stroll to the ferries for a trip to Hong Kong Island well worth doing. We had meal in the bar next to reception which was really good and breakfast a excellent buffet. Everyone very friendly and efficient. would definately stay at this hotel again if i return to hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: McFarlanesAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 22nd-27th March 2009 on our way back from the UK and were very happy with it. The room was fine ( at 1st we did not know what to expect as we had read that the rooms were very small). We had ample room and were very comfortable. The staff were very obliging- food was 1st class- especially the buffet breakfast- would certainly stay again if visiting Honk Kong- easy walk down to Harbour- approx 25 minutes- and close to markets and public transport

Reviews.Title: “Go for the E-Club suite for sure”
Reviews.Author: One-and-Only-Aly-G
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic rooom which was one of the suites with use of the E-Club which was absolutely fantastic. The staff in their were lovely and couldn't do enough for you...it had free internet access and it was great to be able to go and get free drinks from there anytime during the day. The breakfast was basic but perfectly adequate. The hotel is located quite far up Nathan Road but only a short walk from the Jordan MTR station. It's also well located for Temple Street too. I did a half day tour and overheard some people saying how small the rooms were at the Eaton - they obviously hadn't gone the suite route!!! My room had a separate lounge area with TV etc and then a bedroom with another tv and a fantastic iPod docking station. Bathroom was perfectly adequate - a tad on the small side but all in all I couldn't fault this hotel. The only thing that's a little confusing is the layout of the reception and exit which are on different floors. If I was going to HK again I'd definitely stay here but definitely do the suite-route. I'd booked the room on the third day as "day-use" which meant I had it until 6pm. As I wasn't being picked up until 9pm I asked to keep it another couple of hours and this only cost $50HK (about £10) - totally happy with that. Oh, the only complaint was that the bed was the HARDEST I've ever had and that, for me, was a negative point. Finally, I checked out the gym and pool and as always they aren't as great as the hotel website would make out - equipment dated and the gym was tiny so I didn't bother using it. The weather (I was there in March) wasn't warm enough to warrant me using the outdoor pool!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SENIUM
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and have been staying several times. Hotel is very clean and very welcoming. The location itself is one of the best, on Nathan Road, in between Jordan and Yau Ma Tei MTR stations. Can access teh hotel from the side street, almost in front of Nathan Hotel entrance. PLenty of shopping and places to eat around there. Easy walk to Tsim Sha Tsui or to Mongkok and the various markets. Room is not big but well arranged with desk and LCD TV integrated in the wall. There is an iPod dock next to the bed. I never ate at the hotel but there is a major Japanese restaurant in the hotel. Breakfast is quite expensive but with a lot of variety. There is internet access in the room but not free. I'll be staying there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at e-club, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: scot130
Reviews.Content: We had booked suite-initially given non modernised one which was old,tired and dull-asked for change and immediately given upgrade at no extra charge. Suite was modern with nice power shower. The service in the E-Club was excellent. The staff couldn't do enough to help and it was lovely to just go to 1st floor when you got back to the hotel and get cold drinks and a snack. Staff had all the info you needed at their fingertips.E club staff had champagne and a cake sent up for a birthday-very nice. The rooms were kept very clean and nice touches like slippers laid out at night. Hotel was very well located-5 min walk to MTR and across the road from the Temple St market. AVOID CAMERA SHOPS NEAR THE HOTEL-THEY WILL RIP YOU OFF.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: NYorks_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. The first room we were given was tired and very small, we complained and were then moved to a club room after 2 nights (the hotel was having some refurb work done so not all rooms were available). The 2nd room was very staff, the service from the staff was excellent throughout - at breakfast, reception, the concierge even the housekeeping was excellent. The hotel seemed to have a mix of families, couples and business travellers and was in a good location on Nathan Road in Kowloon. Free internet access in the downstairs cafe was good. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my fave hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: AngelClaud
Reviews.Content: The renovated Eaton Hotel is fabulous. The room has a simple and modern look, a bit small but contained all the necessary amneties, facilities, etc. It even has a radio/alarm clock/speaker dock for ipod! Location-wise it's very convenient. From the airport you can take a bus that stops near the hotel (just around 10 minutes walk). It's located on the shopping area in Kowloon. Lots of good restaurants, shops, clothes, electronics, jewelries, almost anything you want could be found in that area. It's also near the 'temple street', which is like a night market. It's also near the MRT/subway station. A very good starting point for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: aj_chopra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from the 24th to the 27th of January, 2007. Here is a summary of my views: 1. Located very close to the Temple Street Night Market and right on the Golden Mile stretch. However, its a good. 1 mile walk to the Star Ferry which is at the opposite end of the stretch. 2. Great rooms, nice bed, slightly small but very comfortable. 3. Flat Screen TV with good number of English Channels. I did have a bad experience at the hotel though. I am used to using a calling card to call home in India and have never been charged for using them by the hotel in case I use the room telephone to call. However, Eaton does charge HK$20 for calling the toll free access numbers. So beware!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: SUNSHINEWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: Great location at the top of Nathan Road, staff are efficient , friendly and helpull, Breakfast is first class.The rooms are smaller than average but the bathroom is clean and roomy.Loved the glass lifts...

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denis9
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny, smelt of stale smoke even though we requested no smoking. no room to hang up a shirt, unhelpful staff. First and last visit.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Photos are Lies! - Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: erwk05
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a decent hotel in Hong Kong for a three night stay last March. Looking at the Hotel ranking (quite high up) and the Star rating (4 stars) I assumed this one was worth a closer look. According to their website "most club rooms have floor to ceiling windows." We arrived at the eaton expecting something similar maybe but we ended up with a similar experience to another review on here. we were taken to a very dated slightly smelly room with a view of the slums. utterly depressing atmosphere. we requested to change immediately and even offered to pay more for a better room. we were told this was the best they have. they moved us to one on the other side of the block still with part views of the slums but the room looked like it was revovated more recently and not smelly(still dated feel though.) overall I didnt lke the rooms at all, they were so small. HOWEVER this hotel did have a couple of redeeming factors, the Eclub Lounge buffet was nice (not big but nice to be in your private section) and the best think of all was the sushi bar downstairs. I would class myself as a bit of a sushi connosieur and this has been some of the best I have had. A little pricey but worth it. The location was also pretty good close to the night markets and not too far to walk to the all day markets.

Reviews.Title: “good spot to explore Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: kmjoz
Reviews.Content: This is a lovley big hotel in a good spot to explore HK. Our room was a bit small but it was fine for what we needed - just somewhere to rest and freshen up and then we were out and about all of the time - we would definately stay here again. Cant comment on the food as we always ate out and never tend to eat in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolynrose
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in Hong Kong at the Eaton Hotel. For 3 people, we booked an E Club 1 bedroom Suite. The overall room size is on the small side so having 1 bedroom, a bathroom and a sitting area was a good choice. The sofa in the sitting room makes into a bed and there were 2 TV sets. Therefore, there wasn't a fee for the third person. There was a view of Nathan Rd. from the sitting area. Included with the suite was a bottle of wine and a fruit platter. The E Club was superb including a full breakfast with lox, rolls, fruit and hot food. In addition, there was an evenng reception including beer, wine, mixed drinks and appetizers. The E Club rate also offers free Internet service and private check-in. The location is about 2-3 blocks from the Jordan subway station. We liked the location because it wasn't a tourist area and it offered many reasonable and authentic Chinese restaurants. We liked the Shamrock Restaurant on Nathan Rd. very much. There is a 7-Eleven across the street from the hotel. The common areas of the hotel are very nice and the service was excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would book the Eaton again on our next trip to fabulous Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TheresaMc
Reviews.Content: We spent eleven nights there over the past two weeks; the purpose of the trip was to get to know Hong Kong a little better (we've only been there for short times before now).
