The Eaton was a great place to stay for that. We stayed in a two-room suite -- clearly all the rooms in the hotel are comparatively small, but the two-room gave us plenty of space for the stay. (Note: if you travel from the US you'll need a plug converter and adaptor, but don't worry, if you didn't bring one there are about twelve electronics shops within a two-block radius). The room was clean when we checked in and was kept spotless throughout the stay. Lobby and other public areas were small but very attractive and always very, very clean; and the lobby atrium really does give the hotel an elegant feeling. The pool is small but the area is pleasant, and they even heated the pool for part of the stay! Hotel staff was uniformly courteous and the concierge was always able to set us up with restaurant reservations -- if our choice wasn't available, they came up with a good alternative. Food and beverages were pretty good -- the hotel's Cantonese retaurant was pretty authentic (even the locals were eating there), its Metro Bar and Grill was a little thin on entree choices but everything we tried was tasty. As part of our package we had access to the E Club, which I recommend; the continental breakfasts always included eggs and meats as well as the usual, and the complementary Internet access (three computers) was really useful. The location, however, is one of the Eaton's best features. Two blocks to the Jordan MTR station; but it's a pleasant walk all the way to the waterfront. In between (once you get past the tailor touts), there's Kowloon Park and some good shopping. Temple Street Night Market is just a block away across Nathan Road. Taxis are constantly passing by the hotel's driveway (altho' if you can't get a taxi in Hong Kong, you either aren't trying or you're someplace you shouldn't be), and are really inexpensive. In short, you can get anywhere from the hotel without any trouble, and the hotel itself is a fine place to rest after each day's adventures. Especially as an alternative to the expensive but cocooned feeling you can get from the Sheraton or Intercontinental, etc, the Eaton is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff but Ordinary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kct1223
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Club floor room for 5 nights. The check in was a pleasant experience with a private check in available on the E Club. Initally I requested a twin beds room as I wanted my daughter to sleep on her own. However, when I entered the room, I was totally shocked. It was a small, dated and poorly decorated room. The wall paper were wrinkled up, the TV was at least fifteen years "Sharp" old fashioned one. I rang to request to change room. To my surprise, I was already "upgraded" to the Executive suite! The gentleman in the E club was very helpful and quickly arranged another room on the 9th floor. It was a small but a freshly updated double bed room. After a nine - hour flight, we were looking for a good night sleep. However, it was another disppointment. We could clearly hear what the neighbour were talking. Even my daughter asked why it was so noisy. I found out that room was adjacent to the next room ,only separted by a door. The next morning, I spoke to the E club manager, she assisted me immediately and eventually we moved to another room on the same floor, this time it was much better.This room was separated by a wall not a wooden door. Besides this 'experience', others are fine. But I suggest to choose at least Club Floor because there is a private check - in avail. Also breakfast are provided in the lounge, though not the best, but adequate and the environment is quite comfortable with interent access as well. In order to avoid the congestion in the lobby reception, it is a better choice. The staff are polite and helpful. I would specially praise the gentleman working in the E club and the manager of it.

Reviews.Title: “Seen Better”
Reviews.Author: soderblom
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small (this IS Hong Kong though), service was spotty, rooftop 'pool' is VERY small. My main beef with the Eaton is that I arrived at 9PM and was told my room wouldn't be ready for an hour. Well, given that Check-In time is 3PM, I was rather pissed. They gave me a free beer coupon and had the room ready in 30 minutes, but after a 15 hour flight, this was not the best way to start my stay. Other than that, it was just OK. I got a deal through Travelocity, but had I paid full price I would have not been happy. Get a good deal, stay less than 3 nights, and you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Trasero
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel from 30th December 2008 till 2nd January 2009. Below are the pros and cons of our stay at his hotel:- 1. Receptionists and all the staff are very polite. GREAT. 2. Metro Buffet Grill served an awesome Breakfast. LOVE IT. 3. Location : 3 minutes walk to Jordan Station, near to some shopping complexes, a minute to Night market, near to Jade market: EXCELLENT. 4. Concierges are very friendly and helpful. :) 5. Room are very small. I agree with some of the comment made by other reviews. UPSET. 6. Bad experience: My family and I were stucked in the lift for 5 minutes but we managed to use the emergency bell for assistance. The assistance responded immediately and helped us through and eventually evacuated from the lift safely. SCARY but COOL. 7. Swimming pool: Unable to use it as it was under construction on that particular date. OK.

Reviews.Title: “How did this hotel end up ranking #25 in Tripadvisor ?”
Reviews.Author: MouMou
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this through the Cathay Pacific 's SuperCity package. OK, it is a good deal. So we get what we paid for. Here's my notes on Eaton : Free airport shuttle to hotel : Available Proximity to MTR : 5 mins walk to Jordan Station. Exit B1 Reception: Busy Busy Busy. Long queue, curt & don't listen. Decor of reception: Excellent for a 4-star hotel Rooms: We got twin & SMOKING room. Not want we want. Service recovery: Poor. We had to ask for room deodorant. Personnel: Can't be bothered attitude. WE COMPLAINED. Rooms (try again): Next day, it was a double & non-smoking. Amenities: Acceptable. No bed-room slippers. No bath-robes. Size of rooms : Both Twin & Double rooms are SMALL. Room Decor : Dated but functional. Views : Concrete jungle Broadband : You gotta pay Wifi : None! If the hotel has broadband, it is easy to set-up wifi. Gym : Top floor. Small but suffices. Swimming Pool: Very nice! Wd be really great in summer. Breakfast: Not important. Tsui Wah is just opposite. Vicinity: A lot of good local food. Near to Temple Street. Conclusion: It is a functional hotel catering to mainly tour-groups and travellers not wanting to splurge on accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with rooms”
Reviews.Author: Parkymarg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton on our way back to UK from Australia. Booked an executive suite (£195.00 per night) but on arrival the room was smaller than YHA Room (£30.00) we had in Cairns. The staff appeared not to that interested in my complaint. When questioned there were other Suites available but they were not offered. We were sent Questionnaire by Hotel and we Indicated that we would like a reply still have not heard a thing to date. Staff rarely got any drink order correct from the garden restaurant bar.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY! Unless you like to sleep in a coffin!”
Reviews.Author: richdad1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel from Cathay Pacific's (CP) SuperCity package list of Hong Kong (HK) hotels - since it ranked quite high here (25/187 hotels in HK). [By the way, if you don't mind really old planes and UNcomfortable business class seats with NO on-demand movies, fly CP!] Eaton hotel's DELUXE ROOM is so small + with ALL their windows completely sealed up, we felt like we were in a coffin! If anyone thinks all hotels in HK are as small, just walk across the street to Nathan hotel (less than ONE minute walk) or Novotel about TWO minutes walk down the street. Bottom line: We checked out of Eaton Hell-tel as quickly as we could - after Eaton's staff informed us that their Club Floor rooms were just as tiny! It doesn't matter if their staff were super friendly and the room were super clean - when a room feels like a coffin, you want to check out even if it were free! [We stayed at Shanghai Eaton earlier this year (2008), although the rooms at Shanghai Eaton were far from big, we could still stay 6 nights without complaints.] Nathan is a much nicer hotel - for less! The only complaint we have of Nathan hotel is their fake Club Lounge, it is VERY, VERY small and you get cold, cheap & lousy snacks. The only good thing about their lounge - their coffee. Beats Starbucks handsdown! (Pray to God you don't need help from Eaton's Reservations Supervisor, Stella Ng, she will make sure you feel UNwelcome!)

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: kohkoh
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the centre of Kowloon. Very small rooms and I was offered a single king size bed. Cant remember the last time I was offered this size of bed, OK because I was travelling without my partner but expensive. Did not have breakfast as it was not included in the room rate. Moved on to the Royal Plaza, Kowloon. Better value, much larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms & A so-so Experience”
Reviews.Author: devil-m
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Hong Kong last night, which means yesterday also marked the end of my 3 nights' stay at Eaton Hotel. I was deciding between Kowloon Hotel (great location) and Eaton but chose Eaton in the end because of the no. of great reviews I read here. Unfortunately, we had a bad start. We arrived at 2pm but was told our room would only be ready earliest by 3pm. We were extremely irritated by this fact because we desperately needed to take a shower, a short nap before heading out. Furthermore, the man serving us was a trainee. He was in no way trying to be rude, but I note that he didn't apologise a single time for this inconvenience caused to us. We were placated with a free welcome drink each, but honestly, it didn't make us feel any better. We returned at around 4pm. The same staff said one of the bathroom lights is not working but if we don't mind, we can go up to the room now. He also said he will take a FEW HOURS to repair. We were horrified! WHAT? Wait even longer?? So we said we would go up to take a look...and we realised...the light that was supposedly malfunctioning was a small light underneath the sink and totally insignificant. I figured we must be one of the really unfortunate ones. That incident aside, all was ok. The room was clean, small but not till unbearable standards. Everything was in order, but no toothbrush/toothpaste provided. TV was working, but don't expect HBO. Location is okay, close to temple street, 5 - 10 mins walk from Jordan MTR. For lazy people like me, I would prefer a hotel closer to the MTR. All in all, it was still a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Convenient to Transportation!”
Reviews.Author: piggipiggy
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal through Orbitz and after some coupon codes we were able to get this hotel for $80 usd/night. We stayed there for 3 nights from Nov 24-27 and found the location extremely convenient. I had written to the hotel prior to arrival and received email responses right away. I was informed that I can take the A21 bus from the airport for only $33 HKD and it takes about 40 minutes. The hotel is conveniently located to the Jordan station and right across from Temple St Night Market. It's about a 15 min walk to Mongkok. We were offered a free upgraded room upon arrival. The room was a bit small but it was very comfortable with a LCD tv and good decor. There are a lot of good food in the area. There are free computer terminals to use on the ground level but it is usually packed with people waiting to use it. We had a really good experience with the hotel and would recommend this hotel to people visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tripp813
Reviews.Content: Great location, Clean rooms and friendly staff. Great location only 3 blocks to the MTR (Subway). Rooms are on the small side but is common in China. Internet charge if used in your room, but FREE if you use the EClub on level 1. 3 computers or use your laptop wireless for free there. The free breakfast each day and free drinks and snacks at night were just the thing to start or end our day. Only 1 block from the Temple night market and Jade markets. Star ferry to Hong Kong Island is about a 30 minute walk or a short taxi ride for 20 hong kong dollars( About $5 USD). The roof top heated pool and Full gym was awesome. Restutants on site were a bit costly but there are tons of places to eat near the hotel with GREAT food and cheap. One is just scross the street from the hotel. They do not speak english there but have a menu which is in english and photos to point to.. GREAT food there.. Hotel and Most places we found people to speak english (Somehwhat) They love to try.. Younger people speak very good english and never found it a problem getting around on the busses or taxis. Will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgibbison
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton in an Executive room for 14 nights in November 2008. On arrival we were given the older style Executive room (with curved windows). The room (1301) was small and in need of renovation so we asked if we could be given one of the newer Executive rooms. Staff were more than happy to assist and we soon had ourselves a newer room on the 14th floor. Bed was very large, room had an average size TV and bathroom was great. All was very clean. Having access to the E-club was excellent. The breakfasts were always nice and the free beer, wine, champagne and spirits on offer from 5:30pm to 7:30pm each evening were always welcome. It was great to come back after a day out and have a few drinks before heading out again or having an early night. The Internet access was always useful for checking out places to visit, comparing shopping prices etc. Staff were also fantastic, always happy to assist. I would recommend the Eaton to anyone and would stay there again in the future. Make sure you get a club room or higher though for access to the E-club, it is worth every cent. Getting a birthday card (and chocolates) from the Hotel on my birthday was also a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Safe bet”
Reviews.Author: clairetokyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Eaton in an executive room. Rooms compact but faultless and staff very helpful. A few minor annoyances - you have to pay 130 dollars per day for Wifi and I had real problems making international calls, but for price and location this hotel is a safe bet. Nice bar and small roof terrace on 4th floor, similar prices to other HK places, and lots of shops and markets etc closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..”
Reviews.Author: lp-james
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Hong Kong and can not fault the staff or hotel. The location is great only a short stroll to Jordan Stn and the night and ladies market. The staff were great breakfast buffet great and the room very clean good view of Jordan Street. Would definatley return and recommend to anyone. There is a 7eleven just opposite which is great fro drinks and pleanty of eating options even at the night markets you can get a good cheap feed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Eaton”
Reviews.Author: Tillybilly_77
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 of us stayed at the Eaton for 7 nights in November for a trip that was half holiday half business. I was responsible for selecting accommodation and change our booking at the last minute to the Eaton after the terrible exchange rate with the HK $ to the `AUD$. We were supposed to stay at the Excelsior on Hong Kong Island, but moved to the cheaper Kowloon side. We all took rooms with access to the E club lounge, which is definatley worth the money. All email and phone calls to the hotel prior where answered promptly. We arrived at the hotel at about 9 am after a overnight flight, we were sent to the 1st floor E club lounge, and asked if we wanted breakfast whilst check in was completed. I requested that one of our 4 rooms booked could be made available to us that morning. After a pleasant buffet breakfast we were presented the keys to all the rooms. This level of service continued through our stay with recommendations for restaurants, booking high tea at the intercontinental (amazing views!) and booking a mini bus to take us all back to the airport. We stayed in Club rooms, which were small but adequate, we weren't in the rooms much. I requested a non feather pillow from house keeping and that was provided promptly. If staying with the access to E Club, make the most of the drinks and canapes served from around 5.30 to 7.30, some nights we made this our dinner, with champagne, wine, spirits, dips, crackers, cheese board, mini wraps etc etc. We would definitely recommend the hotel and will stay there again, we liked staying on the Kowloon side and it is within easy walking distance to the Jordan MTR station, or a 20 min walk down to the star ferry. If you are looking for cheap eats try the food hall at the Harbour City mall near the star ferry. We did try the hotel restaurant once, but it was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton hotel,Hongkong is excellent”
Reviews.Author: BlitzGent
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Eaton Hotel the first week of October. It was our first trip to Hongkong. The Eaton Hotel is a winner. We were welcomed as soon as we got of the (shuttle) bus and our luggage was taken up. The whole stay the staff could not have been more friendly. Breakfast is a joy. Very well organised , no waiting times etc . We advise this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A haven”
Reviews.Author: pcpam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a two night stopover in Hong Kong on our way home from England and Paris to break the journey home to New Zealand. The location of this hotel was extremely good being right on Nathan Road and with the MTR only two blocks away. We paid a little more to stay in E Club level and found it money well spent. The rooms were beautifully appointed, very quiet despite being so centrally located and very comfortable. One of the bonuses of the E Club is that not only was a full buffet breakfast included but there was also a happy hour at the end of the day which included drinks and substantial h'ors d'euvres which we could have made dinner - thats how generous the spread was. Added to the above, E Club provided its own concierge services which made it all very personal. Getting to the hotel from the airport was extremely steamlined - we took the Airport Express Train from inside the terminal to the main central station in Kowloon and then a courtesy shuttle was provided as part of the train fare cost which took us to the Eaton Hotel. We would recomend this hotel to anyone wanting a restful, relaxed and comfortable stay while spending time in busy, exciting and hot Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dusty2dusty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton for four nights. Very good hotel. Rooms are clean although small. Staff very friendly, always available to give advice. Situated on the Nathan road, not far from the MRT. Also close to the Jade market.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely overrated”
Reviews.Author: kermadek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 10 days during September 2008. Overall, we were not impressed with our stay at all, and most likely, we will not stay there again. The hotel itself is well presented, but the room we stayed in was so worn out that it definitely should not be part of a 4* hotel. We stayed in the E-club's executive room, but the room had feeling of an ordinary 3* star hotel witch need to be refurbished. I have attached few pictures: the table lamp fixed with the tape, the plastered wall, mold on the wall, leaking windows, and broken lamp. All these do not provide the level of comfort everyone would expect from a 4 star hotel (especially proclaimed to be the best 4* hotel in Hong Kong). I also have to add that air conditioner was extremely noisy and did not provide any real help in the +35 C, and the cold and hot water was so similar in temperature that it made any shower really uncomfortable. The TV in the room was very old CRT with very poor quality of picture. The room service one of the worst I ever seen, during 10 days of our stay no one even tried to dust bed side tables or clean glasses. The E-club lounge is very small and often just overcrowded, with a very limited amount of snacks. Overall all it would have been more convenient to pay for the room only and purchase breakfast separately from a restaurant. The Business Centre provided extremely poor and very expensive services. E.g. to print A4 page cost HKD 10. The Internet is rather expensive too with a daily rate of HKD 130 or weekly HKD 700. The free Internet access in E-club was for 20 mins only and could not cover needs of business travelers. The location of Hotel is rather uninteresting and little bit unconventional unless you are planning to spend every night in Temple Street Market. The nearest MTR station is about 7-10 mins walking time from Hotel. Overall the hotel is extremely overrated and I can't understand the excitement of some reviews here. Very ordinary hotel, with very ordinary facilities, in a very ordinary location. It is so easy to find more comfort and better value in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy rooms, but great service”
Reviews.Author: schweetb
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying at the Eaton. I was skeptical at first because I had booked the reservations online with Hotels.com. I wanted to reconfirm my reservations with the hotel via emailing the Eaton hotel email but have not heard any response. Finally I called them long distance from Vancouver, BC, and confirmed my reservation. Upon arrival I experience great service with at the Bell desk and as well at the front counter. The rooms were quite small, considering it was the Deluxe Room with 2 single beds. However, the service and the cleanliness do make up for the limited room space. The lounge was relaxing, while the great singers completed the ambiance. The location is conveniently located near an MTR plus hailing down a taxi was easy. I would definately stay at the Eaton again on my next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “chic”
Reviews.Author: bodget
Reviews.Content: stayed here on 2 occasions in september. on 1st visit we had a non smoking room obviously recently renovated. on the 2nd occasion the wife stated she must have a smoking room. higher up than last time but not refurbished and a bit dated. pool is fine if a bit small as are the rooms but not tiny. my brother was staying at the prudential close by and the rooms were larger if not as well decorated. you are paying extra at the eaton because it has a outside area to smoke and drink if you choose to do so. free internet access available in the coffee shop in the basement (your supposed to by a coffee to use). hotel is 5-6 mins from jordan mtr or you can get a number of buses that travel up and down nathan road, we usually looked for the 1 and 1a.

Reviews.Title: “a little disappointing considering it's a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Joethting
Reviews.Content: The location is great but the rroms are small but i guess it's expected. Generally, a forgettable hotel, neither here nor there

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: BazJackSalisbury
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great base for a short visit. Not too expensive which means you can afford to upgrade to the E-Club service which includes breakfast and gets you a bigger room. Handy for MTR station which opens up the whole place to you. Ate in a couple of times and found the food excellent and the staff very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobmcc33
Reviews.Content: This place is unbelievable... There were 5 of us in 2 rooms and, having read previous reviews, we decided to upgrade to the E-Club rooms. We are very glad we did since the complementary breakfasts and 2 hours Happy Hour with delicious snacks was just excellent. The E-Club on the 1st floor allowed us to relax, eat to our heart's content (saved a lot on food since we didn't need to eat in the evening) and the kids could check emails, play games and feel like they belonged. The rooms were great, although we had asked for 2 non-smoking rooms and on entry it was clear that the previous guest had ignored the non-smoking floor signs. No problem... a quick word to reception and someone was up with air freshener liquid immediateley. They even plugged in an air freshener machine next day when we were out. They had offered us another room but we wanted both rooms on the same floor. On the day of departure we explained we had a late (11pm) flight... Again no problem... we could leave our bags at reception, have another action packed day in HK, then back to the hotel to use the pool and showers, then into the E-Club for drinks and snacks before going to the airport. This made a huge difference to our day since we didn't have to worry about luggage, and we could have a shower and food before our flight. The staff were very friendly, especially with the kids. The hotel is well situated close to Temple St. Market but we found the Ladies Market to be much better. All in all, we would recommend this hotel for anyone, and we have.

Reviews.Title: “So SO hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Perspective
Reviews.Content: Hello, lived here quite a few times in the suite and club rooms.. lived here because it was near this place i need to be early in the morning.. although i lived here quite a few times i must say this hotel is expensive and not worth it.... all the rooms and suites are tiny... Service rubbish.. the general manager actually gave me to live here free for quite a few times because i kept giving them useful info of my stay.. but if he is letting me stay here again i will refuse.. cannot stand this place.. well you can tell if it is worth living here now after you see my info

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE, heaven for low budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: travelgaljkt
Reviews.Content: I love eaton! got a really great deal from their website. I was travelling solo and the location is perfect! 5 minute walk from Jordan MTR station,... and surrounded by local shops. tried their breakfast, it's ok but not great, but don't worry starbucks and other deli is just around the corner. Room is a bit small, but hey.. for the price.. who cares? bathroom is compact but very clean and modern. Room has what mimicks a flat screen tv (it's actually a tv in a box), small wardrobe, working desk and chair... and a great suprise... they have one of those IPOD docks with alarm!!!... overall, i enjoyed my stay and really recommend EATON for budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great until the bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: going_there_now
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great until the bed bug bites showed up and created havoc. Have stayed in this hotel many times before and never experienced problems until now. Therefore, I am not going to blame the hotel because the bed bugs could have came from previous hotel guests. The hotel placed us in another room but we worried that the bed bugs might have came home with us. We left the day after but still developed new bites. When we returned home, we had to wash everything down with bleach and hydrogen peroxide including luggages. Terrible experience. From now on, we are going to bring a small flashlight and check every nook and cranny for bugs first before taking any room at any hotel anywhere. In case you are wondering, we still paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: rtapple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel for two weeks from 10-24th August 08. The rooms were adequate and clean but on the small side. The food is top quality and as other reviews say - it is expensive - but you get what you pay for in life. There are 3 proper restaurants which are excellent. The drinks are steep but the Planters bar has a 2-1 happy hour from 6 til 9. You also get free/money off vouchers when you check in to use in all the 6 restuarants and bars within the hotel. The service could not be improved on and everyone is very helpful. The hotel is also in a great location for seeing all of Hong Kong and beyond. It is 3min walk to the nearest mtr station. There is also a gym and pool on the top floor. All in all a top hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, terrible service (front office)”
Reviews.Author: aloka7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on other traveler reviews and the main motivation was the location. I was not disappointed with the location at all, it was fabulous, near the temple street market, near the Jordan train station and a 20 min walk from tshim sha shui and mong kok in opposite directions. Yes its true that the rooms are pretty small but they do have all the facilities you need especially when you just need a room just to catch some shut eye. But, not all was hunky dory. the front office staff were appalling and we got terrible service. We did not get the rooms we booked for 2 hours since we checked in, though we had requested for an early check in. While checking out, though we checked out early in the morning and stored our bags, the front office did not let us leave just as we were loading our bags in the car even though we were just waiting around to leave. Some mix up regarding the billing was something they were fumbling with and eventually though they realised it was a mistake there was absolutely no apology and any sense of embarrassment. I have travelled alot and I was not prepared for the un friendly treatment we got from the concierge either. All in all, terrible service apart from that, everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, shame about the money”
Reviews.Author: Gringravitas
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 13th floor with a great view down Nathan road. The room must have been newly renovated as it was set out and furnished with quality. The other floors being renovated during the day didnt bother us at all. The service and staff at the hotel and all its restaurants were exceptional and were always willing to accomodate us. The rooftop pool was had great surroundings and in general the hotel looks really nice. We got an early booking deal and got a continental beakfast each day which consistedof either 3 small criossants, 3 slices of toast or 3 small danishes + juice, a bowl of fruit & tea. We tried the buffet dinner which was nice and the Cantonese restaurant which has some of the best dim sum I have had. My only complaint was that we were charged a 10% service charge on the room rate quoted on the internet that I didnt see listed anywhere (Dont know if I just didnt look hard enough or if this is standard in HK) and on our last day once checked out they wouldnt let me charge my laptop anywhere without paying for the use of a computer in the business centre. Otherwise, the stay was great and I would recommend to anyone. Just be aware of the service charge when you compare price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: ysouk
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is quite good. It is located in between Jordan and Yau Ma Tei station. If you don't mind walking, you can take a 15-20 mins walk to Mongkok too. The room is small but new. Asked for a non-smoking room but there is still a strong cigarette smell in the room. The room has a LCD TV and the shower is separate from the bath tub. Some of the rooms are currently under renovation, it can be quite noisy from 10am to 5.30pm. The hotel should give a discount during this period. In general, I find HK hotels overpriced. However, if you are on a tight budget, suggest that you stay in Kowloon. You get better rooms at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eaton”
Reviews.Author: AH65
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from two weeks at the Eaton in Hong Kong, myself, my husband and our 16 year old daughter, and we could not have wished for better. We booked one of the club rooms which was brilliant (recently refurbished ). With the club room breakfast is included as is drinks and snacks all day and also a 2hr happy hour in the evening these were taken in the Eclub on the 1st floor where all the staff were very nice and helpful especially Ter. The roof terrace has a lovely pool and gym where Billy always greeted us with a warm welcome. The hotel is ideally situated on Nathan Road with the Temple, Jade and Ladies markets all within walking distance. The transport system in Hong Kong is second to none and made getting anywhere very easy buses were available just outside the hotel and the MTR station was a few minutes away, either would take you to the Star ferry which was also within walking distance. (20 mins maybe). As I mentioned we had a refurbished room, the refurbishments are on going but as they were working from around 10 til 5 did not bother us in the slightest. We were very glad we chose to go for two weeks as there is lots to do and see in Hong Kong and with the pool at the hotel it afforded us the opportunity to relax in between sightseeing days which was very welcome as the heat and humidity was energy sapping. To sum up we had a lovely holiday at the Eaton in Hong Kong and would like to say a big thank you to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Awesome Location!!”
Reviews.Author: girlish_sista
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Eaton Hotel for a week in late November 2007. We were originally booked at another hotel, but changed when we looked at the location of the Eaton as well as some of the good reviews it had received. The location couldn't have been better. We were litterally a 2 minute walk to the start of the temple street night markets, and were surrounded by little restuarants, and of course plenty of jewelry stores. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a corner room, which was very spacious and featured floor to ceiling windows, with some lovely views of the city. Our room entitled us to Club Access, and we were very impressed. Was nice to be able to relax with a drink and a snack after a long day - definitely worth the little extra. The room itself was always cleaned very well, and the staff were very attentive. The only negative was that the bed was extrememly hard and the pillows very very soft, although this seemed to be a trend in North Asia. The general hotel facilities were well maintained and the staff were very courteous and helpful with taxis, sightseeing, tailors, etc. The restaurants were also very nice, and the dim sum on the lower floor was some of the best I have had. I would not hesitate in returning to the Eaton, and can recommend for anyone looking for a good 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: beachedmermaid
Reviews.Content: We wanted a bit of glamour (on a budget) when we got to Hong Kong, and we were pleasantly surprised with the service and quality of this hotel. The room was small, and a bit dark but bed was clean, bathroom was clean, and we lived there comfortably for 4 days. When you're in Hong Kong, you spend the least time in the hotel anyway. Hopefully they refurbish this to more contemporary standards soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Ms_KP
Reviews.Content: I was a little unsure about this hotel as i had read mixed reviews. When we arrived our room wasn't ready but we given another room on a higher floor which was perfectly fine. Staff were polite and very helpful - when we enquired about good electrical stores they even told us which shops to stay clear of that are likely to try and rip-off tourists, in addition to providing good recommendations. Location is good. It's not far from a MRT station, and to be honest the walk down to the Kowloon harbour is not that long (about 15-20 mins). The breakfasts were nice, and they offered a good variety. The rooms are very compact but they are really nice and very clean. The bathroom was lovely. The room even had a ipod docking station which was great to have. This really is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience...if a little pricey!”
Reviews.Author: RWKT1
Reviews.Content: A good start - having arrived at 8am (after an 11 hour Qantas flight), the hotel managed to have one of our 2 rooms available, and the 2nd was ready less than an hour later! Great location - halfway down Nathan Road and everything is within a 10 minute cab ride (which costs about £1.50). The rooms themselves are a good size, very clean, well air conditioned, and have a surprisingly comfy bed! All of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - and made the experience very enjoyable. We only ate at the hotel twice (mostly because of the high cost) but couldn't complain at the quality/size of the meal. Overall, definitely worth considering as your hotel choice in Kowloon! PS - The rooftop pool (with a cool beer) was a welcome sight at the end of each humid day!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: DorkingPeach
Reviews.Content: We've returned back from a great trip round Asia and decided to splurge on our last two nights.... this is probably the best hotel i've ever stayed in - and i've stayed in a few!! We went for the Executive Room with access to the E-Club (It was on special offer at the time) We had floor to ceiling windows in the front room over-looking the illuminated Nathan Road. We were on the 17th floor and the view was worth the money. The eclub also meant a varied breakfast buffet was included as well as free soft drinks and internet. Ideal for catching up on those emails on a long trip!! We didnt eat in the restaurant as the hotel was situated next to the main road... easy walking distance to shops, restaurants and bars and of course, the imfamous symphany of lights. The MTR stops link you to most places in Hong Kong. Jordan station is probably the closest to this hotel. Had a great stay here (and in Hong Kong overall) and it made the perfect ending for a great trip... : )

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure about recommending this place”
Reviews.Author: SDWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Location: Right on Nathan road. Close to all the shops and many points of interest, such as Temple Night Market. I walked to most of the places except to TST or when I got really tired. It is not too far form metro stations. Some have commented that the location is a bit too “touristy”. There is some validity to that. Room and Facilities: I got a really bad room. Room was small. I am ok with that as it is in Hong Kong. Though it was clean but room needed updating. There were dirty marks on the wall and holes as well. Carpet was very much worn out and dirty. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom had nice soft towels and toiletries. There were complementary water bottles. I would rate my room as a 2 star establishment or three at best. Mini bar had all the usual snacks and drinks. There was a regular cathode tube TV with CNN station and other basic channels. Luckily the room did not smell too bad. The scent in the room was a bit strong. Might be problem for some. Common areas, such as the lobby, were a bit small but adequate. There was outdoor space as well, which I think is a bit unusual for HK. I did not use much of the amenities therefore cannot comment on those. Services: A strong point of this place. There were people waiting at the elevator on the ground to help you. Front desk folks were nice, efficient, and polite. I found that the service was at 4-5 stars level. There was no iron and iron board so I requested them. They brought those requested items within 15 minutes. Again, the iron and the board were really old. I was very impressed with the services. Recommendation: I would recommend this place for location, service but not so sure about the room. Other tips. If you like Dim Sums, I recommend Ming Court at the Langham, which is the sister’s property of Eaton. The Dim Sums were amazing. I have a bit of affinity for Asian food. However, I was very disappointed at the food in HK. Not saying that it is bad because I am not native KH. Therefore cannot judge. Just very different from what I have in LA. Did not taste good to me. All the good meals I had were at the Langham: Ming Court and Dinner Buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: Alanxx
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite direct with the hotel and got what we thought was a good price.However,having just spent time in hotel suites in Auckland and Sydney we were disappointed at the size and standard at the Eaton but we suspect that unless you pay a fortune you will not get much bigger in Hong Kong. Good attentive staff and the Plaza Club breakfast and canapes were more than acceptable.One night the canapes were all meat and as I don't eat meat I was stuck with the cheese but the Girl overheard my wife saying there was very little for me and arranged some vegetable spring rools from the kitchen. The suite was fairly tiny and had a lousy view so ask to see the room first !! The Plaza Club room was in the basement and a bit gloomy for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Price and Location but...”
Reviews.Author: Infinity00
Reviews.Content: The location and price was great...was right smack in the middle of Mongkok (10min walk) and Tsim Sha Tsui (15 min walk). The hotel lobby was weirdly situated on the 4th floor and the lifts go right up from the porch to the rooms which was a bit of a security concern since the guys on the ground floor dont seem to bother checking whether yr a guest staying in the hotel. The rooms are really small, and although everything seem to be downsized, everything u need is provided. Skipped all meals in the hotel and ventured outside for food, lotsa nice food along Kimberly Road a short distance away, If you are keen for desserts (which Hkers are really into) there is a small and cheap dessert shop selling great desserts way past midnight, just nearby. A cheap way of getting to and fro the airport is via the mtr, HK$68 bucks thereabouts. Take from jordan and transfer at Lai King then Tsing Yi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: astronaut77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton with my husband for 2 nights in April on recommendation from a friend who currently lives in Hong Kong. The hotel was perfectly located for the night markets, and Jordan train station. Mong Kok (where the Ladies Markets are) and TST are only one stop away, or walking only takes approx 20 mins to each location. We booked a room on the Club Level and got a good deal by booking over 42 days in advance through the hotels own website. I also mentioned that our stay was part of our honeymoon, and we got upgraded to a suite on arrival. We arrived at the hotel at approx 9am and I didn't expect to get a room until early afternoon, but was told the room would be ready in 15 mins and was offered breakfast whilst we waited. Once we got to the room, there was a bottle of red wine, fruit and flowers waiting for us. This was a really lovely touch by the hotel staff. The club level is definitely worth paying a little extra for - the rooms are larger, and the breakfast is great - it saved us a lot of hassle (and money) looking for a suitable place to eat in the mornings. They also serve drinks and snacks from 5.30-7.30pm which was adequate for a light dinner. Overall, I was very impressed with the staff at the Eaton - they were very helpful and friendly when we asked for directions/maps/recommendations etc. This hotel may not be in the same league as the likes of the Langham or Mandarin Oriental, but for the price I thought this was excellent, and the location was perfect. I will definitely consider staying here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel-Eaton”
Reviews.Author: garymiller
Reviews.Content: Excellent food buffets for breakfast and dinner, rooftop heated pool, like a Grecian villa, exercise room, and comfy bed, a rarity in Asia where hard beds are everywhere. By going directly to the hotels website, and checking back, I got a screaming deal. For Breakfast you sit in a large glassed in area. Hotel saved us a bundle on taxi to the airport by negotiating with taxi for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Three Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fifiann
Reviews.Content: For 70 bucks a night through Priceline, the Eaton was an excellent deal. However, Priceline rates this as a 4* hotel. It clearly isn't unless you are staying in a club room and I wouldn't pay even the Expedia rate. The public areas are attractive and clean. The brand new Japanese restaurant is very good and we enjoyed breakfast in the coffee shop each morning where the food is reasonably priced, the staff charming and there are free internet terminals. The room was very small as other reviewers have stated and also rather worn. However, it was clean and if you are out a lot as we were it doesn't matter. The Eaton is conveniently located on busy Nathan Road and 5 minutes walk from Jordan MTR station which is just 1 stop from Tsim Sha Tsui. My friend and I stayed here happily for a week before moving to the vastly superior sister hotel Langham Place where my husband was attending a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: Alan&Sylvia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton for 4 nights in February. We had booked a Club room and were very pleased. With free wireless internet and free hot breakfast and two hours of free drinks per day the E-Club offers fantastic value. The staff are as helpful as it's possible to get, they sorted out of China Visa's and got them returned in 6 Hours! Food and room service were exceptional. Overall a great hotel in a fantastic location and a hotel team second to none!

Reviews.Title: “Small room!”
Reviews.Author: gnom:o)
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 4D 3N- attended a course that was run at the hotel. The hotel staff were pleasant, friendly & helpful- very service-oriented. The meeting room was impressive, well-equipped but the air-con was cold- thermostat didn't seem to work. However, the room that I shared with a friend was terribly small- two single twin beds that would be great for small/ short people, plus there was hardly any space for luggage. The Chinese restaurant had great food though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: zoukee888
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at about 1am. Hotel staff were friendly & helpful. The bell boy even refused to take the tip from me. The reception / check in counter is at level 4 (if I can still remember). The room, bathroom & lift might be slightly too small but was ok for Hong Kong. The rooms & bathroom are very new & very clean. I think they newly renovated it. The room & bathroom were smartly designed to make full use of the small space. It's comfortable with I-Home designs. The multiplugs were smartly covered just above the desks. and the room has floor night lights. Good for me as I had to make milk for my daughter in the middle of the night. The location is in the middle of Nathan Road famous for night markets, good food, near MTR, etc. Will return for more.....

Reviews.Title: “First Class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richiemac69
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Hong Kong and had a 6 night stay at the Eaton hotel. I did a lot of research on this site & others on this holiday as it was a surprise 40th birthday present for my girlfriend & the Eaton in principle appeared to tick all the boxes. The first good thing about this hotel is its location. An excellent base for exploration, just off Nathan Road where buses run frequently and cover all of the key areas in Kowloon; and also 3 minutes from Jordan Metro. A lot of the big attractions are just a short walk or bus/metro ride away, such as Kowloon Park, The waterfront, plus the main museums & markets, I booked a deluxe room & we were on the 18th floor. Check in was simplicity in itself, reception & concierge were very helpful, friendly and informative. The room itself was very clean and well presented. The bed was firm, spacious and comfortable. The a/c was fully adjustable. The flat screen TV, the remote control light panel and the I-home Ipod player was a really nice touch. The rooms are not oversized but I personally think its all relative. If you are going to stay in it 24/7 then you probably get cabin fever. We were out exploring most of the time and when in the hotel we chilled out in the ample spaced Planters Bar or the lovely garden area, so room size was not an issue. The food in the main restaurant was first class with a choice of buffet or al-a-carte. Some other reviews say that it is expensive, but I believe that you really do get what you pay for. The steak was sumptuous & they even had a chocolate fountain..! The buffet breakfast was diverse and the restaurant staff were usually on point. The 24 hour Gym is not very big but it has all the things in it you need for a total cardio-physical workout and I could find no fault. The complementary towels, bottled water & fresh fruit again was a nice touch. The Pool was open and even though we did not use it, it was in pristine condition. I think this hotel is first class and recommend it very highly. I though it was excellent value for money, extremely comfortable and friendly. Well done Eaton Hotel…

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: IVKwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way home to the States. Although the rooms were small, they were very clean and had all the amenities you could want. Super super efficient. The location was great - you could walk to the harbor, to the night markets, Canton Road, etc. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: blimpie71
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a few different hotels in Hong Kong, and I have to say, the Eaton is the least impressive of them. Maybe it was just because we booked the most standard room which was as small as a small hotel room in New York City. There was barely room to open to our suitcases and the room itself was a little run down. The window is small and the view was unremarkable. The shower was not bad but the toilet had the loudest, lingering flush I've ever heard! The location was okay, but a little far up Nathan Rd, so it's quite a hike to the harbour. At least it was close to the Night Market. It sounds like the larger rooms are worth the extra money and probably would make a stay here much more enjoyable. The lobby is small and checking in seemed to take forever, but I should say that the staff was very friendly. This is the kind of hotel that if you get a good deal, it's not a bad place to stay, but for over $200 US, there are better hotels out there. We stayed at the Royal Garden during the same trip and the rooms were much bigger, and the location was better.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DebbiesEvesham
Reviews.Content: This holiday was amasing and far excedeed my expectations the hotel was fantastic and is better than any 4 star i have ever stayed at in the uk. we ate in every restaurant in the hotel and it was all good if we fancied a snack we ate in the bar (the burger is really good ) the coffee shop was good for breakfast with free internet use to catch up with your e mails What struck me about Hong Kong was the cleanleness of everything and the friendliness of the people There transport system is amazing Train Bus or Ferry are very easy and cheap to use Go to the peak about mid afternoon then you get the chance to see it in the day light and at night and if you eat up there Mama Bubbers shrimp bar is the place to do it ( its on a simular lines to an american style steak bar ) We never went to china we wished we had but you need a visa, the hotel can sort this out for you but by the time we knew about it it was to late so check it out as soon as you get there I would defiantliy go to Hong Kong again and stop at the Eaton as it is so central to everyt hing and on such a vibrant street

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gbtynan
Reviews.Content: I lived in Hong Kong for several years (HK Island side) and have returned 8 times since to visit friends. I had always opted for hotels in Wanchai or Causeway Bay because the Island side was where I felt grounded. Reasonably priced HK Island hotels have notoriously shoebox sized rooms and are often a hike to get to an MTR station or anywhere interesting. This time I opted to stay in Kowloon, and had to overcome my prejudices about being right on very busy, glitzy Nathan Rd. I was very very pleasantly surprised by what I found at the Eaton! Yes it is right on Nathan, and a short stroll to the Yau Ma Tei MTR Station, but it was extremely quiet and comfortable. Check-in was excellent and the lobby is welcoming and bright. The rooms were spacious by HK standards and very comfortable. I would definitely recommend the "E Club" option, which gets you a room on a higher floor, plus breakfast and afternoon cocktails and hors d'oeuvres in the 1st floor E Club room. This is a very nice facility - cozy and comfortable. Breakfast is called "continental" but the choices offered were far better than a run of the mill continental breakfast. In the afternoon the cocktail hour sees waiters delivering complimentary glasses of wine or mixed drinks to you on your sofa while you enjoy a newspaper or browse the internet from one of their 3 terminals, or using the free wifi if you have your own computer. The staff are quick to refill those glasses! And the variety of snacks each day was creative and very tasty. A concierge in the E Club room was very helpful with several requests. I'd certainly return to the Eaton and would recommend it as a reasonably priced, superbly located and pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: CMB46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned today from a 6 night stay at the Eaton, and we are already missing this wonderful hotel and amazing city. From the moment we arrived we received nothing but prompt and courteous service, always with a smile. We stayed in an executive suite on the 15th floor, with great views of Nathan Road. We found the room to be extremely clean and comfortable (loved the super comfy bed and pillows) and both the room and the bathroom to be of a good size. The bathroom and suite in general were very clean and were serviced daily by very considerate staff, who even tidied our clutter from a big day's sightseeing. We thoroughly enjoyed the E Club lounge and would highly recommend it for a relaxing wind down to Hong Kong's chaotic days. We were always able to get a comfortable seat, quickly followed by the offer of something to drink. Overall, the quality of the food and service of all of the hotel's restaurants is excellent. Vincent, the manager of Eaton's restaurants and all his staff always provided us with delicious meals and great service. We found the hotel's location to be very central and convenient to all market shopping, with easy access via the MTR to Hong Kong's other tourist destinations. The hotel has compiled a very helpful first time visitors list, of Hong Kong must see's/ do's with detailed instructions (in English) on how to get there, it is available from the concierge desk. We can't recommend this hotel enough and we look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “recently refurbished”
Reviews.Author: blackhorse1
Reviews.Content: Modern recently refurbished hotel. Apparently upgraded room on arrival but unsure of what the difference was other than we were on a higher floor. No views from room other than limited view of Nathan Rd. Hotel was a two night stop-over for us and was very clean and helpful friendly staff. Location not as we expected and spent time on ferry over to Hong Kong Island. Public transport was excellent and suggest purchaseing an Octopus card to use on all public transport. (this included the peak tram ). Hotel transfers were included in our trip but would reccommend the "airport express" from/to airport, this stops on Hong Kong Island where you can easily reach hotels. This system also allows you to check baggage in at the station for return journey, saving you time at the airport. Would reccomend "The Peak" for wonderful views of city and accross to Kowloon, suggest go early to reduce queueing. Bus to "Stanley" worthwhile quaint beachfront location. good choice of restaurants and a typical oriental market to pick up gifts.

Reviews.Title: “Exhilerating Eaton”
Reviews.Author: greenwichgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eaton 18.02.08 - 22.08.08 and had a really excellent stay. I booked through hotel website and decided to upgrade to club class - this I think made our stay completely satisfying. We booked the hotel shuttle via their website. The shuttle took us from Arrivals hall - Area B, desk B4 which took us directly from the Airport to the hotel where staff were waiting to direct us through to the main lobby. From the lobby we were taken to the E-club check-in, and although happy hour had finished we ordered a complimentary drink while checking in. The staff could not have been more obliging and helpful. Our room was a good size and not too small (was worried after reading previous reviews) but found the rooms to be very comfortable and we were very happy with comfort and facilities. We were on 11th floor and had no noise. My only grumble would be that the pool was closed, although we had been informed by email, had been not advised that an alternative hotel could be used if we had wanted and could use the swimming facilities at their chain through Langham Hotel, not far away. Had we known this we would have enjoyed this faciility. But overall, complimentary cocktails and hors douvres during 2 hour period was very welcome starting at 5.30 pm. Use of the lounge and internet access a bonus, varied choice for hot and cold breakfast buffet was excellent, complimentary use of coffee and muffins throughout the day if we felt like it. I loved the outside lifts that looked like glass pods. I would definitly return to this hotel and recommend it to all, families, couples. I though it was excellent value for money and extremely comfortable and freindly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: sugdaddyg
Reviews.Content: we stayed 7 nights during our family trip to hong kong. we had one executive suite and one standard room booked. the standard room was upgraded for free to deluxe and given on the same floor as the other room per our request.... the hotel room is small by US standards but is typical of HK rooms. excellent customer service at this hotel... (unlike other things in hong kong). easy check in and out. concierge desk was not always consistently manned though, but they were very helpful when somebody was there. the Main street cafe had good breakfast items, reasonbly priced. the daily breakfast included with the executive suite was excellent... the evening drinks and snack were OK. the hotel arranged a limo (fancy car or van) for round trip hotel/airport per our request reasonable priced. this is better than the shuttle which has stops at other hotels en route which can take a while.... we had 2 young kids 3 yr old and 1 yr old and had no problem during stay with them. hotel location on nathan road was good.. i wish it was a bit closer to the MTR station (subway). It is halfway between the Jordan and Ya Ma tei stations. about 5-10 minute walk either way. don't forget the complimentary shoe shine and complimentary 2 garment dry cleaning with the suites. laundry charges in general are quite high in the hotel. overall excellent stay.. there are defintely cheaper places to stay but this place was good for the money...

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: pepperc0rn
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed- when we arrived we couldn't find the entrance ( its to the side with no sign posts) I left my partner with the luggage at what we thought was the front, got to reception it then took them close to an hour to help us with the luggage. we had booked a double room in a high floor and was given a twin near the bottom. I found staff to be unhelpful and when we were moved to a double room where expected to tip for a second time. The breakfast was good and rooms where clean. Location was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but rest is good”
Reviews.Author: Bangladesh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a stopover/catch up on sleep. We reserved the room through priceline for 100$, which I think was a bad deal to start with. I could get better hotels. When we arrived at our hotel, we were early and they had no rooms, so they asked to wait, and after 2 hours they had our rooms ready. This was also with major issue as two time they handed us the key for the wrong room. Then the room!! There are so many hotels that I have stayed, I have never seen any room that is smaller than this. BeAware, be very Aware. When I say small, it means tiny. After the furniture, there is no floorspace. My 2 year old daughter was all the time running on TOP OF THE BED as she had no other place to go. The rest of the hotel is good. The location is good, next to Kowloon shopping. The MTR is 5 blocks aways, small walk, but can be very hard in the hot and humid HK weather. The buffet breakfast was really good. Not a lot of choice, but the selection and the quality was really good. I liked the local seasonal fruit a lot. There are lot of local eatery around so do not spend too much here. The restaurants around are really authentic and cheap. There is a money exchanger on the other side and they have good deal. Better than your ATM rate. The Taxi is 270 HKD to the airport, but take the Train, specially when you are leaving as you can check in your laugage at the Train Station. (only on Cathay/BA and some other). The pool is small but nice. Up in the 17th Floor. There is a nice Koi Pond at the front of the lobby, which my daughter really liked, but was always filled with Aussie's smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: rejoicealways
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Hong Kong. We found the hotel via an old Frommer's recommendation, but looked at many hotels online before booking on the hotel's website. The hotel is a tremendous value for the quality we received. The staff was solicitous, the hotel very well appointed and extremely clean and up to date, the ambiance restful and the location superb. It was a short walk to the MTR which was easy to figure out and it was within walking distance to so many of the markets in Kowloon. My only negative was the size of the room (small), but from what I hear of Hong Kong, it was no different from other hotels. I would not feel the need to stay anywhere else for our second trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great staff...thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Beckyreed82
Reviews.Content: The first impressions of the Eaton were excellent, we were given an upgrade on arrival which was a nice surprise and had a lovely room overlooking Nathan Road. Although the room was small, it had everything in it that we needed and we werent there enough for the size to worry us. The staff at this hotel are excellent and were so attentive!! We ate in the coffee shop on a few occassions and the food was lovely. I definatly recommend the supper buffet, it starts at 10.00 and costs only 108 dollars. Well worth it for the choice that was there...the deserts were so nice!!!!!! The location was great and gave us easy access to the markets and shops. Would stay at this hotel again, and would definatly recommend to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tjongo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in an executive room with access to the E-club with breakfast and free drinks 5.30-7.30 every evening. The E-club unfortunately is underground, it would have been nicer on the top floor with a view. They had a pool and gym there instead which looked nice. The room was OK in size, although the bed was rather queen than king size. The location is very good, near the Temple street market, metro, and for a taxi from/to the airport. If I go to HK again I will probably stay here again, and definitely in Kowloon rather than on the HK island.

Reviews.Title: “Affordably priced but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lazla
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Hong Kong for a one week business trip. I normally stay on the Hong Kong but opted this time to try Kowloon. I got an executive upgraded room (eclub level room) and was looking forward to my stay. Upon arriving I was surprised how cramped the hotel lobby felt compared to other hotels I have stayed in HK. I should have taken this as sign as to what the room would be like. The room was surprisingly small. It was clean, well appointed but just very small. Location of the hotel is very convenient with easy access to MTR (subway) and shuttle buses. You can also walk along Nathan Road for shopping and choice of many restaurants. If you want a well priced, clean, convenient location but small room, then I recommend the Eaton Hotel. Get the upgraded eclub room. It is worth the extra price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location for markets, star ferry, etc”
Reviews.Author: whiteout
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel, en route to a wedding in Bali. The location was absolutely first class for the Jade Market, Ladies Market, Temple Street night market. The public transport system in Hong Kong leaves our UK one standing and the hotel was close by buses and trains. Our critism was that due to the air-con, the coffee lounge of the hotel was very cold. The rooms we were allocated for the final few days were very small. The buffet breakfast was excellent and was good value. As the hotel is a popular one for local weddings it is advisable to book if an evening buffet meal is wanted. Plus we did get good insights into the wedding festivities and brides outfits. However, there were one or two problems in the business centre where we booked our return flight seats but we were not charged the 40 dollars normally charged for 15 minutes on the computers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dannyperry
Reviews.Content: For the price, you can't really knock this place (although we did get an online deal). The rooms are pretty small but we expected that; however, they are clean and functional. The location is the best thing - very close to public transport, which is both cheap and reliable. Also good for the markets and shops and only a short walk from the waterfront. My only gripe was that we were overcharged when it came to paying the bill. Sure, mistakes can happen but we found three separate things and at makes me a little wary of their integrity. Would I stay there again? Perhaps, but next time I wouldn't use any of the hotel facilities (mini bar, massage etc...)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londinia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton hotel in May/ June '07 and we booked the Eaton Room. Although quite small I thought it was lovely, luxurious, clean and comfortable with modern amenties. I thought the class of this hotel was much higher than rated and would give it 4and a half stars! I liked the digitally controlled lighting in the room and the ice machine on each floor was especially handy. Being in Hong Kong there was no need to stay in your room alot apart from to sleep and change so the space was not so essential to us anyway. We didn't have breakfast because we were jet lagged the whole time so only got up about 11/12ish everyday. We did have lunch a couple of times and afternoon tea at the hotel restuarant on lobby level. It was excellent, the service was good and the food delicious and reasonably priced. The hotel has a good location a few mins walk from Jordan MTR and can catch buses just outside. There is no need for taxi's as the MTR service is impeccable, clean, airconditioned and modern. Plus if you like shopping there is always an abundance of shops- food and clothes- in each MTR station. Star Ferry is a must and very cheap! So is the peak which has stunning views, excellent restaurants and shopping- we went there 3 times out of our 10 days we stayed in HK! Night markets are an experience and you can get some good bargains- just a few mins walk from hotel. Starbucks is opposite too and Macdonalds! Would definitely stay there again- excellent standard for relatively low price!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: pcsparky
Reviews.Content: Very well priced comfortable and modern hotel situated in between the Jordon and Yau Ma Tei Mass Transit Railway Stations (like the Tube). The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. Make sure to ask by e-mail a few days in advance for a high floor (to avoid road noise) and if you want a double bed then also ask for that. The rooms are quite small but then space is at a premium in HK. The wardrobe is very small but we managed on a 7 night trip and were provided with extra coat hangers when we asked. There is an excellent restaurant, The Coffee Room, hidden away on floor 4 which we only found on the last night, and very well priced. They also have their own chinese restaurant downstairs which we didn't try but also appears to be a fair price. Alcohol was expensive but it appeared to be in all restaurants. There is free internet access on LG floor by the coffee/snack shop. Would recommend getting the Airport MTR to Kowloon station (book online and it only costs about £10 return each). This is so easy to use and is geared up to travellers with baggage. At Kowloon either get a taxi if in a rush or the free Airport Shuttle bus, marked K1, to the Eaton. Do get an Octopus card for the buses, ferry and MTR. There are plenty of buses that stop just round the corner from the Eaton that go to the Star Ferry terminus. The Jordon MTR is the nearest and only about 5 minutes walk to get to the train.

Reviews.Title: “Reccommended”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Traveller085
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice in this hotel and on both occassions have found it to be great. The location, whilst not in the centre of Hong Kong, is fine. If you don't mind walking, it's about 15 minutes to the Star Ferry. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very clean and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nathan_Reading_UK
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights on vacation at the Eaton in an executive room with "E Club". The room was good and had panoramic floor to ceiling windows looking out over Nathan Road. It’s definitely worth booking the "E Club" as this provides access to a cosy lounge and includes breakfast, all day soft drinks, and evening nibbles and alcoholic refreshments. There are also a number of PC's with free internet access, which are ideal for checking-in for your return flight. The hotel is in a great location with easy access to all the Kowloon and Hong Kong sites, and it is particularly convenient for the famous markets. The hotel staff are very friendly and efficient, and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: LuxTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Eaton in late October 2007 for 5 nights. We booked the executive room with access to the E club via the hotel website. This is a good idea as not only do you get a larger room (for Hong Kong) but you get access to the club with internet access, breakfast and drinks (water tea during the day and alcohol for 2 hours in the evening). The room was fine and as somebody else has mentioned small but this is normal in HK. The location is fine for sightseeing. The subway is 5 minutes away and you can catch a bus to the star ferry outside the door. The hotel is about 15 minutes away from the night markets. The streets around the hotel are busy but this is the same as all over HK. Use the octopus card for traveling around HK as it is excellent. The pool on the roof is fine (not very large) and is nice way to relax at the end of the day. We ate at the bar on one night as we were too lazy to go out and the food was fine. Check in and out was fine as the E Club has its own dedicated facility. We had asked and received an early check in following our flight. We used the hotel shuttle bus to get to and from the airport and it is was fine. Water and newspaper offered as you are waiting. It took approx 45 mins to get to the hotel. The hotel offered reasonably good value for money. We would stay there again if in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Still okay”
Reviews.Author: BevAlan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here about 4 times in the past 6 years. I still think its a great hotel the best thing being a central location the reception, hallways, cafe and gym are all still great but the room I stayed in November 2007 was getting a bit tired definately needing a lick of paint. But I will still stay here again but will consider upgaring the rrom to a suite

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfdoets
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly staff. Airco outside the room in the halls make a lot of noise. Stayed on the 20th floor. Recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Subaru12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton for one night. We flew from Sanya to do a 2 day trip in Hong Kong. When we arrived at the Eaton I was pleased. It was in a good location in terms of shopping/eating etc. The bar area was really nice, also the food looked really good too. However, our room was horrible. We got put in one room, which was small, but clean. For some reason they moved is to a different room - which was small but dirty. There was a grubby mark all the way round the carpet...the bathroom door was falling off, the shower was dirty, the room stunk of smoke - and when I attempted to use the hairdryer the end if it was bright white and the rest was all yellow from the nicotine. The hairdryer was a waste of space - I could have blown harder!!!! When we checked out the next day - there were pictures of the rooms on the reception desk - they looked fantastic - so god knows what rooms we were put in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several times at the Eaton and have not had any major problems. My most recent visit I upgraded to the "Excecutive Level" (I was on a business trip so my company was paying for it - ~C$180/nt) and I received access to the "E" lounge, which offers free wi-fi internet access, 3-4 desktop terminals, free drinks (pop, water, juice), some munchies (mini-muffins, cookies) and newspapers/magazines. The room I got was pretty small, but keep in mind that Hong Kong hotels are rather small relative to what you're used to in some other countries as well as to hotels I've stayed at in Beijing, Shanghai and other cities in China. The bed was fairly firm, but again, keep in mind the beds in China and more so in Hong Kong seem to be a lot firmer than in North America etc. so that's par for the course. The hotel is rather non-descript on the outside but it has a nice patio and a roof top pool. The gym is rather small but serves its purpose for those that need some cardio (if you're looking for a heavy weight lifting workout you'll be a bit disappointed but can still maange a decent workout). Foot massages are offered in the fitness centre for a reasonable HK$200 and was quite good (but painful - I like it that way but you can ask for a softer massage). TV in the room is the old tube style and smallish but again, why be in HK if all you plan to do is watch tv? Safety deposit box is smaller than what I'm used to (most hotels in China are big enough to fit my laptop - this one wasn't) but not a big deal. Location is good - you're on a side street just off of Nathan Rd (HK's main tourist strip) and you're about a 5 minute walk to the subway station (Jordan station, I believe). You can walk down to the Park in about 10 minutes and the waterfront in about 20 minutes. You're also close to the night markets on Temple street (Mong Kok area - north of the hotel). There's plenty of shops along the way so if you're a shopper you'll enjoy the walk downtown (south). You can take the airport express train to TST (one stop before Central) and then it's a short walk (5+ minutes with light luggage) or if you're more daring, you can take a city bus from the airport that will take you along Nathan road - buses are super cheap and there's a spot to put your luggage too. Overall, a place I try to stay at when I'm in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for your travels”
Reviews.Author: Chrysm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 7 nights and we couldn't of been happier, the room has small but comfortable and modern! Stayed on the 15th Floor and had excellent views of the busy streets below. The bathroom has modern also, my only gripe is that it didn't have an exhaust vent. The check in procedure was slightly painful, it seems to take a long time to check in/check out, I'm sure they could somehow streamline this process, people were obviously frustrated while we were waiting. The girl who checked us in and who we actually booked with over the phone was very friendly and apologetic as I room wasn't ready yet (we did arrive early before the normal check in time). All meals we had at the hotel were excellent, Maggie who works mainly breakfast I think was always very friendly and smiley! All in all we had a wonderful stay at the Eaton and I wouldn't hesitate in recommending it, its an excellent base for tourists, only minutes walk to temple street night market and 5 minutes walk to Jordan station!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: owlatron
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as a party travelling from sanay the booking in was flawless the rooms adequate for what we needed it for the problem i found was that the windows did not shut so i woke up in the night with a frozen foot but apart from that it was ok small but fantastic location straight on nathan street about half an hour from the harbour where we watched the light show fantastic and slap bang in middle of all the shops

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wirthner
Reviews.Content: We have spent a wonderful time in Hongkong. The hotel is magnificent and we had a perfect service. It is situated in the heart of the city. Bus stop and train stations are only a few minutes walk from the hotel. It was hot and busy in the streets, but we could relax because of the peace in the hotel. Everything was clean and neat. The internet access in the internet cafe is perfectly organised There's a nice cafe on the 4th floor with a terrace. The pool is on the roof, not very big but ok. The pool attendants served towels. The restaurants are great. Overall I would say this is probably one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. You can reach all the markets (jade market, birds market, flower market) on foot. Trips (Great Buddha) are also available from there. All in all it is a perfect place to explore this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine !”
Reviews.Author: C&A_London
