Reviews.Content: A smart, 4* hotel with friendly and efficient reception staff. We'd only booked the night before to escape the Ibis in North Point. Jason was superbly efficient and professional in explaining that our room was not yet ready so we didn't mind waiting one bit. The hotel does a good breakfast and has immaculately clean rooms and lobby. The bed was a welcome soft haven and bathroom was clean and well stocked. Near Nathan Road, it gave easy access to the Temple Street night market and to the Star Ferry terminal. Nice buzz around this area. Open air roof top pool was a blast at 9.00pm, though a tad colder than expected. Probably more suited in the heat of the day. Nice outdoor area for smokers and good table service. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KBScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Eaton Hotel. Used their limo service to get from airport with no problems at all, waiting for us, very friendly staff. Check in painless, although we were given a twin room instead of a double (not a problem for 3 nights) and asked to check in the morning if double available - we didn't feel the need. Really just used this as our base, didn't eat or drink there or use much of the facilities. However, it was very conveniently located, quiet (considering the central location), and we found all staff extremely helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend and stay there in future if visiting Hong Kong. Rooms admittedly on the small side, but had everything required for a short stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J0eOnTheG0
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Eaton Hotel and based on the emotions of my wife and 2 kids on leaving, we had a great time. Service was good, rooms were small but good, aircon worked well and shower provided plenty of hot water. Booked connecting rooms which we didn't end up getting - the major disappointment. Apparently all connecting rooms have double beds - this wasn't explained when I booked. For such a short stay it wasn't an enormous problem. Enjoyed a fantastic yum cha in the restaurant - freshest, most delicious food with great service. Kids enjoyed using the free internet in the basement coffee shop. Rooftop pool provided great relief after a long hot day hitting the shops. Overall service was really good, price very reasonable, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bibbbabe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Eaton in Hong Kong. Good rooms for the price, you dont need a suite, your visiting one of the busiest cities in the world. Our room was clean, comfortable, air conditioned, clean had a great shower and wonderful hospitality. Would definately recommend, we didn't upgrade to "E Club" didnt feel the need, lots to see and do locally, great location, busy all around, always felt welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bongobear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton in Sept 2007 for 6 nights. The quality of the newly renovated room as excellent for the price and the service and staff were all top notch. The location was good too, although it's very easy and cheap to get around HK from anywhere if your near an MTR station. Jordan station is a 5 min walk from the Eaton. Would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “MEDIOCRE AT BEST”
Reviews.Author: agumonster
Reviews.Content: STANDARD ROOMS - not renovated. First I booked Queen size bed, online. I called to confirm and "Yes, we have it". On the day of check-in, they said they only have 2 twin beds. Irritating. Bathroom sink CLOGGED. Used up cotton buds on first day. Did not stock more by housekeeping next day. For around the same price, but more reliable service and definitely better standard rooms, check out Metropark Hotel or Cosmopolitan first.

Reviews.Title: “Why sleep?”
Reviews.Author: pluckaduckie
Reviews.Content: You'd think reserving a room for three would give the hotel a heads up the number of people coming to stay. We arrived around 1am yet we were missing one bed and set of blanket sheets, pillow and blanket... Not to mention the third set of toiletries and towel! They tried charging us for the extra bed but they were saw reason when we explained the downfalls to their room they provided us. But the hotel had some redeeming qualities. Their e-club lounge had great service. The buffet breakfast menu changed on a daily basis and the staff were friendly enough to remember what we liked as a breakfast drink...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: geezy
Reviews.Content: My second visit to Hong Kong in less than a year...I admit I really like this place! My first time, I stayed in Mong Kok so I wanted to try a different location since I wanted to explore more of the areas I didn't get to go to the last time. Most of my planned destinations were going to be more in the south (Victoria Peak and HK Island + a day trip to Macau), but I still wanted to eat and shop up north, so I thought being in the middle of Kowloon would serve me best. I couldn't have asked for a more perfect spot. The MTR was just a few minutes away around the block, and getting here and there was so convenient. I stayed in the "Eaton Room" which wasn't the largest room I've ever stayed in, but it wasn't the smallest either. For a single person like myself, it was just right. I'm sure 2 people it wouldn't be a problem either, unless you enjoy playing catch with a football. It had nice, neat, modern, and stylish decor which made me feel relaxed and comfortable. It also had features, such as iHome (great to plug my iPod and charge/listen to my music), a flat-screen LCD TV and broadband internet access (I didn't have a laptop so didn't get to use). I had a queen bed with feather pillows which were quite comfortable and clean looking which I could really appreciate. Next to the bed was a small desk and chair setup for gathering my documents and looking over my trip dossier. The bathroom was also clean and bright with a modern and stylish sink. Suffice it to say, I was very pleased with my accommodations. I got to use the pool upstairs which was enjoyable. I was taking swimming classes the semester before my trip and I was glad I got to practice my strokes. It's a pretty small pool so I'm not sure what it's like if there were more than 3 people there. My time spent there, I was always by myself so I couldn't complain. Next door to the pool area was the hotel gym. It had a good amount of equipment and free weights to use. Again, the times I used it, there wasn't anyone there so that was cool (no waiting to use equipment). Lots of tvs to distract you and a nice view out the window when you're taking a water break. After, there's a little changing room at the side with lockers and where you can shower. My choice to visit HK when I did was unfortunate because some big tech convention was going on and as a result, hotels all over were booked up and prices weren't what I would have preferred. My costs for 3 nights (including 15% off for 3 night stay) was 3740HKD + 486.20HKD=4226.20HKD ($542.10, or $180.70/night). Kind of pricey for my cheap [--], but it was bad timing on my part plus I deserve a treat one in a while. Probably better rates on a non-convention weekend. But, again, the centralized location and features offered at the Eaton made my stay worthwhile. The hotel overall was very nice and appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: okidoki44
Reviews.Content: I had read many reviews of the Eaton Hotel on Tripadvisor, not quite convinced that it was the best selection, but I booked it anyways in hopes of a good choice. A few weeks prior to our arrival, I received an email from the Eaton hotel management, asking about my arrival time and flight information. To say the least, I was quite pleased that they were interested in the time of my arrival. And it was not a generic email, it was personalized for me. My husband and I arrived at the hotel at 7:00 AM, which is way before the usual check-in time. The front desk was able to locate a room for us, but they needed just 1 hour to tidy the room. We left to get some breakfast, we came back just under 1 hour, and our room was ready. I was estatic, we were able to check in, rest, and shower before the day began. The room was very clean, modern and cozy enough for the both of us. The only negative thing about the hotel, is the location. It is located between 2 train station that is about a 5-10 minute walk either direction. The staff was always helpful, and the rooms were always cleaned. The weather was bad, but the hotel stay was FANTASTIC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ayejay
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews I was a bit skeptical and unsure what to expect. However I had nothing to worry about I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly they even allowed me to check in at 8.00am in the morning with not problem and allowed for ong a later checkout without any extra cost. I found the location to be great I could walk easily to all the markets and there were plenty of eating places around. The concerige was incredibly helpful in organising tours and assisted with transport to the airport. I was impressed to find that they even had a turndown service in the evening which though totally unnecessary was a nice touch. The pool on the roof was certainly a nice touch, a very pleasant tranquil area. Sure the rooms are small but that is to be expected in a city like this I would rather have a small clean room with lots of extras than a large dirty one any day. I wouldn't hesitate in staying again should I be in Hong Kagain.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: DaveRuss
Reviews.Content: Lets get this out of the way. One of the best hotels we have stayed in during our worldwide travels. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. We were here for six days and stayed in an executive room which included access to the E club. Geta room with the e club as you get breakfast, all day tea/coffee and snacks and evening drinks (alcoholic) with nice nibbles ! you also have access to private check in and check out. The hotel is some distance from the harbour, but this is not a problem as Jordan metrostation is a five minute walk away and you can get all over the place from here. The hotel is idealy situated for most of the major markets, including Temple Street, Jade, Ladies etc. The staff were at all time very friendly and helpful. Superb, would have no hesitation in using this hotel again when visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not central”
Reviews.Author: Lraep
Reviews.Content: Reservation : stayed at Eaton for 9 nts. in Jul/Aug. I made reservation via the hotel web-site in May. Between May & July, every time I checked back, price had gone down. I cancelled & rebooked 3 times for better rates - saved HK$3,887.2! Airport Transfer : Our Executive Rm. package included complimentary shuttle. We were told we had just missed one, and the counter staff was nice to offer us bottle water while we waited. They tried to charge us for 1 person (HK$130) but we refused as it was clearly stated in our reservation that we were 2 adults & 1 kid. They ended up asking us to sign for the bill charged to the hotel. The shuffle was fast & comfortable. Check-in : As we arrived late at night, the e-Club was closed & we checked-in at the reception. As other trip advisors have mentioned, the receptionists were not very friendly. Room : When we entered our "Executive Rm.", we were absolutely stunned. The room was small, old, smelly, and looked nowhere close to the photo shown on the hotel web-site. Instead it looked exactly like a Std. Rm. I called the reception, but like other trip advisors' stories, the hotel was full & they could not do anything until the next morning. When we went for breakfast at the e-Club, I talked to the receptionist there, and she promised to move us to another room on the same floor. Our new room was indeed on another side of the corridor, seperated by a door which read "Executive Rms", and it did look like the photo on the web-site. Although the hotel insisted the first rm. we stayed in was an Executive Rm., but we really thought it was just a slight larger Std. Rm. Our new room, although much better, was still quite small, esp. the 2 twin-size beds. We had to move the sofa in-between the 2 beds in order to sleep 3. Food : On the third morning when we had breakfast, my husband drank some skim milk which had gone bad. E-Club's manager, Mimi, was very professional. She came to our table to appologise and told us if we experienced stomach problem & needed to go see a doctor, the hotel would reimburse us. In general, breakfast at the e-Club was of good standard. On some mornings, we saw management-looking personnel going there to make sure things were in good standard. However, outside breakfast hours, we rarely see any snacks, refreshment, or fruit there. We were never there in the evening when alcoholic drinks were served though. Sometimes, when we returned in the evening, we felt like visiting the lounge to relax & had a light snack before going to our room, but there was never anything in the e-Club, not even cookies. Restaurant : the Chinese Restaurant there was good, even for locals. Recommend to go for dim-sum during lunch time. Location : Jordan Metro Station is within walking distance, about 4 - 5 blocks away. It is a convenient location esp. for visiting the night market (Temple Street). Wing On Dept Store (a traditional dept. store) is just across the road. However, it is not a very "central" location. A better tourist location would be Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) on the Kowloon side, or Causeway Bay on the Hong Kong Island. Eaton is moving from 3-Star to 4-Star standard, but not quite there yet. If pricing is reasonable, we are willing to stay there again, but we'll need 2 connecting rooms, or a Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and nothing for people with asthma”
Reviews.Author: Vacation_in_HK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eaton Hotel at Nathan Road for 3 nights in July. Made the reservation as we had read previous reviews (seemed ok) and we wished to stay a few nights in Kowloon, near the tourist attractions such as the Temple street night market and Nathan Road. Let's begin with the good stuff: * The entrance (reception, lobby as well as the restaurant) are renovated and of good standard. Nice first impression * Location is good if you're looking for a stay in Kowloon near the tourist attractions. On the down side: * Unfriendly staff. * The hotel is only partly renovated, the rooms that haven't been renovated are poor. Nothing to recommend to people with asthma or allergies. * Does not meet the standard of a 4-star hotel. Need more improvement in terms of service and room standard (including the renovated rooms). This is our story... At arrival (late at night), we were happily surprised as the person at the front desk told us that we had been upgraded to a superior room. However, as we entered the room it did not seem "superior" in any way. The room was of poor standard, very old and had a funny smell. We stayed in a non-smoking room but the smell of the carpet told us otherwise. Also the air was very "mouldy". I suffer from asthma but normally this is not a problem when travelling as long as I have a non-smoking room. Since we arrived late at night, we went straight to bed upon arrival. Shortly I started having breathing problems. We called the 24-hour front desk and we were told that they would send someone to our room to clear the situation. After a while a person came to our room. It was a bell boy (who hardly spoke any English) carrying an airfreshner spray! Since it was late at night, we decided we'd better continue the discussion in the morning and keep the room (we were told that all other rooms were occupied hence a transfer was not an option). I slept in the bath tub that night, since the bathroom had no carpet and therefore less of the strange smell. First thing in the morning we went to speak to the person in the reception. Although we politely explained the situation, the receptionist did not seem interested in assisting us in any way. We had already made the payment for three nights and the message we got was more or less "take it or leave it". After some more discussions, we were informed that the hotel is under renovation (no information about that when making the reservation). The floor with our room had not yet been renovated. Although we were willing to pay extra to get a renovated room, all we were told was that "all rooms are occupied, sorry there is nothing we can do". Then, when we asked to speak to the manager, the receptionist suddenly managed to find us a renovated room with no additional charge. The lack of information of the ongoing renovation when making the room reservation, the hassle with changing rooms and the unfriendliness of the staff surely bring the rating down for this hotel. I might sound like picky and critical guest. I enjoy travelling and I have stayed at various hostels, b&b:s as well as fancy hotels and have never had any complaints about the rooms. In this case I felt mislead and I was not at all impressed by the way we were treated when we asked for assistance. We will never return to this hotel again and I would not recommend it to any of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. Better once the construtions finished...”
Reviews.Author: JoeBlah
Reviews.Content: We loved the Eaton.. Nice look to the rooms, very clean. Good shopping around the hotel. The location is between metro stops... which was good but sometimes a bit of a walk. We purchased the eaton club membership while we were there. It was nice to have drinks / snacks / internet between shopping and sight seeing but the price was a bit much for what you get. They are doing construction for a bit and durring the day it was a bit annoying... But what can you do? This hotel was great for a couple nights but i wouldn't stay a week here...

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Monkeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days at the Eaton on the first leg of our honeymoon. The room we were given was quite small and we were told we couldn't change rooms as the hotel was full. They knew we were on honeymoon but didn't do anything for us. The hotel itself was fine, breakfast was very good, and although close to the MTR station Jordan, we thought that it was a bit far away from the main tourist areas. We were very near the Jade and Temple Markets which was good. If we went to Hong Kong again we would stay either on Hong Kong Island or near the Star Ferry terminals as these areas seem to be more for the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is good but staff service terrible”
Reviews.Author: WesselAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Eaton Hotel for one week last year. Through Expedia we booked a double superior room. At the arrival we were brought to our room and given a superior, at least we thought so. We asked this to the bellboy and yes he said it was a superior room we would stay in. After some days we started doubting about this because the other rooms were bigger. We asked about it at the reception desk and then the problems started. We showed our booking and the first person told our room was not a superior room. So we asked for the superior which they refused to gave us. We had to argue a lot and had a fight with the front desk. Finally we were given a room which we had paid for (after they tried to put us in another room which was not a superior again). This battle took us like 3 hours and lots of energy. We were very dissapointed by the service of the front desk. Hotel facilites are okay, nice pool and good breakfast/lunch area in the basement with free internet. But the service certainly lacks. Would never return here because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Small But More”
Reviews.Author: IzoukI
Reviews.Content: service is great the moment you step into the hotel, a 4 stars hotel with a 5 stars service. We got 2 standard room, both room as usual is small for hong kong standard. but ameities given in the room is as much as what you get from other hotels although it is really very small. room feel comfortable with well bright lights & soft pillow & bed. it is hard to walk around if you have a larger size or else it is fine, 3 of us stay in a room we still find enough space to move around. if you really need connection door in between 2 rooms, i suggest you rather take a room just next to each other, as onces you open the connection doors, " space to move around "become a question. when u arrive, a bowl of 2 green apple & knight was on the writing desk, which is abit wrong, apples, knight & a mirror infront of you, this is what you always see in a ghost story. haha... bathroom was ok size, with bathtub with a shower head that allow you to take down with different water power for you to choose. toothbrush is provided & of cos other normal stuff like shower gel & bath form is provided. Bathrobe, slippers & safebox provided in your room. swimming pool is small but hey, it is hard to find a swimming pool in a hotel in hongkong! gym was good. Breakfast in hotel, mostly "ang moh" have breakfast at the coffee shop, cant see a asian having brekfast in there, for us, we were given free breakfast by the hotel when we check in. breakfast taste not abd but food for you to choose from is pretty limited. * breakfast outside the hotel is a better choice if you wan to taste some local food.

Reviews.Title: “Annoying but in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rruparelia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton hotel as part of a two week honeymoon to the far east. The hotel was told in advance that we would be staying there as part of our honeymoon as we were advised by our travel agent that we would receive complimentary fruit and free upgrade to the next category room. When we arrived, they did not have a room ready for us and when we asked if we would get an upgrade as we were on honeymoon, the receptionist told us that we wouldn’t as the hotel was full. We were then asked to wait in the coffee shop for an hour so they could find us a room. Not a great start. We were allocated a room which looked out on to Nathan Road, the view was nice but the room was very small. I haven’t been to Hong Kong before so I don’t know if this the standard for rooms in Hong Kong. We had just about enough room to walk around with two suitcases on the floor. This didn’t really bother us as we didn’t spend much time in the hotel. Another annoying aspect of the room was that the TV only had one channel which we found quite odd and we could not find the remote. We later found out that there was no remote in the room and had to request another in order to watch the TV. During our stay at the hotel we needed to use the internet, so we went to the business centre to use the internet, what we were not told at time was there was free internet stations in the café on the basement floor and therefore we paid to use the internet. We stumbled on the coffee shop later on in our stay where we found the free internet. The main reason we chose this hotel is for the location. The location was perfect, a 5 min walk to the nearest MTR (Jordan) and a 10 min walk to Temple Street night market. When using the MTR, it works out cheaper to get an octopus card which you can buy for HK $100 which a HK $50 deposit which you get back when you hand the card in. The MTR is so easy to use and found ourselves using it to go everywhere. The ladies market isn’t as publicised as Temple Street but I definitely recommend going there for better bargains and cheap knock off’s. The market can be found opposite Mong Kok station which is 2 stops from Jordan. Another great find was the outlet centre which is outside Tung Chung station, again we stumbled across this on our way to the Lan Tau. Overall, this hotel is good if are not planning on spending a lot of time in it. The rooms are small and the hotel staff although friendly, don’t really do much to help you. If you are looking for a convenient location, then this hotel is definitely worth considering. Would I stay in this hotel if I visited Hong Kong again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Hotel was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: SummerChaser
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 2 nights and found it to be in a great location for shopping and sightseeing. I was upgraded from a standard room to an Eaton Club room on arrival. Room was small, but had everything I needed, was very clean and new. The pool and gym are also great. Close to the Jordan MTR station, Tin Hau Temple, Night Markets and many restaurants and shops. Short train ride to anywhere! My favourite hotel in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eaton”
Reviews.Author: sunil_sc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton for 2 days in April 07. The thing that stood out about the Eaton was the quality of the service - it was excellent right from the airport pickup. We booked the club room with E-club privileges and were very pleased with our decision. The morning breakfast is top-notch and they also have an evening happy hour which makes for an welcome break in the evening. The hotel is well located, couple of blocks from the Jordan MTR and an easy walk to Mong Kok. The street markets (Ladies, Temple, Jade) are all within walking distance. Overall it was a great place to stay and we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and good location”
Reviews.Author: crispy123
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel, from the very start the service was excellent and worthy of an upgrade to the Executive rooms. The E-Club is very good with friendly and relaxed service. The room, not the most modern, was however very clean and well maintained with a very comfortable bed. Located on the Kowloon side - only a couple of blocks from the MTR station Jordan. Plenty of bus services operate on Nathan Road just outside the hotel. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurants, but the room service food was excellent - as was breakfast and snacks in the E-Club. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “All you need for a short trip to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: S_G.UK
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here one night on a fleeting visit (2-day visit after a business trip to Singapore) to hit the shops. Never stayed here previously, though was impressed with sister hotel Langham Place in Mongkok when I stayed there this time last year. Obviously, the standard of hotel in Hong Kong is pretty good anyway (ie: what you get for what you paid is always much better value in Asia than elsewhere in the world). For Hong Kong, the standard room that I had was pretty small = for two people for more than 1 night it might get a bit crazy in there! Nice comfortable snuggly-pillowed bed, big plasma on the wall, dressing table/desk, nice cool radio alarm clock with ipod dock (looked cool but after 5 mins of trying to figure out how to use the alarm I gave up and used my phone). Compact but modern, tidy room with all the usual (shampoo etc). (dont get me wrong, have stayed in rooms half the size for twice the price in Paris, but you know what i mean...) Door staff and reception staff were really friendly and helpful (arent they all in Hong Kong?). It is an excellent stopover hotel - business or pleasure. Well kitted out for business (tho not wireless, had to plug latop in but it was really simple to get logged on) and excellently placed for pleasure. Its about 2 minutes walk from Jordan MTR station which is only 3 stops from Central = you get all the convenience of being in a very accessible location for everything in Hong Kong without paying HK island prices. Oh, and had the best pleasure/pain foot massage experience via hotel-provided service on 21st floor. Well worth it. Only drawback; pool is weeny and there's no spa. Foot massage was in a kind of communal lounge area. So, if you're going to mix shopping with chilling by the pool, this is not your hotel. But if you're going to mix shopping with getting out there and seeing everything Hong Kong has to offer while staying at a very comfortable, modern hotel in a good central location at a very reasonable price, you cant really go wrong with this hotel. (though I have to say, the Langham Place, which is more expensive - cant remember how much more - was also really lovely and does have the benefit of a lovely rooftop pool and spa - so if youre stuck between the two and budget can be pushed....! )

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Eaton!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrottersl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 8 nights. We had two standard rooms booked and were prepared for a pretty small room based on reviews we had read but were presently surprised. We had 2 adjoining rooms between the 3 of us and had two single beds in each and found there was enough room on the floor for all our bags and our shopping. Although the standard rooms weren't flash, they were very clean, well presented and felt comfy. We loved the location of the Eaton. It was a couple of minutes walk from the Temple Street Market, which we frequented often for shopping. We also ate a few very cheap meals there and found the quality of the food to be great. The MTR and the bus stop was only a short walk away and it was easy to get to Tsim Sha Tsui, which is the main tourist area. We had breakfast in the hotel twice and would rate it as one of the best hotel breakfasts I have had. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially at the Concierge desk where they had a wealth of information regarding tours, sightseeing etc. We had a couple of nice swims in the heated pool and the gym looked very well equiped (although we didn't use it). I would definitely recommend the Eaton Hotel and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BIGDEALAustralia
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very small and we needed two upgrades before we were happy. Ended up with and Eaton Club room Executive suite on the 16th floor. These are about $3000.00hk a night but, but if you are staying more than a couple of days, this would be more comfortable. The club room came with it's own 1st floor staff, free internet, and free drinks and food from 6.00pm to 8pm. American breakfast on the 4th floor was so, so. Ist floor staff were great and more familar with western requirements. You can book in and out through this reception. Location was central ,a choice between the two MTR subway staitions, still had you walking a couple of blocks either way. Temple street markets across the road, with general night market in one street then food the next. Everone was getting into the food if you new what to get. Again we decided to go it a lone regards tours. A long walk to the harbour stopping at most of the large department stores, then a Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island then a bus to the Stanley Markets and repulse bay was achievable but a full day. Another trip along the same lines to the Peak just about coverered what you could see in a short time. Overall ideal for the business man or a short stay.Money changer across the road from the main car prk entrance was consistant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eaton frm 17 March for 6nights. Booked the executive room. Great for space not much of a view though. If you get the 180 degree window room, ur looking over part of Nathan Rd. If you get the slighty bigger room, u have no view at all. I stayed 1night at the slightly bigger one but then asked to move to the 180 degree window as i wanted some kind of view. Very nice bed, comfy! Bathroom is nice as well, only one thing i didnt like about the bathroom is they have shower curtins and not glass ones. The E club was very nice. Very cosy. Worth the money. Breakfast is nice varietly. Afternoon snacks with free alcohol is lovely but if your there for few nights, the afternoon snack becomes abit boring as they dont change much. Loved the all day coffee! All day internet access. The coffee shop down stairs are GREAT for buffet lunch. Cheap, Cost HK $88 + 10% surcharge.( worked out to be like $Aust $15 each) You get a good variety and a world of desserts!!! Fruit juices self serve. Dinner at the same place will put u back HK $238 + 10%. However dinner time you get more variety like cold crabs, oysters, yabbies, and heaps more. It also included one main meal u choose frm the menu. Did i mention a world of desserts....... =) I personally think the buffet was enough without the main! Drinks not included. Starbucks is a 30 sec walk. Heaps of shops close by. Temple Street night market is 2min walk. Jordan Station MTR 5mins walk. One thing u might like to note is when u check in they freeze the WHOLE AMOUNT of ur stay plus about HK200 more (incase u use room service or mini bar) in ur bank account. (like u have pre-paid it) but if you dont use room service or mini bar they realease the extra amount. But yeh loved hkg and the hotel. Would go back even if its just a stopover. Would recommend this hotel to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: justchln
Reviews.Content: I was there twice in March. Both times I was pleased with the service. The rooms are quite small. I was travelling alone so it was fine for me. The rooms are clean and bright. I had problems with the internet the first stay and the tech guy came promptly and fixed my problem. The bell hops are polite and courteous. Practically everyone was polite and courteous. The front desk area can get quite busy. There's no sense of order so you'll have to keep an eye or you'll miss yout turn. The free continental breakfast is nothin to rave about but it was adequate for a quick morning snack. The wait staff can be a little pokey. The hotel is in the middle of it all. Located in Yau Ma Tei between Mong Kok and Jordan. Don't bother exchanging money at the hotel. I got 7.33HKD=1HSD when I was there. Use your ATM card. As for charging stuff. Apply for Capital One. They don't charge any extra fees and they give you the true exchange rate. Temple street is only two blocks away. There's plenty of restaurants and shops all around. The street vendors only deal in cash. There's even a great laudromat a couple of blocks away. Why pay 50HKD a shirt at the hotel when you can get all of it done for 37HKD. There's a kewl fast food great restaurant across the street. I've seen some of the staff eat there. Everything's written in Chinese so you'll have to ask the wait staff what's available if you don't read Chinese. OH BRING TISSUE WITH YOU. Almost all outside restaurants don't provide any tissues and be wary that some restaurants only have floor toilets.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: J&GShoreham
Reviews.Content: 2 nights in this compfy and modern big hotel. Think we had standard queen room, size was ok with modern decor, big compfy bed and great view of downtown Kowloon. Great location, walking distance to lots of shops, parks, bars and restaurants. Has rooftop spa and pool with relaxed feel and again great views of city. Hotel offers great value for money rates especialy on their website and if your a travel agent you get a very good discount. Disapointed with staff customer service except for spa/pool staff, he was very sweet. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: traveller365
Reviews.Content: The Eaton is everything you would desire for a good and comfortable stay,well located on Nathan Rd in Kowloon. We stayed in the newly renovated Eaton room,which is small,really small but very well laid out,which gives the room a really cosy feeling lcd tv et all. Bathroom is up to the mark with everything you would want your bathroom to have. The only problem we found is that if a couple in a room have seperate bags..there is no place to keep more then one bag because of the room sizes being so very small. Service is also up to the mark,no complaints here. A part of our travelling party stayed at the Eaton Club room which is another thing altogether.Much bigger room,bigger bathroom and access to the E-club in which I swear I saw complimentry Moet and chandon flowing like water. :) If I stayed in Kowloon,I would definately consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: climber544
Reviews.Content: Everyone we met were exceptionally polite and helpful. The room, although small, was very comfortable, clean and new. I would stay at Eaton again on my next visit to Hong Kong because of its great value. A little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Badri
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in Hong Kong from Jan10-14. We booked and Executive Room for the increased space and access to the E-Club. Overall the room while spacious wasnt the best available. Other reviews mentioned an LCD tv etc but our room didnt have it. The overall soundproofing also wasnt up to the mark and we could hear road noise well into the night. Having said that we really enjoyed the restaurants (one had live music), the E-Club with all its free food and internet access and its easy accessibility to all things in Kowloon. There is a pool and gym in the top floor as well. For a small increase in price we got a room that was quite spacious and very unlike other rooms in HK. The room also had a convenient safe. The staff was very pleasant and quick to cater to our requests so overall I would give this place 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: apo1105
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel between 2-5 Feb 2007 as part of a stopover to Australia package. I booked a Superior room which was on the 14th floor. This was certainly high enough to escape any ambient noise from the hotel or from the traffic down below on Nathan Road. The room was of a decent, but not exceptional size, the double bed was large, clean and comfortable if a little on the firm side. The bathroom was clean and well-stocked with toiletries and two fresh bottles of water every day (a nice touch I thought). There is a free-to-use safe in the room for storing your valuables. The room also has a TV with channels showing English Premiership football and BBC World for those who like a taste of home. There are three restaurants on-site that feature varied menu choices from traditional Cantonese/Chinese food to more western style dishes such as fish and chips, pasta, steak sandwiches etc. There is also a buffet service available. The food is good and the prices are quite competitive (expect to pay around £25 for a main meal for two, with drinks). There is also a coffee shop with complimentary internet access. If you prefer, there is a Starbucks just around the corner, and numerous other restaurants within 10 minutes walk. Access to the on-site gym is included in the price and is fairly well-equipped with treadmills, exercise bike and a cross-trainer, plus a good selection of free weights, although a little light on weights machines. There is also an open-air swimming pool adjacent to the gym which I didn't use. The hotel and restaurant staff are courteous and friendly, always keen to help - although I didn't really have any cause for complaint during my stay. The location of the hotel, whilst not particularly central, does not pose a problem due to the proximity of the Jordan MTR (subway) station. You can buy a card at the airport for HKD300 (about £20) that entitles you to a return trip on the Airport Express train and unlimited MTR travel for 3 days, so this worked out perfect for me. The Jordan MTR station is a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel and from here you can journey pretty much anywhere you want to go in Hong Kong. Having said all that the Temple Street night market and Jade market, plus loads of shops, are all within easy walking distance. All in all I will probably stay at this hotel again if I return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: Jacketer
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, with friendly staff. Only problem was that we were on the 11th floor but were still kept awake by the noise of the traffic. Be careful we booked an executive room but were put into a club room, although we did question this at check in but to no avail. 20mins walk to Harbour, right in the heart of the shopping centre, short walk to night market.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Eaton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoEric
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton two nights end of January. Small but nicely furnished rooms, great shower/bath, beautiful swimming pool on roof. Nice exercise room, but did find elipitical machine not working. Other equipment all worked fine. Staff very accomadating, everybody polite and helpful. Within a couple of blocks of Temple street and Jade markets. Subway also within two blocks. E club worth extra price, I was picked up at the airport in a luxury bus, very nice happy hour and breakfast. Will stay here again if I return to Hong Kong. Eric Bernauer

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Donaldswim
Reviews.Content: Given frequent complaints about small hotel rooms in Hong Kong and the excellent room rates available at the Eaton, I booked a suite. Very nice room; decent size. Hotel in good condition. Being allowed to check in at 8am after overnight flight was a bonus. Good location for Jade Market, Temple Street night market, etc. Probably my hotel of choice on return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton was great”
Reviews.Author: gazzaINperth
Reviews.Content: We found the Eaton Hotel to be a great choice, especially location. Opposite the temple markets, a few hundred metres from Jordan MTR. Walking distance to ladies market and down to the harbour (although I must confess we did use the MTR on more than one occassion). Rooms were as we had expected in Hong Kong - small but were more than comfortable. The smorgasborg breakfast was sensational - fully cooked if you wanted and delicious fruits. and allowed us to generally skip lunch. Drinks in the hotel were pricy, as they seemed to be everywhere in Hong Kong. Under the Hotel was a really nice coffee shop with free internet access. We usually ate on one of the street restaurants in Temple street - had no problems. All in all a very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Hotel, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: youngs
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 5 nights from 11 January until 16 January.The hospitality & friendliness displayed by the staff whilst we stayed here was to be commended!The hotel's position ie close to the Temple Street & the Ladies Markets proved to be an asset along with the convenience of Underground Railway System closeby.I would thoroughly recommend staying at the Eaton Hotel!!! Carol Young

Reviews.Title: “Good Place!”
Reviews.Author: kokonuk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a Superior Room at Eaton Hotel. It was wonderfully furnished - exactly as shown in their website at -----------. The room was of an ok size - you do not feel claustrophobic inside, and the bathroom was great. Bathtub, toothbrush set, shower cap and all the usual works. There was also a fruit basket welcoming us on the first day. A pity it was not refilled :0) The receptionist, concierge and baggage personnel were all pleasantly friendly. Ask the baggage personnel to arrange for a flat-fee taxi ride to the airport - this will cost you HKD280, including toll. (We wish we tried bargaining to HKD250 though, because the meter showed HKD232.) Nevertheless, while we only have good memories of the place, several faults had to be fixed. The bedside lamp's bulb was blown, and the bed had a missing leg, leading to a most unomfortable first night before we realised what the problem was. However room service was quick to respond, and we did not have any other problems thereafter. All in all, it was a most pleasant experience, and we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small”
Reviews.Author: CplSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton for 2 nights, the rooms are very small I would say good for a stop over. People in our group upgraded and still not satisfied. The Hotel is busy with renovations so if you think to rest after a long flight forget it. The staff not very helpful, did not even attend to my complaint about the noise. If you a big person and try to fit in the bath good luck!!! Not all that bad, breakfast was excellent I would say it is up International standard

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Wash D.C Folks were Odd though”
Reviews.Author: KaraChocolateBathtub
Reviews.Content: While on my normal trip and stay at this wonderful facility, a Certain fellow and what looked to be a Russian Prostitute kept us awake all night. Their constant use of Hairspray and building airplane models at all hours was deplorable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: viasistina
Reviews.Content: A true gem in the middle of Kowloon. Situated right on Nathan Road (dont let that Oasis like photo on their website fool you). Nevertheless, the hotel is well equipped with plenty of restaurants and lounges and appears to have a very lively following of guests from around the world. Book using the web and discover a hidden gem called the EClub. A delightful and trendy lounge on the first floor available all day long for selected guests. Complimentary beverages all day long with a continental breakfast and happy hour plus free internet access. We actually didnt need to pay for breakfast a couple of mornings without intending to do so. The staff was friendly and courteous. Careful of the renovations though, not all rooms are completed yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience beyond expectations;the E-Club de luxe room deal”
Reviews.Author: M.Verbeek
Reviews.Content: We like to contribute with this objective review as non-profit tripadvisor with some usefull tips for frequent-travellers what to do and remarks about this hotel on this location in Hong Kong (mainland-Kowloon) like us who likes always to get what they expect. We booked a REGULAR room (HK$1,950 /night)in this hotel by Cathay Pacific Holidays in a package deal for eight days flight/hotel/transfers/sightseeing and a 6 over-nights stay in this hotel. We were also looking for a perfect central location to discover Hong Kong for several goals like visiting and shopping centers,streets,markets also good spot for (transport) nearby subway entrances.(MTR- subway and taxi is very cheap .we paid taxi's from HK$20 to HK$25 for 2 - 4 km) By reading several positive and negative reviews we found out that a better deal would be the E-CLUB THE LUXE (HK$2,570 /night) because of little space in the room in the regular room prices are not always including breakfast. Calculations via their own home site Eaton-hotel Hong Kong (early bird rates starting of regular HK$855 Eaton club de luxe roomHK$1413) we found out that a better deal would be the E-club the luxe room because of including breakfast and many extra's like all day free coffee/tea/internet acces in a especialy the e-club lounge for e-room members. We most say that altough the booking was a fixed booking for the regular room they organised changements without problems with helpfull informing and very clearly informing the difference in pricing and conditions. Good quick reponse on e-mails send by us to this hotel enquiry/reservation site gave us the impresion that it is a well organised hotel management.. Easy acces to the information home site of Eaton-hotel Hong Kong . E-CLUB lounge Private check in/out service Proffesional great service staff controled by e-club manager Mrs.Mimi Cheung and her assistant Mr.Angus Yip (like PA's to all quests with helpfull tips and following up all requests )We feel very 'at home'although we were far away from home/Holland. Europe In the club lounge (1th floor)even incl. alcoholic drinks between 18.00 and 20.00hrs -the happy free hours-every day also including fine snacks and appetizers are free! Calculation of some drinks a day and great breakfast pays the difference rate regular-eaton and de club luxe with' pampering' 6 stars service included! A complement is to see that even 10 minutes before closing down the breakfast buffet (10.00a.m. and weekends until 11.00a.m.)they started again to fill up the dishes/plates with new fresh items if it has just started/opening breakfast.Many times we have seen something else in other hotels. Free acces on three spots in this lounge for internet-communications in all privacy . Manny LCD's buit in the walls and a fency furniture together with using a lot of wood materials in the decoration of walls etc gave high class impresion right from the moment you walk in this lounge. This lounge is an extra free service exclusive for E-club room members including all services for tourists/business men who appriciate the personal toutch and to have a meeting point . Telephoning is better/cheaper in the lobby than in the hotel rooms .(offen all the prices in Hotels are excl. service tax 10% and government tax 3%) e.g.using telephone in room HK$95 for one minute call to Europe was out of norm.range! So we only used the free internet acces E- Club de luxe room; This is not a 4 star spacy room but a 6 star, with all luxe-facilities incl.great views, good bed -not hard or too soft-, coffee/tea maker, luxery warm interieur/furniture, internet acces (check the rates) -nice badroom(all items are there ) plenty of place to put your clothes and presents you are going to buy!.........(Took some photos) Roomservice incl standard every day fresh fruit-plate and respecting 100% privacy rules.e.g. We made a mistake instead of putting the sign 'make up my room' we turned this sign at the door in the morning by leaving the room with 'do not disturb'..Nobody did come in the room until we came back late in the afternoon. We found two letters who were slipped under the door into the room with requests to contact the staff for reporting on what time we would like them to make up our room!!!. Ther was no minus item to find exept that this room had a 'óld fashion' tv set for such a luxery room.So really nothing to complain about. Great room next time we ll take this kind of room again. By informing about the renovations which is going on, they told me that this is taken care of and changed into LCD/Plasma's . We could stay whole day in the room but we came to see Hong Kong and wanted to see also some other Hotels We have been talking to other guests who stayed in the regular room and as we are planning for a group an Asia non-profit tour in 2007 we asked Salesmanager Fanny Tang to show us the other rooms to make a comparisation . We found out that the regular rooms w'e have seen were a lot smaller as ours (as many hotel-rooms in Hong Kong)and that this hotel is actulaly in an second stage of renovation making the reglular rooms bigger by extending/ajusting half of it 's size extra by sacificing one room to every third room to get back space for upgrading these regular rooms. Good thinking because we are as european traveller used to bigger room/facilities. If you do not mind a smaller room and just looking for a good location and reasonable price without using their breakfast facilities then this kind of room-regular- is very value for the money in this very safe Hong Kong area. Transportation facilities from/to airport-hotel; -Taxi;This hotel has own counter Eaton limousine-pick up service point B04 in the arrival hall of the airport. (HK$490 one way)30-45minutes drive. -Subway (MTR) from airport to kowloon via central-station,changing direction admiralty-station to 'exit'Jordan'station(nathan road) .5 minutes walk to the hotel -Bus; about HK$130,-one way -VIGOR services- We took the limousine one time and the bus the other time . Comparing pricing the pick up/drop off service by bus right to the hotel it is much cheaper and also good alternative for not walking around in the subway with suitcases. Regular room; Price value is okay if you only sleep in this room and furniture standard is not so bad as I have been reading in reviews. Without renovations these rooms are still okay because the hotel keep up the rooms in good condition by many checks. I asked also to show me the difference between renovated and not renovated-rooms .Nice of them showing this without commercial goal these rooms. New renovated rooms are better and more sophisicated with a big toutch of warm furniture by using a lot of wood and I have seen the TV- LCD's build into the wall.(Took some photos) Even the regular room is okay for tourists or businessmen but we liked the eaton club the luxe room more.(best value for money object compared to others as the Kowloon hotel or Shangri-La in this area. We checked ALL the restaurants inside this hotel Restaurants (inside Hotel Eaton) PLANTER's BAR(4) Good international dinner with nice live music. Drinks a bit expensive (e.g. a glass of red wine ca HK$ 70). Veal chop / Lab chops,drinks ;dinner two persons here incl services ca HK$550 not cheap not expensive but okay considering ther is a band playing with different kinds of good music Okay also for a drink with your parner or all by yourself to sit at the bar in the evening just to listen to the music/show. LOBBY LOUNGE (4) We had lunch there.Two persons. 2x express lunch an one drink HK$266 incl serv./tax Located in atrium. Meal incl main course and (eat that all as you like to get or can eat !...so many nice items ,so you for sure have to use the free indoor fitness center or swimming pool on the top floor 23th to loose these calories....) great variously buffet of asian of western food for starters and desserts. Reasonble pricing. Restaurant (-2 floor) YAT TUNG HEEN Cantonese cuisine. We had lunch once and dinner. We asked Paul the responsable man for this award winning restaurant to make/to order something the local people liked best \. Nice remark that the chef-cook Danny(?) came to say hi at the table to all quests. A little personal final toutch. Impressed by this asian food we understand now that we had to make reservation in advance for dinner and lunch.A ll tables occupied!Do try the Dim Sum here.(good chinese special dish (starter main course and several desserts incl. We noticed that no chinese family order alcoholic drinks (some rice wine maybe) at the dinner-table ; only drinks good brandmark tea's. Dim Sum dinner/lunch two persons(all incl)we paid HK$154 and special asian fine dinner about $280 (plus HK$160 for the bottle of nice red-wine!....) Good service and food quality products COFFEE SHOP We visited it but did nt uses this service because of the e-club lounge facilities. Fine casual atmosphere with several internet PC acces and clean area's. Location Hotel Safe area at day and night. Nathan road very central location right next to Temple street -night market (16.00-0.00hrs)ca 100 mtr 1 minute walk. Tung Choi street -*Ladies market 700 mtr 10-15 minutes walk. Paralel to this the electronic goods street; *Sai Yeung Choistreet PC/lap tops,camera's electronic goods. * both you can take the subway exit Mongkok station -Look always outside the shop the display of QTS Quality Tourism Services (clearly displayed prices of products and menus and good knowledge of their products) Hong Kong Tourism Board had checked these shops/restaurants. See also Discover Hong Kong for other tips. -Cable car ca 7 km ride on Lantau island to the buddha statue and have lunch in the monastery. Great view over hong kong mountains and you will even see airplanes landing at the airport very nearby! Hong Kong island . Go to the peak with the tram in the evening to have a great night view of Hong Kong. Very romantic location site at the Peak -peak landmark tram- (amazing view so don't forget your camera to shoot without flash nice illuminated pictures )Bus back to central station is number 1 or take a taxi if you are with more people then 2 persons. Take the Star ferry ( HK$ 2,20 ) central to get back to the mainland (Kowloon- Tsim Sha Tsui) . Good very cheap alternative boat-ride on a (1957) ferry boat and have a great experience and a great view on Hong Kong waterfront-view. You will be arriving by boat at the bus station but you can also take a walk back to the hotel passing by Salisbury road left to Hangkow road and right back on Nathan road .(So you will walk by many nice shops and restaurants) Walking up to the hotel another 15 minutes. A taxi ride from this bus station(boat-Star Ferry exit) to the Eaton Hotel is about HK$ 25-30 Sightseeing Tours; Take a busride tour to discover Hong Kong at least one time during your stay by daytime . We took supercity appetizer by Vigor ToursLtd departing at the hotel Kowloon at .09.00hrs am to be dropped of at 14.30hrs . Not expensive and good value for money. See Hong Kong island ;the peak the beaches the shopping center causeway bay by bus, a short stop in a juwelery factory jade items and 'expensive''nice 'things' -leave your credit card at home?!-and get a lot of information from the english spoken guide history and helpfull tips what to do and see in Hong Kong and a you will have the opertunity for a boatride in the harbour between' the old scene floating boats' Don't take; the Aberdeen Night Cruise (Spendid tours) (HK$560 p.p.) including "night cruise and ' dinner:'' You will be 'dumped' on the roof of a boat in the evening to have some 'free'drinks. Afterwards you will have dinner at the Jumbo floating boat in the middel of the harbour of Hong Kong for an quick-asian-european tasting meal and afterwards a quick stop only!(!)half way up to the peak and then quickly be brought back to your hotel. No value for the money. Instead of this take the Star ferry ca HK$2 and a good restaurant in the top of one of the buildings to overview Hong Kong. There are so many of them. Or dinner/lunch Aqua roma/ Aqua tokyo jap+italian dim sum sunday brunch 29th floor One Peking. Best coffee in town -Starbucks coffee 1-13 D Aquilar Street Central HK - Pacifific Coffee nearby hotel Eaton on Nathan Road 5 minutes walk (direction-south)to the waterfront One last tip ; write down the name of the hotel or destionation in chinese language (by concierge hotel) because not all taxidrivers understand englisch and ask before you go 'on board'of this taxi an estimation rate of fares to this point. If you have problems in Hong Kong call the consumer Counsil Hotline for assistance or multilingual Visitor Hotline HKTB. But.......I don't think you will need this because all the people we have met in Hong Kong were so polite and very friendly, very respectfull so I cannot make another conclusion that we 'll come back to Hong Kong and staying again in the same Hotel Eaton-hotel on Nathan road again. Same room, same place, another time......Writing this review at home in Holland I feel a bit home-sick allready!......Can't wait to come back soon to Hong Kong! With the help/service/tips of the staff by staying in this hotel it created an impact even more then an experience beyond expectatations............................We lived our dream! Please do not disturb.................. Micheal&Christiane Verbeek Sneek, The Netherlands 10-16 nov.2006 Hong Kong Eaton-Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very PLeased”
Reviews.Author: ezale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from spending 4 days at the Eaton HOtel and were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is clean, service professional , a wonderful breakfast buffet, happy hour with entertainment in their lounge nightly, wonderful Chinese restaurant downstairs in the building and a great value for the price. Yes, the rooms are very small but we didn't spend too much time in our room, too busy sightseeing, while their bathrooms are new and large. The location is walking distance to the outdoor markets, and an easy 30 minute walk to the waterfront area and the Star Ferry. If your looking for a nice hotel within your budget, I would recommend the Eaton.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: KGTravels
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great, but busy, location. Away from most of the hustle and bustle on Nathan Road, but near enough to enjoy it. We decided to take the bus from the airport, I think it was either the 20 or 21 (check with tourist info at the airport) and the bus takes you right outside of the Nathan Hotel next door. The reception is on the 4th floor, I mention this as we got a bit lost on arrival, and that was a painless experience. The only bad point was that we were given a different room from what we requested, but it was sorted out in a matter of minutes. The pool was nice, with views over Kowloon, and usually you get it to yourself. The gym was absolutely fine. Can't comment on the food, as we were on a budget. I definitely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “best value hotel with small children”
Reviews.Author: rubenonekord
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best value hotel we could find in Hong Kong when travelling with small children (ages 2 5 & 7). It was important to have interconnecting rooms to allow us some space. The cost can be blown out by this but at the Eaton the rooms were small but adequate and comfortable and about 40% cheaper than elsewhere for the same requirement. Close to shopping, markets across the road, close to subway, great food and exceptional service. The staff are a real credit with a special mention to the Baggage Supervisor and to the Front Desk Assistant Manager (Anton?). Their names escape me as I lost their cards on the trip. These people were exceptional given that the service was already excellent. Earlier comments referred to the hotel undergoing renovations but that looked nearly complete to me and they were changing the beds while we were there. Roof top pool like a Roman Bath as well. CAUTION- avoid the hairdressers across the road when going right out of the lobby (Tony?) A scamming rip off who doesn’t have basic haircutting equipment or skills but thinks he is a designer. Charged me a hundred Australian dollars for a Basic NO.2 haircut normally costing about 10 AUD. However the restaurant left of that is great for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: KSI
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton on the last day of my 10 day trip business trip to China. Booked the hotel on line through their website as the price was great for a 4 star HK hotel (900HKD). Reserved a Queen, Non Smoking Superior Room, which was recently renovated with Plasma TV. Stayed in room 1313 accross from Elevator. Check in and check out were both slow, and not very efficient for a 4 star HK hotel. Rooms were small, but very tastefully decorated and the bed was very comfortable. Lots of road noise, so I assume that the windows were not soundproofed unlike most other HK hotels. Small gym with two Precor treadmills, complimentary fruit and water. Nice roof top pool. Location is not great, which is probably why it is considerably less expensive that other TST hotels. Excellent value for a 4 star Hong Kong hotel. May stay again if I can get the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a 5 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DeVito
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, we were on our way to new zealand and stayed at the eaton hong kong for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon, and they upgraded our room and gave us a lovely bottle of champagne! The room was a club executive room which was massive and so luxiorus! the staff are amazing and helpful and the club lounge was great with free internet access all day long and free drinks and champagne and breakfast. Its definetly worth having a club room as when we spoke to some brits who were staying in a basic room they were saying how horrible and pokey it was and that breakfast was so expensive to have as it wasent included in their package. fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “We treasure our stay in the Eaton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuijn
Reviews.Content: As a former manager of a hotel I can truly say that my stay in the Eaton Hotel is one of the best I have experienced lately. The staff is very effective and friendly. Especially the Eaton Club package is one of exclusive pampering.The Dim Sum restaurant in the basement is excellent and the Aroma Café serves the best Cafe Latte. Rooms are very comfortable with great beds.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis from Nathan Road”
Reviews.Author: UniTraveller
Reviews.Content: We chose the Eaton Hotel based on price and location. It is on Nathan Road, just across the street from the Temple St night markets and is halfway between two MTR stations. We were given an upgrade to a suite, a welcome fruit basket arrived a couple of hours after we did, and another fruit basket and complimentary bottle of wine appeared in our room a few days later. These touches simply added to a wonderful stay. Our room was bright, clean and comfortably furnished (except the bed which was rock hard, but that seems to be the norm in some Asian destinations). It was always a relief to retreat to the hotel when the madness of NAthan Road. True, there were some renovations going on, however these were not intrusive. I would recommend the Eaton to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Recommend Higher Floors”
Reviews.Author: Kanpo
Reviews.Content: There is no free airport shuttle bus that goes directly from Kowloon to Eaton Hotel, but it was about a 7 minute walk from the bus stop at Jordan station to the hotel. I was staying one night on transit, so the hotel location was very convienient to shop and eat. Especially temple street and the night market and restaurants are open until late night, so you could use the whole day fully. However, the rooms were not as grand as their entrance or their lobby. It was clean and basic and that's all. Three things I did not like about the room. 1)Curtains: They have only canvas curtain so you either shut it and have darkness or open it and get sunlight. They should introduce lace or sunlight passing curtains. 2) AC: The AC didn't turn off , so I woke up freezing in the morning. 3) TV Channels: There was not that many options. I had to ask them to change my room because they first put me in an connecting room, where I could hear all the conversations in the next room. The room was on the 6th floor facing the road, and it was also quite noisy. I advise higher rooms. Although it was not an non smoking room, the receptionist changed me to a room on the 9th floor right away. There the noise could not be heard, and I got a view of Nathon road. However, the bell boy, assistant manager and concierge were all quite helpful and curtious, which left a very good impression.

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat the Eaton”
Reviews.Author: JanetN
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Hong for the third time in 12 months and once more stayed at the Eaton as we had enjoyed our time here before. This time though the Eaton Club was up and running in full force, we received private check in and the girls are so helpful and lovely, then found we had been upgraded to a suite. Now on previous trips we had stayed in a superior room, smallish but we managed fine, a deluxe room, much larger but the suite...........2 rooms plus bathroom and gave us so much more space as we were travelling with our teenage daughter it was wonderful. The Eaton is a wonderful hotel, the staff are so helpful, courteous and polite at all times and nothing is to hard for them. We only eat breakfast in the hotel as we have our favourite restaurant on Austin Road that we go to each night, but what we did eat was fresh and enjoyable, with no complaints at all. As people have mentioned you are close to everything from the Eaton but everything in Hong Kong is nearby. Taxis are a definite cheap way to travel especially if you are tired after a long day. Otherwise grab the octopus card and use the trains. Temple Street Nite markets are 5 mins walk and the Ladies market about 10 mins the other way, the jade market is just beyond the night markets but only open days, worth a visit.. Also the rooftop pool is a godsend after a long day walking, it was closed one day while we were there, reason being they had a thunderstorm warning and do not believe in taking chances, we were notified once it had been re opened and allowed to enter for a swim. I would highly recommend the Eaton to anyone who wants a central location and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meg57
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the small side compared with western standards, but we were expecting this after reading the reviews of Hong Kong hotels on this website. BUT the bed was the most comfortable ever. Bathroom also tight, but not inconvenient. Room very clean but did smell badly of cigarettes despite it being classed as "smoke free". No spare rooms available to relocate, so housekeeping did special cleaning of room to remove as much smell as possible. Was acceptable after that. The food, especially the breakfasts, were fabulous with every type of food available to suit any taste. The cocktail bar very enjoyable for a few drinks and some entertainment. But beware, alcohol very expensive in Hong Kong. Hotel conveniently located within walking distance to Temple Street Markets. Though the surrounding area is very grotty and dirty. Excellent transport via buses and taxis make getting around so easy and cheap. We did walk from the hotel to the harbour which took about 30 minutes, but we were shopping along the way. Walking and using the buses gave the best view of the city & what was on offer. We didn't get down to the trains except to pick up the Octopus card - a real MUST HAVE. The Chinese Restaurant in the basement of the hotel was a special treat for our last night. While the food was great there was very little English spoken and we had to rely on one waitress to do the interpreting for us. This was a surprise in such a hotel. The garden area was out of bounds while we were there as renovation work was being carried out on the outside of the hotel. The hotel didn't disappoint and was actually more up market than we expected. Would definitely return on next trip. Staff very helpful and friendly, although some had better English than others. But all in all not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good service,excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Slewmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel from the 15th to the 19th of August 2006 and enjoyed our stay tremendously. From the moment we checked in, we were treated very well by everyone, from the bell-boy to the counter staff. Check-in was a breeze as most of the staff spoke English and in no time we were up in our room on the 10th floor which happened to be a non-smoking floor. The room was very clean and looked brand new. There were the usual complimentary tea-making facilities, a mini fridge and most importantly, a safe to store our valuables. What more could we ask for? The queen-sized bed was comfortable although a bit on the hard side. There was a bathtub in the bathroom which came in handy if you wanted to soak your tired and aching limbs after a day of walking around sight seeing or shopping. There was also a central console beside the bed which allowed you to control the lights, television and also to indicate on the sign outside the room whether you wanted the room cleaned or otherwise. Television channels included CNN, CNBC, BBC and a variety of sports channels in both English and Cantonese. There were also Korean,French, Italian and Spanish channels to cater to tourists who did not understand English or Cantonese. One feature of the hotel which we really appreciated was the ice- making machines located on every floor. This came in handy when we wanted ice cold drinks after a long hard day of shopping. A very useful feature indeed! The hotel is located in Jordan district, right across from Temple Street where there are lots of stalls selling everything from clothes to electrical products. The Jordan MTR station is a short 10 minute walk from the hotel which makes it easy and convenient to get around. Overall, we have nothing but praises for the Eaton and would definitely stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janeysmoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about a week ago. As a thirtysomething backpacking couple, we found it clean, central and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: PShadbolt
Reviews.Content: Although I am now a teacher prior to this I spent twenty plus years in sales the last ten of which in corporate finance with the Bank of Scotland Group. During that time as I am sure you will understand I had occassion to stay on business in many hotels(including... Tower Bride, London...... The George...... Edinburgh, Gleneagles Hotel etc....etc.... I am pleased to tell you now that none of these previous experiences managed to measure up to the service I enjoyed at Eaton Hotel Hong Kong. This was really down to the check in at reception which left both my wife and myself feeling very positive about our decision not only to stay in Hong Kong but to stay at Eaton. The first impression could not have been better and as you know you cannot remake a first impression. I am pleased to report that the excellent job that Mykee had done was backed up by a similar level of performance by every other member of Eaton staff that we came into contact during our visit.................. We will return although the distance involved may mean that it will take longer than we would like.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ete
Reviews.Content: Booked Eaton Hotel, last minute via Asiahotels Service was excellent, in fact the reception staff were the best I have ever encountered! We are a family of 2 adults and 3 children, and this usually causes some confusion regarding number of beds per room, configuration of rooms etc. particularly when booked via web sites with no facility to enter our specific requirements. Eaton staff were very helpful, providing extra bed and allocating almost adjacent rooms. Initial rooms were a little "tired" and I requested renovated ones, these were organised later that day. The free continental breakfast for stays over 3 nights was excellent, however this was for 4 and not 5 people which also caused a little confusion, again we were able to sort that out without difficulty via the reception staff. In short .....if you have a problem explain it clearly to them and in my experience they will bend over backwards to try to help. The location is very convenient, bedrooms clean, comfy beds public areas, particularly ballroom and coffee/internet shop interior impressive. Good breakfast, nicely served.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: London_talking
Reviews.Content: We encountered several problems with our stay at the Eaton. Firstly despite us booking 3 weeks in advance and being guaranteed a late check in they had somehow completely run out of non smoking rooms, after a complaint we were told although it was a smoking room we would be able to be upgraded to a club room. On the second day we spent a lovely day in Hong Kong but returned in the afternoon to find that we could no longer enter our room. The receptionists were most rude and accused us of only paying for one night and failing to check out, 11:30pm at night and half an hour of arguing (the confirmation number it seems is not enough proof) they finally let us in to the room where I luckily had a full print out of the confirmation so avoided paying for the room twice, a quick unapologetic sorry was uttered. Finally my dress hanging in the wardrobe mysteriously 'disappeared' - I spoke with at least 4 different members of staff to no avail, housekeeping said they had not seen a dress and it was not in their possession. I didn't get the dress back - so please lock your cases if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews of this hotel on this site, we were a little apprehensive about staying at the Eaton Hotel but it was lovely. The communal areas such as the breakfast area etc were excellent. Our room was a little tired but renovations are expected. It was clean and not the box room I was expecting and we had an excellent view of Nathan Road, especially at night with all the neon signs lit up. The hotel was only a few minutes walk from the Jordan MTR stop which was very handy as this was our main mode of transport. The hotel is literally over the road from the Temple Street night market which we went to twice. There is also a pool on the top floor and although we didn't use it, we went to have a look for the views of the city at it looked fantastic. We ate breakfast here every morning and we couldn't have asked for a wider selection. It was a little expensive but was worth it and saved us the hassle of trying to find somewhere else. All in all we had a very plesant stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingallthetim
Reviews.Content: I was in Hong Kong for six weeks, staying on Hong Kong Island, so I wanted to stay at a hotel in Kowloon that was not "special occasion" like the Peninsula, but which would provide me with a certain level of comfort to get over my jetlag and get used to HK. After much research on TripAdvisor, the Eaton won over and I must say that I was not disappointed in the least. There are a lot of comments posted about how small the room is. Yes, the room is small but most families in Hong Kong are living in two-bedroom apartments under 17 sq. m. Don't expect anything short of a very lavish waterfront suite to be any different. I loved how quick the hotel was to get to: at the airport, have the HK tourism desk write the hotel name and address in Cantonese, then take the airport link express to Kowloon, and a 10 minute taxi ride later gets you right to the front door. Without two or three pieces of luggage, it's five minutes from the MTR. All the staff were very polite and helpful: the bell boy who helped me to my room almost refused to take my tip; the man at the business centre let me use the internet above and beyond the suggested 1 hour limit; a serviceman was sent immediately when I complained that the internet port in my room was not working; and the spa staff on the fitness floor were really wonderful. Great perks about the hotel: the gym opens at 6am (the pool at 8 or 10am) unlike some hotels, and there are lots of English television channels, great when you have 4am jet lag. Also, there is the Pacific Coffee Club (a Starbuck's type-coffee shop) right in the basement, with nice strong coffee and snacks if you are feeling culture shock, with free internet terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I held my wedding banquet of 25 tables in the Diamond Ballroom in March, 2006. The reason why I choose Eaton Hotel is just because of the reasonable price and the beautiful ballroom, I really didn't expect too much...... this is the feeling of me before my banquet date. On my day of wedding banquet, I was so suprise that the food and service were so great!! We are so impressed that the 'wonderful' staff can handle all the things and really take care of us (the hotel even spare 1 female staff to just take care of my wife, to change clothes, make up, water and tea etc..)!! Even a six-star hotel may not able to do that, or may not provide this kind of service with the 'heart'.
