Besides, I face of problem of shorting 'Red Wine' during the function, the captain simply offer me extra 1 bottle of red wine per table, preventing the embarrassed moment happen to me!! I want to say a big thank you for their flexible service and care!! For the complimentary room, it is so great (although the size is a little bit too small), with all kinds of amenities we needed. The cleaning standard is good, with comfortable bed, quiet environment........ we really can get a good sleep after a carzy, bust day!! Thank you Eaton!! Whenever I will hold functions or need accomodation in HK, I will choose Eaton Hotel as my first choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Althought the room size is a bit small but service in overall is great. The staff provided some wonderful & memorable arrangement for my honeymoon especially the Concierge. Of course, I will recommend my friends to stay at Eaton if visit HK.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than the outgoing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pillow Lace
Reviews.Content: We spent one night and half a day at the Eaton Hotel-We were pleasently surprised to find that it was clean and the staff were very helpful-It had a very nice Planters Bar which you could get a drink and snack. I would reccomend this hotel as a stopover. They are in the proccess of painting it , which I must admit the rooms could do with a lick of paint,and the carpets need changing. All in all this was a very nice Hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I ordered a Superior Room, which is advertized as bigger than a Standard Room (and it costs more). The Superior Room was the smallest room I have had in Hong Kong. Very Tiny. Far better value and bigger rooms as nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloweredCow
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed at the Eaton for 4 nights. I quite liked it, nice restaurant and bar area, cute patio and downstairs coffee shop. The rooms are very basic, nothing to love or hate there. Internet charges are daily, I think $120 HK, but if you go down to the coffee shop they have internet on a couple computers for free. One nice thing, the mattress was nice and soft, my other Chinese hotels had mattresses like boards. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights before going to Bali as part of our honeymoon. This hotel was very nice. It was quite big with nice restaurants/cafe/bars. The lounge bar was particularly nice, a nice place to have a drink and or snack after the long day of sight seeing. The rooms were very small but comfortable and clean. The view from the window wasn't amazing but we didnt spend much time in the room. The location of the hotel was excellent. It was next to Nathan Rd, which was the one of the main roads that runs though Kowloon, therefore easy access to most sights and places to eat etc. Everything was easy to get to by foot. Temple street market was very close. Overall a good hotel to stay if you don't mind small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: diaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Eaton hotel in April for 3 nights. We in Indonesia got great package from Cathay Pacific called Hong Kong Supercity Package for plane and hotel (excluding breakfast). For two people sharing a standard bed room for 3 nights in Eaton Hotel we paid only USD 1086, including plane ticket Jakarta to Hong Kong vv, shuttle bus by VIGOR from/to airport and extra baggage 10 kilos per person, one day unlimited MTR ride card, Cathay Pacific folding bag, half day tour to Aberdeen and Victoria Peak, etc. What a great deal! Eaton hotel surprisingly is a very good hotel. We got standard room in 9th floor, it a is soundproof rrom as our room facing the large and noisy Nathan Road. We can use 4 free internet boots in hotel's Aroma Cafe. We just need to order coffee (they serve ILLY coffee) or juice. We had an free early check in at 11.00 am. We were happy for this. The room size is OK, but definitely not spacious. But warning, they charge you local phone. Better to use the 2 phones at the lobby which is free of charge if you dial local number. The half day tour is definitely a tourist trap. The bus take you to Jewelry Factory, and the bus' tour leader persuade me to buy something, which is OK if you have desire to do so or has interest with jewelry. But no for a budget traveller like us. From Eaton hotel we can walk to Jordan MTR station or Yau Ma Tei MTR Station. It is only one MTR station ride to TST from Jordan. It took us about 10 minutes to both stations as the hotel is in the middle of two stations. Starbuck is in the corner of the street in case you don't like ILLY coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: DaDoubleJs
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed out stay at the Eaton Hotel. We stayed there for two nights in the month of March. We got to the hotel by taxi and found the hotel to be nicely decorated with a friendly staff. The hotel was undergoing renovation, so there was a lot of construction. However, the lobby,lower ground, fitness facilities were all easily accesible and nice. There is free internet at the LG level inside the cafe. The only drawback is that the rooms are very very small! Our room was literally the size of a walk in closet. The hotel is in a pretty good location- Temple Street Night Market is about 2 blocks aways and the MTR is about a 10 minute walk. It was convenient for us to walk around Hong Kong without the use of a taxi. We also had some discrepancies on our hotel bill at checkout. They added on some mini-bar charges that did not belong to us but quickly took care of it when we pointed it out!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: amphitryon
Reviews.Content: Just back, four nights and was extremely pleased. Found the place to be immaculate, the room compact and comfortable, staff friendly and helpful. Excellent price/service ratio; paid HKD 700 first night, 850 subsequent, upgrade (superior)room. Good location as a starting point to discover.Good overall experience!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected and a very very good 3 star...”
Reviews.Author: jeremy_norbury
Reviews.Content: I stayed 8 nights in the Eaton "Club" part of the Hotel, room 1210. The room rate was arranged through Carlson Wagonlits at HKD 1200 per night. My room was above average (as good as some 5 star I have been in) with a view of the street (that's about the only choice considering the location). Ethernet Internet available in room, but costing HKD 4/min with a maximum of HKD200/day. Why am I expecting it to be free? My rate included a few "free" services - 1 suit cleaned, drinks in bar at happy hour and a very average breakfast buffet in the Aroma coffee shop downstairs. The hotel has an excellent "real" breakfast restaurant where full cooked breakfast with all the trimmings is HKD 170. I had clothes cleaned while there, complete bag full of shirts etc cost HKD 400. Fast service. Suit dry-clean was free... Location is great for shopping and the local markets, being about 150m from Temple Street market and a very interesting "produce" market at only 100m. Metro/Subway/Underground lines at 250m in each direction. Highly recommended. Jerry Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: ickle_hobit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my friend for 3 nights. The price was good through Expedia (£500, considering a flight alone would have cost £430) The room was nice and was very clean. I found it no smaller than other hotels I've stayed in and, at the end of the day, you're only going to be sleeping in it! Unfortunately, I was ill when I arrived (problems adjusting to the time difference) and had to call a doctor. This was done through the manager, who was very helpful and gave me a couple of calls to update me as to the time of the doctors arrival. Because of this, I didn't get to see much of Hong Kong but I know the hotel is virtually right across the street from Temple Street market, which is good and there are loads of shops and restaurants along Nathan Road. Kowloon Park is about 15 minutes walk away and it is about 30 minutes walk to the ferry terminal. Anyway, the hotel staff were friendly and efficient, I only ate one meal there but it was lovely and the seating area outside was beautiful and relaxing. Unfortunately, I forgot about the roof top pool being there..! I do have ONE COMPLAINT about this hotel and that is that the lights are activated by placing your door key in a hole in the wall. Fine if you want all the lights on at once but not if you want a small reading light - it's not possible - it's all or nothing and I hated that. I have attached some photographs of the hotel. Helen

Reviews.Title: “Public area a big contrast from the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eeklin
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd hotel I have stayed in HK. Compared to the 1st hotel which I have stayed before...Eaton's rooms are much more smaller. The beds are sinking and needs a change! Anyway, the lobby and public area is so nice but the rooms are really lousy. Time to renovate! In terms of convenience...still needs to walk about 10mins before we reach the MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Great if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: DebTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked the Eaton through United Airlines and selected the hotel mainly for the price. I was a little apprehensive because the reviews seem to run hot or cold, no middle ground. Yes, our room was small and truthfully needed to be repainted, but for the price we paid, $1010 for 9 nights, which included the buffet breakfast, we thought the hotel was great. Although the selection never changed in the buffet there was enough variety so you never got bored. The fresh fruit was fabulous!! The staff in the restaurant and front desk were excellent. The lobby is small but beautiful. Feed the fish in the pond outisde (just sneak some crackers from the buffet). As others mentioned, good location. Five minute walk to the Jordan subway station. We were in Hong Kong 10 days (Fri - Sun) and loved it. On the go every day.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel rooms ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel room I have ever stayed in. I booked it through hotels which only had a few reviews. I like this site better because of the abundant reviews. The blankets were extremely dirty and felt sticky. The water was brown, tv only had 4 channels, room was really small. For $100 us dollars, i thought i would get a decent room but did not. I requested a non smoking room. when i checked in at 5pm, the room was still not ready. i finally checked in at 6pm but when i got to the room it was a smoking room. They said I had to wait for a non smoking room. I did see another room but it was just as bad. The lobby and cafe was nice, clean and modern. The staff all spoke english and was generally pretty nice. It was about half a mile from the main shopping, at least were you see most people hanging out. I would only stay in this hotel if they had the rooms that are pictured.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the centre of it all”
Reviews.Author: dingbat
Reviews.Content: The Eaton is situated on Nathan Road which is in one of the main areas of Kowloon. The hotel provides a shuttle bus service, so if you go to location B4 when you clear customs, it'll cost you approx. $120HKD which is a bargain. While our room was a little on the small size, it was clean, comfortable and had everything we needed. The staff were extremely friendly and attentive, nothing was too much trouble for them. There is free internet access in the aroma coffee shop on the lower ground floor, and a lovely warm pool on the roof which is worth a look. The Star Ferry is about a 30 minute walk where you can get the very cheap ticket to Hong Kong Central. The Soho and Lan Kwai Fong areas are definately worth a look for plenty of bars and restaurants which have a great atmosphere. 5pm-9pm in many of them is happy hour which made them even better otherwise it might turn out a bit pricey. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in HK.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at Eaton, starting on Christmas day. We were given two rooms on the sixth floor. The parents' room was at one end, and the kids at the other, although we specifically asked for the rooms to be near to each other. The view from the parents' room was the highway and a tall, ugly old building with clothes hanging from windows. The curtain could not be properly closed so someone from the old building could see what we do inside. The closet was broken. The bed was lumpy and caved in in the middle. Of course it was noisy with the highway traffic. The kids' room was not much better other than the view. Their beds were even worse. One of them got sick due to not able to sleep on his lumpy bed. When we requested a change of room, we were told the better rooms were for "higher up" people. So if you travel with a group, either put up with it or pay more to get a "higher up" room.

Reviews.Title: “Internet Rate at close to 10% of overall room rate.”
Reviews.Author: Zoula
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the reviews and comments as they are most helpful. If you are choosing the hotel because of the internet as mentioned in their page: I call this daylight robbery! Please be advised that the internet access in most of the hotels in HK; to the contrary of Japan, Singapore and Malaysia is not free from your room/lounge …etc. It would cost you as much as a terrible HK$3.00 per minutes or HK$120.00 flat per day (??!!!). You can get outside rates from PCCW as low as HK$4.00 per day if you have a wireless device just across the road at the SB Café. I had an argument with the manager on duty that day (James "something I can't remember”) and he decided to grant me access to the internet from their business center which I did not accept at the end as I was not asking for charity from them. I had chosen the hotel for their 24/h IT support on internet… 95% of my business is conducted via the internet and mainly by email. The hotel is expensive. Most of the staff are well trained and provide you with kind assistance. A basket of fruits was provided in the room. I had no problems getting the non smoking room and it was cigarette smoke free. The Aroma Coffee Shop is not the place I would go for an espresso as it was served to me in a huge 8-12oz cup (I cannot remember the size exactly). I had my breakfasts the following days in the SB Coffee shop (45 seconds walk from the hotel). In one sentence; if you are looking for a hotel with 24 internet availability for free or low cost, it is not the right place. If I knew we had to pay an additional 10-15% of the room rate for the internet I would had gone elsewhere! The only place where the internet is FREE at the Eaton Hotel in Nathan Road is at the Aroma Coffee Shop where they serve Espresso’s in 12oz mugs. Next time I would check-in in another hotel. Additional tips in Hong Kong, please take the train and from the station take a taxi, it is much faster than taking those bus shuttles. The buses would have to drop many people in many hotels. So if your hotel happens to be the last in the list, you might be doing a 1 ½ hour trip from the airport to your hotel. There may be a difference of HK$10/20, but it is much faster than the bus. The only difference is that you would not get to see much on the way as well. Hope this would help

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Eaton”
Reviews.Author: happybagger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel during a stopover at the beginning of our holiday to Australia. Upon arriving at the hotel we were impressed with the Hotel Staff and the first impression of the hotel reception area was very good up to the point of opening our hotel room door. What a contrast, the room was in need of a major revamp not just a lick of paint. The room and bathroom were exceptionally small. We had to keep moving our suitcases around the room to maximise the available space. At night the suitcases where placed up against the door, not so we felt more secure but so we would not fall over them if we had to go the loo during the night. Thank goodness it was only for three nights and we spent the minimum time at the hotel. Definitely NOT value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachetwan
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 13 night stint in HK staying at the Eaton Hotel. After reading the reviews I was a bit worried - however I have to say that the overall experience was great. Food was fabulous and service very quick - unless in the Yat Heen Restaurant (v slow - like visiting the dentist.)Food generally was all good and bar was good - singers were better than X Factor. Staff were excellent or bordering on scary.... neither the less I would recommend this hotel to anyone visting HK - near all the amenities and very central too. Happy to answer any queries!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it if I paid less”
Reviews.Author: shopaholictraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother and I stayed at the Eaton for 4 nights. We had a suite which had a separate bedroom. The living room had a sofa which pulled out to a bed for my mother. When made, the bed took up the whole room of the living room. Yes, even the suites are small but I expected this from pre trip research about Hong Kong hotel rooms. The bathroom was outside the bedroom which made it easy for all 3 of us. There was a welcoming tray of fruit, candy, wine, and water upon arrival in our room. Check in was very pleasant and the courteous. The location was convenient to the MTR and very close to the night market. We really liked that the Aroma cafe had free internet access. Breakfast at Aroma was very basic and if you have a choice of paying for it with the room or not, I recommend that you save your money and get it outside of the hotel. Other encounters with hotel staff were pretty basic and just alright. The biggest negative is that we paid way too much for this hotel. We paid $1100 for the 4 nights using Hotels. Due to the late reservation, and convention in town nothing else was available. On a side note, we checked out at 6 am. We decided to take a taxi to the airport since we had taken one to the hotel for only HK 260. (Research said to expect no more than HK350).Expecting about the same cost, once at the airport he said it was HK 460. He did something to his counter which jacked the price up. After some disagreement, he took HK400. It was a disappointing end to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a a fine base for a week in Hong Kong. Although the (standard) room was on the small size, it was clean, had everthing we needed, and was serviced daily. This included a full set of clean towels and bottled water every day. The location is great - just five minutes walk to Jordan MTR station, and Temple Street Market. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge who cheerfully arranged taxis for us (one at 5:45 in the morning), and gave useful advice. The bar is pleasant, although very expensive, and the terrace area on the 4th floor is a good spot for afternoon tea, or a beer later on. I recommend this hotel as a good place to stay for the money. Our room only cost something like GBP 55 per night, booked well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Relaxation in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: helper94
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for three nights, in a standard room, using expedia's excellent rate of about $105/night, and were not disappointed. We had spent the night previous at the booth lodge but were dissatisfied with the room and the smell, so we went to an internet cafe and booked this room. The room on the 14th floor was small (though apparently not small for Hong Kong), with some mild signs of neglect such as slightly peeling wallpaper. However, it was clean, did not smell, and was quite comfortable and QUIET. The Aroma coffee shop at the basement was also great, with free internet access if you buy something there, and also surprising quiet, even though it was just off the street from the hustle and bustle. Service at the front desk was courteous, and the Chinese restaurant at the basement was excellent, as well as the buffet lunch restaurant just above it. Convenient to the Jordan Airport train station, as well as the Jordan MTR (5 minute walk), and the Temple Street night market was just across the street. Though we didn't particularly enjoy Hong Kong, because the air was quite polluted and it seemed like a large overgrown Chinatown, this hotel was a good refuge from it, and we would stay there again if we happened to be in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “this is bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i would never stay at this hotel again if i went to hong kong again. from the first day we were treated like one off the locals and we were a tourist.the room was the only way to put it was shocking no hot water at night warm water in the morning bed was made by staff if they felt like it front desk needs to take a lesson on how to deal with there guests in a freindly manner never again,. i would stay in another hotel or sleep in the street before i stayed at the eaton again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Happyholl
Reviews.Content: I basically agree with all of the positive comments made by previous reviewers. Standard room was big enough for two, clean and well appointed, bar and restaurant were good, although we did have a couple of problems with our orders (I never complain too much as their English is far better than my Chinese!). Staff very helpful and very friendly. The coffee shop in the basement (Aroma?) is excellent, and there are four free internet terminals you can use there. Quite good location, only a few minutes walk to the tube station and this provides very easy access to wherever you want to go on HK island or in Kowloon, and elsewhere. Overall, a good place to base yourself in while doing a lot of touristy stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: sLeepy21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eaton hotel from 16th September-25th September.I read the reviews from a few sites and arrived with little expectations. However, from my experience, Eaton hotel was great, they were very helpful and friendly. Also upon arrival you recieve a little discount book for their hotel. We also went to the gym and the pool, both were clean. The staff were very polite and helpful with alot of things. Also, we had room service everyday, free newspaper daily, free use of phones to make local calls also free use of internet down at the cafe. The location was very close to temple street market and cheap food and laundry service. So if you on a budget, you should consider this hotel.Also, we requested for a non smoking room, although it was a non smoking floor we could smell smoke in our room, so we complained to fronkdesk and they immediately changed us to level 18. The room was okay, wasn't extremely small,, the room was bigger than kowloon hotel's room, definately enough space for two and luggages. =)

Reviews.Title: “Bad...way bad. Don't waste your time here.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in jam and needed a place for 4 nights in Hong Kong, I was already there and booked via Expedia from an Internet Cafe on Hong Kong Island. The location is not great, the hotel looks nothing like the pictures. Front desk area very small, and very unorganized. Was told I had a GREAT view upon check-in on the the 19th floor. I overlooked a freeway on-ramp and the windows in the room are not soundproofed at all. The room itself was about as small and dingy as a cruiseship from let's say around 1978 and like so many others have said, very dirty and walls paper thin. It was so small that my boyfriend and I actually bumped into each other quite a lot. I asked to see another room immediately but was told it would cost $100.00 US more a night to upgrade, and that room was much nicer, but not worth the extra money. If you want to be close to the "dirtier side of H.K., this is the hotel for you. Lots of shops that sell a lot of nothing, not near anything except the Temple Street night market that sells everything fake and cheap one could possibly want. All in all, I would have stayed on Hong Kong Island rather than the Kowloon side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Maxwell75
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for week in August. After looking at its location and reading some of the reviews I was uncertain that this was a good choice in accommodation. Boy was I wrong! From the very beginning the staff were very helpful, held the lift open for when they saw us approaching, helped with baggage and even asked how we were. Our room was not too small but was a good size for two people. The room was fairly large compared to the rest of the room. I can't really say anything bad about the room itself... it was pretty much complete, fax, safe, queen sized bed all the mod-cons really. We were on the non-smoking floor (not a trace of tobacco) and no noise from other rooms. The only noise really was from the traffic below which was a quiet hum and not a bother at all really. Airconditioning in the room was a godsend, especially after a long day walking around in the heat and humidity. The meals in the hotel were okay, a bit pricey but nothing special. But who wants to eat in the hotel when there are so many places outside? Didn't check out the gym or swimming pool. The hotels foyer was very nice with a modern decor. We also took-up one of the hotel tours to the Jade Market, this wasn't anything special really, you could do the tour yourself. The hotels location isn't too bad either. About a 10-15min walk to Tsim Sha Tsui and a 5 minute walk to Jade Market and Temple St markets. Nathan Rd would have be the most extraordinary street in HK. A great value for money hotel, I recommend anyone who is looking to holiday in HK to book the Eaton.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst hotel experience i have had! - thank you sir!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff are at least polite although I am not sure they actually understood English! Check Out Conversation; Receptionist: How was everything? Me: Pretty disappointing there have been a few problems. Receptionist; Very good sir, thank you! (smile) Me: No! I am saying this is possibly the worst hotel experience I have had in recent years. Receptionist; Very good sir, thank you! (smile) Me: (I looked blankly at him and left) I never did expalin my issues to him, it was going to be hard work. This is what you can expect from the Eaton; 1. Looks impressive from the outside and has a nice bar. 2. Pokey little rooms. Despite travelling with my wife I was given a twin rather than a double. When I complained they tried to SELL me an upgrade. 3. 8.30am+ constant drilling and banging. Do not try and sleep in. 4. Moved to a higher floor to avoid the drill where I could hear the lift everytime it passed. 5. At no point will you be assisted with your baggage 6. Non smoking rooms still smell of smoke

Reviews.Title: “pretty poor apart from the bar and pool”
Reviews.Author: gabio
Reviews.Content: small dingey rooms with black marks on the wall. small tv and a horrible view from the standard room small window. The bar area was nice though offering live music some nights with a good atmosphere. the pool was great but even the view from there was spoilt by small windows and the gym was tiny. better hotels around the TST area like the sheraton

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in an Interesting area of Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: Catswhiskers1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel in June for 7 nights. The Room. HK is increadibly hot and humid at this time of the year but so the air con in the room was a godsend! We had a room on the 12th floor which ahd a view down nathan road and over the lobby lounge below. There have been complaints about the size of the rooms but we stayed in a standard room and didn't find it small at all! The room was nice and clean but the walls were a little grubby just from general wear and tear. The bathroom had a bath and shower and an automatic hair dryer. There was also a retractable washing line across the bath which came in very handy when we encountered our first tropical rainstorm! Hotel Staff and Facilities. The hotel staff were pleasant and courteous at all times. We didn't really engage with them much as we were out of the hotel for most of the day. We did not visit any of the bars or restaurants in the hotel but they all looked very nice. The swimming pool on the roof is very nice! The pool is quite small but at the time I was the only person using it which was fantastic! Location. For me the hotel was in an almost perfect location (ok, I would have prefered a hotel overlooking the harbour but who wouldn't?). Jordan MTR is a 5 min walk away and using our octopus cards we found it very easy to get around. We were one stop away from the TST area which contains a multitude of bars and restaurants and also the avenue of stars (which is the best place the see the light show). In the other direction, it is a few stops away from the Chi Lin Nunnery (highly recommended) and also various bus routes into the new territories. Also, temple street market is just round the corner. All major tourist attractions are easily accessable from this hotel. Overall. Extremely happy with my hotel choice and would go back again any day!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is central to everything then this is it. We stayed here for 7 nights in June and were very impressed with all aspects of the hotel. We decided to upgrade to an executive room and it is well worth it, floor to ceiling windows, with great views of the nightlife of Hong Kong. Breakfast is included with this room in the Aroma Cafe and though it is only a continental breakfast was more than adequate to start the day with. Internet access is available and we found it quite easy to get a machine. The pool on the roof is wonderful, although only small it serves its purpose of allowing you to cool down after walking in the heat all day. The bathroom was more than functional and served our needs. The room itself was excellent, although small by Australian standards it was quite well designed with all the mod cons and more than comfortable. As the hotel is away from the tourist area of Tsim Sha Tsui you are not hassled by tailors each time you walk out the door. Jordan MTR is about a 3 minute walk and we found that by walking up the back streets (Chi Wo Street) this brought you out at the entrance to the MTR and was much more pleasant as there were no crowds this way looking at the shops, also a great noodle bar up this street. The Temple STreet night markets are another 3 minutes away and fantastic. The MTR can easily get you to Mongkok (much cheaper for shopping) and over to Hong Kong island for sightseeing. The staff at the hotel are courteous and polite at all times and when we had questions they were answered quickly and things arranged exactly as we had expected. I booked with this hotel direct and found i got a better rate by going through them direct, and all with no hassles. There are so many restaurants in the area to choose from it is unbelievable, but for a great one go up Nathan Road till you reach Austin Road, turn left and past the car dealership. On the right hand side you will see a restaurant with yellow vinyl seats, the waiters are great, the food is fabulous and so cheap all we ever seemed to do was eat. The Eaton seems to be central for everything, you are right in between Hong Kong Island and Mongkok and Sham Shui Po, the markets in Mongkok are easily reached with a pleasant walk up Nathan Road and you can either get the MTR back or a taxi for about $25HK. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling to Hong Kong, but organise transfers to and from the airport with the hotel as it is cheaper than getting a taxi and just as easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid range hotel”
Reviews.Author: HB00763
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton in May 2005 in a standard room. Rooms were smallish but still quite adequate with large bathrooms and comfortable bedding. Staff and service were exceptional. If you are going to Hong Kong to shop it is in ideal location next to the night Markets and halfway up Nathan Rd and 5 minutes walk to the MTR. And if you go to Hong Kong get an Octopus card to travel with as they make getting around Hong Kong a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Fine. Not horrible, not great.”
Reviews.Author: OsideLB
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the Eaton hotel gives the impression that your stay will be fabulous. Helpful bellmen, decent check in, nice lobby, good selection of restaurants AND free managers cocktail happy hour from 6-8pm. The location- it's a bit of a hike to the subway, no decent restaurants were found close by, but night market & jade market are close, so that's fun. The room was not great considering the price, very small w/twin beds (hard as a rock, but if you've travelled in Asia, you'll be used to that), dark & sort of stinky, but a very large nice bathroom. Internet service was the sketchiest I've ever encountered. While it was only available an hour each day due to some "technical difficulties" (and believe me the jet lag had me checking email at ALL hours) we were charged for a full 24 hours of service each day- even though they admitted the service was down for 24 hours, we had tried to log on, so we were charged...no appologies. And don't get overly happy at that happy hour...it only includes a couple of drinks and specific ones at that, but they'll keep bringing them (without asking if you'd like another) for as long as you sit.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Eaton is a fairly nice hotel. The staff is always eager to help. Rooms are clean....a tad small (as all standard Asian hotels are), but the bathroom was larger than I expected. The Aroma Coffe shop has some good fruits/muffins/yogurts, plus 4 free internet computers (expect to wait a few minutes for one of the computers to become available). The rooftop gym and pool are small, but nice. Plus, there were rarely more than 3 or 4 people using any of the facilities, so it served as a nice tranquil getaway from the loudness and energy of Hong Kong. The bar was a pretty fun place, and the happy hour from 5:00-8:00 serves 2-for-1 drinks (as do most bars in Hong Kong). Didn't try any of the other restaurants at the Eaton. Looking back, we would have preferred to stay on Hong Kong Island, but I would assume the hotels there are at least double the price. If you can find a similar hotel on Hong Kong Island for the same price, I would go with that. Considering it takes about 10 minutes on the MTR to get to Hong Kong Island, it's really not much of a hassle. In general, the hotel is above average, and fairly convenient to most destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: TooMuchTravel88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eaton March 21 -26, 2005. Having been to Japan and know that in densely populated Asian cities, hotel room sizes are small when compared to hotels in the US & no views unless advertised. I did not expect the Eaton standard room to be different. I found the room adequate for 2 person and a very nice decent sized bathroom & regular size bathtub. Room & bathroom were very clean and well maintained. In-room internet (ethernet connection) cost 100 hkd/24 hrs and very slow when connecting to US for email but very fast using yahoo HK and searching pages in HK. Location and convenience adds to the hotel's advantage. coffee shop at ground floor of hotel, Starbucks across the street on one side, Mcdonald's across the street on another side, 7-11 (visited often since there are no supermarkets in HK like the US) two blocks away, Temple street night market (much better than Stanley Market which took hours to get to) 2 blocks away, MTR 5 min walk, Star Ferry 20 min walk, numerous restaurants, inexpensive to moderate all along Nathan Rd just outside hote. For tourist shopping just walk south on Nathan Rd, for where the locals shop, just head north on Nathan Rd. Fom the airport,Taxi is 300 HKD to the hotel, so if there are 3 or 4 people it is cheaper than the express train. March was still kind of off season and hotel rates was around 80 us on the internet. Snce it was not Yahoo Travel or Expedia, I was relieved to found reservation was properly made at the hotel. Check in took 5 min. Almost everyone at the hotel spoke English, some better than others and the betters ones I found at the front desk, concierge, and hotel operator. TV stations also geared for english speaking tourist with several stations. The whole experience was better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “A four star hotel ???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eaton Hotel in March 05. I booked through a last minute internet website and it was the last few hotels available for reasons that became obvious to me when I arrived at the hotel. The twin room I stayed was dingy and small. There wasn’t any space for furniture except for two single beds and a tiny table between them. The TV was tiny and it was built into a corner position above a very small minibar fridge. The room has a view to a 60’s building over some dirty roof tops. There wasn’t a lobby area on ground level except for a very narrow (1.5m) waiting area in front of a set of lifts next to a driveway where passing cars may brush the corner of your jacket. We managed our own luggage to our room. There wasn’t any offer for porter service when we arrived. The hotel is located in a not-so-flashy area with nearest subway about 5-10 minutes walk away. I didn’t think the location was so great since most Kowloon hotels are located within 5-10 minutes walk to a subway station entrance anyway. I paid about $HK900/night at Eaton. The Eaton was the lowest quality hotel of all the Kowloon hotels (at this price range) I have stayed previously.

HotelInfo.Name: Eaton Smart Hong Kong
HotelInfo.Address: No.380 Nathan Road, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
